Summary: There was 8 of us that shared a suite. Mainly kids and a few adults. The suite was roomy there were 2 queens and a little room where you open a door there's a bunk bed and a pull out bed. IT was comfortable and clean inside. It was also pretty quiet. The room wasn't anything fancy but it was still perfect. I would definitely stay here again
Manager Response: Dear loniasanachay,  Thank you for staying with us during your recent visit to Anaheim. We are glad to hear that the suite you stayed in during your trip was a perfect fit for the 8 in your party. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: We booked the King Suite and it was perfect for 6 people. Walking distance to Downtown Disney and parks.  Earl of Sandwich had amazing food and we noticed they had a breakfast menu that was $5-8 for sandwiches as well. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel.  The pool isn't very big, but the kids enjoyed cooling off for an hour or 2 before dinner.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: When the Price is Right, It's Worth the Walk!
Summary: Our flight arrived 6 hours prior to check-in, but front desk was very accommodating and stored our luggage. Thank you!  Our room was in a different building from the other family we were traveling with and customer service went above and beyond expectations, giving us a complimentary upgrade to a larger room in the same building! Thanks again! Nice touches included ice water available in the lobby before/after our 10 - 15 min. walk up the street, computers available in lobby to check-in for flight home, and free wifi was sufficient for our needs. Our 5th floor room was quiet over the 4 night stay, and our suite and bathroom were clean and comfortable.  Not a luxury hotel, and not right across the crosswalk from main gate, but the price for this hotel was a very good value
Manager Response: Dear Tracy W,  Thank you for visiting us on TripAdvisor and leaving us the review. We are excited to hear that you enjoyed your stay and would choose us again when traveling to Anaheim. If there is anything we can do to assist you on your next trip, please don't hesitate to let us know.

Summary: Don't stay - bad beds, dirty and they will charge you $14.95 to cancel even within 1 hour of booking.  So not worth it - learned my lesson! I will definately stay with branded hotels in the area instead of a place like this.
Manager Response: Dear pamsG2828RQ,  Thank you for leaving us a review. I truly apologize for the unsatisfactory experience you had with our hotel. Please note that the hotel's Cancellation Policy allows reservations to be cancelled up until 3pm the day before arrival with no charge. Any reservation cancellations beyond this time are charged the amount of 1 night's + tax. If you feel that you have been charged in error for your cancellation, please do not hesitate to contact us directly so that we can assist you further.

Summary Heading: Just below average...at least in my opinion....
Summary: We arrived in early June.  This place was $159 per night plus about 200 extra charges that the state, city, county, town and tourist board lay on your bill....major rip off.  I know i am exaggerating a bit, but man...crazy!  The check-in staff were great, very friendly.  The process was handled well...it was quick.  The Inn is an old dumpy place that more or less has the smell of death in it.  The room was old and crusty and smelt like a strip joint based on the room deodorizer used to block the real smell.  The room is carpeted and it was stained.  I never walked on it bare foot.  The furniture looked like it was just purchased at a yard sale somewhere in Orange County....pretty run down and stained.  The patio had plastic Walmart chairs.  The bed was spring based, old and
Manager Response: Dear Tootsie20,  Please let me begin by apologizing for the experience you had at our hotel. We strive to provide each of our guests with an exceptionally memorable stay and I am very sorry that we fell short of yours - and our own - expectations.   Though we cannot change the tax charges you noted on your bill, we will definitely be addressing the issues you encountered regarding the cleanliness and condition of your guest room carpet, furniture, and bath tub as well as the overall odor you described in your review. I assure you that we will continue to make efforts in improving our hotel and services and hope that you may one day give us another opportunity when traveling to Anaheim.

Summary: Great location with easy access to the park. Stayed in a kids suite. Our kids enjoyed the bunk beds and privacy it allowed with the sliding doors. Only issue was the king bed left a lot to be desired! Not sure if it was the box spring, mattress, or both, but it was WAY too soft and springy and would fold in the middle causing my wife and I to constantly roll to middle of the bed.....I eventually had to use multiple pillows to create a wedge to minimize the rolling. Other than that, the property was exactly as advertised.  Despite the $18 "resort fee," it's still cheaper then the $20 that Disney charges for parking and it's only about a 10-minute walk to the main entrance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We could not have been happier with our stay at the Portofino Inn.   Claudia at the front desk was super nice and extremely helpful.  She was able to answer all our questions and help get us where we needed to be.  The hotel is very family friendly and conveniently located within walking distance of Disneyland.  We will definitely go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had such a Wonderful Time staying at the Portofino Inn and Suites, I had a  group threw me a little surprise Birthday party at Disneyland  and the hotel staff was EXTREMELY HELPFUL! And Absolutely Wonderful they stored my Birthday cake for me while I went over to Disneyland  (due to the fact I arrived in Anaheim at 12 pm and check in wasn't until about 2:30ish) and  once I returned for check in they had Actually brought the cake up to my room. This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel and I will continue to stay here whenever I come up to Disneyland. I'd especially like to thank the Housekeeping staff as well as the Front desk Staff Amanda,Cryst,Diana these ladies are Absolutely Fabulous and had made my stay a Magical one thanks again ladies!! Also the guy with the Beard forgot
Manager Response: Dear MarkyEze,  Thank you for the kind words. Our staff is happy to know they were able to assist in ensuring that you had a fun and stress-free birthday trip. See you again soon!

Summary: Just stayed here with family of 4 on a trip to Disneyland. It is clean, well maintained, and in walking distance to Disneyland. Clearly a place that caters to families with lots of kids and guests. King bed with then a desperate area divided by sliding doors for two bunk beds and a queen sofa bed. Considering that they must get tons of traffics, it's nice. Yes, expect some stains on the carpet but did I mention it's clean. The rooms are a nice as some higher end hotels. We stayed here since we came with a group.  Hotel is nestled building-to-building with 4 other hotels. Nice pool and a coffee place next door.  There is NO morning breakfast provided. The worst is the resort fee that they all charge, for what? I don't blame this hotel since they all do it now. Will always search
Manager Response: Dear sailjm,  Thank you for leaving us a review regarding your recent stay. We pride ourselves on maintaining the cleanliness and condition of our hotel and are happy to hear that your guest room exceeded expectations. Please note for any future visits that the hotel's Resort Fee covers parking for one vehicle as well as complimentary in-room WiFi access during your stay. We hope the hotel's location near Disneyland was also a plus for your family trip and that you will consider us again on your next Disneyland visit.

Summary: My brother and I shared the 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms.  This is a suite I have used before when we were 4 adults.  Having 2 bathrooms is a real plus when rushing to get out the door in the morning.  The mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker makes it possible to have a quick, inexpensive breakfast in the room.  The living room area is nice for extra space and also to meet in the morning without disturbing others in the 2nd bedroom.  It is within walking distance of Disneyland (about 2 blocks).  There is a CVS at the corner to pick up drinks, snacks, sunscreen and other items.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  When my son and grandkids come on the trip, I get them the kid suite with bunk beds--which the kids love.  Parents like the extra space and mini fridge for
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not great for business traveler,but great for Disney vacationers.
Summary: This is definitely not for the business traveler if you like amenities.   I can see that if one had a family and a budget and vacationing to visit Disneyland, this would be a good place to stay.  Close to Disneyland and lots of inexpensive food choices.
Manager Response: Dear Susan F,  Thank you staying with us and for taking the time to leave us a review. Given our location and proximity to both Disneyland and the Anaheim Convention Center, we do our best to cater to both business travelers and Disney vacationers. If there is anything we can do to help make your next business trip more comfortable and enjoyable, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Summary: We arrived in the early a.m. and they were great about giving us a parking pass to go enjoy Disney. We came back to the hotel at check in and enjoyed the pool before we went back. The room was clean and spacious. The housekeeping staff were the friendliest and most helpful. The only downfalls were that there was no breakfast. We stayed in the second building but it was not secure from the front entrance. The front desk staff was not knowledgeable of the shuttle routes and times. The pool area was very dirty and we had to ask for pool towels. Other than that it was great. We had a kids suite and it was huge. Fridge and microwave. Tons of storage space. They even had a retractable clothes line in the shower to hang up wet bathing suits.
Manager Response: Dear mommy2lexi,  Thank you for taking the time to share some feedback regarding your recent experience at our hotel. Overall, we are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our Kids Suite room type and that you were able to take advantage of all of its amenities. Hopefully we can become your hotel of choice when visiting Anaheim in the future. If there is anything we can do to make your next stay a great one, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Summary: My family and I visit Disneyland several times a year, I'm always looking for the best all around hotel that suites my family, I think this is it! We had the kids' suite and it was spacious enough for the 5 of us. A TV in each room, a separate sink outside of the restroom, comfortable bed, and very clean. Affordable rate for the area and staff were very friendly. This is definitely walking distance to Disneyland and close to several restaurants as well as Walgreens and CVS. They offer stroller rentals in the lobby. No fee for parking, but parking is limited so can be hard to find a spot if returning late. I will be staying here again for sure!

Summary: I was skeptical because I've stayed at "bargain priced" hotels and have been very disappointed. But not this time. All was great and staff was extremely customer service friendly. Parking was OK...could have more ground accessible, but all in all it was great and I'll definitely be back
Manager Response: Dear Ereymar,  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you on your recent trip to Anaheim. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the hotel as well as the service you received from our team. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

Summary: We stayed in one of the family suites that had a king bed in the main room with bunk beds and sofa couch in the separated room. Value was excellent for the amount of space this room allowed us. The hotel is about a 2 mile walk to the main gate of Disneyland, and this is all sidewalk with only one major road crossing. The sofa bed in our unit could have used a mattress replacement, but it was a sofa bed after all. I would stay here again, but I might try to find an option with the breakfast included.

Summary: Distance to Disneyland was a very walkable length. There was a problem with the printer in the business center, but the front desk let me use their printer, which was very much appreciated.

Thank you again for your loyalty to our hotel and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: In good location a few blocks down the road from Disneyland, a 15 minute walk (with young children). The kids room that had a bunk bed was a perfect setup for our stay. Friendly and efficient front desk staff. Easy check in and out.

Summary Heading: We found a new place to stay

It was quiet, clean, and the fitness room, game room, and pool were all conveniently located.  The trainee, Marlyn (sp), was great. She was attentive, speedy, and very friendly. I believe she will do well as a front desk clerk.  Thank you for making our stay pleasant.

We may stay there again just because of it's proximity to Disneyland and the on-suite room for the kids.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our family trip to Disneyland
Summary: We went to Disneyland with our 1 and 3 year old daughters. This hotel offered a kid suite so the girls had their own bedroom which allowed my husband and I to stay up later than the kids. It's a short walk to Disneyland, free parking for one  vehicle, 24-hour IHOP across the street, pleasant staff and clean rooms. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip!!!

Summary Heading: Don't fall for the Mickey Mouse Drawing
Summary: The hotel was ok, didn't offer breakfast, hotel rooms ok. Our heater didn't work, and went to the front desk to get it fixed. When we came back from Disneyland, it still wasn't blowing hot air. The bathroom smelled like mold, and sink was clogging a little. Not to mention the mickey mouse drawing, don't fall for it, its a scam just to get good reviews for their hotel. Your better off with any other hotels. The hot tub was always filled with adults that were drinking and out of control. The hotel security isn't around to monitor pool and spa. Don't stay here, look on.

Summary: Proximity to Disneyland is great, parking included which was nice. Clean enough I suppose. This place is no-frills, believe me. The devil is in the details: there's no automatic doors. Might seem trivial but with kids, luggage, strollers, and all that stuff, every time you come and go is a nuisance.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love the staff love the hotel we stay here every time we come up to Disneyland they have always taken very good care of if you have kids the 6-person Suite is the way to go it's all in one room so you don't have to worry about your kids sleeping in a joining room next to you! It helps to get a good night sleep

The parking is sufficient and additional parking spaces are shared with other hotels nearby. We would definitely book and come back to this hotel.

Summary: I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone that can get a good deal on a room and isn't staying more than a couple nights. I'd say it's walkable to Disneyland but I don't know if I'd stay much further away. I enjoyed our stay in the kids suite and having them in a separate "room" made it feel much more like a vacation for my husband and I. I think it's worth mentioning that the pool is tiny and the rooms could use an update but there isn't anything really wrong. I'm not the type of person to get bent out of shape over chipped paint or a dresser drawer that sticks. The rooms were clean, it was reasonably quiet and I think the staff was above average as far as helpfulness and friendliness goes. I'd stay here again if I was just doing a quick Disneyland day or two but might

Summary Heading: Overbooked and Could Use Some Updates
Summary: I had booked a suite well in advance of my trip, as I was meeting people and planned to host get-togethers in my suite.  Upon arrival I was told the hotel had overbooked suites, so they would give me a room with two queen beds and a $20 discount on the room I had booked.  This is definitely not a "deal."  I could have booked a room with two queens for far less than $20 off the rate of a suite.  I asked to see a manager, and he said he'd give me a "kids suite" (with a slightly different layout from the original suite) with a discount. I took this option but still wasn't happy they had overbooked.  The suite was fairly small, but the king bed was comfortable. Some of the furniture was worn and could be replaced.  The in-room coffee was not re-stocked our second day.   What I found

Summary: From hotel front door to Disneyland front door, 10 minutes walking in a straight line. Clean, large rooms, one sink unit in the bathroom and another just outside, handy when there is at least four people including kids sharing the suite. There  is no free breakfast but an excellent I Hop opposite. A small pool is also on site.

The CVS Pharmacy store next door is also a big plus as you can stock up on just about anything you may need. Walgreens is also across the road. The downside is that the rooms are very old and dated and the cleaners just do a very basic job of cleaning.

Rest assured we will be addressing your concerns with our team so that we may correct this issue immediately. Thank you again for staying with us and we hope to serve you again in the future.

Summary: I enjoyed my stay, the room smelled like it had just been cleaned. It was spacious and comfortable, the balcony was also a plus. I didn't like the carpet, it didn't seem dirty at all but I don't like carpet in a hotel room, everything else was great. The staff was very friendly and the proximity to Disneyland is a plus!

Summary: Our room was on the 3rd floor and Sheika checked us in.  We were able to get adjacent rooms, so it was easy for us 6 adults and 2 kids to meet up and connect right next door. Thanks, Sheika for accommodating us for my bday weekend!

Summary: I had a big group and employees were able to work with us.  All employees were very pleasant.  Perfect place to stay even if you are not going to disneyland.  We attended a concert.   Will for sure recommend to family.  Rates are very reasonable

Summary Heading: Perfect for our family Disneyland get-away!

The landscape was lovely and beautifully maintained. Our room was on the top floor so we used the elevators frequently, but on the final day of our vacation the elevators were out of service with no sign posted to let us know they were not working. It ended up taking us an extra hour, making several trips up & down the stairs carrying all of our luggage out to the car.  Fortunately

Summary: I came here about a month ago. There was nothing special about the hotel. Overall it smelled somewhat bad, was dirty, rooms were small, not decorative, and just overall very cheap looking. The good things about this hotel was the close proximity to Disneyland, the price, the nice open lobby, and staff were pretty friendly :) if you're looking for something inexpensive, not very nice looking, or nothing really special for a hotel you should come here! Most other hotels in this area are super expensive and it was nice to not spend a ton of money, but we also and a pretty low quality experience in this hotel. Disney was great though!

Upon check-in the woman at the front desk was rude and informed me that they had me in a "deluxe room" instead of the "kid suite" I paid for.  When I showed her the confirmation she said that they were sold out of those rooms and that was the only room left, and I would have to take it up with the third party I booked with. The "deluxe room" was a basic room with 2 beds and a view of the parking lot.  And it felt a bit dirty.   Having two adults and kids amped up on sugar and Disneyland adrenaline in one dirty room was not my idea of the ideal Birthday getaway.  Especially when they gave me a receipt at check out

Summary Heading: Tired hotel, in need of TLC, but staff is nice

The furniture appears to be at least 20 years old.  The window coverings had stains.  The window sill was dirty.  The hotel category is officially a 3 star but I'd say it's more a 2.5 star.  We bought slippers at the CVS so we could walk around the room without dirtying our bare feet.   We also did not like the single entry door right on Harbor near the busy Katella intersection.  People kept walking in behind
Manager Response: Dear roygbiv007,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay. Summary: Room was clean enough, bathroom set up was nice with 2 sinks (one outside of the shower). Shower and water pressure were great, room was very large and spacious. CVS and Coffee Bean in the same parking lot as hotel, walking distance (12min) to Disney. I think bed was comfortable, we slept like rocks after all day at Disney so can't really be sure if was the bed or exhaustion. Hallway had an odd smell but room was fine. Mediterranean cafe Tanor across the street was welcome fresh food.

Summary: I'd like to say, other than the lack of parking, our stay was excellent.  The staff was very accommodating and professional, the room was very clean and exactly what I expected.  The beds were amazingly comfortable and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Summary: Hotel was great. CVS on the corner for snacks and an adult beverage at night. Only about 1/2 mile walk to Disney. Or go to the front desk and buy bus passes. They are good all day so you can come back and forth from Disney to rest. Mediterranean place across the street was good too. And the 7-11 on the corner has got breakfast sandwiches. So all in all this location is just great if you want to walk and don't have a car with you. Which we didn't. Also the pool is nice and the hot tub is GREAT! After Disney it was perfect. Really hot and the jets were strong! Oh and front desk was always very nice and helpful.

It is very close to the park and there is a convenience store next door. I would come here again. Make sure you ask for a room in the tower above the garage. It's very quiet.

Summary Heading: A good find for a Disneyland hotel
Summary: We've stayed at multiple hotels in the Anaheim/Disneyland main gate area. Each has its pros and cons. We only stayed at the Portofino for one night and basically only used it for sleeping, however that is what we needed. We were at Disneyland all day long. Got to our room around midnight and left the next morning.   I'm rating it Very Good for the features it has to offer: extremely close to Disneyland. Walking is possible if desired. ART shuttle picks up right out front of the hotel. (Tip, go across the street and take the #3 line from that stop-you will save yourself some time). Rooms are large. Bathroom is spacious with a good set up. In fact, bathroom is larger than the nearby Hilton. Beds were comfortable and the shower was fine. Everything is clean. Appreciated the towel

Summary Heading: Vitamin Trade Show Expo West Lodging at Portofino Inn-Anaheim

They gave me a fantastic room on the 5th floor that was quiet, spacious and had all the amenities I needed including a fridge and coffee maker. They had fresh fruit and infused water every day. Claudia and Antonia keep my room spotless. I loved their pool area to relax at after a long day on my feet. I look forward to going again next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found this place while looking for a place to stay overnight after visiting Disneyland. This was the best price for a decent hotel listed on the trip advisor website. Not really a suite as I know it. The room was still very nice and the bunk beds and separate T.V. were great additions for the other room. The room could have used some charging ports for smartphones, etc. but did not.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland affordable good for kids

Manager Response: Dear moniH18,  Thank you for providing us with a review from your recent trip. We are happy that you chose our hotel to help celebrate your twins' birthday. We hope they enjoyed their small gift and would like to welcome you back to our hotel on your next trip to Anaheim.

So convenient to have that so close. The staff was so kind. I came in early before my stay just to park at the property. It was 10:45 in the mornIng and check in was not till three. I had also mentioned it was my sons birthday and the mamager made a special birthday certificate for him and placed it on his bed along with Disney pins. He was so
Manager Response: Dear Carly H,  Thank you for the kind words regarding your stay and our staff. Summary Heading: A great hotel for families heading to Disneyland

Pool area is basic but if you're going to be all day at Disneyland it probably doesn't matter. Parking was plentiful in the garage behind the hotel. The temp is set at 73'F, which for someone who lives up north, is too hot!  After adjusting the room temp, I flopped on the bed which to my surprise was very comfy and springy.  Most hotel beds I've slept in have been hard.    The balcony was an awesome bonus.  It was nice to sit outside

Summary: This is the second time we've stayed at the Portofino Inn for a Disneyland visit.  The Portofino is a very clean and very quiet place to stay while visiting Disneyland / Anaheim. On tis visit, our room was in the older West Wing of the hotel.  The rooms are still very nice on this side, though the rooms in the East Wing where we stayed last year were much newer.  Request a room in the East Tower if possible.  Beds are comfortable, the rooms are spacious and clean, and most important, it is very quiet in this hotel.  Many of the hotels near Disneyland tend to have paper-thin walls where you hear every footstep and door closing.  Not so at the Portofino.  This is a well constructed, quiet location. I've stayed at numerous hotels around Disneyland before, including the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel. This was nowhere close to those two, but you can't expect it to be either. This was much more of a budgeted trip than those stays were and if you are looking to go to Disneyland on a tighter budget, then consider this as your place to stay.

Hotel employee at front counter didn't even pretend to sympathize with my stress. 2) We got a handicapped equipped room. We didn't need that. I asked if we could have a room with a bathtub. No go on that. If I used a wheelchair I would have liked the room; however my reservation was not for that kind of room.   The convenience to restaurants and the parks was great but I wouldn't choose this hotel again.

The room was spotless, the furniture was a little dinged up but that is standard for a high occupancy hotel at a family travel destination.  The rooms actually looked recently painted and tiled.  Beds and showers were great and the view from both sides of the hotel was nice.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  You can't beat the location, one of the nicer options for the location for sure.  I have stayed at a comparable properties that were a little closer and this was by far the nicest one.

It's about a 10/15 minute walk to the entrance of Disney. It is also close to some non-Disney shopping and places to eat: California Pizza Kitchen and Cheesecake Factory. In addition, a two minute walk away from CVS and a Coffee Bean.  There is a brand new Hyatt House right across the street. I think I would stay there next time...it was about the same price and it had free breakfast. Portofino had no extra perks.  Again, nice to play to stay if you want the bare minimum.

The combo was pretty interruptive!  The pool was smaller.  There was construction going on and there was no parking available.  They did offer valet parking which helped, but I would prefer to get my car without the wait each time I want to leave.

Summary: This hotel is within a ten to fifteen minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland but I would not recommend it with small children due to the length of the walk and the need to cross two multi-lane streets. A small parking lot is between the two towers and the first level of one tower is a parking garage.  There is no charge for parking and complimentary valet parking is available upon entry.  You may want to use the valet parking as what is available onsite is not enough for the size of the facility.  Just be aware that valet parking is not available from midnight until 7:00 a.m.  We had to use valet service on our

With a family of five we appreciated the flexibility to split the room for adults and children. Beds were confortable. The kids loved the bunk beds and the endless selection of channels (I enjoyed that feature too if I'm honest). Other features were free wifi and parking, abundance of food options within walking distance and the 24 hour CVS Pharmacy downstairs was a God send after a long day at Disney. In all, a fantastic accommodation option for families

(you have to put 2x quarters together in each slot - took us a while to figure it out!)  We used the outside jacuzzi which is a really good size and temperature, perhaps a little too hot. Summary: The hotel is a solid value especially for families. The good:  You get a clean safe room with a normal sized bed and flat screen, then, in addition you also get an alcove with nice wood framed bunk beds, the lower a double, and a second flat screen, a fridge and a couch.  The two sections are separated by a sliding curtained door for privacy (though the kid have to go through mom and dads room to get to the bathroom).  Parking in Anaheim is always an issue, many hotels charge you to park above the room rate.  Portofino in doesn't charge for parking and the VALET SERVICE IS FREE!.  Once you are in Anaheim, everyone walks everywhere, so park and leave your car until it is time to go home.  The front desk staff is very nice, the room and bathrooms are clean- not always the case in
Manager Response: Dear Doc-R-in-northcounty: Thank you very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. And the location was closer to Disneyland than the closest parking for the park, a hefty 2 block walk (4 normal city blocks). In addition, there were a wide variety of eating places close by. The only thing I would have liked was if they had small safes in each room. I used a safe deposit box at the front desk -- which worked fine, but they didn't have any separate area where you could access it without being right in front of everyone.   The room had a fridge, which I love! And a small patio -- with a nice high railing so I wasn't worried about anyone trying to get in.   My room came at a special price -- since it was for a convention so I don't know how the price compares. But I would stay

Summary: This was our 2nd stay. We were happier with it back in 2010.  Cons: The parking is terrible. You have to drive around & find a spot, if you don't find one, then you have to give it to valet. They will park your car on the other side of the building- Which is fine if you don't need to go back to your vehicle a couple times throughout your stay. I had a problem with the AC in the room and it was quickly fixed. I would stay there again if I have to be in Anaheim for business or pleasure.

Summary Heading: Perfectly fine room and nearby to Disney.
Summary: We stayed here YEARS ago and I was a little worried that the room would be dated and in need of repairs now. However, our kid suite seemed clean, there was ample space for 6 people, they brought us extra pillows and blankets, check-in was simple, front desk help very nice, and the walk to Disney was totally doable - making the choice to stay here over Spring Break perfect!    We requested a middle-of-the-hallway room, on the top (5th) floor. The corner rooms are not any bigger than the ones in the middle, but they are near the elevators, making them louder. Being in the middle of a hallway cut down on noise a lot, I think. Being up high, meant we heard practically nothing from down on the street.   We arrived in Anaheim before noon, and knew we couldn't check in until 3 pm, but
Manager Response: Dear hmarks: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love hearing that you had a great stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites hotel. Summary: We stayed one night here in the kids suite with bunk beds.  Plenty of room for 2 adults and 4 kids.  Loved that the kids had their own tv so we're not forced watching cartoons.  24 hr. CVS located next door and an IHOP across the street where kids eat free after 4pm.  Short walk to the park but if you don't feel like huffing it over the ART bus picks up in front of CVS and takes you directly to the park.  $5 for Adults, $2 for kids and 2 and under free!  You can get tickets in the hotel lobby.  Hotel is older and limited parking but there is free valet.  There is a parking structure being built adjacent to the hotel but the noise did not bother us.  Great price and comfortable beds!
Manager Response: Dear turtlenator: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort. Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: We have stayed at the Portofino numerous times.. Easy 12 minutue walk to front gate of Disneyland, Garden Walk for restaurants, and CVS right on the corner. Rooms are simple but clean, Staff is excellent! When we don't rent a car they will store your luggage if you have a late shuttle ride to airport..All in all, great place to stay!!
Manager Response: Dear CATHERINE S: We are thrilled to hear from another loyal repeat guest who had another enjoyable stay at the lovely Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. Summary: Loved the hotel and it's great location.   Room was clean and roomy. Shower had hot water too!  They offer valet parking because there really isn't parking so they take your vehicle next door.  When leaving very early am, you have to walk over there to get them to get your vehicle. But it was worth it for me because I did 3 days at Disneyland and walked everywhere.  CVS is Nextdoor, open 24 hours .  Coffee shop is end of CVS building. Oh! I was alone and felt safe walking to the hotel at night (streets usually packed with people ).  Shuttle bus available  $5.
Manager Response: Dear Arleen R: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed your clean and spacious guest room. We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the Anaheim area. Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: It was a nice room, and big for the cost. But there was hair and stuff on the floor like it hadn't been vacuumed. And there was construction going on during the day and really really early in the morning on the rooms next to ours that made it difficult to sleep . I wish they had given us a heads up or put us in a different room.  Other than that it is affordable, and close to Disneyland. I would stay here again, as long as I checked for construction first.

Bring  your ear pods and a dust cover to the pool.  The furniture in the rooms is getting old and dated, the carpets are dirty.  This is a convention hotel that needs to step up its game if it wants to compete with all of its new modern neighbors.

After walking all day in the park then coming back to the hotel, I had to go back to the lobby to get new keys. It was a hassle. The hotel offers no breakfast in the morning or even a continental breakfast. The walk to the park is not bad in the morning but can be a problem in the evening. They do sell tickets for the ART bus. The hotel room have two flat screen tv's in the room and free internet service which is nice. Overall I would stay here again.

Summary: I selected this hotel for my family of 5's first trip to Disneyland for three main reasons. 1) Within a 15 minute causal walk to the park entrance, 2) the desire to have a somewhat separate sleeping area for my 8 and 9 year old (mainly so our 4 month old didn't wake up the kids throughout the night with his crying/eating), and 3) our budget of $150/night or less on lodging.  On a whole, this hotel provided the above three items as expected. We stayed in a "Kids Suite" which provided a sliding glass door between a King sized bed and bathroom (nearest the room entrance) and a set of bunk beds and small living area which the kids loved. Though not a completely separate room (glass sliding door with little sound/light barrier), it was enough for what we were wanting and the only
Manager Response: Dear FlickaJackson: Thank you for your feedback on your recent stay with us. Portofino gave us a pass to park in the Sheraton lot behind the hotel but did not tell us it was $10 a day to park, that bill was a surprise when we went to leave. Check in was easy and we were able to check in early with no problems, staff was nice and very helpful. Ok, now for the cons.  The rooms are dated and need updating.  The beds are not comfortable, nothing fancy, no high thread count.  Hallways can be loud especially early in the morning with kids running up and down headed out to Disney (to be expected).  This hotel is ok if you just want a place to sleep and if you want to be walking distance to the parks, it's very reasonably priced.

Bathtub felt like sandpaper on the bottom.  It appeared that there had maybe been an anti-slip surface at one time that had been poorly removed. Summary: We stayed here only one night for a Disney trip, with our two young children, and it worked great for us. There is actually a resort fee that "includes" parking, but it's under $10, and many places in the area charge a resort fee and parking fee. As long as the valet has your keys, you can leave your car after you check out, walk to Disneyland and spend the day i the parks, then walk back and pick up your car in the evening. Many nearby hotels would charge 2 days parking for that. This was definitely walkable for us, although we had one in a stroller and one in a baby carrier; I think it would be a little far for young children walking at the end of the day, but not

This place is also close to several restaurants(if you don't want to eat inside the park or Downtown Disney) also a CVS is located pretty much next door. You can buy snacks, drinks and save money on Disney souvenirs.Every time we would come back to the hotel, the front desk would always say hi or greet us in some type of way. I would stay again if in the area. Good price and nice people.

The beds were comfy and the room was quiet. At about 3am the smoke alarm battery decided to go out, so that incessant chirping kept me awake for 1/2 hour. I finally called the front desk and they sent someone up right away. The free valet parking was awesome! The hotel is close enough to Disneyland that you can walk, so you save on parking there, and no parking fee at the hotel. Win-Win! I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

We love hearing that our clean and spacious Two Bedroom Suite with Two Bathrooms worked perfectly for your visit.  We want to thank you for the suggestions about adding an additional air flow for the elevators. It is great hearing that our hotel's close proximity and short and easy walk to the Disneyland Main Entrance, nearby restaurants, our Gift shop, and CVS were a good fit for your traveling needs.  We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Great Location for a Dual Family
Summary: The hotel is the perfect location to Disneyland. We were able to walk to the park in about 20 minutes. The room was dated but the layout was amazing and large enough for a dual family. We had 4 adults and 2 children and all fit comfortably in the Family suite which was great for the price. The parking lot seems a little sketchy and small especially for a huge truck, but other than that great stay for a family on a budget.
Manager Response: Dear joslync: We are thrilled to hear from another guest who had another great stay at the lovely Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the Kids Suite with the  Bunk-beds, mini-fridge, and microwave. We are currently expanding our parking lot and in 2016 you should see plenty of space to park oversized vehicles. It is great hearing you enjoyed our hotel's close proximity to the Disneyland Main Entrance.  We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort. Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: This hotel was in a great location, with a short walk to the parks. Restaurants close by, and CVS almost next door with fresh fruits and sandwiches. The hotel staff was very pleasant, room was clean. Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor Member:  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our clean and spacious guest room. It is great hearing that our hotel's close proximity and short and easy walk to the Disneyland Main Entrance, nearby restaurants, and CVS was a good fit for your traveling needs.  We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Although this is an older property (and the game room is not something you really want to go to with your children because many do not work and take your money), it is just a 15-20 minute walk to Disneyland. And, the best part about our room - it had a separate area for the grandkids with their own TV, bunk beds and sitting area. Although the TV was never on, the separation was super. They loved having their "own space".  The "parent" space was just fine with a King Bed, and much appreciated, two sinks - one in the bath area and one outside making for efficient dressing.  The hotel does not have a restaurant but right across the street is an iHop for breakfast and along the walk to the Park are several other restaurants.  We discovered that it is also convenient to eat at
Manager Response: Dear margaretcov: Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love hearing that our clean and spacious Family Suite worked perfectly for your visit. For Breakfast options, we do have Molly's café across from our lobby that specializes in breakfast and we do have IHOP directly across the street.   We are glad to hear you enjoyed our hotel's location and the close proximity to the Disneyland Main Entrance.  We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort. Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: My father and I had a bit of a dilemma. We were staying at a nearby hotel for a convention he was attending when we realized that that hotel did not meet our needs. After a walk to Ihop, we discovered this hotel and went to see how it was. We read mixed reviews, but were not hesitant to stop by. The woman at the front desk (Sandy? Sandra? I wish I could remember her name), was incredibly nice and helpful. It turned out that the hotel had everything we wanted and we booked a two bedroom room. Our walk was in another building, but it turns out that right next to it was a convenient store (which was--dare I say--convenient...). Sweet! We went up to the fourth floor and in the midst of it, I almost had a panic attack.  Why? I hate elevators. These elevators seemed very iffy to me.
Manager Response: Dear Baillie N: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our amazing location and your Two-Room Suite with the Sofa-bed, mini-fridge, and microwave. We are truly sorry for that your light took a while to warm up and get bright. We will continue to monitor the lights and the door closures as we do our daily inspections of our facilities and all of our guest rooms/suites. It is great hearing that our hotel's close proximity and short and easy walk to the Disneyland Main Entrance and nearby restaurants and convenience stores was a good fit for you and your party. We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort. Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Stayed for our 4th time at Portofino while visiting Disneyland. Clean, super comfy beds, great staff.. Definitely walking distance to parks, and CVS next door is great convenience. Easy parking! They offer a passholder discount for the rooms and they are big rooms. Looking forward to staying there again soon.
Manager Response: Dear sherry e: We are thrilled to hear from another loyal and repeat guest who had another great stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our staff and the pleasant service that they provided you. We are glad to hear you loved our comfy beds. We love hearing that you enjoyed our close proximity to the Disneyland Parks, our Gift Shop, and the CVS store. We look forward to seeing you and the family the next time you are in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Daniel Kramer General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location for local eateries, and to walk to Disney
Summary: Booked this specifically to be within walking distance of Disney. The staff was friendly and efficient, to include Cory, the Valet attendant.  He went above and beyond in his duties to ensure we were assisted with our luggage upon check in and again during our late night check out.   The rooms were clean and the family suite offered us plenty of room, with a fold out couch, a set of bunk beds, and a Queen bed.  The walk to Disney was a bit further than expected, but that wasn't enough to take away from this great hotel.
Manager Response: Dear SouthernVoiceBiloxi: We are thrilled to hear from another guest who had another great stay at the lovely Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our staff and the pleasant service that they provided you. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the Family Kids Suite with the Bunk-beds, mini-fridge, and microwave worked out great for the family. It is great hearing you enjoyed our hotel's close proximity to the Disneyland Main Entrance.   We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Nice,CleanHotel, Friendly Desk Staff :-)  Not sure about some of the staffs integrity:-/
Summary: I'll be honest and admit I meant to book another hotel and picked this one by shear accident so I was more than a little nervous, not knowing what to expect.  The hotel was very clean and the Front Desk staff were very friendly, accommodating, and welcoming.  It has great amenities like a game room, a gym, laundry, valet parking, pool,  a parking garage, free wifi, and a little souvenir shop.  We had the Kids suite which had the king bed and a separate room with bunk beds, TV, fridge, microwave, and a sofa bed which was very roomy and the kids like having their own "space".  I really loved the room- it was clean and spacious. It would have been cool if both rooms had their own bathroom since its awkward with everyone using the same bathroom and cutting through the master bedroom
Manager Response: Dear salley M: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our clean and spacious Family Kids Suite with the Bunk-beds, Sofa,  mini-fridge, and microwave. We love hearing that our pool area was clean and inviting. We are sorry that your family member misplaced their money. If the staff had been made aware that your party had misplaced some of their items we could have assembled a crew to move the bunk beds and furniture around and checks all the laundry drains and traps to see if any money was wrapped up in the bedding.  We are truly grateful that you allowed us to be the host hotel during your stay in Anaheim. In the future, we hope to have another opportunity to demonstrate our commitment in delivering you a first-class hospitality experience.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Our experience at Portofino was not good. We asked for more bath towels and face towels, they come to our room with hand towels and bed sheets. The guy came up 2-3 times still didn't get it right so we gave up. They only have 2 washers and 2 dryers for the hotel guests. One of the washers was not working. The other washer kept on eating my money. I had to go back and forth 4 times to tell the front desk that the washer kept taking money but was not working. I was refunded all the money by the wonderful girl at the front desk. She tried to do everything to help. The bathroom door knob wasnt working properly my son got locked in couldn't get out. Our sheets had a few holes in them. Im not paying to stay in a hotel that gives me ripped sheets. One of our pillow covers had lipstick
Manager Response: Dear Sukh M: Thank you for taking the time to share your observations with us. Our goal is to insure all guests at the Portofino Inn & Suites have a very positive and memorable experience, and again, we are sorry you did not achieve this during your stay. We have shared your observations with our Housekeeping team in regards to the replacement of linen. We have recently updated our hotel including our Lobby, Guest Laundry room, Fitness room, Business Center, and we just installed Mini-fridges in all of our guest rooms. We will continue to update the hotel in order to provide our guests with a great hotel with superior customer service.  We do hope that one day in the future, you would consider giving our property another chance, so you can experience our true first-class hospitality.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Great location to Disneyland..within walking distance!
Summary: Portofino Inn & Suites is a great place to stay while visiting Disneyland!!  The rooms are very spacious, and the kid suite is awesome!!  We never felt crammed and everyone had there own space!  The staff was very friendly and helpful!  You cant beat the location...its maybe a 10 min walk to Disneyland.  There are a couple of convience stores along the walk to Disneyland.  There is also a good variety of resturants within walking and driving distance. Parking can become a issue late at night and on the weekends.  The hotel does offer free valet parking when the parking lot is full.  I would certainly stay there again.  The only reason I didnt rate 5 stars, is because we had a couple issues with our bathroom smelling like sewage while we were there.  It was only when you turned
Manager Response: Dear greatstateofla: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the Family Kids Suite with the Bunk-beds, Sofa, mini-fridge, and microwave. We are truly sorry for that you experienced an odor during your stay. We will continue to do our daily inspections of our facilities and all of our guest rooms/suites to ensure there are no odor issues in the guest room or bathrooms. It is great hearing that our hotel's close proximity and short and easy walk to the Disneyland Main Entrance and nearby restaurants and convenience stores was a good fit for you and the family.   We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: 2nd stay as good as the first
Summary: Had our second stay at the hotel and had a wonderful time. We tried to save some money and go for the 2 bedroom 1 bath suite and while the room was still spacious and comfy we found that with 5 adults and a baby 1 bathroom was not enough. However that bathroom was big and had lots of counter space and a huge shower so if you can get a bathroom schedule set with your family before hand, or if you don't take over an hour each morning to get ready, then this is totally worth the $20 savings a night. The service as always was excellent, from check in to the FREE valet to check out the hotel is super accommodating and happy to help. When we arrived, as promised by the hotel manager, there were socket plugs so a certain 20 month old baby couldn't stick her fingers in the sockets! We
Manager Response: Dear Jessica B:  We are thrilled to hear from another loyal and repeat guest who enjoyed their stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our staff and the pleasant service that they provided you. I am glad to hear that the socket plugs worked well for your toddler. We love hearing that you enjoyed our close proximity to the Disneyland Parks.  We look forward to seeing you and the family the next time you are in Anaheim.   Sincerely, Daniel Kramer General Manager

Summary: Easy walk to Disney from the hotel. CVS next door in springhill suites hotel.  Hotel has family suites that are good for families of 5 or 6.  Hotel has laundry, arcade, pool. Walk 2 blocks to Anaheim gerden Walk ( outdoormall) which has restaurants and a theatre. Hotel has limited parking on site but has free valet service. Stayed here  several years and liked it enough to come back.  Hotel rooms have a little wear in some spots but a good stay if the price is right. Springhill suites next door is brand new but more expensive.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim once again for your stay. We appreciate you for highlighting our proximity to the Disneyland, as well as, the CVS along with the amenities and facilities we have to offer. However, we regret for any inconvenience caused. Please be informed that we try to stay competitive with the area hotels with our pricing. It was a pleasure hosting you and we hope to have you and your family back with us soon.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Great location.  Walking distance to Disneyland and some great hidden secret resturants.  Convient store nearby.  Love the free selfie.  Bus stops. The staff was awesome.  Lobby area nice.  Room was perfect for what we needed it for.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim and for the perfect rating. We are delighted to learn that you were impressed with our proximity to Disneyland and nearby surroundings, our helpful associates who took great care of you, the well-kept lobby area along with your comfortable accommodations. We are happy that you truly enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to welcome you and your family back soon.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: The people are so friendly when you checking in  for service was great  the speed it was done  we got a little late but there waiting for us to showed us to a room  amazing rooms furniture was great  the beds are great  the bathroom is clean   We would definitely go there again next time
Manager Response: Thank you for your lovely comments regarding your stay here at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. We are so happy to read that our efficient team could assist you with a seamless check in and that your immaculate room was to your liking. It is gratifying to learn that you and your your family had a wonderful visit and we look forward to be of your service again soon.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: A bit further from Disney main gate
Summary: The room was clean and neat but average.  We spent the majority of our time at Disney so this was really just a place to sleep and shower.  The free parking was a huge plus.  It's a bit of a further walk than we thought - roughly 15-20 minutes if you are in good shape and the kids are bigger.  The ART shuttle that goes between the hotel and Disney can be a long wait during peak times. The hotel pool is tiny.  There is no breakfast room or microwave in the room. Very nice staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us here at Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. We're glad to hear that the cleanliness of your room and our pleasant staff were to your satisfaction. We normally receive great reviews regarding our location but we are sorry however, for any inconvenience caused to you.  Hopefully, this will not detract you from staying with us again and we will be happy to assist you in determining the best room type to meet your needs. Hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Make a reservation?  Better have a back-up plan.
Summary: As a rule, I try to write positive reviews of hotels I’ve stayed at; however, what just occurred to my wife and daughter at the Portofino Inn & Suites in Anaheim requires a much different, i.e., entirely negative, evaluation.  Since I was present at their check-in, and therefore not getting this information second-hand, I feel qualified to offer this review.  My daughter made a two-night reservation at the Portofino Inn for tonight and tomorrow night.  The reservation was made well in advance, and when my daughter called the hotel earlier this evening, she was led to believe that the reservation was still in effect.  When she attempted to check-in at the hotel approximately one hour later, however, she was advised that her reservation had been canceled.  Apparently, Portofino
Manager Response: We truly appreciate you taking the time to provide a feedback, and we are extremely sorry that your daughter did not have a good experience with us. We apologize that we were unable to accommodate her despite her reservation and for not contacting her before her arrival at our property regarding cancellations. We can completely understand the frustration and the undoubted inconvenience caused, and we are sorry we had to relocate her to another location. We apologize for this unfortunate incident and for any miscommunication from our side. We appreciate your review in the true spirit of constructive assessment, and use such feedback to reiterate our commitment towards maintaining high quality service. We hope to have another opportunity to be of service to you.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: This was a great place to stay if your visiting Disneyland. The hotel was clean well maintained. The staff was more than accommodating. When we went into our room we realized the latch lock on our door was broken but they had maintenance there in 10 minutes to fix it. Our friends who went with us, rented an electric scooter from a local company for their elderly mother but the scooter arrived to the hotel before their flight arrived. The hotel signed for it and held it for her in their locked luggage room until she arrived. The staff offered to store it in that room and charge it for her overnight, all 4 days we were there. That was such a great help to them.   We stayed in a double queen room that had a nice little balcony to sit on. There wasn't much of a view but still nice
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites on your recent trip to Disneyland. It is nice to hear that our facilities were convenient for your needs and we are happy that we were able to meet your expectations with regards to a convenient location, comfortable accommodations as well as amazing service. The engineering staff will be alerted for your concern regarding the Wi-Fi. It was our pleasure to host your and your friend’s stay and we are so glad that you plan to return. Thank you and see you soon!   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Our family of six stayed in the family suite for a six day stay. Upon our arrival we noticed the lobby was clean and the staff friendly. The family suite was what was described to us via the web site. The following morning our plan was to get up early and head to Disney. We have twin daughters that are 14, one went in the bathroom to get ready and there were 3 large Roaches on the wall. You can imagine how the 2 girls responded. I went to the desk and requested another room and the lady at the front desk appeared not to believe me at first. She said she could get us another room but it wouldn't be ready until the afternoon. We had to re-pack all of our belongings which took us a great deal of time because of the number of people. By the time all was done it put us at Disney
Manager Response: Thank you for your candor. We apologize for clearly missing the mark during your stay. We have very high service standards at our hotel and we never want to disappoint a guest. Please accept my sincerest apologies for the issues you encountered regarding the roaches and the inconvenience it caused you. Although, I want to assure you that we do have a regularly scheduled pest control program in place. We follow the most rigorous industry standards when it comes to the cleanliness of our guest rooms. I am sorry on behalf of my entire team that they did not make you feel as a valued guest. On a positive note we appreciate you for highlighting our lobby area, as well as, our helpful associates. We hope you will consider and give us another chance in the future so that we can provide you with a better stay experience.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: We love the Portofino.  The Kids suites and spacious and clean,  The bunk beds are a huge hit with the kids,  We love the King bed, so comfortable!!  This is our family favorite hotel. They have cool water in the lobby and fun camera to take a picture, and you can email it to family.   The rooms were always clean and cool, when we returned for a mid day break.  A nice little gift shop, close by and a CVS.  Also, it is within 15 minute walk to Disneyland or the ART picks you up in front of the hotel.  First stop on and first stop off!! This is the ONLY hotel we will stay it!! Our family loves this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share about your wonderful experience at Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. I am so pleased to read how much you enjoyed your suite. Our family-friendly suites with bunk bed and the king bed are especially designed to accommodate entire families so I am glad to hear that this worked perfectly for your needs. I am also happy to know that you loved our proximity to Disneyland, as well as, the surrounding area including the CVS. It was a pleasure having you with us and we are eagerly waiting to welcome you and your family back soon.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: My family and I like the suite we stayed in. I would recommend this for couples however. My small children enjoyed the pool, but most of the patrons were couples without children. Our room was very clean and I LOVED the flooring! Not carpet!They have a restaurant on site, but pricey.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that your family had a fun filled and amazing stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. There is nothing more rewarding than reading terrific comments such as yours and knowing that we made your stay everything it should have been. We are happy to know that you loved your comfortable accommodations and also that your kids had a great time at the pool. We do appreciate your observations and concerns and thank you for recommending our hotel. We hope to have you and your family back with us the next time you are in Anaheim!  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Stayed for one night awesome no complaints would come back to for D23. The rooms were clean the only compaint is that I couldnt check in earlier like i have done before. I don't know what happened they used to be so accomodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing about your overnight stay experience with us here at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. We are happy that you enjoyed your overall time with us and the cleanliness of your room was to your satisfaction. We appreciate your feedback and are happy that you plan to return. We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: As a travel Agent we are always looking for good value accommodation in a good location to recommend to clients, this hotel ticks both those boxes, and walking back and forth to Disney was no problem even a few times a day if necessary. CVS next door is wonderful as is the coffee shop just round the corner.  Air Con is a little noisy but you get used to it, and in the kids suite the sink next to the bathroom is a welcome addition if not a little awkwardly positioned.  proper curtains rather than the flimsy material between the rooms would be better too, so kids could go to bed before adults, having teens this did not bother us, but would be a good idea.  Housekeeping was good and thorough, and reception staff friendly.  valet parking was easy and a good option. security is good,
Manager Response: Thank you for painting a wonderful picture of your stay with us here at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. It is nice to read your detailed description about the accommodations we provide and we are glad that you liked them as well. It's our goal to deliver great value for the price paid and we like hearing that we accomplished just that. With our superb service and proximity to famous attractions, great amenities, and all the facilities we offer, we are pleased that guests find us to be the best choice in the area. We appreciate your business and do hope to welcome you again the next time you're in the area!  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Great value and proximity to Disneyland Parks
Summary: We stayed in the king suite on the fifth floor and I was very pleased with the general cleanliness spaciousness of the room. On top of that, the staff was very friendly and helpful. As far as location,the hotel is about a 5-10 minute walk to/from the parks so that was a definite plus. Having stayed at other exterior-entrance hotels in the area,  I preferred the fact that all suites/rooms were within the hotel proper and that entering the building required a key. The hotel was also next door to a CVS, which was convenient for stocking up on snacks and water en route to the parks (you are allowed to take your own snacks/drinks). Overall, it was a great deal for the money!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. We are so happy that you had an enjoyable stay and your clean comfortable suite along with our convenient location to Disneyland as well as the CVS next door was perfect for your visit. We're always glad to hear that guests are pleased with the terrific value received at our hotel. Our friendly staff will be delighted to your gracious feedback and we do hope to welcome you back the next time you're in the area!  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: We had a last minute Disneyland trip for just one night, and luckily were able to find this great place to stay and we're very helpful in making my reservation. I must say when we arrived 12pm there was a little confusion with the lady at the front desk and relaying or entering information in the system of our arrival confirming we have arrived but due to the time we we're unable to check in and next shift did not see that note of our arrival.  But glad they called me to double check on the reservation and we got our of Disneyland beat and can barely walk but to a neatly cleaned room, fresh and very comfortable. Definitely will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites on your recent trip to Disneyland. We are happy that we were able to accommodate you with your last minute reservations and glad that your clean and comfortable room met your expectations. Guests love that our location is within a few minutes walking distance to Disneyland park and we are glad that it was convenient for your visit as well. We will be right here perfecting our services in anticipation of your next visit. Please hurry back soon!  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Just got back from our Disney vacation.  Loved the location and price was good too.  Nice size rooms and clean is always a plus!  Tomasa the housekeeper was great!  Beds made and clean towels when we got back from a long hot day at Disneyland makes for a happy mom and kids!  Already planning our next trip!  See you in November!
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your glowing review of the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim. It's great to read that you loved our terrific proximity to Disneyland and the value for money we offer. We are also pleased to know that you loved your clean accommodations and our associates especially my housekeeping team who took great care of you, as well as, your needs. I'm glad that your family had a memorable stay and we are eagerly waiting to welcome you and your family on your next trip to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Good stay for the price. It is definitely a place for young families to stay on a budget. It is fair for the price. However, travelers beware. The parking situation is not good you will never find a spot. You must rely on the valet for parking duties. In the evening it seems the valet was under staffed. One night the poor kid had at least 10 cars deep to park. Make sure you tip those guys, they bust their butt! Unfortunately, the hallways stink like dirty diapers and cheap delivery pizza. (Not sure which is worse) It's not the hotels fault, just the inconsiderate pigs that are too lazy to take the stink bombs and stale boxes outside. The rooms are clean and plenty big. I felt like they were clean but you could see they are highly traveled. With all of the people coming in and
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay at our hotel. We are glad for you highlighting our rooms and especially the pull out couch which provided you with an excellent sleep. We are more than happy that you had a great overall stay with us. However, please accept my sincerest apologies for any inconvenience caused. We are passionate about providing our guests with the cleanest facilities so I am sorry that we did not meet this goal. We hope to have another opportunity so that we can provide you with fresh accommodations and the wonderful service that you deserve.  Sincerely,  Dan Kramer

Summary: Had to wait when we first arrived.  No one at front desk to greet us and the two other parties waiting in line behind us. Waited several minutes.  Not good when you are tired from traveling.  No air conditioning it seems in some areas of hotel so very stuffy and warm in the elevator and hallway.  They were having particularly warm/humid weather so maybe this is not usually an issue.  Room was comfortable and clean. Near Disney Parks .  When we were greeted, hotel personnel was polite.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us recently and for sharing your experience. I apologize that you were disappointed on your arrival and the inconvenience caused due to the delayed check in. I will  make sure that this is an isolated incident and ensure that this situation is not repeated again. On the brighter note, we are glad that you felt we are a good value for your money and also that your comfortable room along with our terrific proximity to Disneyland was to your satisfaction. I hope that the rest of your stay was enjoyable and that you will choose to stay with us on your future trip to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Nice but not as clean as we'd have liked it to be
Summary: Very friendly front desk hosts.  Hotel was nice and great location, just not very clean.  Floors were pretty gross and we'd find garbage behind things.  Location was great - within walking distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our hotel and for taking the time to share your experience online. I am glad that you loved our helpful associates and that our proximity to Disneyland was convenient for your needs. However, please accept my sincerest apology for the housekeeping issues you encountered in your room. We are passionate about providing our guests with the cleanest facilities so I am sorry that we did not meet this goal. I have discussed this issue with our Head of Housekeeping so that we can determine where we fell short and take corrective action. We hope that you'll stay with us the next time you are in Anaheim so that we can provide you with fresh accommodations and the wonderful service that you deserve.   Sincerely,  Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland at a good price
Summary: We stayed at the Portofino Inn and Suites on a Disneyland trip. We were happy with our stay and it met our expectations.  Plus The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the entrance to the park. Great proximity There is a CVS store, Subway and small convenience store very nearby The hotel is well maintained The price is quite reasonable for the area Maid service was good  Negative The air conditioner was not well maintained and had trouble keeping up. The filter needed service In general the floor did not have good airflow. It had that hotel smell.  **IN fairness to the hotel I did not complain, it was annoying but not quite to the point of making a stink about it.   I would recommend this place again. You are getting a middle of the road hotel. My expectations were not extremely
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at our property and letting us know about your overall nice stay. Guests love that our location is within a few minutes walking distance to Disneyland Park so there's no need to ride the shuttle, unless that is their preference. We are glad that you found our hotel to be very well kept, and having the CVS and the surrounding stores made it very convenient for you. However, I regret for the trouble you encountered with the air conditioning unit and that it did not work properly. Please be sure that I have already alerted my engineering team and see to that it is fixed as soon as possible. Thank you for recommending our hotel and we hope to have you back with us soon.                                             Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Nice staff, but hotel is VERY dated and not worth staying there again
Summary: I got to Anaheim every summer to go to Disneyland. Usually i stay at the Doubletree but my sister stayed on the other side of the freeway at another hotel so we figured wed stay a little closer to her and picked the portofino. The staff was very friendly when we checked in. We got to our room and it smelled like mildew. the next day, My husband asked the housekeeping staff what the smell was and they told him that there are certain rooms that smell from the condensation from the pool below. We went and asked the front desk about it and they offered to move us (i declined because we were already unpacked and situated and didnt want to move 5 people and all of our stuff) they said they would have maintenance go and look....we never heard anything back from maintenance or the front
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for feedback on your recent stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites. We apologize we fell short in making your guest experience at the Portofino Inn one to remember.  Our goal is to ensure all guests at the Portofino Inn & Suites have a very positive and memorable experience, and again, we are sorry you did not achieve this during your stay. We are truly sorry that you were unable to find a parking spot next to the lobby and had to use our other secured lot adjacent to the hotel between Portofino Inn and the Sheraton. Our current Complementary Valet hours are 7am-1am daily. In 2016, there will be a brand new parking 5 level structure adjacent to our pool that our guests will utilize.  In regards to our Décor, we have recently updated our hotel including our Lobby, Guest Laundry room, Fitness room, Business Center, and we just installed Mini-fridges in all of our guest rooms. We will continue to update the hotel in order to provide our guests with a great hotel with superior customer service. It appears that perhaps the Room Attendant you spoke to about an odor may have miss understood the question. Our pool is an outdoor pool in an open area that is not located under any guest rooms or structures. I apologize for any miscommunication. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our Hotel staff and the great service that they provided you. We do hope that one day in the future, you would consider giving our property another chance, so you can experience our true first-class hospitality.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Staff is great, hotel dated and not all that nice.
Summary: Room was clean, but dated. Air conditioner didn't work - but staff arrived quickly and fixed it. Movie channels did not work. Staff worked to fix. Not what I expected. Not updated in the least. The staff is fantastic, though...
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and for sharing your constructive feedback. We routinely examine our capital projects and create action plans to address areas of the hotel that may need refreshing and refurbishing. We are happy to know that you loved our clean accommodations, our associates and that they took great care of you. Also we are glad that our associates were able to resolve the issues you had with your guest room. I appreciate your candid feedback and have made a note of your concerns. Thank you again for choosing to stay with us and we hope to welcome you back again in the future!  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, lots of traffic and construction
Summary: This was my second stay at the hotel (I stayed there a few years ago).  We had a deluxe 2-queen room.  It is a clean hotel that is very close to Disneyland (about a 10 minute walk).  Lots of restaurants in the area as well.  They have a pharmacy a few yards away at the corner which also has some sandwiches, drinks, alcohol, etc. ... very convenient.  We had a balcony which was nice but stares at another hotel across the way.  You can definitely hear the fireworks at Disney when they are going off and the hotel is not the quietest (but is certainly acceptable).  They did have a convenient mini-fridge in the room too.  Parking, however, is by valet service which is free but don;t expect to be able to easily access your car in case you forget something in it.  We did take our car
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest again at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim we are honored to have you back with us. It's great to read that you loved our terrific proximity to Disneyland, CVS, as well as, the great restaurants in the area. We are also pleased that you enjoyed all the amenities and facilities we had to offer. We are more than happy to know that we could provide you with a memorable stay experience. We appreciate your observations and concerns and we hope to welcome you and your family soon on your next visit to this area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: What can I say about Portofino Inn & Suites? This place is definitely a home away from home. I was welcomed by an amazing staff (Edgar, Diana and Claudia) and their service was amazing! Their honestly, loyalty, and kindness are only a few words to describe their unbelievable service to their guests. Their dedication to their duties surpasses any of those that I have ever seen in terms of guests services from my past resort stays.
