Summary: We stayed in the "bunk-bed suite" with our three children (ages 8, 4 and 2).  The accommodations were great.  It was a very easy 5-10 minute walk to main gate at Disneyland.  We made use of the fridge, microwave, and coin operated laundry.  The front office and service staff were friendly and prompt, and the hotel was quiet for being a "family" venue.  The only recommendation I have is to make the curtain on the french doors separated in the kid's room and king room with black-out curtains - the curtains are currently sheer so the kids can see any light from the adult rooms, which hinders privacy.  We will definitely stay here again!

We look forward to seeing you and the family during your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Very comfortable, kid friendly hotel.  Kid suite room comfortably held 4 kids and 2 adults.  Good size in room mini fridge.  Smaller sized pool, but hot tub also.  Unfortunately, no continental breakfast offered.
Manager Response: Dear KathyM710sf-  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed our pool and spa.  We look forward to seeing you the next time you and your family visit the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: My adult daughter and I stayed here during our trip to Disneyland at the beginning of April. The desk service was great. The employee at the desk when we checked in suggested we skip the cost of the ART pass and walk to the park. This was a great idea as we were less than a half mile away. This was a good way for us to get some extra exercise and it was a nice walk. My only complaint would be that the hotel is out dated and there were some areas where the cleaning staff could have paid some extra attention. The curtains covering the sliding class doors had what looked like spots of crusted food on them. The bed coverings were a bit stained. The furniture and carpeting all looked like they have been there for quite a number of years and have seen thousands of guests. Everything
Manager Response: Dear Kelly W-  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future. We have recently implemented a new bedding package and in 2013 we have installed new carpet and new Flat Panel High Def TV's in each room. We will be adding some new lighting fixtures and some new furniture to the guest rooms in 2014.  Thank you for the kind words about the friendliness of the staff. We hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: My family and I stayed here over the holidays and it was a terrific experience. The staff working was very friendly and helpful. We were greeted well, and were assisted quickly when help was needed. The rooms were very spacious and bright. Its extremely close to Disney, which relieved stress when we were coming back tired. Its also conveniently in front of I Hop and a few shops in case you need anything. Overall, it was a great experience, and I would recommend anyone to stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great experience as always. Staff was courteous and knowledgeable. Closeness to all our excursions was a plus us. Parking was excellent. Would have been nice to have a refrigerator. My granddaughter would be perfectly happy jut to stay and enjoy the pool and spa.
Manager Response: Dear Ridgecresy-  Thank you so much for your positive comments about your stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We are always pleased to hear from our guests that they had a nice relaxing, quiet stay with us.  It is great to see you enjoyed our pool area and how our hotel is centrally located for all your excursions. We look forward to seeing Nana and the family the next time you come to visit the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Extremely helpful staff and made our stay a memorable one. Loved the room and the location is great.the kids room is the best.I would stay again at any opportunity. Great pool area amore restaurants are close, but some available service would be an enhancement.
Manager Response: Dear Chip W-  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love hearing that you had a fun stay and that our spacious Family Suite with the bunk beds worked great for the family.  It is nice to hear you were able to take advantage of our close proximity to restaurants and the pool during your stay.  We look forward to seeing you the next time you visit the Anaheim Area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Comfortable and affordable.   Need to have the doors in the Kid Suites off a track. Housekeeping and front desk were friendly. Love the location.  Close to Disneyland,  Convention center & the Garden Walk.
Manager Response: Dear It4m2000-  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Great place, quiet and clean! I would recommend to anyone who has to stay in Anaheim. Great beds and the suite was big enough for my stay! I enjoyed the in room coffee machine and reach in. I also enjoyed the touch screen for the air and heater. Very cool!
Manager Response: Dear Larry M-  We are glad to hear you had a great quiet and relaxing stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites hotel. It is nice to hear you were able to enjoy of our spacious suites and the in room amenities. We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in Anaheim.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: This was a spur of the moment decision to stay here. Our family had thought about it previously and my daughter and I were on a Road Trip over Spring Break exploring colleges for her this Fall. The Portofino surpassed our expectations!! HUUUGE ROOM!! In a QUIET area!! We only heard the noise outside our room when we had the double doors, that separated the bed from the rest of the room, open....if we remembered to close them, we slept sound!! The beds DID HURT my body, but I have chronic pain, what doesnt hurt my body!?! Oh hahaha my daughter did get me stuck trying to roll me into the door from the sidewalk, I actually had to stand up to get the chair in......other than that....we WILL be back!!
Manager Response: Dear Damsel_in_Defense:  Thank you so much for your positive comments about your stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We are always pleased to hear from our guests that they had a nice relaxing, quiet stay with us.  It is great to see you enjoyed our spacious suite and the great location that our hotel has to offer.    We hope your daughter chooses a college nearby so that we can continue be your host hotel during your routine family visits throughout the academic year.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: 2nd time at the hotel and can't say enough about the location. Service was great.  Our a/c wasn't working and they sent someone up right away and fixed it.  Front desk folks are very nice and helpful.  Will stay again!!!
Manager Response: Dear Tracey E-  Thank you for being a loyal and repeat guest and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We are glad to hear you enjoyed our spacious Guest Room and that we were able to trouble shoot the guest room AC in a timely manner. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our staff and the great service that they provided you.   We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Portofino Inn & Suites - No Too Sweet
Summary: Our first impression of Portofino Inn & Suites as we entered was good - until we got to our room.  Although it was located directly on the construction side of the hotel, we didn't find the construction noise to be overbearing, so no problem there. The room itself (which was a Kids Suite) was of sufficient size for our group of four. The first thing we noticed was the smell.  The room had a strange odor, which you would not expect from rooms that had just been "renovated."  I was sorry I didn't have a candle with me on this trip. The second thing we noticed were the wall lamps on either side of the king bed - the left one was totally loose and the right one had broken in half and was hanging off the wall. We promptly called maintenance to repair, as we were afraid to use them
Manager Response: Dear Mary F-  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future. Our closets generally have a minimum of 8 hangers in the room (4 pants and 4 shirt hangers). Our Suites offer our guests a closet, a chest of drawers, a luggage rack, and night stands to accommodate our guest belongings. We have recently implemented a new bedding package in our guest rooms.  We hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you superior service.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: The hotel is 10 minutes walk to Disneyland, the rooms are generally quiet and clean, staff are friendly. the gift/snack store in the hotel is a plus, cheap and convenient. IHOP is located right across the street. several eating places are well within walking distance. we enjoyed our stay in this hotel and will likely recommend it to our family and friends.
Manager Response: Dear Eva N-  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We are glad to hear you enjoyed our quiet and clean Guest Rooms. Thank you for the kind words about the friendliness of our staff. It is great to hear you were able to enjoy our close proximity to the Disneyland parks and restaurants. We look forward to seeing you and your family the next time you are in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: The hotel was very accommodating and met all expectations for celebrating a magical birthday. The room was clean, the staff was very helpful, and the front desk even gave my daughter a surprise gift for her birthday. The Kid's Suite is spacious and is very family friendly. I recommend this hotel for your next Disney stay.
Manager Response: Dear OnceMer-  It was a true pleasure hosting your family and being a part of the magical experience of a Birthday visit to Disneyland. It is great hearing that the kids loved the bunk beds and that the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites.  We thank you for all of your kind comments about our staff and the great service that they provided you. We look forward to seeing you the next time you and your family visit the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Decent hotel with suites within walking distance to Disney
Summary: We stayed here during our spring break...we are from Oregon. We needed a place with sleeping for 5 people and they were one of a few within what we call walking distance to Disneyland. The rooms were decent enough. It would be nice if they added another mirror area other than by the sinks as we all needed to get ready in the mornings. The parking was limited. Their didn't seem to be enough for all the guests. They were doing construction in the parking area so we were packed like sardines and had to park in iffy places. All in all it was okay. The bed was comfortable enough and that's mostly what matters to me. I would try to get closer to Disney next time though. Oh, it would have been nice to have a complimentary breakfast for what we paid. We had to pay for parking as well.
Manager Response: Dear MNMTD-  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love hearing that our spacious Suite worked perfectly for the party of five.   I apologize that the parking lot was a little bit tighter to maneuver. The neighboring hotel is scheduled to be completed very soon and in the very near future we will be expanding our parking lot. Our Resort taxes/fees includes free parking for 1 vehicle, free wifi, our fitness room, and our pool/spa.     Although we do not serve breakfast at the hotel, We do have Molly's cafe across from our lobby that specializes in breakfast and we do have IHOP directly across the street.    We are glad to hear you enjoyed the easy walk from the hotel to the Disneyland Main Entrance.   We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: We took a family vacation to California and the Portofino was very affordable and close to Disneyland..we loved it and would go back and stay there again..it was close to alot of places to eat and was in walking distance to pretty much everything
Manager Response: Dear Georgina D- We are thrilled to hear from another guest who loved their stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We are glad to hear that our close proximity to restaurants and the Maingate Disneyland entrance matched your needs. We look forward to seeing you and your family on your next visit to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: All staff was very friendly.   Booked the room because of the close distance to Disneyland.  Walking there in the morning was great but our feet hurt so bad at the end of the day, ending up taking the bus back.  The room was big enough for 3 people, the balcony was nice but it was very dark and the curtains were filthy.  The pool was very small and therefore very crowded.  Rooms do not have a fridge or microwave. Bath towels were small, bedding was OK.  We stayed once before in the newer tower and it was a much better experience but,  would stay somewhere else next time.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa D-  Thank you for being a loyal and repeat guest and for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the short walk from our hotel to the Disneyland Maingate entrance. It's nice to see that after a long day at the parks, you were able to utilize our Anaheim Resort Transportation (A.R.T.) shuttle to return back to the hotel. All of our King Suites and Family Suites (Bunk-beds) do include a mini-fridge and microwave. We are very grateful that you allowed us to be your host hotel during your visit to the Anaheim area. We hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: The rooms and grounds were clean and fresh looking. The maid service was good. We got a King Suite so we could have a separate sleeping area from our toddlers, but the sliding French-style doors that separated the two rooms had sheer drapes and weren't sealed. So our kids could see our light on and us moving about the room - this prevented them from going to sleep. So we would have to turn out our lights and go to bed at the same time as our kids, which was what we were trying to avoid by getting the suite. Also, the pool was very small, and not friendly to small children. It was 3 feet at entry and 5 feet in the deeper end. Wished we could have used it more, but our little ones couldn't touch the bottom so it wasn't fun for them. Portofino would get 5 stars from us if the pool
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went to Disneyland on a family vacation.  This hotel was very nice.  Great value with nice rooms.  Would definitely stay here again.  Only downside was the sliding doors to the kids room were off track and did not close properly
Manager Response: Dear Heather O-  Thank you for the kind words about our Family Suite with the Bunk-beds. We appreciate you sharing your observation in regards to the sliding doors. We will continue to ensure all of the sliding doors are positioned correctly for a smooth and easy closure to separate the Master bedroom from the Kids bunk-beds room. We look forward to seeing you and your family the next time you some to visit the Disneyland Resort parks.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: The only con I have ever thought for this hotel is there is no view of the fireworks. We have stayed here several times. We take our granddaughter every year at Christmas to Disneyland.  This past year, we discovered the total lack of view is not completely true. We happened to have the drapes open when the fireworks were going. There is a mirrored building across the street that provided a spectacular view of them! Grandpa was already asleep. But the two of us enjoyed the view very much. :-)  It is no more than a 15 minute walk. Leisurely. And pushing a stroller. At the first corner, is a little convenience store. You can get milk, snacks, hot dogs, etc.  We always get the kids suite. It is well sized. The king size bed and bathroom side has a tv and plenty of room.  The bunk

We may be able to deliver one to the room for you. We look forward to seeing you and your family the next time you are in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Perfect in every way.  The room was clean, comfortable and had all the amenities we requested. It was the perfect stay for grandparents, children and grand children alike.  The pool was clean and warm and we enjoyed the friendly staff.  Thank you so much

We look forward to seeing you and your family at the Portofino Inn & Suites the next time your travel plans bring you back to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: I had been wanting to stay at this hotel for quite sometime due to the 2 bedroom Kids suite they have. It was nice but I expected a little more. However, the location was wonderful! We walked both days to and from the hotel, disneyland and downtown disney. I would stay there again due to the location and price. I do think they need a little bit of an upgrade on their bunk beds. The bottom bunk was slightly slanted and the railing on the top bunk was a bit loose. My kids still slept in the bunk beds.  But like I said I would saty there again.

Summary: it was perfect for the whole family! We are a family of 6 we got the childrens suite and it was great.  No one was left to sleep on the floor. Very clean. We called for extra pillows and blankets and no one ever brought them but other than that it was great and i would defitatly go back.

We are glad to hear that our spacious Kids Suite was able to accomodate all 6 of the family members. We look forward to seeing you and the family the next time you visit Anaheim and the Disneyland Resort parks.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: This hotel is nice for families with kids cause it had the kids suite with bunk beds. But it is NOT 1 block from Disneyland entrance. More like 2 1/2. Don't get me wrong it's nice but it was really pricey for that far away and I think cause we where there for USA cheer and close to convention center they rasied the price. They had a hard time keeping our suite filled with clean Towels and Toilet paper. Couldn't understand why. The beds where VERY uncomfortable! I give it a 3 out of 5

We hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you superior service.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: For my sister's birthday and my son's first trip to Disneyland, we stayed at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim Hotel and it was amazing. The family suite with the bunk beds is perfect if you're traveling with children, my three year old daughter loved having the top bunk to sleep in and my son was able to sleep on the lower bunk. I also loved that they put the bunkbed and the queen bed in two seperate rooms divided by sliding french doors. It's close to Disneyland, a McDonalds, Starbucks, gas stations and a few other popular resturants like California Pizza Kitchen. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with children!
Manager Response: Dear Chrisalen Y-  It was a true pleasure hosting your family and being a part of the magical experience of a first time visit to the Disneyland resort parks. It is great hearing that the kids loved the bunk beds and that the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites was close to all the restaurants and shops to satisfy every person in the family.  We look forward to seeing you and the family, The next time you visit the Disneyland parks.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: very pleasant stay including staff. found the lower floors a little noisy if you have upstairs guests. The swimming pool and hot tub were well kept and clean. Sometimes difficult in getting ahold of staff if they were busy but were always polite. We would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good location. A 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland.  Rooms were clean and big enough for us to have a roll a way bed.Had 2 rooms that were ajjoining, which was perfect for our family of six. No refrigerator, which would have been nice.
Manager Response: Dear Jonna K-  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We are glad to hear you enjoyed our clean and spacious Deluxe Guest Rooms. Our King Suites and Family Kids Suites (Bunk Beds Suites) do have a microwave and refrigerator in the rooms. Also, we do have a limited supply of spare refrigerators that we can deliver to guest rooms that do not have one. Please do not hesitate to let the Front Desk know that you would like a fridge and we will be delighted to deliver one to your room, if available.  We look forward to seeing you and your family the next time you are in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: We enjoyed out stay. Kid friendly hotel, small pool, small parking lot. I recommend a parking garage for your guest. Excellent location. Disney park is a block up the street in walking distance and Disney parking is right across the street. Free shuttle to and from the park. Great place to stay if your on a budget!
Manager Response: Dear Tammee_1-  We are thrilled to hear from another guest who had another Great stay at the lovely and kid friendly Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel.  We are glad to hear that our close proximity to the shuttles and to the Disneyland Parks matched your needs. We look forward to seeing you again.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Recently stayed here in the beginning of March for 5 nights. This was my 4th trip to Disneyland and had not stayed here before. I found the rooms clean and beds comfy. House keeping did a great job each day. Staff are friendly and check in and out was easy with no hassles. Has a laundry which we needed which was good. Didn't use the pool but had a look and it looks good if you want to go for a swim. Our room had a balcony but we didn't really use it due to being out all the time. The hotel is close to plenty of places to eat, there is a convenience/gift shop downstairs that seems to sell everything. There is also a place that sells Starbucks coffee next door which came in handy. Disneyland is about a 10 to 15 min walk depending on if you get the lights or not? Overall I enjoyed
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is 2 blocks walking distance to Disneyland. We stayed in a family room, it was perfect for traveling with two teenagers. We had a queen size bed and the kids had bunk beds and a pull out sofa. The room was spacious and clean. I requested extra towels and they delivered. I asked the cleaning service for extra coffee and they provided it. There was enough storage space. Only two things I noticed about the room was the outlet by the outside sink was lose so I couldn't plug anything there and the door to the bathroom needed to be oiled, it made  noise when opened in the middle of the night, we only stayed 2 nights so we didn't bother asking for service. They only provide parking space for one family car, we had a 2nd car so we had to park at the Sheraton, right behind
Manager Response: Dear Lopezsm77-  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love hearing that our spacious Family Suite with the bunk beds worked great for the family. We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Very friendly front desk staff. Room was clean. We stayed in a kids suite. Kids loved the bunk beds.  Great location very easy walk from Disney land. Would stay again. Only downside is no breakfast is offered.

Summary: The room was nice lots of room and an easy walk to the parks.  The parking was a little spares. House keeping was very nice and keep the supplies fun.  We were with in walking distance also to many restaurants and the bus line for other activities.
Manager Response: Dear Tracy P-  We are thrilled to hear from another guest who had an excellent stay at the lovely Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We are glad to hear that our close proximity to restaurants and the Disneyland park entrances matched your needs. We look forward to seeing you again.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Very Good place for our family's trip to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here in mid February for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. We had a two bedroom unit which included a queen bed, bunk beds and a sofa bed (which we did not need).  The bathroom was roomy.  The little kitchenette was adequate for our needs (heating bottles, a place to store snacks and wine!, we did not use the coffee maker).  The beds were comfy and the maid service was very good.  As to location, we found the walk easy.  It was one kilometer to the gates.  There is no breakfast option or restaurant at the hotel so we utilized neighbouring restaurants and convenience.  The pool was very nice.  Large with plenty of seating and had a hot tub.  It was in a quiet location.  The hotel staff were very helpful.  There are a lot of little mom/pop style eateries close by -
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to the park/family suites spacious
Summary: Check in was quick, room was clean and spacious. Beds were comfortable and clean. Walk to Disney entrance was 10 minutes, crossing 2 lights. Pool  and hot tub were clean, warm and while small, accommodating to all the guests using them. Parking was good at check in and we never had difficulty finding a space. Allowed to leave your car after check out if you are still visiting the parks. Staff very friendly and accommodating as well. We would definitely return with our family of 5.
Manager Response: Dear momofboys223344-  We are glad to hear you had a nice and relaxing stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites hotel. We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in Anaheim.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Overall we enjoyed our stay!!!!!   We got the family suite. The king size bed and the two bunk beds. The room was clean, spacious, and over all comfy. Not many outlets for charging stuff but if you look hard enough you'll find them.   Beds were extremely comfortable especially after a long day in the parks. Shower and bathroom was nice. Clean. Water stayed at a perfect temperature (believe me, I've stayed at hotels were the water goes from super cold to super hot every 10 minutes). Maids made up the beds very nice everyday. Folded our extra blackest we brought along with us. Always makes me feel good when they fold them or place them nicely on the bed. Shows they take care of your belongings. Not throwing them around.    Shuttle to the park stops at the corner of the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed here many times.  This time was no different. Great service, clean rooms.  My only complaint is parking.  It is often very difficult to find a spot. And this time was even harder because part of the lot was blocked off for construction.

Summary Heading: Great for families; close walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We booked the room with the king bed and bunk beds for three nights.  We were in the larger of the two buildings and facing ongoing construction of a new hotel being built on the corner of Harbor and Katella.  At check-in, they told us this was the only room available in the type we wanted that night, but if we found the noise bothersome, they would gladly move us to a new room the following day.  We found that the noise never once bothered us; in fact, being on the third floor (of four) we rarely even ever heard other hotel guests.    The bed was very comfy and the kids loved the bunk bed.  The hotel provided a crib for the two year old, and it was a pack and play style with a mattress, sheets, blankets, and a pillow that they delivered promptly.  We used the fridge and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We all stayed at the Portofino - great location, kids loved the bunkbeds.  Easy walk to Disneyland, the staff was very friendly and helpful.  My daugher-in-law has stayed at this Hotel before and likes the convenience and size of rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Pam A-  It was a true pleasure hosting your family and being a part of the magical experience of a first time visit to Disneyland. It is great hearing that the kids loved the bunk beds and that the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites was an easy walk to Disneyland.  We look forward to seeing you the next time you and your family visit the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: ALL GREAT .. Enjoyed the stay in our king suite. The rest of the family had the kids bunk bed rooms and they were very happy with them.the only problem was the parking situation. Hopefully after the construction is finished the problem will be solved. We would love to come back to your hotel in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Rudy C-  Thank you so very much for your feedback on your recent stay with us. We love hearing that your stay was "Great". We are glad to see that both the King Suite and the Family Suite with the bunk beds worked great for the family. We look forward to you returning to the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites when your travel plans bring you back to the Disneyland Resort.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: We chose Portofino Inn for the kids suite. My kids loved the bunk beds and the room gave us all plenty of our own space. The location is convenient,  and although walking to Disneyland from here seemed like quite a walk, we drove less then half a block into the toy story lot and used the shuttle to the parks. The downside to the hotel is the need for a little TLC. Mainly the bathroom.The wallpaper in the bathroom had a few spots that really showed it wear and tear, and the chair in the kids suite could use a good shampoo. Overall it was a clean room. And smelled clean too, the bed was more comfortable then most hotels in the same price range. And we would be more then happy staying here again!!!
Manager Response: Dear Kristy B-  Thank you for the kind words about our Kids Suite with the Bunk-Beds. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the close proximity of the hotel to the Disneyland Main Entrance as well as the Toy Story Parking Lot and shuttles. Thank you for sharing your observation in regards to the guest room items. I will personally look into making the proper changes in order to better enhance our guest experience.  We look forward to seeing you and the family during your next visit to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: The room was large and open. Fifth (top) floor was very quiet. Construction was going on next door so the view outside one window wasn't spectacular, but the other window opened up to the Harbor and that was nice. Location is good. Little far for a late night walk from Disneyland, but the walk there is fine.
Manager Response: Dear gtcsdad-  We are glad to hear you had a nice, quiet, and relaxing stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites hotel. It is nice to hear you were able to take advantage of our close proximity to Disneyland. We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in Anaheim.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Stayed in the 2 bedroom suite, had a great time staying at the portofino l, room was clean, quiet and big enough for my family of 7. Contruction noise in the morning next door but of no fault of the hotel and will be done soon so no bad marks against the hotel. Pool was fantastic after a long day at the park, from desk staff very nice and helpful. Have stayed many times at the portofino and will be back many more. Fantastic stay !!!
Manager Response: Dear Eric H- Thank you for being a loyal and repeat guest and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the Two bedroom Suite and the pool.  Thank you for the kind words about the friendliness of the Portofino staff. We look forward to seeing you and your family the next time you are in Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Was quite happy with everything. The only suggestion I would make is it would be nice to have access to basic medicine such as Tylenol and Tums either through a vending machine or front desk. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Traveled with my wife, son and daughter in law and two granchildren, 6 and 9.  We got the kids suite for them and a suite for us.  It was a wnderful stay.  The staff were great.  Jessica and the 5th floor crew kept the rooms ready for us on our return from Disneyland.  It is a bit of a walk to Disneylad for anyone that needs assistance.  However, the local bus picks up just outside the hotel and drops you at the entrance to Disneyland.  Just ask the front desk about boarding passes.
Manager Response: Dear maddog3299- Thank you for choosing to stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites during your family trip. We are delighted to hear about your experience and we are thrilled to hear that the staff gave you such great service. We look forward to seeing you the next time you come to Anaheim.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary Heading: Convenient and Always a Great Stay
Summary: Located convenient to Disneyland and walking distance to just about anything you need.  Staff is friendly and our stay is always enjoyable.  Having a pool is a plus for the kids.  .............................................................................................................................................................................
Manager Response: Dear Mike H-  It is so great to hear that you and your family had an enjoyable return trip to the Portofino Inn & Suites hotel! We are so happy that you have chosen us more than once to host your Disneyland trips. It is so great to know that every visit you’re able to enjoy our close proximity to Disneyland and our pool. Thank you for your positive feedback about or staff. We look forward to seeing you again during your next trip to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Good hotel.  Very basic ammenities, nothing fancy but really good if you need a place to lay your head and take a shower after a long day at DisneyLand!  Received a great internet rate and is about half a mile from the main entrance to California Adventure and DisneyLand.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: President's Week Trip with the Family
Summary: My family of 5 stayed in a Kids' Suite for 2 nights during the President's Week.   No restaurants, complimentary breakfast or complimentary shuttle on site.  However, complimentary Wi-Fi and parking were great. The hotel was conveniently located across the street from IHOP (I would recommend that you get there before 8 AM to beat the crowd).  The walk to Disneyland and California Adventure (our youngest is 6 yrs. old) took us about 15 mins.  Add extra 5-10 minutes to Downtown Disney. Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient.    Room was clean and exactly as described.  The 2nd sink made getting ready a lot quicker in the morning and at bedtime.  The kids enjoyed their "separate" area with their own television.  It was nice to have the extra space after spending all day in
Manager Response: Dear FamilyofFivehaveFun- Thank you for sharing your experience at the Portofino Inn! We are thrilled to hear you enjoyed your Holiday Weekend trip .We are glad to hear that our Family/Kids Suite was able to accommodate you and provide you with the room to spread out and relax during your stay. Thank you for your positive feedback on our staff and our location. We appreciate the time you have taken to write a review and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future!   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk to Disneyland, closer than the Disney parking lots.  Convenient location and the rooms are a reasonable size.  The suites with bunk beds and pull out bed are perfect for a family.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was great and close within walking distance to Disneyland. The hotel was clean and the front desk clerk was great. We also felt safe at this hotel, and safety is a factor. The hotel is surrounded by eating establishments.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property was a very nice place. Close to Disney.  About 10-12 minute walk with kids.  We stayed in the kid suite and had plenty of room for 4 people.  The room was clean and up to date.  There was construction on one side of the hotel.  When I checked in, I asked if we could have something away from the construction and they happily granted my request.  Construction was starting around 7 am. We parked on site free of charge and walked to the parks.  The walk is not bad, but can be a little more, epsecially after walking through the parks all day long.  My kids enjoyed the kid suite bunk beds.   For the price the room was large, clean and well appointed.  You might be able to stay closer, but i think you may have to pay for parking.  Next time we may look for something
Manager Response: none

Summary: Located just a block away from the  resort entrance and easy walk to lots of great dining options. Good pool for a break from the activity to relax and enjoy the sun. Comfortable rooms--we stayed in a family suite which have a great set up for a separate sleeping area for the kids separated by French doors with curtains for privacy.
Manager Response: Dear J C- Thank you for sharing your experience at the Portofino Inn! We are glad to hear that our Family/Kids Suite was able to accommodate you and provide you with the room to spread out and relax during your stay. It is great to know that you enjoyed the pool, the sun, and the close proximity to Disneyland. We hope you will be able to join us again in the future!   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: Rooms were nice. Our kids had their own private room. The bunkbeds were a hit withvour girls.nice big t.v. the room had a sofa thatvthat also turned into a bed. It was very close yo disneyland and the shuttle picks up and drops off right in front. Very secure
Manager Response: Dear Denise- It is so great to hear that you and your family had an enjoyable trip at the Portofino Inn! We are so happy to see that our Family Suites with the Bunk-beds were a hit...And you were able to take advantage of the Sofa Bed too. We are thrilled that you were able to enjoy our close proximity to Disneyland. Thank you for your positive feedback, we hope to see you again during your next trip to Anaheim.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: The only good thing about this hotel is the location.  BUT - there is construction next door which is noisy.  The room is very tired and worn.  Lighting was bad and some lights did not work.  The bathroom was dirty and there was chewing gum on the furniture.  Staff was pleasant.
Manager Response: Dear JWtn2014- Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  On behalf of our entire team, I would like to apologize for failing to exceed your expectations. Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future. I have shared your comments with our staff and Management team so that we can learn from your observations and continue to improve in the Maintenance and Housekeeping Dept.  We are saddened to hear that you were unable to have relaxing stay with us due to noise of the Marriott hotel being built near us. We will make every effort to ensure our guests enjoy our newly refreshed and updated rooms with out being disturbed by near by construction in the city.  Once again, We are truly sorry for any inconvenience we may have caused you. We are very grateful that you allowed us to be your host hotel during your visit to the Anaheim area. We hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you with a superior experience.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: We stayed here in February for a trip to Disneyland for my kids.  The rooms were great. The price was great, and we had a wonderful time.  The location to Disneyland was excellent.  Just a 10 minute walk to the park.  We arrived in town from Phoenix at 9 am and they were very nice to let us check in at that time and not have to wait until later.  That made it very easy to unload the car and freshen up before heading out around town.  The only bad part was that the guests above us were very noisy and the sound came through the floor quite loudly.  Not a huge issue because I myself was traveling with young children and I understand how excited they can be.  Would have been nice if they offered a breakfast, but again not an issue because there are lots of places to eat, very close
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was nice and enjoyed the ability to separate the rooms.. It was clean and the temp. was great-  Parking was sparse and made it difficult to find a spot close= even had a guest block some cars in for a half hour. Employees were very helpful
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were clean. Walking to the Convention Center was easy and convenient. There are a wide variety of restaurants in the area.  I appreciated the security of the back area near the pool.  Ordered pizza in one evening and service was quick.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was very impressed with everything until 6 AM when I woke up to very loud construction noises. Through the window I noticed a construction site about 50 feet from the hotel. I know it is not the hotel's fault, but I expect them to tell me about it and maybe also to try and offer a room at the other side of the hotel. Besides that, everything else was fine.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved the hotel, the only thing was that I seen two small pesticides in the bathroom. Housekeeping did come clean the room and it was fine after that. I loved that they offer kids suites, which my kids loved. We celebrated my daughters 5th. Birthday at Disneyland, I loved it was just one block away and I was even able to decorate the room in Princess stuff to make the stay extra wonderful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for nothing more
Summary: Was one of the less expensive hotels near the convention center and close to the Disneyland resorts too.  So, price isn't cheap in the area and so it was an ok hotel room but the hotel lacked some basics and the TV would turn off by itself about ever 20 or 30 minutes for no reason at all.  The lobby doesn't have any snack or breakfast area at all so I had to find breakfast separate from the hotel.  I guess I am spoiled that way but for business travel that just adds time to my mornings that I usually don't have to spare so that would have been nice.  Some of the amenities in the hotel room you could see were definitely worn and looked well used.   The bed was way too soft for my comfort level.  I woke up achy.
Manager Response: Dear ttraveller321-  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us. . Your satisfaction is important to us and we will be using the feedback you provided to make improvements to ensure we offer an exceptional experience for our guests in the future.  We have recently implemented a new bedding package in our guest rooms. We do carry mattress boards that we can install for you to make the mattress firmer if that is your preference at your request. We hope that you will consider staying with us again so that we can have another chance to provide you superior service.  Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: We really enjoyed our trip and the hotel was located in a great spot for us, with great service. We went to Disneyland as a family for the first time and we were able to walk to the park from the hotel everyday. The staff there was very friendly and the hotel was very clean and welcoming. They had a pool and a hut tub which was both fun for my husband and I and entertaining for our five years old
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved the short walking distance to Disneyland as well as a local nightclub. Since I went with a large group of friends, this was really helpful for us if anyone forgot anything at the hotel or just needed a nap/break, they could just hop back to the hotel and meet up with us later without us having to worry about transportation/safety. I would say that the sliding door between the "kids" and the "parents" room is definitely not very helpful in blocking sounds likes snoring, though.
Manager Response: Dear  Y D- Thank you so much for your positive comments about your stay at the Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We are always so pleased to hear from our guests who enjoyed their overall experience, the wonderful amenities, and the great location that our hotel has to offer.  We do have a couple suites that offer a fully enclosed wall between the Master and the second sleeping area. Perhaps those suites may help with the light sleepers in the group. We look forward to providing you with another excellent stay, and we hope that will be soon!   Sincerely, Dan Kramer

Summary: I liked the importance of my stay with Portofino because they were very happy to receive us and greet us in a very polite way. Rooms very clean and comfortable beds. I recommend Portofino Inn & suites.
Manager Response: Dear Maritsa Q- We are thrilled to hear from another guest who had an excellent stay at the lovely Anaheim Portofino Inn & Suites Hotel. We thank you for all of your kind comments about our staff and the great service that they provided you. We look forward to seeing you again, and hope that it will be very soon.   Sincerely, Dan Kramer General Manager

Summary: Well kept room and not as noisy as some had mentioned. If you choose a lower level floor ya gotta expect some racket from above. An easy 10 minute walk to the park entrance. Nice to not have to pay additional to park your car although parking was a bit limited. Decent value for being so close. We would use them again....
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not the greatest, fanciest hotel ever but that's not really what I paid for. The room is pretty clean some of the furniture is pretty beat up but with the amount of kids that come through here, that's expected. The walls are pretty thin but overall ok.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice easy walk to the Park and restaurants in the area including Anaheim Garden Walk. Enjoyed staying in the kids suite unit, with the 4 of us in the room it was comfortable. Would stay here again next time we come to Disneyland for a visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was wonderful. Location was great. Perfect restaurants so close. I'd say the only negative was we drove across the street and had to pay 15.00 per day to park and take the bus to Disneyland (literally across the street - odd)
Manager Response: none

Summary: The first kids suite we were in faced disneyland and construction of a new hotel. Upon arrival the white bed linen had specs that when brushed smeared. We tried to make the best of it but the second day after the room had been cleaned  new and more small flake like pieces of something were on the beds. None of us have allergies but all were stuffy. Upon waking the the second morning of our 4 nt stay, a large chunk of grey something lay on the edge of my pillow. At that point we had had enough and after observation figured debris was being forced out of the air ducts into the rooms. We took the large piece and several smaller pieces down to the front desk. They were very accommodating but at the same time seemed unconcerned and said it must be from the construction next door.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a great time at California Adventure, Downtown Disney and of course Disneyland.  Spent 3 nights at the hotel and was impressed with the convenient location.  Walked to Disneyland each day and not far from many restaurants.  Will be going again soon and will be staying at Portofino!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 2nd time staying here and yes we will be back
Summary: My wife and I stumbled upon this hotel when we were planning our trip last year and one of our favorite features is the king bed with kids suite.  There is plenty of room and beds for that matter also comes with a fridge and microwave which is exactly what we prefer.  The pricing is reasonable and the walk to Disney is short and not long at all, even after a long day at the park.  Staff was friendly and we will most likely be staying here on our next trip to Disney.  I highly recommend this place!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The employees were friendly but I feel the rooms could be nicer. The cable tv was fuzzy on most channels. I tried to get it fixed but it was still messed up. The dresser was old and funky inside...not very clean looking. And, the construction next door that started at 7:00 am woke me up everyday.
Manager Response: none

Summary: No complaints and as in past years when we've stayed there found your staff to be better than those other hotels around you who's employees aren't so happy and helpful. We'll be back there next year. Thanks
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel except for construction next door
Summary: Hotel is convenient to convention center with large rooms.  The only downside was major construction outside our window. This is great for families, there are french doors between the main room and room with bunkbeds, microwave and fridge.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent hotel!  Our family of 4 stayed in a kids suite with bunk beds.  It was real nice as both the kids and parents had their own room/privacy.  The pool water was nice and warm for the kids to do a late evening swim before bed while we relaxed in the hot tub!  10 minute walk to Disney.  Restaurants, groceries, 7-eleven, all within a couple minute walk.  We will definitely stay here again!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: A very good set up for children, the bunk-beds were just right for our 7, 5 & 3 year old's. Housekeeping staff always friendly and professional. Front Desk staff as well. Room rates were reasonable and a good value. Construction outside our 4th floor window was a surprise but not as surprising as the fact that work begins at 6 am on a Saturday! Still worth it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I arrived early and requested an additional day. I was checked in right away and extra day was added without any question. Friendly receptionist. I was greeted with a smile from EVERYONE on staff. Rooms were spacious and bed was cozy. I would recommend hotel to family and friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a nice hotel within walking distance to disneyland and great for families. The rooms have bunk beds and a sliding door (although be warned-- the sliding door does not block light or snoring from the other room!). The pool and hot tub were nice. The hotel and the rooms are clean. When we first arrived our room smelled funny and they quickly moved us. I recommend this if you are looking for a reasonably priced place to stay when visiting disneyland and want to save your money for the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a night at Portofino after another resort wasn't willing to book our reservation for the final night of our disney stay. We switched over to Portofino for the final night and wished we would have stayed there all 3 nights. The room was very quiet and comfortable and very close to disney. As a new mom who has to refrigerate milk, they were able to accommodate me and brought us a refrigerator.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was nice and the bed was comfy. It was a four block walk to Disneyland (a little less than a mile) and there are a ton of restaurants also within walking distance. Thee was construction on the hotel next door that started early in the morning, but there's nothing this place could really control about that. A parking pass for your whole stay was $20 which was less than any other Disney parking option. There was a free city shuttle, but times are limited so get details before planning to use it. Very clean and I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect during winter and if you dont have children with asthma
Summary: Hotel was nice, appeared clean, and quiet. Although the ventilation system was bad. My son who has asthma coughed and wheezed the entire night in hotel. The rest of my family was fine in the room. So as long as your child does not have asthma I would consider staying here. The pool was rather small so I would only consider this hotel  in winter. There is no way all the kids in this hotel could fit in pool diring summer.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We liked this hotel! It was a very easy walk to disneyland it took about 15 mins. The room was clean. We had a great room rate because we booked very early. The only thing that was bad was we were on the 2nd floor and you call hear the people about us walk! So next time we will ask for the 3 flood!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Functional but charmless- everything works- AC, hot water, and it's clean enough.  Also plenty of space in the kids suite, free wifi, and you can park 1 car free.  The picture of the pool is misleading- it's tiny.  Ditto the lobby- their photographer is a genius.  The website says its 5 minutes from Disneyland, but its a 10-15 minute walk to the Disneyland gate, if you walk fast and get lucky on the traffic lights.  The rather expensive hotel shuttle stops at every hotel in the area and will take longer.  I suggest taxis- they'll be much cheaper if you have more than one in your party.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the kids suite which fit our needs perfectly. However the walls were paper thin. The ice machine was three doors down and we could hear it perfectly when someone was getting ice. Just someone walking down the hall speaking in a normal voice sounded like they were next to the bed. We are not early risers so this was a big issue for us. The hotel certainly needs some TLC, water damage around fridge, stains in the tub and ripped wall paper. The staff was super friendly and accomidating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a wonderful disneyland vacation.  The kids absolutely love the kids suite Room 2421. Staff was very freindlyand helpful. We can not wait to come back again. Would be nice if there was a restaurant on location. However the IHOP across the street works just as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed staying here. Staff earl helpful and they were always cheerful. Place was clean. Ended up staying an extra night and  they worked t out that we could stay in the same room.  Helpful when planning a bus tour. Pool wasn't working but we didn't have time to go swimming anyway. Would sure stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location was great, only 10 minutes from Disneyland.  The rooms were clean but couldn't figure out the plug to the bathtub. The beds were awesome, and the room was always cleaned, and the kids were excited to see that the housekeepers, set up there stuffed animals everyday.Only wish that there was some sort of breakfast in the hotel, but we bought cereal from the 7/11 down the street
Manager Response: none

Summary: I reserved a kids suite and it was exactly how i wanted it to be. The hotel was not across the street from Disneyland as it stated in the magazine. Disneyland was located on same side of street as hotel and 2 stop lights further up. About a 10min walk with kids. Kids definitly enjoyed. Staff really helpful as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place just a few kinks
Summary: Wonderful staff, my daughter was sick and the staff pulled out a map with all the pharmacies in the area. I loved our room we stayed in the kids suite but one of the sides of the bunk bed ladder kept coming off.  Room was very clean, one of the sheets was a little dirty and the hotel staff offered to change it right away. Walking distance for older kids but not for a 4yr old. Bus system A.R.T was great as usual. I loved the gift shop downstairs! Only wish was that the place should have some sort of continental breakfast. I loved the kids suite. Construction was a slight problem but I don't think that should be hotels fault. Didn't bother us at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location was great easy walk to Disneyland . The family Suite was large enough for a family of 5. Lots of restaurants closes by helped with feeding the kids before heading to Disneyland .       The daily service was great the room was cleaned daily & extra towels , bedding if needed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Communication prior to check-in was lacking, I needed to talk to staff about parking prior to arrival, and that was not going to happen.  All staff were wonderful once face to face.  Room was clean and location was wonderful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: location was excellent.rooms were spacious and clean
Summary: good service and location.Walk to shops and Disney land.Car park available.Laundry available at premises.Rang to book in another day on returning from Hawaii and easy to book and also stored our luggage for 2 weeks or so.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very nice staff. Suite large and hotel within walking distance to park. Beds very comfy.  Room not the cleanest. Housekeeping forgot to fill coffee supplies daily. Fire alarms sounded at night. Construction next door started too early in the morning. TV cable out every few minutes. Could be a nice property if they work out the kinks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel and surrounding restauraunts were BETTER than Disneyland
Summary: Great location, easy to walk to many good restaurants and a close walk to Disneyland. Also a close walk to the convention center if going there. Place is simple, no frills but nice big rooms with fridge and microwave, two rooms each with TV and best of all the price is good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Room with lots of space!
Summary: I attended a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center with a friend, so Portfino Inn was within walking distance and at a good rate! Lots of restaurants close by and so was Disneyland (but we didn't have a chance to go). Room was clean and spacious with only minor repairs needed like a new shower curtain. Staff was friendly and helpful when the key wouldn't work (it was programed for the wrong dates accidentally). Parking was good and even on the weekend they provided a parking ticket for the neighboring hotel when theirs became full. I would stay again especially if I return for another conference.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I enjoyed my stay at the Portofino Inn. The only downside was the parking situation.  After a long day at Disneyland we had to park at the Sheraton very inconvenient and had a problem getting the car out.  Other than that I would stay here next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a wonderful time at the Portofino. Can't beat the location and the kids suite was perfect for our family of six.. That being said: the parking is horrible and do NOT count on being able to park in the free parking, you will only 50%of the time if that. Consider it not to have a pool, it is dirty, the size of a postage stamp and in the parking lot. Housekeeping was nice and rooms were very clean. Overall great, just don't plan to swim or park your car.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel twice now. The staff has been great & rooms clean. The first trip we had a kid suite which more than met our needs. This summer the hotel upgraded us when there was a mix up with our room. The prices are great. The walk to Disney easy. A+
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very close to both Disney (10 min walk) and Garden Walk (less than 10). Pleasant, friendly staff, clean and updated, but basic hotel.  Also free parking & wifi which we appreciated. A few small maintenance issues should have been addressed before we checked in: toilet seat cracked in half and towel bar in bathroom hanging by a thread. Otherwise, very good stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean, decent accommodations about a 10 minute walk away from Disneyland main entrance... not bad! It was great for our family of four, we got the family suite which had bunk beds in a separate room for the kids. Fridge and microwave in the room really helped too. And there's a pool and hot tub! The only thing that was a bit tough was the thin walls and ceiling- we could hear quite a bit in the room from rooms surrounding us and above us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice location and good accommodations for our family.  Our four teenagers were comfortable in the family suite.  Had a fifth floor room and were able to catch the disneyland fireworks on a couple of nights we were back in the room early.    Would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean and tidy.  The amenities were great and the staff was very pleasant and helpful.  The only down side was the vent in the shower room.  The motor did not remove the moisture very well.  As a result the room remained quite moist for a long time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had done some research for hotels in the Disneyland area for about a week and none of the hotels could accomidate a family size of 6.  I was completely surprised since families are generally what you see at Disneyland. I came across Portofino Inn and saw they had kits suites!  BEST IDEA EVER!  Everything about Portofino inn was accommodating. The hotel was clean, had plenty of room and wasn't too noisy. We will be staying here again for sure!  Only problem is parking but we can over see that because the stay was amazing!

Summary: When we arrived the concierge tried to get us into a different room from the one we had booked due to a sprinkler that had mistakenly gone off making less rooms available. We stood our ground however and got the kids suite we had originally booked. Construction outside our window that started at 4am the following morning was not very welcoming either. Ear plugs, we were informed by letter, would be supplied. They wern't. Ear plugs hardly befit a five and two year old either do they? The suite tho was great. Lots of sleeping room, lots of privacy, and two large bathrooms. The refrigerator could have been bigger. There was also no space to store dried food items that we had bought either. It's almost a half attempt at a kitchen and a better effort would have suited our needs
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly staff, great location, and our stay here this time was quiet.  The only down side was that the Jolly Roger next door was torn down and being rebuilt so we couldn't use the pool or go to their excellent restaurant.  I was looking forward to having a few of their famous 'Monte Christo' sandwiches :-(  For us it was only a ten minute walk to the gates at Disneyland so the location was great.  Another plus is that they didn't gouge you for outrageous parking fees like some of the other places we looked at.  All said, I can recommend this hotel, especially the kid's suite, and we will return if again if we ever go back to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was good, comfortable and clean. Slept so well woke up late :) The only thing missing was a standard microwave and refridgrator in my rooms. Over all Staff was nice and room stay was good.Wold like to stay here again when the rnovation is done and stay in the new suiets.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing that you enjoyed your stay and good night's sleep at our Anaheim hotel.  We are very pleased that you were extremely comfortable and would like to stay with us again.  It will be such a pleasure to welcome you back!  Keep in mind for your next stay that refrigerators are included in our suites and can also be delivered to guests staying in other room types for a nominal daily fee.  Thank you for staying with us and giving us your feedback.  We are definitely looking forward to earning a higher rating on your next stay!  Best, Daniel Kramer, General Manager

Summary: I enjoyed my 4 day stay in one of the suites at the Portofino, however, no continental breakfast, no ventilation in the bathroom so it got really steamy & too warm when taking a shower and a mirror in the "kids" room would have been more convenient since we were a group of adults (no kids) and we all had to use the bathroom area to put on makeup.  On the positive side, it is conveniently located to lots of restaurants, Disneyland, freeway(s) and the staff were all super, super nice & helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We continue to stay here on our annual trip to Disneyland.  The private balconies are our favorite.  The rooms are always clean and the staff is very friendly.  I definitely recommend this hotel. IHOP is across the street and the walking distance is just right.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay was a fun and pleasant stay. room was very clean. the only hick-up was a broken sprinkler on upper floor that set off alarm in the early morning which was just a bit of a shocker. other than that it was a trip and a place i will stay at with the family or just as a couples get away.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: nice hotel short walk to disneyland
Summary: We stayed in the kids suite. It was nice good for the kids. Heated pool was great. Quiet safe location and very short walk to disneyland the staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the area. This is my third stay here and I will return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel within walking distance of Disneyland.  It met our needs perfectly, just the basics.  We just needed a nice clean and comfortable bed to sleep in after a long day. Very clean and staff very helpful. Diana at the front desk was very helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We love the Portofino! Close enough to walk to Disneyland.  A separate area for the kids to sleep so they can go to bed before us or so the baby can nap!  It's great.  Reasonably priced too!  Do wish they offered a continental breakfast or at least toasters in the rooms.  The counter space is also kind of limited for a longer stay/if you are buying groceries, etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great deal for price, good access to Disney
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two days and we very much enjoyed the hotel, it's proximity to Disney, and other restaurants. We brought our family along and they were very happy with the accommodations. The staff was very friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: You cant beat the price. We reserved the room on hotwire for about $70 for 1 night. The tvwas cool but a lot of channels didnt work. Had to plug the wire for the tv back into the adapter. Pleanty of places to eat. Patio/balcony area definitely a plus.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a great place to stay with family the kids really love the bunk beds.  The rooms are clean and very comfortable.  The Portofino is walking distance from Disneyland, Downtown Disney  and  great restaurants.  We always enjoy staying at the Portofino.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had only one issue at the Portofino, awful coffee!  Will bring my own next time.  Staff was wonderful, room was clean and comfortable.  Kids suite was fantastic. Oh, the IHOP across the street has the highest prices I've ever seen.  The Kidd's buffet across from Disney isn't good either.  Maybe try Denny's.

I could hear footsteps from the room above, but again it was never a big deal. Whew! The "deluxe" room was clean and spacious. No Fluffy white towels and new ultra deluxe bedding, but it was very nice esp. for the price. The location was not as close as I hoped, but walkable to Disney and again an excellent value. I would recommend this hotel for those who want to play as much as possible at Disney and have a

We were moved and same problem. Maintenance took care of it and it was repaired. Location is great, pool was good. Needs more amenities, ie resteraunt etc. overall not a bad stay.

Summary: The Kids suite rocks. My wife and I were able to put the kids to bed and enjoy hanging out in the room. A unique family experience. Disney is less than .3 miles away and there is a variety of restaurants around and the garden walk mall is across the street. The staff was not super friendly however just average. the rooms were clean on check in but the housekeeping during our stay while adequate did not do a thorough job at make the room feel freshly turned over. (didn't add ne t.p. to the holder left a dirty towel in the corner of the bathroom etc. overall a great stay however.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights and we had an absolutely magical time. Frontdesk Staff was extremely friendly and helpful and they made us feel welcome the minute we stepped into the Lobby. Also Housekeeping Staff was very friendly and we got daily Stay overs and fresh towels. The hotel is located very close to the Parks and Downtown Disney, we would stay here any time again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Portofino Inn for our family trip to DisneyLand. We had a wonderful time and the Portofino was a great place to stay.  The only suggestion I have is that parking should be addressed. We had to park in a different hotel parking lot our last night due to no parking spaces. It would be nice to have a parking lot/garage to accommodate all the guests.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful,  we had a large group traveling with us and had 3 rooms total and we all agree that we would use them again the next time we are planing a trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have two teenagers and one adult daughter (plus two parents) and were finding it difficult to find one room that we could share comfortably. Portofino has wonderful rooms that gave everyone their own space. The two room suite was just what we needed and the price was the best we found. The location two blocks from the entrance to Disneyland (a 10 minute walk), not even difficult after a full day of Disney.  The room was very clean and the amenities were excellent. We would stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was a bit of a walk to the park. Hotel room had a smoke smell.otherwise ybe stay was nice! The service was also very good! The staff was very helpful with directions to places we wanted to drive to. I would stay there again.

Summary: The room was very large had a separate space with a pull out full size couch and bunk beds with a TV and sliding privacy doors. The main space had one King size bed. Inside the bathroom was a sink, toilet, and shower. Had a separate sink on the outside of bathroom which is great for multipal people getting ready. Only complaint was the Construction around the building and the room smelled like someone had smoked in it and hint of a sewer smell from the sink. Otherwise it was a great place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a reservation but had to make some adjustments last minute, since I arrived a day early and chosen to stay a few extra days. The receptionist where very helpful, they even helped me get free transportation to universal studios and affordable park tickets. Overall we had a great time during our visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good for young kids going to Disneyland
Summary: We have a 3 and 5 year old and stayed in the kid's suite with bunk beds. It worked out well. You can kind of close the door between the kids room and the room with the king bed. Everything about the room is average. It's definitely well worn, but comfortable and, for the price, it works good if you're just going to be at Disneyland all day. It's about a 15 minute walk to the parks. You are closer to Disneyland than the parking lots.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not what I expected. Just pay the extra $ to stay somewhere else.

I am used to staying at the Hyatt Regency in Anaheim and I took a chance staying here due to other family already booking ahead of us and wanting to stay at the same place. I will probably just pay the extra money to stay at a better property next time. Just not what I expected overall. Left feeling disappointed not because the service sucked but the place is an older hotel and really needs to get a complete makeover. Carpets look old, furniture  looks like it’s been there since the hotel opened. My husband described it as a Motel 6 with bunk beds. : (   Pros:  Got a good deal on their website   Room was a good size  Has sliding
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing your thoughts and opinions to our attention by completing the review. Summary: LObby looked really nice. Was excited to see our rooms, once we got to our rooms we were disappointed. I was on the third floor and could hear people talking and stomping. Toilet was clogged but staff (maint) was really nice. Beds were not comftroble. Really close to Disney.

Summary Heading: Great access to Disneyland and friendly staff.
Summary: Service desk is quick and efficient. Limited room amenities, just a microwave and fridge. Some bathroom paint peeling.  Family rooms great for the whole crew to have some space during a Disney trip. Sliding room dividers could use a heavier curtain.

Summary: Few issues..   The hotel is directly next to a construction site which was very loud! They also advertise that they are VERY close to Disney, when in fact it's about a two block walk to the entrance than another block to the gates. Walking to the parks were fine, but we took cabs back.    The rooms are basic. Small bathroom, bad hotel soap and rough towels. The bunk beds have their own lights, which was nice. The small fridge didn't quite get cold.. But worked for waters and snacks. The window opened all the way, and being on an upper floor with children made it scary. Also, the door between the rooms isn't a door, but rather a sliding see thru curtain "door" that was more like a pantry door.       Best part was the maid service. Our room was clean, she made my sons bed with his

Summary: We stayed at the Portofino Inn from 10/17-10/20. We come to Disneyland from Phoenix about every 2 months, sometimes more often. We have stayed at a LOT of the different hotels, including the Grand Californian and Paradise Pier. We like to try a new hotel when we come. The Portofino was a pleasant surprise. I had read mixed reviews, several about cleanliness so I was hesitant. I am VERY concerned about cleanliness. I am a clean freak. Here are my positives and negatives: Positives -Very close to Disney. Some people will disagree with this but I just don't understand why people can't walk half a mile when they're going to a theme park. It's on the corner of Harbor & Katella, 10 minutes (if that). -Customer service! They were unbelievable! So nice, helpful and genuinely happy to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Feels like home away from home!!
Summary: I visit California a few times a year and I will only stay here at the Portofino Inn! We stayed in the kids suite with 1 king, bunk beds and a sofa bed. We had plenty of room to spread out and sleep very comfortably. Housekeeping is amazing, your room is always nice and fresh when you come back from your day. Anything we needed or requested was always done right away. Front desk and management has amazing customer service and they truly want you to have the best experience. I love that it is so close to shopping, restaurants, and DISNEYLAND!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was nice and quiet. It was very reasonably priced and within walking distance to Disneyland. The staff was very helpful and we never heard any exterior noise while we were in our hotel room. Great for a family vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is decent & clean which is  located close to Disneyland.  Good for families with more than one family going together.  They offer suites with bunk beds, and even have a 2 bedroom suite that can sleep 7-8 guests comfortable with enough space for privacy and has 2 restrooms separate.  I've stayed at this hotel in 2013 at least 6x since I'm an annual pass holder.  They don't charge for parking and their hotel rates are very reasonable.  This hotel is also walking distance. It's not across the street but it's not a far of a walk.  Don't expect a 5 start hotel. I consider this hotel an in between Motel and Hotel.   Better than a Motel, but not quite a real Hotel.  I am going again in Dec with my family.  I can never beat the rates.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked the Portofino Disney package which was a very  good deal. Our package included a 2 queen bed standard room. No bells and whistles here. The beds were terrible. No matter where you sat on them it felt like you would fall off. Very uncomfortable. No matter how many crappy pillows you put on a bed...they are still crappy.  We definitely missed having a complimentary breakfast with our stay as well as a disney shuttle. We agreed that paying a bit more and getting these accomodations are worth the extra money. Not sure that we will give the Portofino another try when we bring the kiddos here next time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Portofino for 4 nights in the kids suite.  My kids loved their own sleeping area.  If someone woke early the other could keep sleeping.  Much better then having two beds in one room.  The room itself was adequate for our short stay.  I thought the rooms would be more updated (newer looking) but it was looking like it could use a could cleaning in the shower area.  The price was excellent.  We were only in the rooms to sleep so it was fine for that.  The front desk staff was extremely nice.  Being right across from the ihop was great for breakfast.  And across from the 7 eleven was awesome.  Picked up water on the way to the parks in the morning and grabbed a snack on the way home.  Would have given it excellent rating but the room needed a good cleaning in the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value, good location and clean.
Summary: The Portofino is an older hotel but with new carpets and clean beds it's a great little hotel.  My family and I had the Kid's suite which I would strongly recommend and loved the space it offered. We stayed 9 nights at the hotel and the walk to the park was in fact 10 mins which is what they quoted when I called to ask. The bus stop from the park, #3 if you're interested, is directly in front of this hotel.  Would definitely recommend if you're looking for value. The fixtures are older and there are scuff marks on the door frames but if you're willing to overlook superficial details you will like this hotel.
