Summary Heading: Great family place to stay while visiting DL
Summary: We love staying at the Portofino when we visit DL (4 x yr). The kids love the kid suite bunk beds. The rooms are clean, spacious and well cared for. It's one of the only hotels with rooms spacious enough to fit a double stroller through the door and parked in the room without running into it or sidestepping around it. I don't have anything negative to say because we never had a bad experience here which is awesome! I can't say that for the other hotels we've strayed at near DL. The location is close enough to walk to the park & restaurant. Staff is always helpful.

Summary: Very clean and comfortable. Loved the porch. Only problem was room 1126, is next to the elevator, which you can hear all night as it goes up and down. They should have let us know when we checked in that this room  was next to the elevator and would be very noisy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Portofino! The room was clean and big (we had the kids' suite with the bunk bed and pull out bed in addition to our bed). Our bed's mattress was pretty weak, but that's typical of hotels in this price range. The location was very close and within walking distance. The hotel staff were friendly and professional. And the free wifi was an added bonus.

Summary: This was our first stay at this hotel and it was great.  We have been to Disneyland every year for the last 8 years and have stayed at many hotels.  The kids sweet was very spacious and slept 3 kids and 3 adults very comfortably.  The room was very clean and had normal sings wear and tear but was still very nice.  It really pains me when people whine and moan and submit pictures of a tiny crack here and some pealing wallpaper in an obsure corner of the room.  They are checking into a solid 3-3.5 star hotel and expecting a 5 star!  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The extra sink outside of the bathroom was extremely convenient.  Literally every staff member said hello with a smile in passing.  I would definately stay here again.

Summary: I would give it another chance  down the road :) I just thought the rooms were a little outdated loved the balcony though.The people that were working the front desk were very nice and friendly. We stayed in a deluxe suite with two beds so I hope this reveiw is helpful thank you.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and perfect for big family, rooms
Summary: Guest service was excellent. The room was perfect for a family of 4/5. My children loved the bunk bed. The location is so close to Disneyland. Hskp. service was excellent as well. Thank you

Summary Heading: 3 night stay for a trip to Disneyland
Summary: Good overall stay. You get what you pay for, meaning I was happy with the service they offered at a reasonable price. We would definitely stay again. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. There was a high school sports team staying on our same floor that was a little loud at night. One call to the front desk and we didn't have a problem the rest of the stay. It was not as nice as some other suites we've stayed in in the area, but it was good enough being that we were only there to sleep. Our room was near the elevator
Manager Response: We appreciate your input and details on your stay, Jeremiah S. Summary Heading: Not Fancy But Great for Disneyland Trip

It's definitely not a resort, and the pool is small, but you are at the wrong hotel if you plan on hanging around all day.  We had a room with bunkbeds.  The "kitchenette" was actually just a tiny refrigerator and a microwave.  The refrigerator was old, and was missing brackets that held items in place on the door, so that portion was unusable.  The room was clean.  There were issues with the television, but the front desk claimed it was because they had a new system.  The parking spaces are tiny
Manager Response: none

Summary: clean and well priced,family room was big enough for fam of 4 ,5 min walk to Disneyland and you could see fireworks from room,room was made up everyday ,the only negative was there was no safe in the room

Summary: We had a family room and found it to quite comfortable and clean. Good location reasonably close to Disneyland. Laundry facilities are also good. Swimming pool was a little disappointing. Bathroom amenities were OK. Kids enjoyed the bunk beds.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with suites. Walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: This was the closest hotel I could find to Disneyland that had suites available. It was walking distance to Disneyland. It was clean and nice. The suite was perfect for us since we have two small children and wanted a separate living/sleeping area. I would definitely stay there again.

Summary: Thanks, we had a great time with our daughter, her husband and their 4 sons, things could not have gone better for our visit to southern California. Summary: Very comfortable room at a great price.  Walking distance to Disneyland.  Would definitely stay here again.  Third floor room was very quiet.  Service was excellent.  We bought a four night package that included three day park hopper tickets. Both were discounted and an excellent value.

Summary: Very nice stay.  The staff were very accommodating and friendly so were the housekeeping staff.  When we asked for more towels, they were right there.  It is an easy 15 minute walk to Disneyland front gate.  We had two cars for 6 people, so the extra $80 for parking was a little much.

Summary: I was really surprised by this hotel! the room was great, a king suite. the bed was really comfortable and the price was terrific for disneyland resort hotel.The negatives were the one night concrete pour that started outside our room at 2 A.M but I guess it needed to be done sometime!! the sink area was outside the bathroom and the vanity was really too small to hold your toiletries and a lot of the plug ins were falling out of the wall.also the lack of restaurant was also inconvenient but overall I would definitely recommend it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been going to the Portofino for over 7 years. Overall we enjoy staying at the Portofino; they have great staff and it is very convenient to the Disneyland Resort.   We have never really had a bad experience per say, but we have noticed that it is definitely time for some renovations. It's the little things: torn drapes, nicked coffee tables and very unreliable wi-fi.  I really hope the new hotel that is being built nextdoor will encourage the Portofino to fix things up and not get lost behind a new building.
Manager Response: Dear Melony L,  Your continued patronage over the last 7 years is certainly appreciated, as is your valued suggestions.  Be assured that we are committed to making the necessary improvements throughout our hotel in order to enhance the overall experience enjoyed by our guests.  We recently refreshed our accommodations with new carpeting, plush bedding and duvet covers and bathroom fixtures, and have more exciting changes planned for the near future.  Also, please know that our wifi system has, indeed, recently been updated and our third party service provider was informed of your comment of the connectivity issue you experienced.  Again, thank you for staying with us and providing us with your insight.  We will look forward to having you both as our guests again.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights as we were visiting Disneyland and San Diego.  I do not have anything to complain about the hotel.  It served our purpose since we were out most of the time.  The rooms were clean, decently sized and had the basic amenities.  There is 24hour IHOP opposite where a meal could be grabbed anytime.  Lots of restaurants within the vicinity and disneyland is just a 10minute walk.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We travel alot and i'm always a little nervous to stay at new places. Our stay was fabulous. The staff was friendly and anytime we needed anything our requests were taken care of very quickly and efficiently. We stayed in the kids suite which was awesome. The location is so convenient. There are so many dining options in walking distance and Disneyland was a quick 10 minute walk away. I have no complaints and will be planning our next Disney trip for December at this hotel.: ) Can't wait!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: For a weekend trip to Disney...this works
Summary: Great location. Two blocks walking distance to the parks. When we first arrived at our room, it smelled like smoke. We requested a room change and rather than come up and get us a new key for the room right next door, we had to come down and "get it". Frankly, as a guest checking in after traveling, hospitality could have been better. The rooms are older and could use more attention to detail in their cleanliness. For example, seals on sink panels were warmed with water damage with slight mildew; the grout in the bathroom tiles were black in several areas; bathroom ceiling had questionable stains throughout; and window sills were warped with water damage in the inside. Our room faced current construction site of soon to be Springfield suites which caused a dusty view. they are
Manager Response: Dear XBWells,   Thank you for staying at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim.  We apologize for not being able to deliver your new room keys to you, and are looking into the our logs to investigate the details.  We are glad to learn that overall our hotel worked out for you and your family on your weekend trip.  Your suggestions are always appreciated.  Thank you for noting how great our location is!  Come back and see us soon!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The mattress was very run down. It became a taco as soon as we got into it. Rooms need to be updated pretty run down. The whole weekend there were kids running up and down the hall hitting doors at 11 at night. I know its a family hotel, but come on mom and dads watch your kids!
Manager Response: Dear Robin R,  Thank you for bringing the issue with the mattress in your room to our attention, as well as the neighboring younger guests in the hallways.  Please keep in mind that we are always available to assist you.  We would have loved to relocate you into a another room and sent our security guard to your floor to remind those guests of the common courtesies that should always be practiced, especially at that late hour.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We hope to have the chance of delivering an overall enjoyable and comfortable stay on your next trip to Anaheim.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Very easy walking distance for my 10 & 12-year-olds.  Loved the family suite with plenty of room. We even had a theme park view and could see the fireworks e Rey night, but I'm afraid that might go away with the construction of a new hotel in the parking lot.  It's a shame that the city of Anaheim would allow that.  Pool was nice but a little small.  Still, the kids loved taking a break from the parks in the middle of the day.  Also walked to Downtown Disney very easily.  I would recommend going through the Grand Californian and using that entrance rather than walking all the way around.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This iis a VERY run down hotel with no services to speak of.  Understaffed  front desk with as many excuses as you can shake a fist at.  The pool for 190 rooms is smaller than most home pools.  There is no restaurant for breakfast, it's a very long walk to Disney, the two washers and dryers for all rooms, don't work, but there is plenty of parking.  The furniture is quite old and scratched up. There are no plugs by the bed, so be sure to bring an extention cord if you need to plug anything in.  The rooms are not quiet.  It might help to be on the top floor.  The lobby is nice, and that's pretty much where nice ends
Manager Response: Dear jobcoach,  We are disappointed after receiving your review and hearing our hotel did not fit your preference.  Please know that our front desk staff does their very best to accommodate our guests in every way they can.  I would very much appreciate your time in discussing your comments further, especially conceding our staff.  Also, under normal circumstances, our guests are welcome to use the much larger pool located next door at our sister hotel, Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel; however, this is not the case during the temporary construction that is taking place on the corner of our block.  Again, we are sincerely sorry we failed to impress you.  Thank you for your review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: NOISY, but close to the Park
Summary: Upon checking into our hotel room after a  day in the park, we called the front desk because our toilet was leaking. Even though told Maintenance was supposedly 'on their way immediately' to remedy the situation, it took another call and at least 45 minutes to an hour for the guy to show up. Was our toilet fixed? NO! We were just told 'do not sit on it and lean back (basically don't sit on it like you would sit on a toilet normally).' During our two night stay we constantly battled sleeping with the noise other guests were making in the hallway. Even though some people were using normal inside voices, they could still be heard as if we had no door on our room. At one point during our first night here, my wife even asked some people coming in from the pool to keep it down as they
Manager Response: Dear Frisbeemaniac,  We are sorry to hear of the inconveniences you faced during your recent stay.  Please accept our sincere apologies and know we have taken your comments seriously.   We are addressing our staff and reviewing our logs to investigate the details to the leaky toilet in your room.  Standardly, our maintenance staff would alert the management staff on duty if the issue could not be immediately resolved.  We do appreciate you noting the positive aspects of your stay that you did enjoy and hope you will keep these in mind, as we would certainly appreciate the opportunity to deliver the overall comfortable experience that you deserve.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed in a Deluxe Room (Best Available Rate), and it was clean and everything was in working order. One problem: the room didn't have a refrigerator. The marketing materials don't promise one; I thought in this day and age it was a given, unless you're staying in a real corporate hotel. We stayed in a suite two years ago, and that room had a refrigerator. This might not be a big deal to some people, but we were up early everyday to go to a conference. It would've been nice to have cold water, milk for cereal, etc., before we walked to the convention center. Other than that (and a family feud breaking out in the next room at 1 a.m.), the room was fine.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A clean and convenient place to stay for a family of six. We had a two-day Disneyland trip planned and enjoyed every minute. Being so close, walking, distance to the park, restaurants, and the freeway, this hotel was a perfect fit.  The front desk staff and cleaning crew were very friendly and helpful to say the least. We would return to this property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family of 4 just got back from a 6 night stay at Portifino Inn & Suites. We stayed in the building closest to Disneyland (across from the lobby) in 2311. Our room had a king size bed with the kids suite, which is a separate area that is separated by sliding french doors and has bunk beds, a sofa bed/couch, microwave, mini refrigerator, and microwave.   The main reason we selected this hotel was for the bunk bed/ kids suite feature. Upon first arrival to our room we were hit with a strong cheesy odor. Once in the room, the smell wasn't as obvious so we didn't complain about it, but it would be noticeable each time we first would reenter the room.  The furniture is a little beat up (scratches and nicks). The sliding french doors do not provide much of a sound barrier between
Manager Response: Dear Isabel V,  Thank you very much for your detailed review on your stay.  Please know that we are always, that means at all times, at your service to assist in any way we can to make your stay comfortable.  The odor you experienced in your room was unacceptable.  Our staff is passionate about delivering superior customer service and would have loved to have remedied this situation for you and your family.  We apologize for the inconsiderate neighbors and, of course, thank you for reminding your kids of the common courtesies that should always be followed after the reasonable hour has ended.  Keep in mind that we are always available to deliver this same reminder to other guests.  Again, thank you for your valuable insight on your experience.  We do hope that you and your family will decide to return on your next visit.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The motel was run down and the staff was rude, the toliet get plugging up, and if you wanted a Frigde in your room you had to pay extra for it plus a tax for everyday  the baloncy felt like it ready to fall off, I very dis satisfied with this motel and I wouldnt every stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Jimmy M,  We're disappointed to hear that you were less than satisfied with your stay with us, and apologize for our shortcomings.  Thank you for providing us with your feedback so that we may follow up on the important details mentioned.  We hope you will change your mind and return.  It would be our pleasure to have another chance to deliver the impressive stay that you deserve.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We had the children's suite for this visit.  It was clean and everyday it was immaculate when we returned.  When we made the reservation, we requested a crib; unfortunately, even tho it had been requested, no cribs were available.  It was difficult with a child not quite 1  year old.  The next day, however, we did receive one. The location is close to Disneyland parking.   Parking at the hotel was bad.  The lot was shared with another hotel and trying to find parking was extremely difficult.  What made it more frustrating was we needed a handicap spot and only once we found one.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: not what I expected from the pictures
Summary: The hotel was not what I expected from the pictures on Portofino's website.  Our room did not have a refrigerator and microwave.  These days, these two items should come standard in a room.  One should not have to make a special request for it.  (As a side note, on the day we were leaving there was a refrigerator waiting outside our room!)  We were traveling with our two children and the lack of a refrigerator and a microwave was really inconvenient.  The TV automatically looses signal every 20-30 minutes and had to be reset to Dish.network.  Needless, to say this was a huge annoyance with the kids when they wanted to unwind and watch a show.  Not to mention my wife and I having to hear the kids whine every time the TV went out.  Our bathtub / shower was clogged.  But at least
Manager Response: Dear hotinfresno,  Thank you for taking the time to bring the details of your stay to our attention.  We apologize for missing our mark at exceeding your expectations.  Please know that the pictures on our website are of our rooms and amenities, in fact, they were recently updated when we refreshed and retouched our rooms.  Also, our Kids Suites and King Suites both have refrigerators and microwaves in them. We do have both available, for a nominal daily fee, for guests staying in any of our other room types that can be delivered to your room at your request.  We are glad that you enjoyed our prompt service and efficient wifi connectivity. Thank you for your review.  Kind Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Experience was average.  Room was smallish.  Slight musty\moldy odor in room.  Housekeeping service was average.  Rooms were a bit noisy.  Hallways were musty and a bit unkept.  Location was this hotel's best selling point--only 10 minute walk from the Disneyland parks.
Manager Response: Dear Thomas B,  Your feedback on your recent stay is greatly appreciated.  We regret that we failed to impress you and have followed up on your comment regarding our hallways, as this is not the standard impression.  Our housekeeping staff is committed to keeping our property spotless and we have shared your review with them to ensure this does not happen again.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We got a same day reservation at the Portofino for two nights.  They delivered what was promised.  Enjoyed the location and the room was clean, large, and appreciated.  Would recommend the hotel to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Most motels/hotels today offer some sort of breakfast as well as a referigerator and microwave in the room.  This one does not.  Parking is hit and miss.  On the plus side, the staff was helpful especially Claudia at the front desk.  With all the competition in the area, I will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Larry A,  We are very disappointed that your recent stay did not exceed your expectations.  Please know that we do offer a refrigerator and microwave in our Kids and King Suites.  Guests staying in any other room type may request either a refrigerator or microwave in their room for a nominal daily fee.  Thank you for your great compliment on our customer service.  We hope you will keep this in mind, as well as our extremely competitive rates and incredible location on your next visit to our area.  We appreciate your business and also your time in posting a review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place for families but needs some updating.
Summary: Our package deal which included Disney tickets was a very good value for the money.  Staff were helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.  The maid not only did a good job cleaning our room, she also arranged our granddaughter’s stuffed animals in cute ways each day.  We discovered late the first evening that our refrigerator didn’t work.  It was only minutes after our call to the front desk that a maintenance man came to our room.  He said if he couldn’t fix the problem he would go and get us a replacement.  It turned out the plug had come out of the wall behind the bunk bed where we couldn’t see.  He was as friendly and helpful as the people at the front desk.  The two room  “kids suit” was great.  There was a sink in the bathroom and another (with more counter space) just outside
Manager Response: Dear Theresa N,  Thank you for your detailed review on your recent stay at our hotel.  We have shared your comments with our front desk, housekeeping, and maintenance staff, as your positive feedback is rewarding and encouraging.  Your suggestions are also appreciated.  Our entire team is committed to listening to our guests' and making the necessary changes or improvements that will enhance their experience with us.  You are right; it is always our pleasure to delver extra toiletries upon your request.  Keep in mind for next time that we are at your service throughout your entire stay.  Again, thank you for your review.  We will look forward to serving you and your family on your next visit to Anaheim.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: My family and I stayed for one night in the family suite.  It had a King size bed, a bunk bed and a pull out couch in a separate area partitioned off by french doors. When booking the room, I wasn't looking for the cheapest hotel, I was looking for a good hotel, near Disneyland for a good price. A good price didn't mean the cheapest price, but after reading reviews, I definitely thought it was the best for the location and quality. Some of hotels near Disneyland are more expensive, but lower quality.  The hotel is about a block and a half from Disneyland and an easy walk. We didn't have to pay for parking at the hotel, so when we arrived early in the morning, we got a parking pass from the front desk, parked our car and walked to Disneyland from there.  We had no problem
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location for a Disneyland vacation. Could see the California Adventure ferris wheel from our room. We were able to walk to the main gate in 10 minutes or less which allowed us to come back to the room for breaks during the day and for the kids to take a nap or use the pool. Parking was free, super rare in this area and free WiFi too. Pool was a little small but worked as we didn't use it much. The balcony was a nice bonus as it served as an extension of the room.  Loved that it had a table for eating. Overall, a great experience. Maids skipped our room for cleaning one day and was late when we returned so we had to have the desk bring us clean towels, shampoo, and coffee, but that was the only complaint.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was happy with this hotel.  The room we stayed in was perfect.  Quiet, comfortable king-sized bed, clean bathroom with a bathtub!.  Two sinks in room which is great.  We had a two room suite with refrigerator which kept everything really cold and the microwave was good too.  The sliding French doors were awesome because my kids got to watch their own tv on the sofa bed.  We also had our own tv and closed the French doors for privacy. Drawers and closet were ample. The cleaning staff was happy to accommodate and kept the room clean and supplies well stocked.  The hotel staff addressed concerns and did follow up on any all of them.  The pool was small and adequate.  The hot tub was really hot and there were plenty of towels outside and chaise lounges to get sun.  I saw the staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a perfect hotel if you have kids and need room. The suite has a HUGE bed for mom and dad... plenty of room. And there are double doors connecting to the kid's room. The kid's room has a bunk bed, and a double sized pull-out... so 4 kids could sleep in that room comfortably. And they have their own tv ! Tons of privacy! There's also a fridge and microwave... and .... double sinks!! One in with the toilet and bathtub, and one right outside the bathroom door, so you aren't on top of each other. It's just a nice roomy hotel room. The pool is average... but there is a spa which is nice. It's just down the street from the Disneyland entrance. We walked it and i counted 1355 steps. Not too bad. (about 10 minutes) There's also a store right there at the entrance which has
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the kids suite and couldn't have been happier. The room was clean and the bunkbeds were the added bonus!! Plenty of room for a family of six, and with the fench doors as a room divider there was actually privacy. we purchasedthe package with the hopper tickets included and saved a ton of money!!! Can't wait to stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel was fine customer service was terrible
Summary: From the original check in to the the check out and follow up was horrible. We were told to call early in order to try and get our room before the 3pm check in time, so we called at 8 am and they said they should have an availability by one . We arrived at 1245 and some rude hispanic woman told us that it should be available by 130 she seemed bothered that we even asked even when we called before. We arrived back at 200 pm and were told that nothing would be available until 3 pm by a different employee who looked at us like we were stupid for asking. We finally got our room at 245. After numerous complaints. Upon check out I miss placed my extra set of keys keep in mind i checked out august 4th today is the 7th. I have been calling every day and have not recieved a call back
Manager Response: Dear Josh J,  We apologize for the miscommunication.  It is always our pleasure whenever possible to fulfill guests' requests for early check in, and we are sincerely sorry that we failed to make this happen for you.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  We are also sorry that you misplaced your extra set of keys.  Please know that our housekeeping staff has a remarkable record of reuniting guests with their lost items.  Once a member of our housekeeping staff recovers a lost item, it is then logged and turned into our lost and found department.  The guest is then called to make arrangements for it to be returned to them.  Again, your patience and understanding is greatly appreciated.  Thank you for staying with us and for posting a review on TripAdvisor.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: After reading other reviews I was skeptical about staying here but my family of 6 stayed here for 2 nights and we had nothing but a good experience. Bunk beds are a great idea when staying with kids. The walk is far to Disneyland with kids in tow however paying for the bus is well worth it. The Portofino is the first stop so you get back quickly. We would defiantly stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean and comfortable accommodations.  An easy walk to Disneyland.  Very friendly and helpful check in staff.  Free parking was a big plus.  We parked on arrival and didn't use the car until we departed. We would definitely consider staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Bunk beds are great - but a mile walk to Disneyland
Summary: The layout of this room was great for our family of five. We had a king bed with a separate area for the kids with a bunk-bed and couch.   However, the hotel is NOT "one block from Disneyland" as advertised.  It is nearly a mile walk from the front door to the ticket gates at Disneyland. That makes for a very long walk at the end of the day with tired kids.   Noise from other rooms was a problem. As other reviewers have noted, the walls and ceiling are thin and noise from other rooms (and the hallways) was a big problem for us.  Also, be aware that there is a major construction project in progress right next to the hotel.  (We were there Aug 2013)   It was odd that while there was two TVs in the room, neither could be seen from the bunk-beds.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have stayed at this property 4 times in the last 2 years and its perfect for families with small kids visiting disneyland.  Have two kids, 8 and 7 and the kids suite with the bunk beds is a huge hit and exciting change for both of them...couple that with disneyland and you have a huge hit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was great.  The staff was helpful prior to visiting as well as when checking in and with all my questions and requests  We stayed in a kid suite and they boys (3 and 6) loved it.  Everything was clean and new thanks to the recent refurb.  The pool area was nice with towels readily available and nice patio furniture.  The walk to Disneyland was great with a stroller.  10-15 depending on how long your legs are. We came back after lunch for a nap and then headed back for the parades and fireworks.  I'm reserving the excellent rating since the bed was just ok and the one TV kept losing signal.  Other than those 2 minor issues the whole family liked it.  It will be at the top of our list on our next trip to Disneyland.  Oh, and getting the tickets at the front desk was
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were in a kids/family suite.  The room layout is excellent for 6 people, and even for 7, which we had (one person on floor in sleeping bag).  I was disappointed though, because website said the rooms were recently renovated but it didn't seem like it.  When I opened a drawer to put our clothes in, the bottom of the drawer was not clean; the tiles around the shower/tub needed a good scrubbing to get the grout back to white; overall things just seemed a little worn.  Not a big deal, but noticeable.  The really annoying thing was that, for a room setup to accommodate 6, there was only one towel hook in the bathroom (on back of the door).  Where do they expect 6 people to hang their bathtowels?  We tried just piling them on the small counter, but the bathroom did not have a fan
Manager Response: Dear Rtardis,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel during your family's recent visit to Anaheim.  We certainly appreciate you taking the time to give us your candid feedback, as your insight on towel hooks, dresser drawers and tile in the bathroom will definitely we addressed.  Thank you for noting that you and your family enjoyed our room layout.  Our rooms were recently refreshed with new bedding, carpet and bathroom fixtures.  We do hope that you will decide to stay with us again.  It would be great to exceed your expectations on your next visit!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Our stay at Portofino was very nice.  We asked for roll away bed and were told they never ran out. Later as we went to check guess what was not available (roll away bed), the ran out. The first day we were placed in room right above the elevator and all night as guests came in the noise was very disturbing. We went to see if we could be moved and they were very helpful.  The rest of the days we stayed were very pleasant and we got to enjoy our trip to Disney and our nights were very comfy, restful and peaceful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No frills hotel with only wifi and location the only thing going for it.
Summary: This hotel doesn't offer shuttle service like say Candy Cane inn. Doesn't offer any breakfast pastries like Camelot Inn. No refrigerator or microwave for the leftover food or drinks. It does have a blazing fast wifi connection, it is near several restaurants such as IHOP, and it is walking distance to the main entrance (albeit a 10-15 minute walk). Also, a word of warning to those who wanted to book the deluxe rooms (with the outside balcony/patio), smokers would likely get those rooms so don't be surprised to smell a whiff once you enter the room (my wife noticed it right away). Not a great hotel, not a bad one also. Will I recommend this hotel? Not likely.
Manager Response: Dear spikeyflip,  Thank you for staying with us.  We appreciate your business and your valued insight.  We are glad to hear that you did enjoy our location and blazing fast wifi connection.  Please keep in mind that we do have refrigerators and microwaves available for a nominal daily fee, for those guests that are not staying in one of our Kids or King Suites.  We do hope to see you again.  Thank you for your review.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Overall, I would not stay at this hotel again.  The parking is supposedly "free," but they charge a resort fee, so it's basically as if you're paying for parking.  On top of that, the first night there, there wasn't any parking spaces available, so we had to park at a neighboring hotel.  In addition, our room smelled almost like mold.  You could see a repair patch in the ceiling where there was probably a leak before.  Also, there was a patch of hair on the "clean" bathroom sink when we first arrived.  For the money I paid, I should've stayed at one of the nicer hotels for a little bit more money.
Manager Response: Dear Loren H,  It's disappointing to learn that we failed at exceeding your expectations.  We appreciate you providing us with the details of your recent stay, as we take your feedback very seriously.  Please keep in mind that our resort fee is certainly nominal, especially when compared to other properties' resort fees or daily parking fees.  Our parking is complimentary.  There are times, while operating at full capacity, that few guests are asked to park next door at our sister hotel; however, this is on the rare occasion where both of our lots are full.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  We appreciate your time in completing the review on our property.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The staff was very friendly, responsive, and helpful. We got the family suite and the size of the room was great for a family of 4. Only complaint was the bathroom fan, which came on when the light was on, was very loud.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The location is easy 10 minute walk to Disney.
Summary: This hotel is a good location for a Disney vacation. We walked to gates in 10 minutes. It feels longer after a day at the park though! The suite accommodated family of five well, with more floor space for moving around than some other places.  In building 2, we felt a bit disconnected from the lobby and pool areas- my guess is that main building feels more like a hotel. The housekeepers and support staff are awesome and seem to put a lot of effort into their jobs. It's not a luxury hotel, but for what we paid, it is more than adequate. Nice beds, pillows and bedding.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were not as appealing as on the web site. Curtain was torn, only one bar of soap, refrigerator did not work properly, parking was poor. Not worth the money. Mediocre at best. Have stayed at others in the area for the same price that are much better.
Manager Response: Dear Cal M,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent visit at our hotel. We are very disappointed to hear we fell short of impressing you.  Please keep in mind that we are always at your service, wiling to assist in any way we can to make your stay an enjoyable one. Also, additional toiletries and maintenance assistance are always available upon your request.  We would love the opportunity to regain your confidence in our hotel and hope to have the pleasure of having you and your family as our guests again.  Thank you for your review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Cons: My room had stuff left over in it from a previous guest. That to me says the room was not cleaned appropriately. Front desk staff contacted housekeeping and asked for "vip" cleaning. That was nice and all, however shouldn't a room being checked into be cleaned this way always? They credited me $30.00 but when paying over $200.00 per night I don't really feel that was quite the right way to handle it.   Pros: great location. Pgood sized room for an average family size.
Manager Response: Dear Dwayne S,  Yes, you are exactly right; standardly, all of our rooms are cleaned throughly and efficiently. The coded cleaning call that was requested by our front desk staff just alerted our housekeeping team that a guest was waiting or already in the room that was in need of attention. More than one member of our housekeeping staff will respond to the call in order for the request to be fulfilled as soon as possible.  Thank you for your patience and understanding for our shortcomings.  We are pleased that you loved our location and spacious rooms.  It would be great to accommodate your family again on your next visit to Anaheim.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Last minute trip turned out awesome!
Summary: Did not think I was going to find a room at such last minute super excited to find out they had military discount. Henry at the front desk was awesome. Room was very clean. Walking distance to the Happiest Place on Earth! Only down fall they do not offer breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we checked in our door was not closed all the way but housekeeping just left so I figured they did not close the door all the way. Next day when got back to our room the door was open and not closed all the way. I checked our belongings and nothing was missing but I did alert reception. They sent the maintenance man who was very rude and did not even look at the door. I tried to show him if you do not pull the door all the way closed it does not lock but he did not care to look. I called back to the front desk and all they could say is that they have had problem with this maintenance man but did not offer to send anyone else or offer any type of solution to rectify the problem. The next day we packed up our valuable items and took them to the car because we did not feel
Manager Response: Dear David H,  Please accept my apology and be assured that this will not take place again.  After receiving your comments, I, personally, followed up to investigate the details to this situation.  Again, I am sorry for the inconvenience and for missing our mark at delivering the exceptional service our guests have come to expect from us.  Thank you for bringing your experience to our management team's attention.  I hope you will reconsider giving us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids
Summary: We decided to stay here because we have three kids. It was the best choice we made for our summer vacation trip to California. Our oldest had the full bed, while his sisters slept on the bunkbed. It was also nice having a king for hubby and me. The only thing that would have been better is if the TV where the kids slept could be seen from all beds. The girls couldn't see the TV unless they were on the couch(folder out full bed) with their brother.  Overall the room was clean and gave us enough room to not be stepping over each other. Very comfortable stay with a 3yr, 8yr and 17yr old. Very friendly staff as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Book elsewhere...unless you like tv's that don't work, water that isn't hot, & rooms that smell like ashtrays.  This hotel does have a great location, which is exactly why it's so sad that its so dumpy.
Manager Response: Dear MarcNodler,  Naturally, we are very disappointed to hear that your stay was less than satisfactory to you.  We apologize for the details described in your review.  Please know that your experience was not the typical stay at our hotel and that we take your feedback very seriously.   Thank you for your review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I arrived late --- about 1 a.m. --- and was greeted by a friendly and professional staff member who got me checked in quickly and answered all of my initial questions about the area/hotel. The room was clean and comfortable and ready for my stay; and, although I didn't use them, there is also a pool and hot tub..couldn't have asked for better, and the per night rate was very acceptable for the location.  If you're looking for a good clean room, at a good price, and in a good location, I definitely recommend the Portofino!  Close to local transportation, within walking distance to Disney and Garden Walk, and right beside the Anaheim convention center; there's also an iHOP across the street that is open 24hrs and a 7-11 on the corner at the end of the block.  Save some gas money,
Manager Response: none

Summary: the hotel was fine. it looks gorgeous from the outside, but is rather simple on the inside. there is no continental breakfast, no newspaper in the morning, free parking in the garage -which is a nice convenience, and there is no free shuttle to the park. if you are accustomed to those perks, you will miss them; but it was close to the parks and clean and staff was responsive to our inquiries and requests for extra sundries. we would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: about 15 minute walk from disney, door to door. we stayed in room with bunks, so separation from main sleeping area, good for families. service was good. rooms clean. there is a construction site next to part of hotel facing disney. they start work around 8am i think, and are done by sleep time.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: hidden fees and TV are not working
Summary: The room was advertised for $125 but then you get an additional $18 occupancy fee and a $10 resort fee ! ... I found this rather upsetting especially given the fact that the TVs lose the connection almost every 5 minutes
Manager Response: Dear Michel S,  Thank you for your recent stay and for completing the review.  Standardly, when booking a reservation online or through our reservation center the daily rate and charges are itemized or reviewed, respectfully.  Upon receipt of your email confirmation  all charges are again listed.  There are times when booking through a third party travel site, a few clicks are necessary to view the itemized charges.  We apologize for any miscommunication and inconvenience that occurred.  Your patience and understanding is appreciated, as is your valued feedback.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We obtained a suite to hold our family of 6.  Upon arrival we found there were 4 pillows, called front desk, asked for 4 more... we received 2 more and told that was all they had.  Asked for an extra blanket finally received on 3rd request.  Ironing board was broken and would not stand unless leaning against wall.  Toilet clogged 5 different times which I had to unclog myself after a plunger was left by staff.  Ease of electrical outlets was little to none.  Front staff was VERY hesitant to assist in payment situation on departure.  Even when I was able to supply all parties names and times of who were aware of situation.
Manager Response: Dear Helena L,  We apologize for the inconveniences that you and your family experienced while staying with us.  When operating at full capacity, there are times when we receive quite a lot and requests and supplies run low.  We have followed up and noted your comments on extra pillows and the ironing board in your room.  Our staff is committed to listening to our guests' feedback and making the necessary changes and improvements.  We appreciate your insight and hope to have the opportunity to deliver an improved and impressive stay to you and your family in the near future.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: No Air Conditioning, Construction Noise, & Baby Crying
Summary: Intermittent to No Air Conditioning,  This is unacceptable. Significant Construction Noise (M-F) from next door.  Need to notify prior to stay. Thin Walls (Baby Crying Heavily 2 Doors Down).  Motel will not intervene. May have to park at a different motel.  Overflow parking at Jolly Roger. We've stayed at many 3 Star establishments.  This is not a 3 star establishment. Any Dollar Savings Is Not Worth The Hassles.
Manager Response: Dear Lawrence M,  We are sincerely sorry.  Intermittent to no air conditioning is unacceptable, and we have followed up on this, as it is a very rare occasion when our maintenance team is not able to resolve any issues that our guest may experience with our air conditioning.   Please accept our apology for the inconveniences described in your review.  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review and bring these important details to our attention.  Sincerely,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel last summer too. It was a very different experience this time . We really enjoyed the freedom of 2 pools last time. This time there was only one and nowhere was it told of the change. It's very small and crowded for the size of the hotel if we had known that we would of checked out completely and found another location with better pools. Room were nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland, about 1 1/2 block . Across the street from IHOP.  Internet/parking included in one price.  Priceline reservation was confirmed, but when I arrived, the hotel, was full.  Priceline did a mistake and apoligized, but I did not have a room.  The staff was extremely helpful, Claudia was able to relocate me for one night and continue my vacation with Portofino.  Thanks for going the extra mile Claudia.  I would definitely return to Portofino on my next visit to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We took our family of six to Disney for 3 days and stayed at the Portofino Inn because of its proximity to Disney.  It was a short walk to the park gates.  We swam each evening in their clean, but a little crowded, pool.  The room was a kid suit and it wasperfect for our family.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Run as fast as you can....
Summary: We were told that check in is at 3pm and when we arrived there was a line to the door of people checking in but their rooms were not ready at 3pm. We didn't get out room until 4:30pm. This was very upsetting. Then the pictures on the website are not true of what the hotel rooms look like. The was really frustrating. The pool was full of kids and the water was gross.The room smelled and was not very clean. The air conditioner was the best part. The TV cable would go in and out of reception. There were only a few channels for kids to watch. The refrigerator was old and gross. I will not be staying there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean Rooms with comfortable beds and clean sheets Clean Bathroom, good size, and sufficient clean towels  To make this an excellent experience please take care of the following: Rooms: wash carpet/sofa/chair fabric, and paint walls/furniture. Facilities: wash carpet, clean floors/stairs and elevators
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were clean and spacious.The staff was friendly and helpful. The kid suite with the bunk beds was especially nice and a great value for a family of 6. The property was within walking distance to Disneyland (10 -15mins).   Not enough parking. I struggled to find a parking space every time we came back to the room, even with the extra parking in back. This is something I did not want to deal with after a busy day.  If the parking situation was better I probably would stay again. Unfortunately, I would not want to have to deal with that again.
Manager Response: Dear Jeremy J,  Thank you for sharing with other travelers how much you and your family of 6 enjoyed our Kids Suite and close proximity to Disneyland.  We appreciate you bringing the struggles you had in parking to our attention, as this is not the typical experience.  Our front and back lots are most often more than enough spaces to accommodate our guests when operating at full capacity.  Thank you for your valued insight.  We have taken the necessary steps to follow up on your comments in order to investigate the details to this matter further.  We hope you will change your mind and bring your family back to stay at our Anaheim hotel.  Thank you for completing the review.  Kind Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We are a family of 5.  We spent 4 nights at the Portofino Inn and Suites in June (18-22).  We stayed in a kids suite.  The location to Disneyland was great.  I consider it walking distance as we only had to cross 1 street.  It was an easy walk for my family kids ages 8, 6 and 3 (in stroller).  The hotel was clean and quiet.  I asked for a top floor room away from the elevator. It was perfect.  Room service was prompt every day and the staff was friendly.  The room had a mini fridge and microwave which we used daily for breakfast and sometimes lunch.  We used the pool a few times and it was a basic rectangle pool, the furniture around the pool was nice and appeared to be new.  I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This looked like an older hotel that had been nicely updated.  We were upgraded to a king suite which was very spacious. The downside to this hotel is that it is close to Disneyland so there are kids and families coming into the hotel late at night.  The hotel needs better security to stop kids from running up and down the hallway, screaming and disturbing sleeping guest.  For this reason alone I would never stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear cclaird,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  Your feedback has been taken seriously and is greatly appreciated.  Please know that we do our best to remind our guests that are returning late from the Disney Parks to be quiet and courteous.  There are those occasions where our younger guests are trying to wind down and get carried away, and we apologize for this disturbance.  We are glad that you enjoyed your upgrade to a king suite and hope you will keep all the positive aspects of your stay in mind on your return visit to Anaheim.  We would appreciate the chance to deliver an improved experience.  Kindly, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The hotel was very nice. It was a few blocks of the main entrance to Disneyland (which is why we chose it). But it was also close to several restaurants. We were able to walk to all of our dining locations and never had to move the car. It was nice to be able to come back to the hotel, rest & go back to the park. The pool was a little on the small side but it served it's purpose. The staff was very pleasant & accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked last minute for six people. Its definitely close,two blocks LA style. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were amazing! We got a bunk suite...so comfortable. The price was awesome for what we were getting and compared to the main gate hotels. This hotel is the best and I will stay here again! I recommend it to anyone going to Disneyland. Housekeeping always made sure we had towels and the room was clean...very friendly as well. 7-11 and ABC market...subway with "normal" prices...
Manager Response: none

Summary: The family and I vacationed at the Disneyland and Califormia Adventures while staying at the Portofino Inn. The room was clean, bright and easy to get to. It was very warm at the park so it was advantageous to be within walking distance to both the park and the Disney shuttle park. Also coming back to an air conditioned room was a blessing! From the pool jacuzzi we could see some of the Disney fireworks in the evening. The kids enjoyed the bunk bed set up. We will be coming back to Disney again this year and everyone wants to stay at the Portofino again
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: don't let pictures of this hotel fool you
Summary: I had a very disappointing bad experience with this hotel..   the room that I got the first night had a big roach in it, I told the front desk girl what we saw in the room and she insisted that it was maybe only a water bug then looked at me that I didn't know what I was talking about.. so then, I took the big roach to the front desk to show it to her and she didn't know what to do when she saw what was in the cup that  I was holding for her.. so, then, they transferred us to a different room that was crappy that we had to kicked the main door so we can get inside the room... we didn't had any other choice than to stay in this crappy hotel, because I paid cash ($854) that they couldn't come up with so that way I can stay in a different hotel and continue enjoying my vacation...
Manager Response: Dear jacqueline f,  We are truly sorry to learn about your experience and apologize for any inconvenience it may have caused.  Our front desk staff member immediately informed management of this situation and we did have your room inspected by our professional pest control company.  While we are certainly not discounting your experience, they reported that they were unsuccessful at finding any pests.  Please be assured that we are aggressive and proactive in our approach with our pest control policies and have professionals conduct routine fumigation and other pest control programs throughout the hotel.  Again, we sincerely apologize any inconvenience and for missing our mark of delivering a comfortable experience. Thank you for completing the review.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Our family has stayed at the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim Hotel numerous times. Check-in is always prompt and courteous.  There is plenty of parking and once you park, you don't really need to drive again.  There are plenty of restaurants and stores in the area that carry or sell whatever you need or want.  The rooms are always clean and well maintained and the staff is always helpful.  The pool and jacuzzi area are clean and well maintained.  This hotel is always my first choice when visiting the Disneyland/Anaheim/Buena Park area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Enjoyed location but that was my highlight.  As far as  cleanliness of room, I will give it a 10...Bathrooms were well equipped except for our 8 year old son slipping in shower.  Should have warned him as this happened  to me.   Towel does not work as we tried this  during our 5 day stay.      Upon leaving, front desk clerk did not ask how was our stay.  Was it the "look" of disappointment upon checkout.   Would give this a 1 star due to the close proximity of a 7-11 store across the street.
Manager Response: Dear R N,  We regret that your experience was less than impressive.  Please accept our apology for missing our mark at delivering the attentive and friendly service that you should expect from us.  We do appreciate you taking the time to bring these details to our attention, as we have taken the appropriate steps to ensure that this remains an isolated incident.  Your comfort is truly a top priority and, again, we apologize for our shortcomings.  Thank you staying with and completing the review.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We rented the Kids suite (with one king & bunk beds) that includes two separate areas with a sliding door in the middle to give an impression of 2 rooms. One area has king's bed, 2 night stands, a dresser with a TV, and a tall free standing cabinet, one washroom, and a sink outside of washroom. The other area has a bunk bed, a 3 seater sofa, very small round breakfast table with one chair, mini refrigerator, microwave, and a separate TV. Overall the room was very good and quite comfortable for families who just need to sleep at night having spent a long day at a near by theme park. Front-desk staff was also very courteous and cheerful. There is also a small garage/covered parking for @20 cars - that mostly stays occupied. There is also a gift shop next to the elevator facing
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay at the Portofino Inn and Suites was okay.  The room was okay.  When I checked in I never signed anything (found this VERY strange) and when I went to check out I had almost $7 in charges that I didn't agree to.  It's supposedly a city tax that was added, but no where did it state on my confirmation it would be MORE than the price (with taxes) I was quoted.  Tried getting this straightened out but no one will do anything.  Very disappointed and I won't be staying here or recommending it to anyone.  Anyone who is staying there, double check everything!  You may be charged more than you know.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were not what we had seen online. Bathroom floor was dirty. Kids suite was way different then what was portraited online. Noise from the room above us and outside in the hall early morning. We wanted a nice clean room like the one online but it just wasn't what we expected.
Manager Response: Dear Loveviolet,  Thank you for bringing to our attention that we missed our mark at exceeding your expectations. Please be assured that all of our online pictures are taken here at our property.  We regret that your stay was not the best it could be and have immediately looked into our shortcomings and the details you described in your review.  Your comfort is certainly a top priority for our entire staff.  We appreciate your feedback as it assists us in our constant efforts to provide the very best experience for each of our guests.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience and know that your return stay will most definitely be an improved one.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: My experience at the portofino inn
Summary: I was very disappointed with my stay, I was originally going to stay three nights but cancelled after one night , the room was dated and the bed was cheap and uncomfortable , also people were smoking at the entrance and the elevator also smelled like smoke the pool was cloudy, all in all not what I expected for 225.00 a night .
Manager Response: Dear Pete L,  We do apologize that your stay was less than expected and that choices made by other guests affected the pleasant and enjoyable atmosphere typically enjoyed at our hotel.  Your comments have been taken seriously and are greatly appreciated.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your opinions by completing the review on our property.  Respectfully, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We were very happy with the Portofino Inn & Suites. The room was very comfortable, clean and modern.  We had a one bedroom suite with a king size bed. It is conventiently located just two short blocks to the main gates of Disney and Adventure park. We would recommend this motel without hesitation.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Uncomfortable stay; NOT renovated as advertised
Summary: Pros: 20 minute walk to Disneyland front gate, could see Disney fireworks from top floor; housekeeping staff were attentive to our requests. Cons: old furniture/furnishings, possible bed bugs in bunk bed, extremely soft mattresses, toilet clogged, soft water (did not rinse soap off our skin very well), electrical outlets did not hold plugs (they kept falling out), freezer in mini-fridge did not freeze food, advertised "renovations" were disceiving.  When I called to make the reservation, I asked specifically if the furniture was replaced during the renovation.  They told me "yes," however, the rooms were obviously not renovated.  Upon checking in, and asking further questions, they revealed that only the carpet, TVs and bedding was replaced.  I would NOT recommend staying at
Manager Response: Dear Portofino_Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review which is extremely important to us. Please accept our apology for our shortcomings and the miscommunication in regard to our furnishings.  it was certainly not our intention to mislead you in any way.  Our furniture has been refurbished or retouched and we have installed brand new bedding, carpet, window coverings and bathroom fixtures.  I have followed up with our entire staff regarding your comments to ensure that we avoid any miscommunication in the future.  We always welcome guest feedback as it helps us monitor our standards and services, as well as take action on improvements and apply solutions to suit our guests' needs.  Once again, we are sorry that your stay did not fulfill your expectations, and we appreciate your valued comments.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The hotel is very convenient as it is close to disneyland. Room was small but nice and staff were courteous and friendly,Linen was clean and beds were very comfortable. If you are satisfied with basic amenities this hotel is value for your money
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Portofino because I found a great deal on a room with 2 queen beds.  It was definitely in our price range. There's no microwave in the room, and no refrigerator. You can pay extra to have a refrigerator, but we really didn't need one.  The 7-11 and ABC mart across the street were good enough for us.  And if we wanted food, there were lots of takeout places close by and an ihop across the street that's open 24 hours.   The walk to the parks wasn't more than 10 -12 minutes.  Close enough for us to walk back if we needed a break.   As for the hotel itself, the room was decent.  The housekeeping staff kept our room tidy.  The only complaint we had was that there was a sour smell in the stairwell and we did notice it in the hallway one evening.  However, we can't be
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disney but room was not the best
Summary: Althought the portofino in was SUPER close to Disney, the room amenities were hard to find. There were leaky faucets, smelly carpets, dangerously slippery bathtubs, broken microwaves that took 3 days to replace! And no coffee in lobby:( nd you heard EVERY early morning riser and the African Savannah re-enactment upon returning home each night! The temperature in the elevators was awful.
Manager Response: Dear Liza N,  It's very disappointing to receive your feedback and we apologize for the inconveniences described in you review.  Your comments describing all that you experienced are appreciated and if you would like to further discuss the details of your stay with me, please contact me at the hotel at your earliest convenience. Please be assured that this is not a typical experience at our hotel.   I hope that you will provide us another opportunity to show you that our hotel and services are much better than what you recently experienced.  Thank you for completing the TripAdvisor review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Although the rooms were small, there was enough room to meet our needs.  The room was clean and service was excellent.  We had to request extra towels, due to showering at night and then again in the morning, and they were delivered within ten minutes. The only thing I would have liked to have was a table.  There was a very small fridge and a microwave so it would have been nice to sit at a table when eating or playing games.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We like to take the opportunity to let you know that we have enjoyed our stay at Portofino Hotel in Anaheim. Also my son enjoyed the pool and game room. My wife enjoyed the balcony. Its very nice to see the hotel decor is so uniquely designed, it is one of the best boutique hotels that we have ever stayed in Anaheim.  The room was spacious and clean and the amenities were excellent. I wish you had a restaurant inside the hotel so we could have ordered drinks while relaxing at the pool.  I have attached some of the pictures to show you how much we enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The pictures online made this hotel look way better than it really was. First thing that bugged me was the parking I didn't feel safe where my car had to be parked. Second thing was we were on the first floor it was so loud with people walking by our door and the outside sliding door the people above us kept us up also. The third thing that grossed me out two of the pillows had blood on them !!! Forth thing that I felt was a downer was the pool it was super small and filled with kids so we didn't even get to swim. And the the last complaint I have which isn't as bad as the blood on the pillows but caused me more of a problem was the last day we got a parking violation for parking without a permit which wasn't our fault because the Friday we checked in we were never handed a slip
Manager Response: Dear Ameliasmom7,  We are extremely sorry that your stay was less than expected.  Thank you for bringing to our attention the unacceptable pillow cases in your room and our error  in failing to issue you a parking permit.  The parking violation was issued by our security staff because he did not find the permit visible in your car.  Once you brought the violation to our front desk, we were able pull up your reservation, identify our error and resolve the issue.  Again, we apologize for this inconvenience.  Our complimentary parking is for our guests only and is strictly enforced.  We regret that your stay failed to be overall enjoyable stay you deserve and should expect.  Thank you for your valued comments.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The people at the registration desk were very welcoming. The check-in procedure went very quickly as I prepaid for my room. The hotel is in a central location that is within walking distance to the Disneyland Resort, Convention Center via Hotel Way St. and restaurants ($-Subway, $$-hotel cafes to $$$$-Ruth Chris's Steak House or Morton's Steakhouse). The room was very clean and had a nice balcony.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great service, room, and location.  I least liked the broken, bottom part of the bathroom door.  I most liked the service, location, and layout of the hotel.  The front desk staff was very professional and helpful. Housekeeping was very good.  The pool and hot tub area was clean and in very good shape. We had a great time!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Before I booked this hotel I did read the terrible reviews, I honestly thought that some of the complaints were exaggerated until I experienced some of them my self.  Yes it is true that the lobby picture they post on the web site is not their lobby, and I also had issues with my toilet not wanting to flush had to call maintenance 3 times on first day.  Air condition was a big issue according to maintenance my thermostat needed to be replaced.  Front desk was able to get me another room on my second night.  Had toilet issues in that room as well, not enough water pressure to flush toilet if you have to go #2.  My first room was not very clean big stains on carpet and sheer curtain was coming undone from bottom. They do charge a resort fee and I'm not sure why, this hotel in my
Manager Response: Dear Eddie F,  Please accept my sincere apology the unacceptable inconveniences that occurred during your stay. I will immediately address the shortcomings described in your review to ensure proper attention has been given to the rooms you stayed in.  I would also greatly appreciate the opportunity to discuss these details with you further.  Please be confident that all of our pictures on our website are certainly of our property, as well as any pictures on third party websites that we have partnered with.  Again, I am genuinely sorry for failing to provide you with the memorable experience our guests have come to enjoy.  Thank you for providing us with your feedback.  Kind Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: This hotel is in a great location! Walking to Disneyland and local resturants was easy even with 2 small children. The hotel is cute, but the rooms are in need of a remodel. We stayed in a kids suite which was great, just a little out dated. Be careful in the tub it is very slippery, my husband slipped and fell while taking a shower! All in all we had a great stay and would recommend to friends visiting the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall, our stay was okay. The room was average but the bathroom can need some upgrading.  The pool turns out to be really small and disappointing.  The housekeeping was good and quick.  Parking lot can need some work.
Manager Response: Dear Monkey_  We always strive to deliver an above average experience and it is disappointing that this was not the case on your recent stay.  Please accept our apology for our shortcomings and know that your insight is truly valued.  Our guests' feedback is always taken seriously and addressed in our management and staff meetings.  We do appreciate the note on our quick and efficient housekeeping.  Thank you for providing us with the details of your stay by completing the review on our property.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: The hotel was pretty much what we expected. Decent value for a good location.
Summary: Front desk staff was very nice and helpful . The housekeeping and other staff however seemed like they did not care about the guests at all and some even gave the impression that we were bothering them with any requests . We had a 2 room suite. Having 2 sinks was very helpful. The French Doors to the second room were not substantial at all - they did not close completely and were not sound proof at all . The room was clean - no unpleasant smells . A few more kids channels on the TV would have been nice since it is a "family" destination hotel .
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was ready upon our arrival, kid's suite looked nice.  I was pleased to see the mini fridge in our room really was and I could actually store some food in it unlike at other hotels.  The proximity to the park is good and is just a short walk away.  All these things were positives, so I was glad with our choice of hotels. The cleanliness of the room  wasn't too bad, although I felt like our carpet needed a good shampooing and the bathroom a good mopping. They advertise newly refreshed rooms but our door molding in the bathroom was rotted out the bottom 2 inches. And bedding wasn't the cleanest looking. The first night there was horrible. I think my husband and I slept about 3 hours broken up into naps. We live in a 2-story house and have 3 children, but I think even the
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer W,  Thank you for taking the time to bring to our attention the details of your stay at our hotel. Your feedback is truly valued as it is essential to our success.  Please accept our apology for failing to deliver the accommodating and efficient service we are known for.  Unwelcome noise from neighboring guests can occur and our goal is to always promptly  address it so that our guests are not inconvenienced. We regret that that this was not the case on this occasion.  Your comments have been taken seriously and shared with our staff.   We are anxious to gain your confidence in our hotel and services, and hope you will decide to give us that opportunity.  Again, thank you for completing the review on our property.  Kindest Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at the Portofino twice in the past ten years and the visits were just fine.  This year we had one of the worst experiences we have ever had in a hotel!  When we arrived at check-in, our room was not ready.  We were told 15 minutes.  Since we were actually there 15 minutes before the official check-in time, this was not a problem.  We unloaded the car of our 4 children and all of our luggage and proceeded to spend an entire hour in the lobby trying to stay out of other's way while waiting for our room while we were continually told "it should be any time."  On our second of four days we stayed, the room was never made up and we waited for fresh towels for over an hour (after spending the entire day at the beach).  Day three consisted only of our beds being made.
Manager Response: Dear Angela G,  We are extremely disappointed to learn that your visit failed to be the  enjoyable experience that you deserve and that has brought you back to our property over the last ten years.   Please accept our apology for the delay upon check in and any challenge you experienced in your suite due to our oversight.  Be assured that I have, personally, addressed our staff and reviewed your comments with our entire team to ensure that this does not happen again. If you would like to discuss anything further, please do not hesitate to contact me at your earliest convenience.  Your patronage and feedback are truly valued and we hope that you and your family will decide to return.  It would be such an honor for us to have the opportunity to exceed your expectations and earn your guest loyalty once again.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We decided on the spur of the moment to take a trip to Disneyland.  Called the Portofino - they had a family suite available and gave us a great rate if we bought our park hopper passes through them.  My hubby decides to just banzai down I-5 after we left the Sacramento area around 11:30 p.m.  I called the Portofino about 4:00 a.m. and asked if we could check in early as we would be arriving about 7:00 a.m.  No problem.  We arrived (dead tired), checked in and went to our room.  The family suite was great for us (2 adults, 3 kids - ages 14, 12 and 10).  Staff were friendly and accommodating and the room was clean.  The bathroom was a bit outdated but there were about 12 towels so I can't complain too much.  Close to Disneyland (15 minute walk in the morning, 25 minute walk at
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay by Disneyland
Summary: Easy walk to Disneyland, which is what was important to us.  Even after a full day at the park with aching feet we could walk back to the hotel.  We had a room with 2 queen beds and it was beautiful, clean, and spacious.  We used their Disney package that included tickets and saved us $200 from regular pricing!!  We did not use the pool but whenever we walked by it was full of happy people and their children.  We had a wonderful experience and will not stay anywhere else for future trips to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we had very nice stay .if we we ever comeback we would stay with you again. nice rooms with balconies we are smokers so we made use of the balcony. laundry room could have been a little nicer .rooms where spacious and very quite. the maids did a excellent job cleaning our room . front desk help was great . and Ihop restaurant right across the street that stays open for 24 hrs.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The pool is very small and full of a million little noisy kids but then the hotel is geared toward kids so just expect it. It looked clean and well maintained.The only negative thing was our room was located RIGHT beside a new hotel (or something?) construction site. Graders and heavy equipment started very early morning, went til at least 6PM or after daily. VERY,VERY loud noise. Ask for a room away from that side. We were in 2322.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were relatively pleased with the Portofino Inn and Suites. It is a basic, clean hotel near the Disneyland Resort so you can easily walk each morning to the park. Check-in was straightforward. We were disappointed to find out we were unable to buy our daughter's Disney tickets through the front desk. The front desk only sells Park Hopper, but we simply purchased them the night before on our way to Downtown Disney. The shower could use a good scrub down with some bleach or bleach abrasive. The grout was too dirty for my liking. The bathroom door jam was rusted and corroded and needs to be replaced. I was also unhappy that I had ordered a crib weeks ahead of time and when I asked for them to bring it they brought me a pack n play instead telling me the cribs were gone. This
Manager Response: Dear SaraJL,  While we are happy that you were pleased with your stay, it is disappointing for us to hear that we missed our mark at exceeding all of your expectations.  Thank you for bringing to our attention the shower and bathroom door in the room that you stayed in.  Please know that we do our very best to fulfill all of our guests' requests.  We apologize that we did not have a crib available for you and for any inconvenience this may have caused you and your family.  Thank you for taking advantage of our affordable rates and choosing to stay with us.  We will look forward to providing an overall impressive stay on your next visit.  Thank you for your review..  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Taking my grand-daughters to Disneyland. Portofino wasn't a bad choice. It was very clean, good sized rooms, had a pool and small spa, you could walk to the Park. On the down side, there were no refrigeraters or microwaves in the rooms. the ice machine was sometimes empty and no food available on site. All in all, good for location, short on amenities.
Manager Response: Dear Richard E,  Thank you for choosing the Portofino Inn & Suites Anaheim Hotel to stay for your special family getaway with your granddaughters.  It's great to learn that you enjoyed our clean, spacious accommodations and incredible Anaheim location!  Please keep in mind for your next stay that our King and Kids Suites include microwaves and refrigerators, and for a nominal daily fee you could have one delivered to rooms that do not include them.  We apologize that on occasion the ice machine was empty.  We have addressed our staff with your feedback and have added an additional restock rotation to ensure that they remain full.
