Kind Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I wasn't sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews for this property. All I can say is I had a great experience and fealt I received more than my money's worth.    Room: clean and well maintained.  Service: spot on. Helpful and sourtiouse.  Location: you won't find much better without being on Disney property. Short walk to the gate.   Yes, the room was on the small side but it had a nice balcony. Suites are available for a small amount more. Two adult and two kids with two queen beds was not a problem.   I'm not sure what to make from some of the negative reviews. Make no mistake, this is an inn not a resort. If you want a wet bar, room service, buffet breakfast and a gym this is not the place.  I would say the room quality was comparable to the Disneyland Hotel for
Manager Response: Dear Lce99,  We are thrilled to receive your detailed review on your recent stay!  Thank you for sharing how much you enjoyed an excellent value and great experience with us.  We are certain that all of your comments and tips will be appreciated by other travelers..  We want you as our loyal guest and look forward to delivering another memorable experience to you and your family on your next visit to Anaheim.  See you soon! Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in one of thier split rooms. There was a sleeping space and a sitting area (with fold out sofa bed) that are seperated with french doors. The room was clean and very nice. The only thing I would change would be to put some sort of room darkening curtains on the french doors. There was only a sheer curtian which defeated the purpose of having the seperate rooms. There was a little privacy when the doors were closed but not much. You can tell there was new carpeting and wallpaper and it all looked very nice. You can park here and walk to everything! No need to worry about parking at Disney. I would stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Neil S,  You are 100% correct; while staying with us you certainly can walk to everything!  Our Anaheim hotel is conveniently located to all of the local attractions, as well as restaurants and shops.  We are very pleased to hear of your family's comfort and enjoyment.  Thank you for your wonderful compliments on our accommodations, location, brand new carpeting and wallpaper.  We have undergone many new improvements and appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback and great suggestions.  Come back to visit soon!  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The hotel was stinky like old chinese food.  The spa was broken (if you could call it a spa) the wifi did not work either.  I will not be staying in this hotel again. YUCK! My kids were super excited to go swimming and the pool was only as big as my bathtub, and took all the color out of the swimsuits it had so much clorine.  I was excited to stay there because the pictures looked really nice.  The smell was the worst thing.
Manager Response: Dear Carrie W,  Thank you for providing us with your feedback on your recent stay.  We apologize that your experience with us was less than impressive.  Please know that our brand new upgraded wifi system was installed a few weeks back and our guests have been extremely pleased with its speedy and efficient connectivity.  Also, all of our guests are more than welcome to use the very large pool located next door at our sister property, Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel.  It is our hope that you and your family will return to enjoy an improved experience in the near future.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent value - walking distance to parks
Summary: We returned from Anaheim today and had an excellent stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites. We stayed in a family suite, which was perfect for our two young children, my mother and my husband and me. We discovered on day 1 that it was crazy to park our rental car at the Disney parking lots because we could leave the car at the hotel and make the 10 minute walk to the main gates without any problem.   With 5 of us in the room, we really appreciated the fridge, as well as the double sinks. It made getting ready much easier in the morning.  Our room was clean - we did request top floor because of noise concerns, and it was just right for us.The staff was friendly and helpful and even worked out a special rate for us for an additional night's stay. No charge for parking and so close to
Manager Response: Dear Julianne R,  Thank you for making us a part of your visit to California!  We are very excited to hear that you had an excellent experience at our Anaheim hotel and appreciate you sharing how much you and your family enjoyed our accommodations and location.   Thank you for also mentioning the easy 10 minute walk from our property to Disney's main gates, complimentary parking for up to two vehicles and our friendly and helpful service.  We hope to accommodate you and your family again on your next visit out from Washington.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Our Disneyland preference for a larger family.
Summary: We stayed at the Portofino Inn and Suites for several of our visits to Disneyland.  We loved that the kid suite accomodated our larger (six people) family size and was within walking distance to the park. The king size beds were surprisingly comfortable, and the children were all well rested as well.  The pool was well maintained as were the laundry facilities.  The convenience of being able to grab Subway (across the street) on our way to the park was fantastic and kept our food costs low.  We never had any issues with our reservations and always enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear Disney6California,  We truly are thrilled to be your Disneyland hotel preference!  It's very exciting for our entire staff to receive your 5 star ratings and review on our Anaheim hotel.  Thank you for sharing how comfortable your larger size family of 6 was in our Kids Suite.  Our beds certainly are comfortable and it's great to hear the kids rested well too.  We appreciate you mentioning that you always enjoy your stay with us  and thank you for your continued patronage.  We can't wait to see you again!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Just got back from a stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites, Anaheim while attending the NAMM show.  We stayed there 2 years ago, and we were not impressed, but this year we tried again, booking a 2 bedroom suite for our party of 5.  The close proximity to the Convention Centre is great, but that's about all that is great.  This property is run down, needs a total overhaul.  The wallpaper is stained and splattered with who knows what, there are electrial outlets hanging out of the walls, and worst of all, absolutely NO INTERNET!  It wasn't even available to purchase.   I find this totally unacceptable in this day and age.  I gave up two king suites at the Holiday Inn Express, which was undergoing extensive renovations, but in hind sight, I wish I would have gone with my gut and
Manager Response: Dear cjopba,  We appreciate you returning to stay with us  and taking the time share your experience.  Please accept our apologies for the sudden slow internet speed that occurred.  We do, indeed, offer complimentary wifi in all of our rooms and common area.  During your stay, we did experience a slow internet connection and immediately contacted our third party service provider.  Your comments are valued, and your suggestions are taken seriously.  If there is anything you would like to discuss further, please contact me directly at the hotel at your earliest convenience.  I would appreciate the opportunity to personally apologize and express how much we appreciate your patronage.  It would be our great pleasure to impress you and exceed all of your expectations during a future stay with us.  Thank you for your review.  Sincerely, MItch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed in their two room suite. It had one room with a bathroom and king sized bed, a living area with a couch bed and then another room with two queen sized beds and an additional full bathroom. It was perfect for the 6 adults and 1 child that we had in the room. The couch bed was uncomfortable according to the adult that slept on it but I think that is with any couch bed. It was a little bit of a walk to the park. If you have little ones I would suggest purchasing ART bus tickets through the front desk for only a few dollars a day. Some of the areas in the hotel are a bit worn but overall it was a good fit for us since we wanted to all stay in one hotel room.
Manager Response: Dear heatherm222,  We are happy that we had the perfect accommodations for the 6 adults and 1 child traveling in your group.  Our suites are certainly the ideal choice for any size family seeking extra space and amenities for the whole family to enjoy.  Thank you for mentioning the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle that provides transportation for a nominal daily fee.  Although, we are located so close to Disneyland, we do understand how it might be a great option when traveling with little ones.  Thank you for your review.  We hope that you and your family plan to stay with us on your next visit to Anaheim.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We are a Disney family.  We have stayed at a lot of resorts.  I will say that now my kids are adults and they still want to go because it has become our family tradition.  We always stayed at the Candy Cane when they were young, and it is great.  I wanted to use miles to pay for this stay and the Portofino was available so we booked it.  We wanted a suite we (5adults) could all stay in and surprisingly the kids suite did well.  It was very comfortable and big.  We do spend most of our time at the park, but my husband said the hot tub and pool were great and we didn't find the walk to be that bad. The staff was nice and helpful.  I have stayed at the Grand Californian and the Disney Hotel as well as a number of other hotels in walking distance.  The Portofino is simple but very
Manager Response: Dear Caibo,  We would like to thank you for giving us the opportunity to accommodate you on your recent visit to Anaheim.  As an avid traveler to our area, your recommendation of our Anaheim hotel means the world to us.  Thank you for your kind comments on our staff, spacious Kids Suites and amenities.  It would be our extreme pleasure to be a part of your family's tradition for many years to come!  We appreciate your time in giving us your feedback and look forward to seeing you and your Disney family in the near future.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Took daughter's family (w/2 young kids, 5 & 8) to Disney & stayed in Kids Bunk Bed suite. Had a view of the Disney fireworks from 5th floor room. Kids loved it, the bunk beds & the childrens table/stools. Their parents slept in comfortable sleeper sofa, and we took outer room, divided by pocket doors. Bathroom has sink, toilet & bathtub/shower behind closed door and another sink in the room. Two TVs was great! Front desk staff very accommodating and VERY friendly. Such a nice hotel that we will stay in again when visiting Disney. GREAT PRICE, clean, and CLOSER to Disney than some of the more expensive hotels!!!
Manager Response: Dear travelnbug54,  We are thrilled to be your Best Value hotel in the Anaheim area!  Thank you for your 5 star rating and review on our comfortable and spacious accommodations.  We are pleased that you and your family enjoyed everything about your experience with us!  Thank you for mentioning just how convenient our location truly is for travelers visiting the Disney parks. Your high recommendation of our Anaheim hotel is greatly appreciated.  Come back and visit soon!  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good, clean and basic - great location and pool
Summary: We stayed here with our 2 kids (7 and 4) during our first visit to Disneyland.  It is a clean hotel, close to Disneyland and with a lot of different food options nearby. It is a 10 minute walk to Disney and there is also the ART (Anaheim Transit) bus that takes you back and forth. The ART tickets cost $14 for 2 adults and 2 kids and were well worth it for us because at the end of the day at Disney when you are extremely tired and have cranky kids there is nothing like stepping into the bus and being dropped off right outside the hotel.  The Disney parking lots are further from the hotel and I am sure they have buses as well but I suspect the ART bus lines are shorter than the Disney bus.  The pool at hotel is nice and warm, the hot tub is also good and they have towels in the
Manager Response: Dear travelwisher,  Thank you for making us a part of your family's very first visit to Disneyland!  It was our pleasure to make your experience a memorable one.  Thank you for sharing the ART shuttle details with other travelers.  Although we are only a short walk away from the Disney parks, the nominal daily ART fee for unlimited rides is certainly a great option to consider, especially with small children.  We appreciate your compliments on our staff, accommodations and location and are happy that you would stay here again!  Thank you for your review.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The Location was Fantastic, the room was excellent value. We stayed in a family suite which had a separate room for the kids with it's own TV and doors to close it off from the main room. The Facilities are a little dated (ie TV) but for the price, you can not complain. It is about a 10-15 stroll to Disneyland, it is right opposite, but you have to walk around the corner and in to Disneyland. Very convenient and very comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear Kodabel,  We absolutely agree; our location is certainly fantastic!   Thank you for sharing how much you enjoyed being so close to the Disneyland parks and how comfortable you and your family were in our Kids Suite.  We appreciate your excellent review and hope to see you and your family again on your next visit to the U.S.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: So this hotel is all about location... To Disneyland in this case, a short 2-3 block walk and you're there.  The hotel is actually a pretty good value in terms of price that close.   Unfortunately the hotel seems tired and old. Another posting had a management response that new carpet and repairs were underway, a month later for me and not obvious it's been done. Stayed in a regular room, no safe, noisy air unit, average bath and shower. The beds did rest good and pillows were good  Initially the heat did not work, but maintenance fixed within an hour.  He knew exactly what to do though, which suggests the problem is common and not being fixed with replacements (consistent with other items seen). The TV didn't want to work half the time (screen went blank).   Fixtures were old
Manager Response: Dear MacJoeFQV,  We appreciate you taking the time out of your schedule to rate and review our hotel.  It is disappointing to hear that we failed to exceed your expectations and we apologize for the inconveniences that occurred.  Please know that new carpet has been installed and repairs completed in parts of our hotel, and more improvements and transformations are to come!  We are glad that you did enjoy our affordable rates, great value and incredible location!  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The pros of this hotel are good but for us didn't outweigh the cons. Pros:  2 "room" suites (divided by glass doors) -kid room has a bunk bed, small table and larger table, TV -adult room has king bed and 2 end tables, TV -fridge and microwave -clean room -comfortable bed This hotel is about a 10 minute brisk walk to the main gate.  Fine for us (with our 11 and 13 year olds) but wouldn't be good for much younger kids unless in the stroller. Cons: So noisy!  We heard every thing from the room upstairs from using the toilet, closing drawers, pouring their ice chest with ice down the sink.  The first guests were incredibly loud.  It sounded like they were playing ball.  This went on for 2 of the 4 nights we stayed.  We complained 5 times (this was up until 1:00am).  We were going
Manager Response: Dear benandshopiesmom,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. We value your candor, and are sorry to hear that your experience was less than impressive. Your time in detailing your stay and giving us your opinions and suggestions is greatly appreciated.  Our guests comfort and enjoyment is always our top priority, as we are constantly making the necessary changes and improvements to ensure we deliver the very best experience.  Should you have anything further you would like to discuss, please contact me directly at the hotel at your earliest convenience.  Again, thank you for your extensive review.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Good location within walk distance of Disneyland, the reason for our stay. It was a bonus to have the room available when I checked in around 9AM.  The friendliness of the staff in the front office and housekeeping made up for the tiredness of the hotel.  The room was spacious and clean with a well lit bathroom with plenty of wardrobe space.  The guest laundry is adequate as is the swimming pool.  We requested a microwave and a mini fridge which was an extra cost but worth the expense. There are so many hotels in the area to suit most budgets and I think the Portofino is well priced.  We booked some tours through the hotel and received good advice from them.
Manager Response: Dear happy solo_12,  We are very pleased that our close proximity to Disneyland brought you to stay with us on your recent visit to the U.S.  Thank you for your comments on our clean and spacious accommodations, amenities and our friendly staff.  We also appreciate you sharing that you enjoyed our great location within walking distance to the Disney parks, as well as shops, restaurants, Anaheim Convention Center and many other Anaheim attractions.  Thank you for posting a review on our property and giving us your valuable feedback.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed in the kids suite and i had read some of the reviews before we got there..I would have to say that honestly it wasnt bad at all..i thought the room on the adult side would be bigger it was a bit small and the curtains should on the adult side  and darkened as its hard for the parents to change as the kids can see right through the see through light curtains.  From our 5th floor room the kids could see the fireworks perfectly but i questioned the front desk why no balcony and they replied..its for security safety reasons theres no balcony ..Yet the 5th floor window was cracked open with NO screen so ..What would prevent a curious child from opening the windown and dropping 5 stories?? I think mgmt should address this issue promptly..The staff was courteous
Manager Response: Dear tracy v,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us while visiting California.   We would also like to apologize for missing our mark at delivering a warm and friendly check in experience.  Be assured that we have followed up with our staff on your comments to ensure this does not happen again.  We are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed the Disney firework show from the comfort of your Kids Suite.  Also, thank you for bringing the crack in the window of your suite to our immediate attention.  Please know that all of our windows have safety locks on them for the protection of all of our guests. Thank you for your great rating and review on our Anaheim hotel.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great price if you want to stay close to Disney.
Summary: Like most others say, it is old. But what place across from Disney will be new. The parking was great by the pool. Back door in and up the elevator lead us right to our cozy room. Sliding door to balcony was nice. The tv was old and the room smell was musky till the ac cleared it, but we just went to poop and sleep. The sheets were clean and after all the walking we just used the CLEAN shower and were out fast asleep. The tolite however was small old style WITH NO VENT IN REST ROOM. Forget the coffee, it is old school near the stinky restroom (gross), and the lobby has nothing but water in the morning. A bit pricy for what you get but it was all about location for us.
Manager Response: Dear Mike J,  We're glad you enjoyed our prime location near Disneyland and our cozy accommodations! It was our pleasure to provide you with a clean shower and comfy bed after a long day at the Disney parks.  We appreciate you bringing to our attention the musky smell in your room that cleared after ruining the air conditioning.  Your insight assists us in our constant efforts to deliver the very best experience our guests can enjoy!  Thank you for your rating and review.  We will look forward to having you and your family as our guests again.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: The advertisement for this hotel and what you get are two different things completely.
Summary: I am very disappointed with this hotel. We were sold on so many good things and decided to stay here. We have a family of 6.  The rooms are old. The wallpaper behind the curtains is peeling. The microwave is gross. The refrigerator barely keeps things cold. We were hot in the room so I decided to turn on the air conditioner. Big mistake. The thing sounded like an airplane.  I turned it off and then it kept turning on a few times after that.  The carpets are dark probably to hide the dirtiness of the rooms.  I am extremely disgusted.   I definitely don't recommend this hotel to anyone. I would never stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear GK0906,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience at our hotel. Please accept our apology for falling short of your expectations and missing our mark of delivering an impressive stay.  We have promptly followed up on the peeling wallpaper behind the curtains in your room, as well as any necessary repairs to the appliances.  Please know that we are installing brand new carpet in our hotel this week and making various other exciting changes throughout our hotel!  Once again, we are sorry that the details you described in you review impacted your experience at our hotel. We would truly appreciate an opportunity to deliver the comfortable and enjoyable stay that you deserve.  Thank you for your valuable feedback.  Best Regards, Mitch Healty, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location, but that's about it
Summary: The pictures are extremely misleading, furniture is beat up, dusting is horrible, housekeeping decided to stop replacing the plastic cups and washcloths. Rooms are overpriced for what you get. Location is great, since it's in walking distance of Disneyland. Paying over 100 dollars a night for plastic cups and having a smeared tv screen is ridiculous. I work for a hotel and this type of service is just unacceptable when it comes to cleanliness, the shower had mildew in it, also looked like there was water damage around the door frames. I would not stay here again, not worth the money at all.
Manager Response: Dear leflygal88,  We apologize that your recent experience with us fell short of exceeding your expectations. It is very disappointing to hear of the details in your review in regard to the condition you found your room. Immediate follow up was taken to ensure that any issues are resolved and that this remains an isolated incident.  We have also addressed your comments with our housekeeping staff.  We are sorry for these unacceptable inconveniences.  Thank you for taking the time to post your review on Tripadvisor and give us your valued feedback.  We hope to soon have the pleasure of delivering the impressive and enjoyable experience that you deserve.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights last weekend and were hesitant after reading some recent reviews. We booked a king suite through Expedia and got a great rate! The lobby was very nice and even though the parking lot was pretty full we found a spot close to our room.  We were in building 2 on the 5th floor. The room was very spacious and we really enjoyed  having the living room to relax in at the end of the day. The bed was very comfy and the hotel was quiet at night--great when you are beat up from the parks!  We are annual Disney passholders and have stayed at several area hotels. This one is a lot better than some others that we have stayed at. Yes there was a little wear and tear in the rooms but the room was clean and we would definitely stay here again. Having the microwave and
Manager Response: Dear ksvegas,  We always enjoy exceeding our guests' expectations!  It is great to receive your positive feedback on our spacious rooms, amenities and extremely helpful customer service.  We are thrilled that our Anaheim hotel proved to be better than other properties you have stayed at in our area.  You're right!  We are installing brand new carpet and also have other exciting transformations in store for our guests! Thank you very much for your wonderful review.  We look forward to welcoming you and your family back in a few months!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what I would choose, Good thing I got a deal
Summary: The pictures and reviews on their website looked great but was not reality. We found an online deal for $100 a night for the family suite for our family of 5 and that was the only thing that kept us there. Furniture and carpet looked old and worn. The fridge was turned off and had been closed so it had a sour smell. the sheets and blankets were cheap, thin and stained. Each morning as we were waking up we'd hear a loud gurgle and bubble come from the toliet and then a terrible smell...like it was on a septic system. The kids room section had the airconditioning unit in it and it was LOUD!! Most of the cold air stayed in that room which wasn't good for the kids, not to mention waking up everytime it came on. The pool and hot tub were at very warm temps (good!) but the hot tube
Manager Response: Dear travelover6989,  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments on TripAdvisor.  We apologize that you had a disappointing experience and appreciate you bringing this to our attention. We value you as a guest, and want you to know that your feedback is extremely important to us.  In order to ensure the details you mentioned are properly addressed, we have immediately followed up with our housekeeping and maintenance teams.  Again, please accept our apologies. We hope to have the opportunity to have you and your family as our guests again.  It would be a our pleasure to renew your confidence in our hotel.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney
Summary: We stayed here for three nights over Halloween. We booked a two bedroom, two bathroom suite. We were pleasantly surprised that our suite also had a full living room! It was the perfect space for my family (two small children, myself and my husband, and grandpa). They also gave us a great rate on the room because we were AAA members! The hotel was about a ten minute walk to Disney, but there is a bus available for a small fee. The pool was properly heated, and we were able to swim even at night.   The only downside was they don't have breakfast on site. The only day this was an issue for us was our last day, as we had an early flight.
Manager Response: Dear Adams2615,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel for your 3 night Halloween visit.  It's thrilling for us to learn that our suite was the perfect space for you and your family!  We're happy that you took advantage of our great rates offered to AAA members and that our pool was properly heated for night swimming.  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience and tips with other travelers.  We are certain your review will be helpful to others.  Come and visit us again soon!  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: This was a well priced hotel given location, and having free car-parking was a plus. The room was a bit worn, however comfortable bed and nice size balcony. The pool was a welcome addition after a 14 hour flight. All in all good value for money.
Manager Response: Dear Country_girl00,  Thank you for sharing the details on the good value you enjoyed while staying with us.  We appreciate you taking advantage of our affordable rates, complimentary parking and unbeatable location!  Please keep in mind for your return stay that our guests are also welcome to use the larger pool located next door at our sister hotel, Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel.   Again, thank you for your review.  It will be our pleasure to welcome you and your family back to the U.S. on your next visit.   Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: dirty and unsafe for kids next to Disneyland
Summary: Although the location was great,the property looked like it needed help. The furniture was defective and unsafe for kids. The carpets were dirty and the sheets had stains and strings of hair. We decided to leave, I did not see how I would want my kids sleeping there. 2 blocks further we found a nice, clean property forthe same price.
Manager Response: Dear MGeorge_16,  We are very sorry to hear that you and your family did not choose to stay with us.  Please be assured that our furniture is not defective and is most definitely safe for kids.  We apologize for the details described in your review in regard to the carpet and sheets in your room. Thank you for bringing your opinions and comments to our attention so that we may immediately address them.  Again, we apologize that we failed to impress you.  Thank you for your time in completing the review.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We paid a great deal of money to stay at this hotel because there was a big convention nearby for work. The sink in the bathroom was backed up, so that wasn't great. The bed was comfortable, but  the sheets were pretty aged. Overall I agree with alot of the other reviews, it seems like they spent money on the facade, but not on the rooms. They have old tube tv sets in the rooms, you don't see those much any more. I felt we paid way too much for this place--if it were my own money I would have complained big time! Its on a Motel 6 type of level.
Manager Response: Dear AJfromCO,  It is disappointing for us to learn that we failed to exceed your expectations on your recent business visit.  We are sorry that we failed to impress you and appreciate your valued feedback on your stay.  Your suggestions are very important to us, as we are committed to making the necessary changes and improvements to ensure our guests enjoy the best experience with us.  Thank you for completing the review.  Our staff hopes to have the pleasure of having you as our guest again on your next visit to our area.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: A short walk from Disney and a generally great stay.
Summary: Portofino Inn is very close to Disneyland (which is a big plus to not have to pay for daily parking).  The leisurely walk takes about 20 mins and passes many different restaurants along the way.  We made it a habit that we wouldstop at one and eat breakfast along the way to the park.    The property itself is very lovely and have lots of tropical plants everywhere.  Garage parking is extremely small and limited.  Interior of the building was nice but not spectacular.  Nothing really wrong but nothing standing out as really nice either.  Beds were comfy and rooms were large.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and had 8 people stay for 3 days without any issues.  Decor seems a little dated but was anything wrong.  Free wifi was a big plus with 4 kids in the room!  Would definitely
Manager Response: Dear photowanderluster,  Thank you for your great rating and review on our Anaheim hotel.  It is a delight to hear that you found our lovely property comfortable and enjoyable.  We are also pleased that our 2 bedroom suite worked out great for your group of eight.  Our complimentary wifi is always a big plus for our guests of all ages.  Thanks again for choosing to stay with us.  We are very excited that you and your family would definitely stay with us again!  We will look forward to it!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here in March and it suited our needs.  Within walking distance of local 'famous' eateries such as Cheesecake Factory. Across the road from IHop for a late night snacks.  Parking looked a little dodgy but we were assured all would be fine. Pool was small but good for a quick dip after a LNG day at the theme parks.  Great place if you don't want to spend a lot of time in your room
Manager Response: Dear Sarah C,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit from Australia.  We appreciate you choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel and giving us your feedback on your experience.  As you mentioned, our location is not only walking distance to the Anaheim attractions, but also many shops and a wide variety of restaurants.  We hope to have you and your family as our guests again on your next trip to the U.S.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Horrible!! Never stay here unless u like Motel 6!
Summary: Complete upgrade of room is extremely needed. Paper thin walls, extremely noisy...felt ceiling would cave in from upstairs guest stomping around all night! Bedding was horrible, torn sheets. Stinky/Smelly room, dingy carpets, toilet would not flush, shower curtain & rod were disgusting. Old outdated lighting, electronics. Over all very disappointed! Felt like we were in a 2 bedroom Motel 6!!! Would never recommend or stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Kv123456,  We are very disappointed to hear that we failed to deliver an enjoyable stay.  Please accept our apologies for any inconveniences that occurred while staying with us, including the noise you experienced from other guests.  Be assured that the details described in your review do not reflect the standard condition of our accommodations.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention, as we have taken your comments very seriously and always follow up on our guests' feedback.   Once again, we are sorry that we missed our mark and failed to impress you.  We appreciate your review.  Best,  Mark Healy, General Manager

Summary: I stayed for a conference at the convention center, and the location for both the convention center and Disneyland was great.  However, I also booked the hotel for the free wireless internet given I was here for work, and it was completely unusable the entire time.  I could hardly even load a webpage at times, and was not able to do my work.  I spoke with IT, and they said they were going to address the issue and get back to me, and it was never fixed, nor did I receive the follow-up I was told I would.  I found it extremely frustrating to choose a hotel that advertises free internet, and had to go and pay for it at another hotel just to be able to do anything online. For this reason, I will not stay here again, nor would I recommend it for any business traveler or anyone that
Manager Response: Dear Sonja61,  Please accept our sincere apologies for the internet difficulties you experienced during your stay, as well as our failure to update you on its status.  We did experience an issue with our wifi connection and immediately notified our third party service provider.  Unfortunately, this connectivity issue was beyond our control.  Please know that it has been resolved.  This issue is not a typical occurrence at our property and has been addressed with our service provider.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  It is our hope that you will reconsider staying with us again to give us the opportunity to provide you with a comfortable stay, along with the complimentary amenities that you deserve.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manger

Summary Heading: Great location for disney and conference centre
Summary: Was kn town for a conference and was shocked to see a shuttle to the convention centre when i realized i only had a parking lot (and less than 5 min) between myself and the conference centre. A walk to disneyland was 3 blocks or about 10 min...but no kids with me so maybe quicker than families. Nice from the outside, a little dated inside, but room with bunk beds is roomy for a family.  I would like to see better tvs and a green program rather than wasteful coffee program (lots of plastic) but for the price i was ok with his. Not sure how it compares to other nearby hotels but this would not be as uptodate as most chains i have been in but does the job.
Manager Response: Dear paixful,  We are happy to hear that you were pleasantly surprised at just how close we truly are to the Anaheim Convention Center, Disneyland, and other Anaheim attractions.  Thank you for taking the time to share how spacious our Kids Suites are.  We appreciate your comments on suggestions to enhance our guests' experiences.  Thank you for your review.  We hope you will decide to visit us again on your next business trip to Anaheim.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Stayed here three nights for a conference at the Convention Center.  This was a huge conference and we were late in making reservations, but they gave us a special rate and the hotel is extremely convenient to the Convention Center (<5 minute walk).  A lot of other attendees paid a lot more for hotels much further away.  The staff was very nice and allowed us to check in several hours early at no charge due to our flight schedule getting us there in the morning and the conference starting in the afternoon.  The hotel is also a short walk from Disneyland and numerous shops and restaurants (which is a good thing since there is no restaurant or breakfast on site).  The gift shop has a great selection of sundries and gifts at reasonable prices.  The fitness center was kind of a joke
Manager Response: Dear CosmoVA,  Thank you for staying with us during your recent business visit to Anaheim.  We are glad that you took advantage of our affordable rates and very close proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center.   Thank you for mentioning that you enjoyed an overall good stay, which included clean and comfortable accommodations and friendly customer service.  Please keep in mind for your next stay, that we are always at your service throughout your entire stay.  It would have been our pleasure to immediately resolve the minor issue with one of the sinks in your room.  Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to give us your feedback by completing the review on our hotel.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The Portofino Inn and Suites is a perfect place to stay during your Disney trip. I was so worried after reading reviews but my family and I decided to book anyway. We arrived an hour early and were able to check in early without any problems. The hotel is beautiful, our room was clean and spacious, and parking was perfect. The walk to Disneyland was also perfect. The staff were all so very nice. My family and I will stay here again next year for our family trip.
Manager Response: Dear Elizabeth W,  We couldn't agree with you more; the Portofino Inn & Suites is the perfect place to stay for a Disney trip!  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  It was our pleasure to fulfill your request for an early check in upon your arrival.  We always love to receive such wonderful feedback from our guests, especially when the word perfect is repeated several times!  Thank you for completing the review on our Anaheim hotel.  We are very excited that you and your family will be staying with us again on your next family trip!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The Portofino Inn and Suites is a gem, nestled in central Anaheim,  where the  area's best attractions are a short walk away.   This hotel is a beautiful, modern oasis, offering so many wonderful amenities that they are difficult to list.  I think I will try anyway.  After a long day at one of Anaheim's theme parks, take a dip in the refreshing pool, or relax your muscles in the outdoor spa tub.  If you didn't get enough walking in, tone up at the state-of-the-art fitness facility!  For those of us who have to do a little business, even when on vacation, the 24 hour business center will be a life saver, as well as the in-room wireless internet service.  The Portofino Inn and Suites also offers a game room, a concierge desk, and shuttle service to the airport, a shopping center,
Manager Response: Dear DestinationDiaries,  We are honored to be your gem in Anaheim accommodations!  Thank you for making us your home away from home during your recent visit to our area.  Your 5 star rating and fantastic review on your experience is greatly appreciated by our entire staff.  Thank you for your valuable time in summarizing many of the wonderful aspects and features of our rooms that set us apart from all the rest.  We are also very happy that you found time to enjoy so many of our great amenities.  You are absolutely correct; it is pretty incredible that you are able enjoy the Disneyland fireworks from the comfort of your own room!  Again, thank you for your wonderful review.  Please know that we do, indeed, enjoy our job of ensuring that you enjoy your experience.  We hope to have the pleasure of doing just that for you again on your next visit to California!  Warm Regards,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The deluxe room was anything, but deluxe. There was no mini refrigerator or microwave. The room was small and rather ugly. The floors were not really that clean and the sheets were not changed during our stay. The photos must have been taken when the hotel was new and they do not reflect the Portofino now.   We were charged a ridiculous seventeen percent room tax plus a resort fee. A supposed 320 dollar fee wound up to be four hundred dollars. It was definitely not worth the price charged. There was no continental breakfast or other services that a resort fee should be charged for. It  was claimed the resort fee was for the internet and parking. The internet would not work and it was nearly impossible to find a parking space. Management was very unhelpful when I tried to discuss
Manager Response: Dear kstierwait,  Please accept our apologies for failing to deliver an impressive stay.  In each of our rooms and suites, you will find an explanation of our property's conservation efforts, as well as instructions on where to place the bedside tent card if the guest requests their sheets be changed daily.  Thank you for brining your opinions and details of your stay to our attention.  We would certainly appreciate a renewed opportunity to deliver an enjoyable experience.  If there is anything further that you would like to discuss in regard to your stay, please contact me directly at the hotel at your earliest convenience.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Adequate for a budget Disney stay
Summary: Our king bed kids suite was fine for a last minute Disney trip.  The furniture and the room in general shows a lot of wear and tear but I imagine the rooms are full of kids on most nights and may take more abuse than the normal hotel room.  With the king bed, the bunk beds and a sofabed you could potentially have 6 people in the room and you would still have plenty of room for all your things, which would make this a bargain for a family on a budget.  For the most part, the room was cleaned adequately. The notable exception was that the blanket on the bed looked like it had not been laundered after the last guest. This always makes me wonder about overall housekeeping practices although everything else seemed pretty clean.
Manager Response: Dear Rollingvacationer,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for summarizing your experience in your review.  Thank you for pointing out how spacious our Kids Suites are.  We couldn't agree with you more; our Kids Suites truly are the ideal choice for any family seeking clean and spacious accommodations at an affordable rate!  We do apologize for the condition of the blanket that was in your room.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that we are available 24/7 to assist you in any way we can.  It would have been our pleasure to replace that blanket within minutes of your phone call to our front desk.  Again, thank you for your patronage.  We hope you and your family will return to see us soon!  Warm Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what its advertised to be!
Summary: We were looking for a hotel that was close to the Disney parks, and that could fit a larger family. We found the Portofino Inn & Suites, and they had a 2 bedroom suite with a sofa sleeper. This hotel is about a 10min walk to the parks, so we thought great!  Pro's: 1. Close to Disneyland  2. Had availability on a busy weekend Con's: 1. Room is old - does not look like the nice pictures they have on their webpage  2. Beds are worn out - uncomfortable  3. Rooms are very noisy - on the street - can hear traffic all night 4. Two TV's had fuzzy signals - only one really worked  The site looks as if this is a well kept hotel - but once you are inside, you find out that its not.
Manager Response: Dear Paul M,  We are very sorry that we failed to exceed your expectations.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your valuable feedback on your stay.  Your insight assists us in our commitment to delivering a comfortable and enjoyable experience to each and every guest.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience that occurred during your stay.  Please know that your comments have been taken very seriously and immediate action was taken in our follow up to the details described in your review.    Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Comfortable beds, quiet rooms and a very clean hotel.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Easy walk to the parks, small market and several cheap restaurants within a block.  The only thing that would have been better is if they'd offer refridgerators and microwaves in each room.
Manager Response: Dear Bill H,  It was our pleasure to be a part of your great Disney visit!  Thank you for sharing details about our comfortable beds, quiet and clean accommodations and how friendly and helpful our staff truly is!  We are pleased that you found our location not only convenient to the Disney Parks, but also within walking distance to parks, shops and several restaurants.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that we do have mini refrigerators and microwaves available for a nominal fee.  Once again, thank you for your fantastic feedback!  We will await your return visit!  Best, MItch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Low cost accommodations for the family close to Disneyland. However the property is beginning to show it's age and the house keeping is not the best we found leftover food items on the floor of our room.
Manager Response: Dear J B,  Thank you for your review.  We are extremely sorry that we missed our mark of delivering exceptional housekeeping service throughout your stay.  Please know that these unacceptable details have been followed up and addressed immediately.  Your comments and suggestions are very valuable to us.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We hope you and your family will decide to return on your next visit to Anaheim.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed here on a family trip with my grandsons as well as my daughter and son-in-law. It is close to Disneyland,  about two long blocks by foot. There is also a shuttle but it was not running on schedule when we visited.There is no continental breakfast or coffee however they had iced water with lemon in the lobby. Our room was clean and comfortable and when we called maintenance to replace a battery in the fire alarm because it was beeping they were there within 5 minutes. However, at night the A/C was very noisy. There is a small pool, a room with 4 machines that they refer to as a gym and a small arcade as well as a nice gift shop in the adjoining building. There is an IHOP across the street and half a block up is a 7-11 as well as a Subway, Pizza and an Asian
Manager Response: Dear 9erfan,  Thank you for choosing to make us a part of your family trip to Anaheim.  Thank you for your lovely review and all of your wonderful compliments.  Our front desk is, indeed, staffed 24/7.  We apologize for any delay you experienced.  Please know that we appreciate your time and have looked into the details described to ensure that this does not happen again.  Thank you for your recommendation of our property to other travelers.  We do hope to welcome you and your family back on your next visit to our area.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great facilities, fairly clean, but great customer service
Summary: I stayed in one of the Family Suites in Sept 2012.  The arrangement of the room was really great for my family of 5.  Past trips with a standard 2 Queen bed room have been uncomfortable, to say the least, having to stay quiet once the kids were down.  The kid suite has a nice, but not completely private, sliding door between the kids sleeping area and the adult sleeping area.  The kids also have their own TV, which was great!   We used the sofabed and even still their was room to negotiate the room just fine. The cleanliness of the rooms was not perfect, for the germophobes out there.....but it was okay for my family.  I never felt like any of the flaws was endangering anyone's health.  Just a stray hair in the bathroom or a missed paper under the bed. We did have a problem with
Manager Response: Dear stinawired,  Thank you and your family of 5 for staying at our Anaheim hotel.  It is always thrilling to receive such great feedback from our guests.  We appreciate you taking the time to detail some of the great features in our Kids Suites. The spacious layout, separate sleeping rooms and multiple T.V's are a great beginning to all that our suites include.  Thank you for your kind compliments on our exceptional customer service.  We enjoy assisting in any way we can to ensure that your experience is the best!  Your review is great appreciated.  We're very happy to hear that you and your family would definitely stay with us again!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Booked the kids suite and when we went into the room in the morning notice about 40 ants in the tub. I cleaned out the tub and told the front desk what I noticed. They asked me if I would like another room I declined because they were gone. They told me they would spray the room and we should be good. Went to Disney came back beat. Got into bed and started to read when I felt the ants run across my arm. I told the front desk it is time to change rooms they gave me a room on the forth floor packed up went to room. Upon entering checked the tub and saw ants in the tub and the sink. At that I went to call the front desk but the phone was broke. (Ha sounds like a bad movie.) With that I packed up and left. To the credit of the inn the staff where very compliant and even went as far
Manager Response: Dear Revialfire,  We are very sorry for the inconvenience that you experienced.  As you mentioned, it would have been our pleasure to relocate you and your family to another kids suite; however, we understand your confidence in staying in that particular room when the ants appeared to be gone.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  Please know that our third party service provider was immediately notified, as they professionally treat our property on a regular basis.  Again, we appreciate you bringing these details to our attention and apologize for failing to deliver an enjoyable stay.  We truly hope that you will decide to give us another opportunity in the future to provide you with the comfortable and quality stay that you deserve.  Respectfully, Mitch Healy, General Manger

Summary: We stayed in a kids king suit and it was nice. Plenty of room for the kids to run free and with all the kids running around never heard anything coming from any of the other rooms. It was super close to Disney Land and we walked. The pool was a bit small but the fact that you could use another hotels pool made up for it. Lots of places nearby to get something to eat which weren't to expensive.
Manager Response: Dear ShrekGFFG,  Thank you for your wonderful compliments on our spacious and comfortable  Anaheim accommodations.  We appreciate you mentioning that your room was quiet and that you never heard anything from the neighboring rooms.  We're glad that you and your family also enjoyed having access to the larger pool located next door at our sister hotel, The Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel.  Again, thank you for the great review.  We hope you and your family plan to visit us again soon!  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We booked the King kids suite as it looked like a great option for the kid and adults to be comfortable during a trip to disney. First impression was OK. Lobby and grounds were decent. We check in and things start to go downhill. First off no A/C in the hallways which with the 100 degree weather at the time were uncomfortable. Then we notice the carpet in the halls is pulling up from the floor. Not a good sign, but we can live with that. The room is nice and big, but start to notice the walls are dirty, the bottom of the dresser drawers are stained. OK, we can live with that.   Hmm the A/C doesn't seem to be keeping up. It's not too bad, we can handle that. OK so time to get dinner. We come back to the room and start getting the kids ready for bed. We then notice pieces of
Manager Response: Dear Michael C,  Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconveniences that occurred during your stay.  We have taken immediate action to address your comments and resolve any issues.  Our guests' comfort and enjoyment is very important to us and we are constantly making the necessary changes and improvements to ensure the very best experience. Thank you for your valuable feedback.  It is disappointing for us to hear that we failed to deliver a pleasurable stay for you and your family.   We hope to have the opportunity in the near future to provide you with the quality stay that we are known for and you deserve.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect family hotel so close to Disneyland!
Summary: Was very pleasantly surprised at the value of this hotel.  We stayed in a kid suite which included a regular hotel room with an adjoining room separated by french sliding doors with a couch bed and bunk beds, separate tv and mini fridge.  This was absolutely the perfect place for a family to stay near disney.  The first day upon advice of others, we walked to the Disney parking lot, and rode the shuttle for free, but the second day we discovered it was actually quicker to walk to Disney itself, t took less than 10 minutes.  The hotel is a little run down but as I understand, a number of hotels in the area are.  The staff was super-friendly and were quick to respond to any requests we had.  Stayed at the Best Western last time which was a 15 minute drive to Disneyland, it was
Manager Response: Dear lajb,  It is very thrilling for us to receive your great feedback on your recent stay with us!  We are honored to be your perfect Anaheim hotel!  Thank you for mentioning our very close proximity to Disneyland.     You are absolutely correct; it takes just minutes to walk to Disneyland from our hotel.  It was our pleasure to provide you with friendly service and quickly respond to any of your requests.  We appreciate your review and are happy that you will definitely be staying with us again!  Warm Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: The worst hotel of our trip
Summary: We booked this using our Diner's points and it was a big comedown from our stays at Staybridge Suites in Anaheim, Westin Lake Las Vegas, Tahiti Village in Las Vegas and also Sheraton San Deigo Suites.    The carpet is lifting in the hallway and we have a son with Cerebal Palsy who has walking difficulties and it would trip up on normal kids, let alone him.    We asked for blankets for the sofa bed and they arrived and they had multiple large holes in them.  That was disgusting and I believe unacceptable.  We ended up leaving and going to San Diego for three nights and coming back only for our last night before departing for home.     The pool is disappointing and backs onto a carpark.  The airconditioning was so noisy in the master bedroom that I had to sleep with airplugs in.
Manager Response: Dear Merryn S,  We are very disappointed to hear of your recent experience and the unacceptable inconveniences that occurred.  Please accept our apologies and know that your feedback is taken seriously.  We have taken immediate action into further investigating your comments, as this is not the standard stay at our hotel.  We will most certainly repair any lifting area in the hallway carpet and our entire inventory of blankets have been thoroughly inspected.  Again, we are extremely sorry that we failed to impress you.  Thank you for your review.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Almost Perfect for Families visiting Disney
Summary: This is a spacious, clean, comfortable hotel that has 'almost' everything for the travelling family. We stayed in a suite that offered two rooms (one large bathroom) with dividing doors and TV, desk facilities in each room.  The children's room had bunk beds and Disney inspired furniture and our room boasted a king sized bed and lots of space. The only downside was that the hotel did not have a restaurant, but offered discount vouchers for the grill next door (this wasn't that good). Breakfast is served at Denny's just across the road, which served a very good breakfast (all American style and in huge quantities, with great service). The Disney Park is about 10-15 minutes to the gate, but bear in mind that there is still another 10 minutes walk to the turnstiles within the park.
Manager Response: Dear Worldscapetravel:  We are very excited to hear that you enjoyed a comfortable and clean stay in our spacious Kids Suite!  Thank you for mentioning some of the great details of our suites that sets us apart from the other hotels in the area.  We are glad to hear that you also enjoyed being located so close to many dining options.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We will look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the U.S.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: This is a well run hotel 10-15 minutes walk from Disney. We stayed in a kids suite which is well set up to allow a little space between you and your kids. The locations is the key to the hotel together with being well run, good housekeeping (clean) and not too old even if the decor is a little dated. The hotel seems to know its market but we couldnt figure out why no breakfast. If you are looking to avoid kids/ families this is probably not the place for you as it can be a bit noisey (jumping off bunk beds) and the AC can be loud so ask about that when you check in to get a quieter room which I suspect is block A. The fridge and mircowave means you have some flexibility and there are plenty of restaurants close by if you tire of overpaying for Disney food. Overall for the price
Manager Response: Dear Scoobydoo4169,  We are thrilled to hear that you and your family enjoyed a quality stay.  Thank you for mentioning our affordable rates, excellent location and well run hotel.  All of your great tips will certainly be appreciated by other travelers.  We look forward to delivering another comfortable, clean and memorable experience.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your valuable feedback.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: bunkbeds, close to Disney, but not too close
Summary: We always recommend the Portofino for families.  We need our kids to be in their own room but not sharing a bed so this is perfect. Although the door between is open on the sides so it's not soundwise like it's in a separate room.  We stuffed the extra blanket in there.  It's down the street from the entrance to the parks so it's a tiring walk after a long day.  Sometimes one parent would go get the car and haul everyone back.  The big negative is there's no place to eat or free breakfast, but the bunks are worth it to us and it's tough to find a king bed too.  Get a room on the outer side facing north toward the park and you can see the fireworks especially if it's up high.
Manager Response: Dear dsavery,  We appreciate your continued patronage and recommendation of our Anaheim hotel.  Thank you for sharing some of the great details of our Kids Suites that sets us apart from the other properties in our area.  As you mentioned, a king bed along with bunk beds for the kids is quite hard to find.  We are so pleased that you and your family enjoy our accommodations.  Also, thank you for  posting your travel tips.  We are certain other travelers will enjoy viewing the Disneyland fireworks from the comfort of our rooms too! Thank you for your rating and review.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: good value, short enough walk even for preschoolers to Disney
Summary: Kids' suite was as pictured pretty much.  I don't know why they put the curtains on the kids' side of the doors, but otherwise the design of the room is good.  I was worried the walk would be too long because they talk about a shuttle, but it really is just 3 blocks to Disney- shuttle seems silly.  There are two very busy roads to cross though.  The mexican restaurant in the strip mall across the street (Mi Casita?) was tasty and stays open late.  There were some ants in the bathroom, but otherwise clean.
Manager Response: Dear Chelan B,  We appreciate you taking the time to mention that your Kids Suite was as pictured on our web site and that our close proximity to Disneyland worked well for your preschooler to walk there.  Thank you for complimenting the good value you experienced while staying with us.  Other travelers are certain to appreciate your tips and dining suggestions.  We are sorry that you found ants in your bathroom.  Please know that we are at your service throughout your stay and enjoy assisting you in any way we can.  Again, thank you for your great rating and review.  It will be our pleasure to see you and your family again on your next visit to Anaheim.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We've stayed here a few times now & our daughter LOVES the Bunkbed Family Suite! It's quite cozy & plenty spacious! We mention the Portofino when friends are asking for Disneyland Tips. Unfortunately, the extra walking time - fact that there's no Breakfast included - and, the incredible amount of noise from other Families...leads us to other Venues. It also took a VERY long time to check in!
Manager Response: Dear facosmo,  Thank you for returning our hotel.  We appreciate you taking the time to mention our comfortable and spacious accommodations, as well as your recommendation of our Anaheim hotel to friends.  It is very disappointing to learn that you and your family were inconvenienced by noise from other guests.  Also, please accept our apologies for any delay you experienced while checking in.  Our check in process is standardly quite fast and efficient, however, during the extremely busy summer months, there may be a few more guests in line.  We appreciate your patience and understanding.  It is our hope that you and your family will decide to return.  We will look forward to welcoming you back to the comfort of a Family Suite.  The bunk beds are waiting!  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Our family of 8 recently stayed the hotel in a 2 room suite. The hotel is right in the middle of everything and so close to Disneyland. We did have a micro and fridge along with 3 tv's and 2 bathrooms. There was plenty of room for everyone. The AC worked great for us just a bit noisy in the master bedroom. Another complaint was that it was tough to find parking at night. Also, we had a few minor maintainence issues such as clogged sink and loose door handle. Over all I have to say we enjoyed ourselves and staff was friendly and helpful. I believe we got a great deal and would consider staying again.
Manager Response: Dear Danielle E,  We are happy to hear you took advantage of our great rates and enjoyed yourselves while staying at our hotel.  Thank you for mentioning you had plenty of room in our spacious 2 room suite and that the air conditioner worked great.  Also, we appreciate your comments on our unbelievably convenient location.  You're right; we are definitely right in the middle of everything and so very close to Disneyland.  Thank you for your excellent review and ratings.  We hope you will decide to stay with us again.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Facilities with no maintenance, a spider, a filthy room and no maid service. The manager never showup.
Summary: Filthy hotel, we had two rooms, first room we find a spider in one, splashed it in the wall, reported inmediately, they never clean the wall,  we stayed there for 3 nigths. Second room, the room was filthy, and a very smelly bathroom, we reported, they never offered to change room because they were overbooked, one day they forgot to do the room, we have ti reported again, they not apollogized. They know they can have guests from all over the world, so they dont care about the experience of a guest that will never comeback because  they still  have millions of chances of people that want to visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Jupitero,  We absolutely do care about our guests' experiences at our hotel.  Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconveniences that occurred, and know that we have immediately followed up on your feedback.  Thank you for bringing these details to our attention.  Also, be assured that a member of our management team is always available.  If there are any further details that you would like to discuss, please contact me directly at our hotel, at your convenience.  Again, thank you for giving us your feedback on your recent stay.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The Portofino Inn and Suites has cockroaches and according to reviews I read they have had them since 2006. I stayed here this week and we found BABY cockroaches and mothers I am still crawling but I'm gonna crawl to the Public Health boars they have a responsibility to the public. We used the tub for an infant and their idea to fix it was to bomboard us with Raid. They are in total denial and told me they never heard anybody complain about their roaches who own the place. You rent a room but the Roaches have the deed! Also the maids don't clean why should they it's bombarded with roaches
Manager Response: Dear Kris M,  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience that occurred.  Please know that our property must adhere to strict company standards and regular inspections, which we take extremely seriously.  A third party service provider treats our entire property on a regular basis, as well as performs their own inspections, in which they submit reports on.  Should a guest report a sighting, they are immediately called out to investigate, per our request.   Promptly spraying the area you pointed out was just a temporary solution until our service provider was able to respond.  Thank you for bringing the details of your stay to our attention.  Again, we are sorry that your experience was the exception.  It would certainly be our pleasure to have the opportunity to deliver the comfortable and enjoyable stay that keep our guests returning to our hotel.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Weak Air Conditioning System failed to keep up with extreme heat
Summary: Overall, the check in process was exceptional, with curteous staff members. The rooms were clean and upkept daily. The distance to Disneyland was a short 10 minute walk, with a wide variety of eating establishments close by. However, the air conditioning in both rooms reserved was less than adequate and failed to keep up with the extreme heat during our stay August 6-9, 2012. This led to restless, sweaty, uncomfortable sleeping arrangements. After walking Disney all day you expect to report to a cool room to rest and recover, and that did not happen. If you are visiting during cooler weather, I would recommend this establishment, however, summertime...not so much!
Manager Response: Dear Paula C,  We apologize for the air conditioning inconvenience during your stay.  After immediate follow up to a guests inquiry during their stay, our maintenance team placed a call to our third party service provider in regard to our systems.  The air conditioning have been running smoothly and keeping our guests nice and cool.  Thank you for all of your wonderful compliments on our exceptional customer service, clean accommodations and convenient location.   We hope you will keep these things, as well as all of our great amenities, in mind when in our area again.  Thank you for your review.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Don't stay here.  With all the choices of relatively reasonable hotels in the area, don't pick Portofino.  I thought we'd give it a try based on reviews on this website, but I wished I'd looked at the reviews on YELP. Check in was courteous and efficient. Room looked clean, but smelled from the cleaning chemicals. My biggest complaint was that our room's air conditioner never sent out "cold" air.  Air was cool, but never cold.  We set it at 64, headed out for a late dinner,  When we got back in the room it hadn't cooled off, was quite humid, and our room never got below 74. We didn't discover the issue with the air until it was too late.  We figured it would cool down, but after dinner we came back and went to bed, expecting to get up early for Disneyland.  We all had a terrible
Manager Response: Dear Laura M,  We are extremely disappointed to hear that your experience was less than impressive.  Please know that the thermostat in your room could have been set to read when you and your family were present in your room. Consequently, turning off when you left and back on again upon your arrival into your room.    Also, be assured that our beds are definitely queen size beds that measure the standard dimensions of 60 inches wide by 80 inches long.  We apologize that they did not fit your preference.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience that occurred during your stay.  We appreciate you completing the review and bringing these details to our attention.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Very friendly but got a curve ball
Summary: Recently stayed here and the service was very friendly but a bit slow.  The curve ball we received was after check out when we noticed a charge for a resort fee.  No where in the website does it state this charge.  This by no means is a resort.  The rooms were nice and the hotel is clean.
Manager Response: Dear Carla M,  Thank you for your recent stay at our Anaheim hotel.  We are very happy that you enjoyed our location and friendly service.  Also, thank you for your patience for any delay you experienced.  During our very busy summer months we do our very best to assist each and every guest in a timely manner.  Please know that when booking your reservation through a certain third party website, the terminology limitations based on their software program lists our resort fee as service fee.  Our minimal resort fee covers all of the wonderful amenities we offer, including high speed internet, parking, games, and the like.  Thank you for completing the review and giving us your valuable feedback on your experience with us.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, spacious kids suite
Summary: This hotel is very close to Disneyland, so walking is an option. For those that do not want to walk, parking in Disneyland is $15/day. It is in a good location for local restaurants as well.  We had the Kids Suite room and it was a nice large size for our family of 4. The rooms could use a little more updating, but overall they were very clean.  The beds were comfortable. We had a mini-fridge in our room. The staff was friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Holly DMN,  Being able to walk to any of the local attractions while staying with us is definitely a great option to have!  Thank you for mentioning that you enjoyed our location, spacious accommodations and comfy beds.  All of our Kids Suites and King Suites have mini refrigerators, which is convenient to store drinks and snacks for the family.  Also, we appreciate your compliment on our friendly staff.  Thank you very much for completing the review and recommending our Anaheim hotel to other travelers.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: My husband, son and I recently stayed there for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience. The hotel staff was extremely pleasant and eager to help make our stay perfect, the rooms were quiet and clean, except for the occasional noise from the little ones in the morning, heading to Disneyland, but that is to be expected, and being able to walk to Disneyland was wonderful. We never used the hotel pool but because my husband read reviews prior to our arrival, we knew about being able to use the Jolly Roger pool and loved it. The pool temperature was nice and warm (I hate walking into a cold pool!) and it was never crowded. The only problem we had was that our television kept shutting itself off randomly. We never brought it to the staff's attention until we checked out because we
Manager Response: Dear Deedah98,  Thank you for the outstanding review on our Anaheim hotel!  We are thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed all that we have to offer, including our affordable rates.  We appreciate you for bringing the television to our attention upon check out, and, again, we are sorry for the inconvenience.  Our guests are always excited about being able to walk to Disneyland, as well as all of the other attractions. Also, thank you for mentioning that our entire staff was extremely helpful and eager to help make your stay perfect!  We simply love what we do and are committed to delivering an enjoyable experience to each of our guests.  It will be our pleasure to welcome you and your family back to our comfortable, clean and affordable Anaheim hotel.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The  Portofino was a little outdated. We had the family suite and had to call for more pillows because there weren't any for the fold out bed.  Also, the A/c made the most horrendous noise and didn't keep the room very cold.   The staff were very friendly and professional.  One morning we had the front desk call for a cab and it took over an hour to get there. One really great thing is there is no charge for parking.
Manager Response: Dear SandyCO64,  We're sorry that you had to call to request additional pillows and that the air conditioning in your room was not working properly. Please keep in mind for your next visit that we are available 24/7, and our maintenance staff appreciates the opportunity to make things right and resolve any issues that may arise.  We also apologize that the local cab company was delayed in getting here. Thank you for staying with us and mentioning that you enjoyed friendly and professional customer service.  We appreciate your review and hope you will visit again soon.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: If you want to be able to walk to Disneyland or the convention center then stay here. If your budget doesn't allow for hotel fees and parking stay here. If you want to walk to a nearby restaurant  okay this is nice. Rooms and bath show some wear. No microwave or refrigerator so families need to plan on eating out, a lot . If your looking for a hotel with all the little extras look elsewhere. The Portofino is all about location.
Manager Response: Dear Tony R,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us!  We appreciate you completing the review on our Anaheim hotel and mentioning that our location beats the other properties!  Along with our prime location, our affordable rates without all of the extra fees keep our guests returning time and time again to enjoy a comfortable and memorable experience.  Please keep in mind for your next stay that our Kids Suites and King Suites both have a microwave and a refrigerator.  You and your family can have the convenience of storing food and heating it up!  Again, thank you for your review.  We hope you and your family will choose to stay with us again on your next trip out to California.  Warm Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, decent rooms for the price!
Summary: Just finished a 6 night stay at this hotel.  No complaints, room was clean and everything worked.  Rooms are a little worn but acceptable.  Hotel is two blocks from Disneyland entrance.  A mini fridge in the room would be nice.
Manager Response: Dear tc8288,  Thank you for your great review and feedback on our Anaheim hotel.  We appreciate you choosing to stay with us for your 6 night stay in  Anaheim.  Our convenient location is very hard to beat!  Being so close to the Disney parks is very exciting; however, it's also great having the Convention Center and all of the restaurants and shops just minutes away too! Also, please know that we do have mini refrigerators available for a minimal daily fee.  Again, thank you for staying with us.  It will be a pleasure to have you and your family as our guests again soon!  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here last January while visiting the parks. Room was a Kids suite, clean and comfortable. Staff was accommodating and friendly. Price was great. Stayed for total of 9 days in two chunks, different rooms each time, both were just fine.
Manager Response: Dear theawe5,  We thank you for your effort in reviewing your 9 day experience with us.  Thank you for mentioning  how clean and comfortable our Kids Suite is and that you took advantage of our great rates!  We're very happy that you enjoyed both rooms you had, as well as accommodating and friendly customer service.  Your high ratings and review are very much appreciated by our entire staff.  We hope you and your family will be back to visit us again in the near future.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: My Family trip began 7/12/12. The kids suite was nothing like the photos on the internet. Bathroom reaked of urine, badly. The blow dryer had hair stuck in it. The remote control to tv had crumbs & gunk stuck on it. Bedding was not comfy it had this sticky, gross microfiber comforter that i immediately tossed aside. Sheets felt like sandpaper. I understand its all dated but for the price I paid to make sure my son had a clean, fun room was rediculous. The only chair in the room was DIRTY & stained. If your not looking for a clean fresh room it's okay. But to drive 6hours for this was not worth it! Your better off at a Best Western.
