Manager Response: Dear Sabrina E,  We are very sorry to hear of your disappointing stay with us.  Please accept our apology for failing to deliver an enjoyable experience.  Be assured that the pictures on our website and throughout any 3rd party sites are, indeed, pictures of our property and various room types.  Also, please know that we always appreciate the opportunity to promptly assist in any way we can during your stay. We would have taken immediate action and had a member of our housekeeping team at your door to take care of these unacceptable details in your room. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention so that we may further investigate.  Thank you for your review.  Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: This hotel needs a major renovation job on every room, hallways, elevators, carpets and pool.  The pictures on the web make it seem like a real suite, which to be honest, it is not.  The room was smelly, dark, furniture in bad shape, bathrooms from the 70’s, out-of-date TV’s, my view was the restaurant/bar on the other side of the hotel, and overall, not to the standards of my family and myself.  To owner of this hotel:  please do something about your property if you do not want more negative reviews of your hotel on the web.  On the positive side, the employees were very friendly and accommodating that the manager agreed to refund us our money with no hassles.  Within 30 minutes of cheking we were on our way out to the Embassy Suites.  Thanks, but not again.
Manager Response: Dear A300Pilot,  We apologize for failing to impress you and that our hotel was not to your family's standards.  Thank you for your opinions and suggestions, as they are extremely important to us in making the necessary changes and improvements.  We also appreciate your compliments on our friendly and accommodating customer service. Again, we are sorry that we failed to exceed your expectations.  Thank you of your review.   Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General  Manager

Summary: Staff is great, but they need more people.  When you walk in and there is a line of 3 or more, and only one person working the desk.   Like all the other reviews, the rooms show their age.  Needs upgrading.  Bathroom shower stall has mildew from years, TVs are old with no instructions on how to use, remotes were so old, the buttons are worn and you can't tell what button is what.  Pool, turn the heaters off.  We went swimming at both pools, and it was like taking a bath, only cool parts of the pool, was in the shade.  Great location, minutes, around 10-15, walk to Disney.  We stayed in a kids suite, must for anyone with kids.  Make sure you ask for the suites in the main building.  The ones in the other building, smaller, but do have two sinks.  This is a fine hotel, especially
Manager Response: Dear Myron B,  Your comments and suggestions are very important to us.  We apologize for any delay you experienced at our front desk, the worn remote in your room and that the temperature of our pools was not to your liking.  Please know that we have followed up and looked into these details in order to make the necessary changes and improvements.  Also, keep in mind for your next stay, that it is our pleasure to assist you in any way we can during your stay to ensure that you are enjoying your stay.  Thank you for your review.  We hope you an your family will return to visit us again.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good for business travel to Convention Center, free parking.
Summary: Stayed here for  conference at the Convention Center - I got a better deal from a random web-based travel agency then I could have directly from the hotel itself.  It was a 10 minute walk to the Convention Center via cutting through parking lots -when you are lugging convention stuff in a wheeled box, it was not fabulous, but hey, if you are not expensing the trip then you gotta make do. Anyways the room was fine, and they let me park the whole day after check out without charging.
Manager Response: Dear airportschlep,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent business trip and for taking the time to mention our very close proximity to the Convention Center.  We also appreciate you commenting on our complimentary parking.  We understand that it's not everyday you come across a hotel that offers free parking! We're glad you enjoyed your stay.  Thank you for your review.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Not quite up to expected for the price.
Summary: We booked 2 kid suites for 5 nights at the Portofino.  The 2 rooms were located closed to each other, and the hotel was easy to get in and out of.  The rooms were clean, and the shower and bathroom were well kept.  The dresser on the other hand hand broken drawers, and twice we almost pulled the drawer out on ourselves.  Upon check in, we had to get our bags up to our room and the only parking spaces available were in the back of the parking lot.  This was mainly a problem because the asphalt has many holes and broken areas, so rolling the bell cart and or luggage was challenging.  In addition, housekeeping often came so late in the afternoon we were power napping, and so we missed out on several days of room cleaning and fresh towels, and toilet paper.  Also, in the hallway 4
Manager Response: Dear Lovetotravel_000_10,  We apologize for the challenges you recently experienced.  Thank you for bringing these details to our attention, as we follow up on all of our guests' feedback.  We appreciate you mentioning that our accommodations are clean and that your shower and bathroom were also spotless;however, your comfort and enjoyment is one of our top priorities.  Please know that we are available 24/7 and, at your request, can provide you with extra towels, etc.  Also, when you are power napping, we can always schedule a later time to get your room cleaned and replenish your towels, just give our front desk a call and we a will arrange that for you.  Again, thank you for your review.  Our hope is that you will decide to give us another opportunity to deliver an enjoyable and comfortable stay.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Stayed three nights and was very disappointed.  Hallways had torn and wrinkled carpets. Rooms had tube tvs and dated bedspreads. Furniture had lots of wear. Edges and corners of carpet into bathroom had years of built up dirt  Place needs a good mini interior facelift. The exterior looks great. Lobby looks wonderful with natural stone but is not representative of rooms. Worst is no free breakfast. It is a pain to go find breakfast before starting out to Didney. It takes a full five minutes JUST to cross the street to an overpriced ihop. The pool is an okay setting but is tiny and lacks any privacy plantings to the parking lot. The rooms do not create a feeling of wanting to hang out in them dark. 15 minute walk to Disney gates. AC was old and noisy. Nice shampoo and bath gel.
Manager Response: Dear Tadtv,  We appreciate your valuable feedback and your time in giving it to us.  Please accept our apologies for disappointing you and failing to deliver a memorable experience.  Thank you for bringing these details of your stay to our attention and for your suggestions.  We are pleased that you did enjoy our comfortable beds and convenient location.  Again, we are sorry that we failed to impress you.  It would be a pleasure to have another opportunity to exceed the expectations you may have on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good If You Plan on Walking to Disneyland
Summary: This is an average hotel. It's clean but dated. The staff was friendly. The pool is small. The hotle is close enough to walk to Disneyland, although riding the shuttle is an option.
Manager Response: Dear DeeAnn L,  Thank you for staying with us.  We're glad you found our location convenient and enjoyed friendly customer service.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that all of our guests are also welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel during their stay with us.  We appreciate you taking the time to share the details of your stay with other travelers and hope you will be back to visit again.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The hotel is in a pretty good location if you're going to Disneyland and there is a bus that stops right by it. The rooms are nice in that you can sleep so many people in them. The room with the bunk beds and pull-out is pretty tight, but the room with just the king bed is spacious. The price is good, but the hotel seriously needs to be updated. The room was very clean, but the outdated features make it look old and run-down. I probably would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear stephanie_2448,  Thank you for your informative review. We appreciate you sharing the details on our clean and spacious accommodations.  Your comments and suggestions are taken seriously.  In our staff meetings, we take all of our guests' feedback into careful consideration, as we are constantly striving to make the necessary changes and improvements throughout our property.  We do hope that you will decide to stay with us again.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: This is our 2nd stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites. We love this place because of the location and value.  The rooms have great amenities. Only problems we had where a fridge that didn't get cold. We just used our ice chest and filled it with ice from there machines. Not to much to worry about. They are about 4 blocks away from the main entrance for Disneyland. The staff is nice but at around 9 pm there isn't anyone to help at the front desk. I was doing some laundry and the machine ate my quarters had to go to the front desk for help. The staff was behind doors and took a couple of minutes to help me. They where helpful, and nice, but someone should be there ready to help. Parking is a little tight, but I found that most places in CA have tight parking. There is restaurants and
Manager Response: Dear SithRico1,  Thank you for coming back to stay with us again!  It's great to hear that you had another enjoyable experience with us.  We appreciate all of your kind remarks on our accommodations, amenities and location, as well as your suggestions.  Your feedback is extremely important to us.  Again, thank you for your review and continued patronage.  We will await your return to welcome you back!  Best Regards,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Stayed here whilst touring the west coast of America and Mexico. Was great based for it's proximity to Disneyland park, Anaheim. Within walking distance 10mins (with small children). Rooms very comfy and clean. we opted for a fridge in the room. Ice machine up the corridor. Our room had a large balcony, two huge beds or small child had one all to themself! the hotel has a small pool which is very nice. It is also open until late, which is welcome after a long day at the Disney parks. Staff were very friendly and helpful. the hotel was quiet even though it was busy. All in all a nice stay and a good base for the park and visiting LA.
Manager Response: Dear H37,  Thank you for choosing to make us your home base while visiting Anaheim and LA during your tour of the West Coast of the U.S.  We are extremely flattered by all of the wonderful compliments from such an avid traveler as yourself.  It is a great pleasure for our entire staff to hear that you enjoyed a comfortable experience and received great customer service.  Thank you for mentioning our clean and spacious accommodations and close proximity to Disneyland.  We hope you will include us in your plans for your next visit!  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: The room  was filthy and smelly. I checked out 2 hours after checking into the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear ilove2travel951,  We are very sorry we failed to impress you.  Please accept our apologies.  Thank you for your review and bringing your experience to our attention.  Your opinions and suggestions are extremely important to us, as they assist us in our focus to consistently deliver an enjoyable and comfortable stay to each of our guests.  Again, thank you for completing the review.  Best,  Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Friendly staff and Close to Disneyland
Summary: First off, while there may be closer hotels to Disneyland's main gate, this one is within a very reasonable walking distance.   I want to first commend the hospitality of the staff at Portofino. They were hands down excellent. They treated us with amazing customer service (which is unheard of these days) and gave us lots of detailed information of where to eat, what to visit and included free or discounted coupons to those places. They made our stay very enjoyable.   As for the hotel, it is a bit worn around the edges. You can tell it was at one time a polished gem, but now needs some necessary repairs to get it back to that status. The landscaping was wonderful, sidewalks were clean and clear. The room was very comfortable (2 room kid suite). The one thing we would complain
Manager Response: Dear DocB911,  Thank you! We appreciate all of your wonderful compliments on our Anaheim hotel.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed a comfortable stay at affordable rates.  Also, it is extremely rewarding for our entire staff to receive your outstanding comments on our superior customer service.  You're right: it is, indeed, our pleasure to go out of our way to assist you in any way we can during your stay.  Thank you for recommending our property to other travelers.  We are happy that you will return to visit us again soon.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: You get what you get for the price. I would highly reccommend TO NEVER STAY NEAR THE ELEVATOR. It was constant loud noise that was horrendous...it was so loud and it seemed like the noise would come back every 15 minutes( imagine sleeping right accross from an old loud washing machine)..I gotta say that was the most horrible part of my stay. In order to sleep I had to use ear plugs. The pool is nice..its small so beware if you go when its hot weather. We stayed during spring break season and it wasn't too crowed but weather was high 70"s. If you want a reasonable hotel at a decent price this is your place. It no where near 5 stars but it will do for a short stay. Don't expect anything grand. If walking distance to Disneyland and price is a factor then this is the place for you.
Manager Response: Dear Claudette A,  We are sincerely sorry for the noise inconvenience that you experienced during your stay, as well as our charge error.  We understand your frustration and appreciate your patience while we corrected our error.  Please know that we do appreciate any opportunity to ensure that you are enjoying your stay with us.  It would have been our pleasure to move you and your family into another room.  Also, keep in mind for your next stay that our guests are welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger. Your feedback is very important to us and we appreciate you bringing the details of your stay to our attention.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: great place to stay near disneyland
Summary: I really enjoy my stay  at the portofino hotel located near the disneyland park. staff very friendly.  easy check in.  several parking spaces  avaible to people checking in. I especially like that each room came with a balcony /sitting area I  enjoyed sitting outside. parking areas were well lite up. no need to drive anywhere   close to  restaurants /bars/shopping  plus transit to and from disneyland. rooms were very clean .pool  was very nice  i enjoyed  evening swimming. I

We are very excited to receive your review and hear about all of the wonderful things you enjoyed about our Anaheim hotel. Thank you for taking the time to give us your valuable feedback by rating and reviewing our hotel.  We certainly appreciate you sharing how much you enjoyed your stay. Summary: Great hotel very near Disneyland.  Short walk to Disney entrance (just a couple blocks.)  Super polite and friendly staff.  Free parking (they even let us park there prior to check-in and after check-out!)  The rooms were spacious and the beds were super comfortable.  Even the shampoo and conditioner were fabulous.
Manager Response: Dear tamarmcc,  Thank you for taking the time to share how you and your family had a great experience with us.  We are very pleased to receive your high ratings and compliments on our polite and friendly customer service, comfortable beds and unbeatable location.  Thank you for mentioning how fabulous even our shampoo and conditioner are!  We don't miss a beat and are committed to delivering an outstanding stay from start to finish!  It will be a pleasure to have you and your family back to a visit again soon.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Disappointing Part Of Family Disney Trip! 4/26/12
Summary: Few quick details about the this hotel to consider before booking for the convenience of the location..... POSITIVE ASPECTS OF THE HOTEL: - Extremely polite and friendly staff. - Across the street from Disney park. Within walking distance but the transit is well worth the cost when the family and little ones are tired from walking all day in the parks. - Conveniently located across from IHOP and several other restaraunts - Fireworks (on weekends) can be viewed from hotel rooms facing Disney park.  Very nice for little ones.   NEGATIVE ASPECTS OF THE HOTEL: - Very limited parking: uncovered parking minimal and garage parking little to non. Approximately 15 spaces at most and they are always taken. - Urine smell in hallways and bedrooms (on more than one level). This is one of the
Manager Response: Dear Fam_Vacation_Disney,  We apologize for disappointing you and your family.  Thank you for expressing your concerns of your recent visit.  We're sorry for any odor in the room, not having enough hand soap available, the unacceptable condition of your towels and the other inconveniences you experienced.  After receiving your review, immediate action was taken to  identify the cause of these occurrences.  Be assured, this will not be overlooked.  Please know the entrance parking between our towers continues through to the end of the first tower where you will find an entire lot of guest parking.  Again, we are very sorry for failing to deliver an amazing stay for you and your family. Thank you for your feedback.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manger

Summary Heading: Not As Nice As The Photos Suggest
Summary: We were excited to stay at this hotel during our recent trip to Disneyland.  The Kids Suites looked great and the location was close to Disney.  The photos made the hotel look relatively modern and nice.  It was rated with three stars and had very favorable reviews.  We were disappointed by the aging rooms. The attraction to the Kids Suites is the bunk beds and foldout couch in a separate room from the king sized bed. But the doors that separated the areas had flimsy curtains (no privacy) and blocked the air conditioner when closed. The carpet, bedding, walls, bathroom, etc., was all rather aged. The televisions were older.  I guess I just expected better based on the other reviews and the photos.   Also, it's not as close to the entrance to Disney as you might think.  Do
Manager Response: Dear nana1999,  We are sorry that your stay did not meet your expectations and hope that you will accept our sincere apology.  We regret failing to impress you and appreciate you bringing these details to our attention.  Listening to our guests' feedback and taking action in any way possible to make necessary improvements is very important to all of us here.  Our hope is that all that you enjoyed while staying with us: quiet rooms, affordable rates, location and amenities, will bring you back to stay with us again.  We would appreciate the opportunity to exceed the expectations you might have on your return visit.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: For the price we paid this hotel should have been listed cheaper.  Shower drain was broken and even though we notified management the only time they came was while our little ones were sleeping.  I requested that they return in an hour and they never came back.  The kid's room on line was completely different from the way it was set up.  I am so totally disappointed in this hotel
Manager Response: Dear YankeeBB,  We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced, as well as failing to visit your room again after your kids were done napping.  Please know that this error has been addressed with our staff.   Also, the general set up of our Kids Suites is standard; however, there are a few rooms where the furniture and/or decor are located in different spots than shown in our pictures due to the location in building or shape of the room.  Again, we are very sorry that we failed to impress you on your recent stay.  We appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback by completing the review on our property.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Family was pleased with the stay
Summary: The hotel was beautiful, lobby and hallways were really nice but the rooms were a little dissappointing as they were somewhat dated and just never felt like it was that clean.  The kids loved having their own bunkbeds and tv which was nice.  The staff was pleasant and accommodating.  We enjoyed the pool and hottub.  It was nice having the ABC to pick up food and drinks at a reasonable price.  It was nice to have a small laundrymat in the hotel (I packed purex three-in-one washer/dryer sheets that were compact and no worrying about liquid).  We found it to be a fairly short walk to Disneyland.  Price was very good and we would consider staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear LaurieAnn70,  Thank you for sharing that your family enjoyed their recent stay with us.  The bunk beds in our Kids Suites are always a big hit with our younger guests, as is our pool and hot tub area.  We appreciate you mentioning your washer/dryer sheet tip with other travelers so that they may also take advantage of our convenient laundry mat.  It was our pleasure to provide you with friendly and accommodating service.  We hope to greet you again soon and exceed what you might expect on your next visit with us.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Very nice room. Very very comfortable beds. Short walk to Disneyland. My only complaint would be parking. Very rough lot and small spots.
Manager Response: Dear TodLis5,  We are very happy that you had such a great stay with us. Thank you for the wonderful feedback.  Our comfortable accommodations along with our prime location is second to none!   We appreciate your ratings on our Anaheim hotel, as well as your comments on our parking area.  We hope to welcome you back to enjoy another great experience with us soon.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent And a 10 Minute Walk to Disneyland Entrance
Summary: First let me summarize that this is a great place to stay while visiting Disneyland.  Having said that, I am at a complete loss to explain the negative reviews posted for this property.  Our group of three children and three adults stayed in a Kids Suite and double queen room for three nights starting March 19, 2012.  Both accommodations were, crisp, fresh, clean, in good working order and as quiet as a place that caters to families with young children can be.  The Kids Suite is just fine for one or two adults and up to three young to medium aged children.  It would be pretty cramped for teenagers.  It was clean and well laid out.  There were plenty of towels and face cloths.  Our double queen room was also very clean and fresh with plenty of linens and towels.  We were very
Manager Response: Dear maranasam,  Thank you very much for your outstanding review and ratings on our Anaheim hotel.  We are thrilled to hear of your comfort and enjoyment in our Kids Suite and deluxe room.  We appreciate all of your wonderful compliments on our accommodations, amenities, location and all that we have to offer.  Thank you for taking the time to share some of the wonderful things about our hotel that make us stand out above the rest.  We look forward to welcoming you and your family back to California!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We spent 5 nights at the Portofino Inn earlier this month.  We are a family of 5, so the Kid's Suite was perfect for us.  Plenty of towels in the bathroom, which was great, but one bar of soap between a tub and two sinks? That didn't make sense to me.  The bathroom had no fan, so it would get very humid during a shower, which probably also contributed to the paint peeling on the the ceilings and wall.   The A/C was very noisy, so we ran it during the day. But by morning, the room was stuffy.  We did open the window, but that just cooled off the kid's area.  Our first night there, an alarm clock went off at midnight somewhere in a room near us.  We could hear every single word of the songs through our walls. We called the Front Desk twice, it took them 45 minutes to figure out
Manager Response: Dear rtch03,  We take your feedback very seriously and appreciate you bringing the details of your stay to our attention.  Please accept our apologies for the inconveniences you mentioned in your review.  Thank you for choosing to spend your 5 night Anaheim visit with us.  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We just spent three nights at the Portofino in a Kid's Suite.  Arrived too early to check-in but staff was very courteous and helpful with luggage storage.  I asked if our room had been assigned yet and which area of the hotel it would be located in.  Found out all Kid's Suites are in the "Venice" Tower.  I inquired if the rooms had been renovated and was told no.  At that point I was a bit leery as to what the room would look like.  Wasn't much we could do other than spend the day at Disneyland and receive our room keys when we returned.    We finally made it inside the room about 9pm.  I don't think I'm exaggerating to say it's the blandest room I've ever seen.  The floor coverings, curtains, and bedding are old and dated.  Color scheme as blah on blah.  The room temperature
Manager Response: Dear NWbySW,  Please accept our apologies for failing to deliver an enjoyable experience.  We appreciate your all of your comments and suggestions.  Please know, that we do look forward to exciting changes in the near future, and hope you will decide to give us another opportunity to accommodate you.  Thank you for your review.  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: I was afraid because of some of the reviews I had read but we loved it. Close walk to Disneyland and awesome kids sweet. Sleeper sofa was even comfortable! I would stay again for sure!
Manager Response: Dear Mathews4,  We are extremely excited that you and your family loved your experience with us!  It's great to hear that our Kids Suite is awesome and that you were so comfortable on the sofa sleeper.  Thank you for the outstanding review and ratings on our Anaheim property.  We can't wait to see you again!  Best, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: We were here for 4 nights and our room was in the older section, where the front desk is. We were situated on the 3rd floor in room 1304 and our daughter was in 1302 with her family. We found the Portofino much in need of a face lift. The interior hallway carpets were very rough and showing signs of needing replacement being worn away in front of room doors. The rooms showed signs of needing painting and cleaning. Our bedspreads were stained.  Our major complaint is that the air conditioning never worked! We checked in in Monday, 3-12-2012, and found the A/C was blowing warm air. Our daughter, in a Kid Suite next to us, had the same complaint. The next morning I informed the front desk of the A/C problem and watched the clerk write down the info and say it would be look into. As
Manager Response: Dear retiredTPD,  We apologize for the air conditioning inconvenience you experienced.  The delay in resolving your issue is completely unacceptable.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and all of your comments and suggestions.  Thank you for staying with us and completing the review.  Sincerely, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place for a trip to Disney
Summary: We stayed here recently and have recommended it to family and friends as an adequate, decently priced suite for families such as ours, too large for a traditional hotel room. It was great having a kid Suite with room for the little ones to hang out. The walk to Disney was quick, and we enjoyed the convenience of the little shop just downstairs. They had inexpensive ice cold water for $1 that was a lifesaver when visiting the park and trying to economize. We have also stayed at the Disney resorts, and of course they are nicer, but they are also much more expensive. This works out to be a clean, friendly place to lay your head when visiting Disneyland that doesn't break the bank.  Really check their website for different rates, because they had quite a variety that it took us a
Manager Response: Dear thehiggi,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for recommending our Anaheim hotel to family, friends and other travelers.  We're so glad to hear that you not only enjoyed staying in one of our Kids Suites, but that you found our gift shop and property location convenient for your family's visit.  Thanks for your great review!  Best Regards, Mitch Healy, General Manager

Summary: Wow. Where to begin. This situation was so NOT cool.  Don't let the photos fool you, this place has rooms that are very run down.        We were hoping to get a good deal with close access to Disneyland.  We did get a lower price than you might expect from a mid-grade hotel, but this is no mid-grade hotel. I don't see how this property could even get a two-star rating.  Rooms are run-down, wallpaper peeling, not clean, not in good repair, old bedding, icky-dirty feeling to the tops of everything and NOISY.  Our room was on the main floor next to the laundry room/arcade and we couldn't sleep all night without the sound of rocket-like gearing up every few minutes. The front desk said it is the laundry room going on "stand by" during the light.  LOUD! The front desk staff is very
Manager Response: Dear BeautifulWorld08,  Thank you for your feedback and bringing the details of your stay to our attention.  Please accept our apologies for any inconveniences that occurred during your visit.  It is very disappointing to learn that we failed to exceed your expectations.  Again, thank you for completing the review.  We hope you will decide to reconsider giving us another opportunity to deliver an enjoyable stay with us.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights with our 2 small children (3 and 20 months) in the kid suite.  The room was perfect for families - the kids room (separated by French doors with sheets) was very large and had its own tv and a fridge and microwave. We were able to put the kids to bed at night and still watch our own tv or do whatever.    Every day the housekeeping staff replenished the toiletries and left the room in pristine condition.  The hotel is a short walk from Disneyland - about 5-10 minutes from the gates to the park.   For the price this is an extremely great value! And the front desk staff were beyond kind and helpful from the time we booked the room to checkout. Parking is free and there are 2 convenience stores next door.  We will DEFINITELY be returning to
Manager Response: Dear LeeFam2005,  We are very pleased our Kids Suite was perfect for you and your family!  All of your wonderful compliments on our excellent customer service, housekeeping, affordable rates and great value.  We are excited to hear that you will definitely be returning to our hotel for your future Disneyland trips!  We can't wait to have you back!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: 10 min walk from Disney entrance. Family room convenient for family of 4. Rooms need renovation, everything is old. Just suitable for a sleep. Internet connection very slow. Interrupts freq.  Value good for 4. Get what u pay for..
Manager Response: Dear HatOrth,  We appreciate your feedback. We're glad you enjoyed our family suite, convenient location and good value.  Your suggestions are very important to us and will always be taken very seriously.   Thank you for staying with us.  We hope you and your family will visit again soon.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary: We looked every where for your families first vacation. We are a family of 6. We chose this hotel and everyone was very happy! When I checked us in I requested a crib be brought to the room for our youngest 5 months at the time. We went to the room and before I could put my bags down there was a knock at the door, it was an employee with the crib. We had a great time and just booked again for our family vacation this year. The kids are so excited to go back. A lot of places say that they are family friendly but when you arrive that is really not the case. Portofino says they are family friendly and they really deliver. Thank you so much for being there for families like ours.
Manager Response: Dear BusyM0mAZ,  It is our pleasure to provide family friendly accommodations and the exceptional customer service that you deserve!  Thank you for all of your wonderful compliments on our Anaheim hotel.  We are ecstatic to hear that you and your family have chosen to book your family vacation with us again this year!  We appreciate your patronage and look forward to welcoming you back!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: the room was clean, sizeable but tired and worn out.  we were there to see disneyland with the kids anyway, so werent expecting to see much of the room. the location is perfect - ony 10mins walk from the park with a decent ihop across the street.  good free wifi service. nice comfortable beds and chirpy staff. decent value if youre looking for a no frills option.
Manager Response: Dear alamo36,  Our entire staff is very pleased to hear that you enjoyed our cheerful customer service!  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback by completing the review.  We are also happy that you were nice and comfortable in our accommodations and that our convenient location was perfect for you and your family.  We hope you will be back to see us again on your next visit to the U.S.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel from Jan 13-15 for a quick weekend trip to Disneyland.  We booked a kids suite in order to have more room for the 5 of us traveling.  The separate kids area with the bunk beds was nice, but the room was "tired" at best.  One leg of the kids table and chairs was broken off and was inserted to just balance the table. The bedspreads were old looking and dingy (kids area and king bed area).  While the room wasn't outwardly filthy, I just expected more from this hotel.  It is in need of some new items and a little TLC.  The walk to Disneyland is fine 10-15 min, but we opted to take the local Anaheim transit bus twice.  There is a bus stop in the front of the hotel.  It is Route #3 for the bus pickup at Disneyland.  The hotel doesn't have a restaurant on site,
Manager Response: Dear javillane,  We appreciate you bringing the details of your stay to our attention, and apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  Your comments and suggestions have not gone overlooked.  We take our guests feedback seriously, as it assists us in our commitment to deliver the very best stay for each of our guests.  We do hope you will decide to give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Thank you for your review.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I spend what seemed like hours trying to decide the best hotel for my families recent trip to Disneyland and yet have it be with my budget.  With three kids you either get two rooms or find a suite.  I then looked and looked and finally booked the Portofino. Our stay was great, a short walk to Disneyland and Downtown Disney.  I ended up booking a King suit.  Our room was clean no lingering odors and had plenty of room for the whole family. I most definitely would book the Portofino again.
Manager Response: Dear MitMor7,  We are very pleased to hear that you are happy with your recent decision to stay with us, especially after spending hours of your time researching Anaheim accommodations.  Thank you for your great ratings and compliments on our property.  We're glad you will definitely stay with us again!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: With our family of 6, we chose the King-bunk bed room.  It was perfect for all of us.  It was a short walk to the Disneyland/CA resorts, about 15 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear lovelife2012,  We are ecstatic to hear that we are a perfect fit for you and your family of 6!  Thank you for your review and compliments on your experience in one of our Family Suites.  We appreciate you making us your choice in Anaheim accommodations, and hope to have all of you as our guests again soon.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: we stayed here with our family over christmas.It ws clean,close to Disneyland and very acceptable.I think the bad reviews are ridiculous,we were worried for nothing,nice pool,so close to walk to everything.helpful staff,great parking.you can rent a car right in hotel,and be picked up right there for any tours.edxcellent family on a budget hotel.
Manager Response: Dearkathtia37,  Thank you for the excellent ratings and review!  We love hearing when our guests enjoy everything about their experience with us.  Again, thank you for completing the review.  We look forward to your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Best Regards, Connie Gore, General Manager

Summary Heading: Better than average but not quite Very good!!
Summary: Would like to rate this hotel 3.5 out of 5.  We stayed for 5 nights in a kids suite.  Liked the fact the kids had their own room and TV.  There was enough space for our cases, but it wasn't overly spacious.  The bed was comfortable, although all the fitted sheets kept scrunching up as the elastic had gone on them.  The positives were lovely, friendly staff, great location to Disneyland and the Garden Walk area, 7/11 across the street, fridge and microwave in the rooms, and good parking.  Negatives were bad soundproofing of rooms (thought we had a herd of elephants stampeding upstairs), dodgy plumbing in the bathroom (needed maintenance twice) and laundry facilities consisted of one functioning washer and dryer, which is pretty inadequate for a hotel of this size - we had to find
Manager Response: Dear Kerry C,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent visit to the U.S.  We appreciate your candid review on our property. We are very pleased to hear that you enjoyed our exceptional customer service and convenient location, and hope you will decide to stay with us again on your next visit.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The sheets had hair (not mine!) all over it. The comforter looks like it hadn't been washed. And there were more hair in the bathroom. That's just unacceptable. As convenient the location is (very close to Disneyland), I won't be staying here again. I'd rather stay at a clean hotel a mile away and just walk. The only positive thing about this hotel was the service--the staff was very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Mark F,  We are very disappointed after reading your review.  Please accept our apologies.  We take your feedback extremely seriously.  Please know that we have taken immediate action into further investigating the details and will make the necessary changes in order to ensure that this does not happen again.  Thank  you for your review.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: If you want to sleep, DON"T stay here.
Summary: Rented the two room suite, perfect for the family.  It was on the corner of Harbor and Katella Blvd.  None of us sleep because of the traffic noise, we got to hear every bus, truck and motorcycle that passed on these two busy streets.  The A/C-Heat unit is in one of the bedrooms (basically at the foot of the bed), had to turn it off because of noise, far beyond normal unit noise in a hotel, room got cold.   They moved us to two rooms next to each other.  This was a winter time stay, so heat and A/C was necessary in the room. (Warm during the day cold at night). You can have your choice of either heat or A/C, but not both, and it must be set by their maintenance.  Sounds crazy but this is how it works.  Not knowing this, the room was very hot after returning and set it to cool.
Manager Response: Dear Jim K,  We are very sorry about the inconvenience you experienced with our A/C unit and appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Please know that we are here 24/7 and it is always our pleasure to assist you in any way we possibly can.  Our maintenance staff can be at your door within minutes of your phone call to remedy the situation and go over any necessary details on our units with you.  Again, please accept our apologies.  We hope that your family is well and thank you for your feedback.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel October 15th-19th 2011. At the time of our stay I noticed blood stains on our sheets. I asked my husband and we figured that it must have come from a scrape because we couldn't figure out what caused it. The next day we noticed more blood streaks. I thought it seemed like it was a different place but just chalked it up to not changing the sheets... A few weeks after coming home, my husband started noticing bites on his arms and legs. My Mom mentioned bed bugs so we looked and we have them! I did some research online and the blood stains we had at the Portofino matched exactly with the bed bug blood smear photos that were online!! We now have to have our home professionally treated thanks to the Portofino! We will never stay there again!! Also, please read
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have a family of 5 and were looking for somewhere close to Disneyland to stay. We took a chance and booked this hotel online. It was pretty good for the cheap rates. We had a nice size room with a bunk bed and a couch bed and a king bed for us. There were doors that closed off the kids part of the room from our part. It was nice and clean and had a big size bathroom. The pool and hot tub were really nice too. It was probably a 10 minute walk to and from the main Disney gates.
Manager Response: Dear rosalia206,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know of the details of your recent stay.  We are happy that you and your family were comfortable and enjoyed your Kids Suite.  Thank you for your comments on our clean and spacious accommodations, affordable rates and very convenient location.  We take pride in all the wonderful things we have to offer our guests, and it is always rewarding when our guests have so many great compliments on our hotel.  Again, thank you completing the review.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This was a nice place, parked for free and walked to Disneyland, that was good!  On the downside the bed was not comfortable and the rooms are not very soundproof, bring earplugs!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel because it was close to a business convention that I needed to attend. It was dirty and uncomfortable. Further, I did not realize until I got back home that I had a few bites on my body. I thought they were just allergies but it turns out that they were bed bugs. The bed bugs traveled on or in my suitcase and infested my home. My wife was severely allergic to the bites and had to see several doctors before they could diagnose the situation. Our lives were turned upside down as we had to pack everything in our home and have exterminators determine where these bugs were hiding. This business trip cost me well over $3,000! BEWARE of this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had read all the reviews-positive and negative first.  Some people are expecfting a 5 star luxury hotel and of course they are disappointed because it is not meant to be that and the price reflects it.  For a grandma and family with 3 kids, our 7 day stay there was perfect.  The kids loved the bunk beds and my sofa bed was VERY comfortable(most aren't),  Plenty of room with king for the Play and Pack.  We went  the week before Thanksgiving so quiet at hotel AND Disneyland.  Enjoyed their warm pool and helpful housekeepers. Nice sized(and quiet) fridge and just had breakfast and some dinners there.  If you go in a hectic time of year, expect it to be hectic and frustrating everywhere!  Take a week in the fall or school if you have kids under 12 as this is a field trip of
Manager Response: Dear seniortravelbug,  We are very happy to hear that your recent experience with us was perfect!  Thank you for making us your choice in Anaheim accommodations.  It's great to hear that the kids loved the bunk beds and you were very comfortable sleeping on the sofa bed.  We appreciate your excellent review and ratings.  It will be our pleasure to welcome you and your family back soon!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I was a litle worried about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews posted on this web site. I must say I was very suprised. We thought this was a pretty nice place to stay and the staff was very helpful. We arrived earlier than we thought because i had forgot that California is one hour earlier than Arizona. We got there at 4:30 and they had a room for us so we was able to check in and get a little nap before heading to the park which was helpful cause i had been driving most of the night. The room was nice and not totally gross like some of the reviews had said. We had a kids suite which was perfect for us and the 2 teenagers that was with us. My one complaint was we got the room right next to the elevator and you could hear it going up and down most of the night and
Manager Response: Dear derrick m,  We are very happy to hear that we exceeded your expectations!  Thank you for taking the time to write your review on our Anaheim hotel.  We certainly appreciate your compliments on our clean and comfortable accommodations and mentioning that our property is a nice place to stay with helpful customer service.  We hope you will choose to stay with us again on your next visit to California!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Hotel room was wonderful. Great location - our 3 kids aged 5, 3 and 2 were able to walk to DisneyLand with no trouble at all. It literally is just around the corner and a 10 min walk.  The Kids Suite was fantastic! Loved that my husband and I could put all the kids to bed in their own room and relax and watch TV in our room, and not interrupt the kids while they were sleeping or playing. The maintenance staff did an excellent job of cleaning and tidying our room while we were there - 2 adults and 4 kids under the age of 5 make quite a mess! The entire staff was very pleasant to deal with and genuinely wanted to make our visit a great one. Overall, very good value for the level of service received. Will most definitely stay there again in the future!
Manager Response: Dear 4kidsin4years,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the U.S.  We are very pleased that you and your entire family enjoyed your experience with us in one of our Kids Suites.  Thank you for complimenting us on our high level of customer service and great value at affordable rates.  It's great to hear that you will all return to enjoy anther excellent stay with us in the future!  Regards, Beckely Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: The best value-priced hotel in the Anaheim area
Summary: Details are the main differentiator in many walks of life. Small details are what really makes a difference; it doesn't matter how small or complicated to solve a problem is - the fact that somebody is willing to help, with no true direct interest of any kind, is greatly appreciated in these days in which everything seems to either be money-driven, or simply doesn't happen.   I'll tell you a bit of my ten-year relationship with the Portofino Inn. My family and me are originally from Mexico (we purchased 6-day tickets to Disneyland, so as you might guess we're big fans of the park), and we purchased a Disneyland package from the main Mexican airline back in 2001 from a glossy brochure that showed a Ramada with a very nice façade. When we got there, although the hotel lobby was as
Manager Response: Dear Fernando C,  We are very flattered to receive your excellent review on our Anaheim hotel!  Thank you so much for taking the time out to share all of the wonderful details of your recent and past experiences with us.  It is extremely rewarding for each member of our staff to receive such positive feedback on our exceptional level of customer service and clean and comfortable accommodations.  Again, thank you for your outstanding compliments and ratings on our property.  We certainly appreciate your continued patronage and look forward to welcoming you and your family back once again!   Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Location, Family Suites, Decent Price
Summary: We stayed here for about a week during our trip to LA.  The family suites were nice for a family of 5.  Hotel was good, not elaborate, but just what we needed.  There is a little store in the hotel for snacks souvenirs, a small pool for a quick dip after a long day, and a laundry.  Restaurants, and some shopping with walking distance, and a few other mini-mart stores about a block away.  Grocery store was a quick 5 minute drive as was Target and a bunch of other restaurants.  Disney is walkable, but for small children coming back after a long day at Disney - they might need to be carried or put in a stroller for some portion.  Other things we did in LA (Santa Monica Pier, Hollywood/Farmers Market, Universal Studios) all required about an hour drive from Anahiem.
Manager Response: Dear Dean1967,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your week long visit to the Anaheim area!  We are very excited to learn that we were just what you and your family needed.  We are pleased that you found your suite comfortable and that you enjoyed our hotel.  Please come see us again on your next visit to the U.S.!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location, good service - average rooms
Summary: We stayed here due to its close proximity to the Anaheim Convention Centre where I was attedning a conference, and it is in a great location, only 5 mins walk to the convention centre, 10 mins to Disneyland/Garden Walk and few minutes drive to a supermarket/Target and other shops. So for that it was great.   The downside for us was the room - it did not look anything like the pictures we'd seen, and it  was honestly old, dated and tired. It looked clean enough until we found pieces of paper from previous guests under the pillows. I think it was clean, but years of ingrained dirt in the bathroom/sinks just look bad.   The price was also good, and the bed was comfy, we had a kid suite which would be ideal if you had a family travelling as it gives some more space and a useful
Manager Response: Dear BurntK,   We appreciate your bringing this to our attention and apologize for not exceeding your expectations.  Your feedback has been taken seriously and the appropriate members of our team have been informed.  Thank you for your compliments on our great location, customer service, affordable rates and comfy beds.  We do hope that you and your family will decide to stay with us again.  Sincerely,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Disneyland area hotel with a few Problems
Summary: Stayed here and while the facilty itself is fairly average for the area, one problem was irritating in that it happened over and over, and made for a few inconvenient moments.  The keys that were programmed for our stay failed - four times in two days we had to have the keys replaced.  Normally, when there's an issue like this, it isn't a big deal, unless you have a cold child coming in from the heated pool, and you have to walk around the hotel to the front door to get a new key; or come in from an excursion with a little girl who needs a diaper change, and you have to haul everything to the other side of the hotel to get a new key; or you've just arrived and after checking in, you've driven around to the door closest to your room, loaded up with all your bags, and your key
Manager Response: Dear BobNeb,  We are sincerely sorry for the unfortunate inconveniences you experienced with your key cards.  Please know that by no means did we want you to feel as though it was your fault.  Our front desk staff is informed on what to avoid carrying our card keys next to and we always like to see if we can resolve any issue by reviewing the details with our guests.  Again, we apologize.  Thank you for your review on our hotel.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Shame on me for not checking the reviews BEFORE we went.  I looked at the web site photos, which must be very old.  We booked a kids suite. The room was run down, the furniture was pretty beat up.  We took one look around and decided we were not staying.  There was a hole in the bathroom counter top.  There was gum stuck in the upholstry of one of the chairs.  The bathroom wasn't clean. There was no screen on the window. The carpet was crunchy.  I didn't even want to sit on the bed, much less sleep on it.  The comfortor was dirty and the bed looked lumpy.  The elevator was dirty and had graffiti on the inside. The hallways smelled weird.   I thought it was a little odd that no breakfast was offered.   When considering the minimal price difference between here and the Disneyland
Manager Response: Dear Shelley W,  We are sorry to hear that you decided not to stay with us.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you experienced.  The condition of the room described in your review is most definitely the exception.  We have taken immediate action and will continue to investigate this further.  Thank you for being so kind as to compliment our customer service level.  We appreciate you bringing all of the above to our attention by completing the review on our property.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: OK Place if You Want an Economical Place Close to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I just returned from staying at the Portofino Inn and Suites in Anaheim for 3 nights while on a vacation to Disneyland on October 27 - 30, 2011, and we really enjoyed it. We took our three children ages 23, 21, and 17, so wanted a place to spread out a bit, but didn't want to pay for two rooms.  This set up was great and gave us all a little more space and privacy.    Pros:  Good location right on Harbor Blvd, though had we not had a car and free in and out parking passes to Disneyland parking lot, we would have had to buy trolly tickets, which would have added an additional expense. (It is close, but too far to walk when you're really tired at night.)  Free Internet service and easy access and use of it - fast connection. Free parking (though it gets full very
Manager Response: Dear BevSLC,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We appreciate you taking the time to let us know of your comfort while staying in one of our Kids Suites and that you and your family will definitely be staying with us again.  Also, thank you for your suggestions. We always take our guests comments and opinions extremely seriously, as we are constantly improving in any way we can to deliver the very best experience for each of our guests.  Again, thank you choosing to stay with us.  We are happy that we will have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Brief summary of what to expect
Summary: On a recent personal trip to California I stayed at the Portofino. This time I booked backwards I booked the airline ticket first and the hotel was automatically selected as part of an Expedia deal.  Since the hotel was already booked and paid for I set about the task of reading guest reviews just to get an idea of what I was in for. Before I describe my experience I want to say I would have booked this hotel anyway; I was extremely impressed straight off the back with the percentage of follow up responses from management to the reviewers. The simple fact that an establishment actually makes time to read guest reviews, evaluate them, and follow up adds a touch of quality and class that’s unmatched. Now to jump back to my experience, once I read many reviews I used the top five
Manager Response: none

Summary: Average hotel in a good locagion.  The kids suites are great.  It is nice to put t he kids to bed and still be able to have the lights on and watch tv.  The wifi was not consistant.  A good place to stay if you are price sensitive and want to be close to the park.
Manager Response: Dear rholtm,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to the U.S.!  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed a quality stay at our affordable rates.  It certainly is a great convenience to be able to put the kids to bed in one room, and have the T.V. and lights on in another room while staying in one of our Kids Suites.  Thank you for completing the review and sharing your experience with us.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Family Vacation to the Happiest Place on Earth
Summary: We stayed at the Portofino in a Kids Suite with our teens-this was great as they could have their own room and tv.  The location of this hotel is within in 15 minute walk to the Disney parks-no courtesy shuttle-this would be nice, but for 2 dollars one way person the shuttle will take you to the door of the hotel.  This hotel has 2 pools, again great for teenagers and families, and is walking distance to many restaurants and shopping.  There is no daily breakfast, but an IHOP is across the street and other quick type breakfast stops are a block away.  The hotel was clean, and the rooms were spacious.  The staff were helpful and assisted in booking cabs, transportation to other sites throughout LA.
Manager Response: Dear Heather 1967,  We appreciate your time in competing the review and giving us your feedback on your stay at our Anaheim hotel.  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay and appreciate all of your great compliments on our accommodations, location and helpful customer service.  We hope you will decide to come back and see us again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Portofino Inn on a spring break trip to Disney.  This hotel is about 1/3 the cost of a Disney hotel and was very comfortable and clean.  With two small children we like to stay in suites and this suite is very kids friendly.  The kids loved that their room had bunk beds, and we had a refirgerator and microwave which was so helpful to have snacks for the kids available.  This is about a 1/4 mile walk to the Disney entrance, but is also on the Anaheim attraction bus route.  This is one of the closest hotels to Disney without being a Disney property.  It was clean, comfortable and has a pool as well.
Manager Response: Dear stevenroz,  Thank you for your outstanding review on our Anaheim hotel!  We are excited to hear that you and your family had a clean, comfortable and enjoyable stay with us in one of our Kids Suites.  The bunk beds are always a kid favorite, and you can't beat the convenience of having a refrigerator and microwave in your own room.  Thank you for sharing how you enjoyed our location; we definitely are one of the closest hotels to all of the Disney excitement!  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Southern California.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: OK PLACE IN NEED OF SOME MAINTENANCE
Summary: The hotel is in need of some maintenance as it looks and feels run down. It is however clean and in a good location if you are going to Disneyland. Having stayed at other hotels around Disneyland on previous occassions the things I found most dissapointing about the Portofino Inn are no refridgerator or microwave  in the room. Also nearly all the other motels offer some form of breakfast Portofino does not and this combined with no fridge and microwave makes it hard when travelling with children as you can not keep anything for them to have when they first wake up. As for housekeeping, the rooms were kept tidy but they flat out would not replace items that had run such as coffee and tissues and they would only leave 4 towel when 4 people were staying there. I would have to go to
Manager Response: Dear tiredaustraveller,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for bringing to our attention the things that were disappointing about your experience.  We apologize for the inconveniences that occurred.  Please know that we take our guests' feedback extremely seriously, as it assists us in improving in any we can to deliver an enjoyable stay.  Thank you for completing the review on our property.  We hope that you will decide to stay at our Anaheim hotel again and give us the opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Portofino in October 2011.  We stayed in a Kid's suite and other members of our family had a regular room with two beds.  The room suited our needs well enough and our kids liked the bunk beds.  The room itself wasn't horrible, but you could tell things were starting to get worn.  Paint on the doors were peeling off.  You could tell there had been water damage to the baseboards in the bathroom at one point that they just painted over.  The beds in the main room was not comfortable. The hotel staff were polite.  The hotel is split into two buildings and the laundry is in the building where the lobby is.  Our building is not connected to the main lobby and the ramp was not in a convenient place.  We had to walk around the parking lot just to get the luggage cart
Manager Response: Dear Bryan C,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review.  We are very disappointed to hear that we failed to impress you and that we were not a good fit for your family and your needs.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us.  We appreciate you sharing the details of your stay, and hope you will reconsider giving us another opportunity to impress you on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The Portofino is my usual hotel for Disneyland vacations. It's walking distance to Disneyland, and the suites are large enough for a family. I go with my family and share the bunkbed suite with the queen bed. The rooms are update and clean and vibrant. I've always had a pleasant experience at this hotel
Manager Response: Dear Maggie B,  Thank you for your continued patronage!  We are thrilled to hear that you and your family enjoy your experience with us each time you are in the Anaheim area.  We appreciate all of your high ratings, as well as your title of Perfect Little Spot.  Thank you for completing the review.  We look forward to welcoming you back again soon.  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: It's hard to rate the Portofino because I'd give it a 5-star for excellent front desk service (housekeeping service was a 2.5), a 2 for laundry facilities and a 1-star for the noise and the funky smell that came out of our A/C. We stayed for 8 nights in the Kid's Suite. We stayed here because it was within walking distance to Disneyland.   Front desk (5.0) = EXCELLENT service. All hotels should take their cue from the Portofino Inn! I've stayed in numerous hotels (some even upscale) and so far nothing comes close to the service we've received at the Portofino Inn.   Rooms (3.0) = original room would have been rated a 1.5 due to the paper-thin walls and the very loud A/C. Our son was startled when it came on; it literally sounded like a car engine. I tried to turn off the A/C but
Manager Response: Dear OahuMom,  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to California!  We are flattered by your excellent comments and ratings on our high level of customer service.  It is always very rewarding for our entire staff to receive such outstanding feedback!  We would also like to apologize for the odor from the a/c in your room.  We are very sorry for the inconvenience and appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Thank you for taking the time to detail your experience and give us your feedback.  All of your comments are taken very seriously, as it assists us in our constant efforts to deliver an enjoyable and memorable stay for each and every one of our guests.  Again, thank you for your review.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This hotel is close to Disneyland and easy to find.  Staff was very friendly.  Pool and jacuzzi had a LOT of chlorine, but welcome relaxation after a day of running around Disneyland.  Close to a lot of restaurants and convenience stores.  Walls/ceiling/floor were "thin", so we could hear people walking above us and in the hallway.  Could also hear voices of people in the hallways.  Could also hear the water running while people in other rooms took showers.  Mostly clean, but after a few days, bathroom smelled mildewy, probably from lack of ventilation...  There is no microwave or fridge in deluxe suites--kid suites had them though (we had 16 family members in both deluxe suites and kid suites).  We ended up buying a styrofoam cooler and keeping ice on hand just to keep drinks
Manager Response: Dear localwifemommy,  Thank you and all of your family members for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel.   Thank you for your great compliments and suggestions.  We are pleased that you enjoyed our friendly customer service and unbeatable location.  We are also glad to hear that you found time to enjoy our pool and jacuzzi.  Thank you for bringing the chlorine level to our attention.  Please know that our pool levels are monitored frequently throughout the day, as many guests are in and out of our pool area on a daily basis.  We appreciate all of your valuable feedback and hope to see you and your entire family again soon!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Hi Everyone!   My girlfriend and I checked into this hotel through Expedia and stayed from September 19, 2011 through September 26, 2011.   We stayed in the left side of the hotel (non family side). There was a few negative reviews and we were debating on staying here but the location to Disneyland was the deciding factor.   To keep the review short and sweet and perhaps helpful to other young couples without children....this place is amazing!!!  Front desk was helpful and knowledgeable. Room service on point and provided everything we needed. Rooms spacious. Beds semi soft, did the job. Noise level in the hotel was quiet at night as most hotel guests on this side were couples around 25 and up and not of the partying variety. Decor dated but clean. Lastly, location to Disney and
Manager Response: Dear al_calgary,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your 1 week stay in Anaheim.  We are very pleased that you did not have to worry about anything during your stay. Thank you for complimenting us on our helpful and knowledgeable customer service, comfortable accommodations and great location. Summary: We booked our hotel through Disney as one of their partner hotels.  We were a little disapointed in our room.  We had a kids suite which was nice but it wasn't very big and was not very clean.  Our bed had huge black hairs which completely freaked my wife out.  I pretty much had to rip the sheets of, shake them and put them back on and convinced her it was okay.  There was a pretty nasty smell in the room as well.  Not sure where it was coming from.  My kids were also dissapointed in the room and they are only 5, 9, and 11.   We didn't complain to the management as we were only there to sleep.  There is a small fridge and a microwave that makes it nice if you're planning on making lunches and storing them in a backpack to take into the park unless you're willilng to shell out
Manager Response: Dear Brady N,  Please accept our apologies and know that your experience is the exception.  We are always at your service 24/7 during your stay and would have appreciated the opportunity to make your stay more comfortable and enjoyable.  We hope you and your family will reconsider staying with us again.  It would be our pleasure to exceed your expectations.  Thank you for completing the review and bringing this to our attention.    Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Okay first off the hotel location is great. The lobby was very clean and hotel staff was friendly.  We arrived early so they gave us a parking pass so we could park and headed off to Disney. When we checked in later to our deluxe room we thought it was clean but everything was worn. The deluxe room is small. If you have kids I would recommend the 2 bedroom suite. I heard its great for kids. The hotel pool is small but nice. The pool was relaxing and the patio furniture was nice. Its looks like its pretty recently updated. We were also told their is a pool we could use at the Jolly Rodgers Hotel. We didn't get there to view that property. The positive about this hotel was there was no charge for parking. They also state with our room free WIFI which with us is a big thing but
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: For families, it really "fits the bill"
Summary: This hotel was clean, comfortable, and a great family value.  The family suites were perfect as they afforded a bit more space and privacy for us and the kids after a busy day at the park.  The microwave and fridge made it easy to prep our own simple breakfasts, too.  And the close proximity to the park allowed us to walk and save some $.  It's a not a fancy place, with a small, but very clean pool.  But since we spent the majority of our time at Disney, it was a value that "fits the bill."  Would surely stay there again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear AZWildcat01,  We are thrilled that you had a comfortable and enjoyable experience and that you would surely stay with us again!  It's great to hear that one of our Kids Suites worked our perfectly for you and your family.  We definitely had families like yours in mind when we designed them.  Thank you for your great review and ratings.  We will look forward to seeing you and your family again.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: As huge Disney fans, my husband and I decided to go to Disneyland for the first time for our anniversary.  We looked at all the surrounding available hotels and we decided this one, since we had never been to Anaheim and weren’t familiar with the area.  It is also listed as a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel.  We were able to call the hotel and make reservations and we were able to get the hotel and ticket package at a pretty good price.    The hotel was about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland or you could take the city bus to the parks.  Very convenient, reasonably priced, friendly staff, had a computer and printer when was needed to print out boarding passes.  IHOP is across the street, there was a steak place down the road and other restaurants within walking distance.  Besides Disney
Manager Response: Dear sh0028,  Thank you for making us a part of your first visit to Disneyland and your anniversary.  Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you experienced.  We appreciate you patience and understanding while our laundry facilities were being repaired.  We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our affordable Disneyland Package and our convenient location.  We hope you and your husband had a wonderful anniversary celebration!  We look forward to celebrating with you again!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: the Portofino Inn is a lovely, 10 minute walk to the Disneyland park. It is not a luxuries hotel. Tiny pool and spa. But the location makes it great.

We hope you and your friends will stay with us again on your next visit to Southern California.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My sister, friends and I stayed here for the recent Diensyland Half Marathon weekend. We were able to get a 2-bedroom suite, and it was the most cost effective place for us to stay. It's within walking distance of Disneyland. It's a "Good Neighbor" hotel, which means that it's met certain criteria Disneyland sets forth, and it's one that comes up on resort searches for Disneyland vacations. The staff was great - I had called to put all of our names on the reservation as we had thought we would arrive separately, but then found out that the names were in fact not on the reservation. When I contacted Emily about setting up a 5-way split of the bill, she found that the names were not on the reservation and put them on for me. Splitting the bill 5 ways was not a problem - we ended
Manager Response: Dear verticalchaos,  Thank you for staying with us during your recent visit for the Disneyland half marathon event. We did experience a delay in the arrival of our vendor and we appreciate your understanding.  Thank you for your great comments on our customer service. Come back and visit again soon! Summary: We stayed here on our recent trip to Disneyland.  I would classify this hotel as average given the following reasons. On the positive side, it is very close to Disneyland (about 10-15 minute walk), it had suite accomodations, and it was close to the Garden Walk shopping/restaurant district so finding family dining options was easy.  I will also say that the room seemed clean and the air conditioner worked very good (it was close to 100 the days we were there and had the air running a lot).  My three year old daughter really liked the suite we stayed in with the bunk beds and the little child size table; this made eating in really fun for her since she had a place that was her size.  I also feel that the price was very reasonable given the suite accomodations.  These were the
Manager Response: Dear berthoudrunner,  We appreciate you making us your choice in accommodations during your recent Anaheim visit.  Thank you for bringing the details of your experience to our attention.  We are happy that you found the Kids Suite nice and comfortable; however, we are disappointed to hear that we did not exceed all of your expectations during your stay.   We have taken your feedback seriously and hope that you will reconsider giving us another opportunity to accommodate you and your family in the future.  Sincerely,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Call hotel direct for services required. That was much faster and got a better deal than the one online at the last minute!
Manager Response: Dear Baruoon,   Thank you for the excellent ratings and review on our Anaheim hotel!  We are very pleased that you enjoyed our great customer service and amenities.  We're glad to hear that you enjoyed receiving an affordable rate and a quality stay!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We chose this site due to close proximity to the convention center and the availability of a 2 bedroom suite.  The rooms, including 2 full baths, were clean, spacious and comfortable.  The beds, 2 queens and 1 king were very comfortable. As has been said, the furniture was worn, but served us well.  We didn't use the pool as the convention and Disney kept us too busy, but many families did.  A nice surprise was the ability to see the nightly fireworks and Disney and one night at the baseball stadium. (We were on the top floor). This hotel was an easy walk to the convention center, Disney and the Anaheim Garden Walk. We had breakfast every morning next door at the Sheraton which was very good. We got a call from housekeeping on an item that got left in the room and arrangements
Manager Response: Dear debdeg,  It's very exciting to hear that you had a comfortable and enjoyable experience and that you would stay with us again!  Thank you for taking the time to share the details of your stay.  We are happy that you and your family enjoyed the nightly fireworks from the comfort of your room!  That's always an added bonus for kids, as well as the adults!  Again, thank you for your review.  Come back and visit us again soon!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Close too DL Resort and good Family accomodation
Summary: 1/2 a mile away from the entrance to DL and California Adventure you will find the Portofino Inn & Suites a very comfortable stay. Parking is included and close; walking to the Parks is tolerable even with kids. The kids suite is the ideal room for family with kids (as the name says). It has 1 King, 1 Bunkbed(sleeps 2) and a pullout couch(also sleeps 2), the nice part is the King is seperable from the other beds by pullout doors, both parts of the room have tvs.  Cleanliness is ok, could be a little better.
Manager Response: Dear uTravelTheWorld,  Thank you for staying with us and completing the review on our property.  We are very happy that you enjoyed your accommodations and our convenient location to the Anaheim attractions.  We hope you and your family will be back again soon to enjoy one of our Kids Suites on your next visit to the Anaheim area!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My wife and I decided to go to California without the kids for our 16yr anniversary. I used this hotel due to the previous reviews and how close it was to Disneyland. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous. Our room was located on the first floor with a alright view. I have 2 complaints, the first being the air conditioner in our room was horrible. We would set it at 65 degree's and after being out all day it felt sticky and not cool at all. We had the repair man out 3 times to the room and still no good. The hotel only offered a $50 rebate for the inconvenience. The second was not a big deal, the pool was closed the last 2 days we were there. So we never got a chance to use it.  I would stay again, only if we had a room that had a actual working air conditioner and the pool
Manager Response: Dear Tofer38,  We are very sorry for the inconvenience you experienced due to the air conditioner in your room.  Thank you for your patience and understanding.  We appreciate you bringing this to our attention during your stay, and have taken the necessary steps in repairing the unit that was in your room.  Thank you for all of the great compliments you included in your review and for choosing our Anaheim hotel to celebrate your anniversary. We hope you will be back to stay with us again soon.
