Summary: Found a great rate for this room online, even after the D23 expo, and the room was great! The front desk staff was very friendly and explained things well when we checked in. Parking was no problem ( we got a space in the covered carport). Our room was on the third floor as requested, and was really clean. We giggled at the chairs in the room that squeaked loudly when we sat on them.  We were out in the theme parks most of the day, so don't know how the hotel is during the day. Nice and quiet at night though.
Manager Response: Dear fiddlefuego,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to write about your enjoyable experience with us.  We appreciate the kind comments on our great service and the outstanding ratings on our property.  Come back and see us on your next visit to the Anaheim area!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: PROS:  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Quick response time when calling to front desk for supplies.  Short walking distance to Disney (maybe just a little too far for small children to walk back from Disneyland at the end of a long day).  Clean comfortable rooms.  Enjoyed the kid suite with closing doors between parent/kid room for late night quiet time. 2 option pools.  Felt "safe" walking around outside.  Laundry facilities.     CONS: A/C was noisey (its a good background noise in the kids room though).  Fast Wi/Fi was anything but fast.  More like dial up.  YES, I would go back.  Overall its a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Sarah F,  We are so pleased that you found our Anaheim hotel a great place to stay and that you would come back!  We appreciate your excellent ratings on our service, value, comfort and cleanliness.  Thank you for your additional compliments on our friendly and helpful staff, accommodations and safety assurance.  We hope you and your family will come see us again in the near future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: A  Great Family Hotel Close to Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 5 has stayed at the Portofino several times during our annual Disneyland visits, and we've always had a good experience. It's not a luxury hotel by any means, but compared to many other dumpy, overpriced hotels within walking distance of the Disney parks, it's a great value.  What we like: The suites are spacious and comfortable, with bunkbeds and a large sofa-sleeper in one room, and a king-sized bed in the other. The rooms have two TVs, a mini-fridge, a microwave and a single-cup coffee-maker. There's one sink inside the bathroom and another sink outside, which is convenient when 5 people are all trying to get ready at the same time. The hotel has a decent-sized outdoor pool and hot tub. If you get an upper-floor suite facing the parks, you can see the fireworks
Manager Response: Dear BothellFamily,  We thank you for all of your comments, suggestions and tips.  It's always very nice to hear when our guests have stayed with us several times and had enjoyable experiences.  We appreciate you highly recommending our property to other travelers and mentioning our great value, convenient location and comfortable accommodations.  Please know that we have taken action into the few items that you brought to our attention.  Thank you for your time in giving us your feedback.  We are looking forward to your next visit to California!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Mangaer

Summary Heading: The best hotel in the area.
Summary: We stay at this hotel every time we go to Disneyland and it is always great.  As a mom of three we are first concerned with cleanliness, and this hotel is always fantastic.  We have tried many of the other hotels near the park and have decided that this one is the best for us.  They always have great deals, we can buy park tickets in the lobby, we are just a short walk away from the park and there are many restaurants just a few steps away.  We usually get the kids suite with bunk beds which my kids love.  Who wants to spend more than they have to on a hotel.  You cant beat it!
Manager Response: Dear auntcolie,  Thank you for your great compliments and traveling tips!  It's wonderful to hear that you and your family love our Anaheim hotel.  We completely agree; you really can't beat our affordable rates and quality stay. We appreciate your continued patronage and recommendation of our property.  We will be anxiously awaiting your family's next arrival!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel for two reasons:  location to Disneyland and room size/configuration.  We LOVED being able to walk to Disneyland.  This was a huge plus, and definitely something we will look for again.  The other family we were traveling with has 3 children, so the kid suite room size was a definite plus.  Our children loved the bunk beds and the individual reading light by each bunk.    Other room features we enjoyed were the in room refrigerator.  We also liked  the large room size.  The room was clean, just a little hard used.  Not terrible.  There were some maintenance issues at the pool.  Many of the jacuzzi jets were not working and the hand rails on the pool and jacuzzi were loose.  Overall, not bad.  The hotel served it's purpose as a convenient place to sleep and
Manager Response: Dear Kay S,  Thank you for making us your choice in Anaheim accommodations.  We are very happy that you loved our convenient location and bunk beds in our Kids Suite.  Thank you for your comments on our accommodations and amenities, as well as bringing the jets and hand rails to our attention.  We hope you'll be back to enjoy our  Anaheim hotel on your next trip to California for a Disneyland vacation!

Summary Heading: Will probably stay elsewhere next time...
Summary: We have stayed here a few times, mostly for the great AAA rate on the kids Suite and the close proximity to the park entrance (we could walk).  However, rates have gone up and we found a few drawbacks... First, a car alarm went off every 30-45 minutes during the first two nights of our stay.  We were exhausted and the repeated calls to the front desk seemed to elicit a polite response but no results.  We bought earplugs!  Second, though there is a small coffee maker in our room, the hotel offers NO coffee in the lobby and there is NO continental breakfast.  i would also add that the free internet is painfully slow... Why bother to offer it at all???  Would prefer to pay for functional access.  next time we come to Disneyland, we will look for a hotel with breakfast available and
Manager Response: Dear Noodler_10,  Thank you for your continued patronage.  We apologize for the car alarm interrupting your night's rest.  There was a delay in resolving the issue, due to the fact that the alarm itself was experiencing problems.  After the alarm sporadically sounded off a few times, we were able to determine which car it was and informed the guest immediately.  However, it was not until the following evening that the guest chose to permanently resolve the issue with the faulty alarm.  Again, we are very sorry for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay.  Thank you for giving us your feedback by completing the review.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I don't know how this place is able to stay open. It was extremely DIRTY!!!  I'm definately not a hotel snob and would prefer to stay in smaller/older/cheaper hotels/motels but this was just plain gross. Upon exiting the elevator, we saw an old king mattress that was leaning against the wall. It was covered in nasty stains (don't they use mattress protectors???). As if it wasn't bad enough that this was just sitting out for all to see but it sat there for THREE DAYS!!  There was a stained twin mattress placed near the outside entrance for FOUR DAYS!!  YUCK!!  The hallway was continuously covered in towels all over the place and smelled like a mix between dirty diaper and vomit.  In order to avoid the lines for the elevator, we decided to take the stairs. The door to the stairs,
Manager Response: Dear stacey,  Please accept our apologies.  We are extremely disappointed to hear that we failed to deliver a comfortable and enjoyable experience.  Please know that during the time of your stay, we had an unfortunate mishap occur that required a plumbing repair.  The towels and signs in the hallways were used to extract the water and caution our guests. New carpet and mattress box springs were necessary in a few of our rooms.  We are very sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused you.  Thank you for bringing your comments to our attention by completing the review.  Your feedback will certainly assist us in our continuous commitment to improve in any way we can to ensure a memorable experience for each of our guests.  Again, we are very sorry and appreciate your understanding. Our hope is that you will reconsider giving us another opportunity to exceed your expectations on your next visit to the Anaheim area.   Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland - average hotel facilities
Summary: We stayed at this hotel while visiting Disneyland. I choose this location because it was about a 10 min walk with a 3 and 6 year old kid to the Disneyland parks. You can also get a bus pass which we used to come back to the hotel. Its the first stop on the way back. You might wait longer than the walk for the bus to leave the park but with two exhasuted kids it was easier than carrying them. The hotel itself was OK. We got the kids suite that had a double bed and bunks in a separate room - divided by glass sliding doors. The room was what you'd expect for a average hotel in the price bracket. Hotel staff were a mixed bunch - all freindly but not all were helpful. We were allowed to park our car the morning we arrived, go to the park and then come back and check in. That saved us
Manager Response: Dear RunnerAkl,  Thank you for completing the review.  We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us.  Although, we are pleased that you found all of our staff friendly, we are disappointed to hear that we missed the mark on assisting you in any way we can.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention and please know that your comments have been taken seriously.  We appreciate you making us your choice in Anaheim accommodations and hope you will do so again in the future.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This hotel was a wonderful surprise. Its located right next to Disneyland. Hotel staff were helpful and very nice. Rooms very very clean and the beds were extra comfy. Very pleasant hotel. I will stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: Dear kbwright79,  We are very excited to hear that you will definitely stay with us again!  It's great to hear that your experience with us was comfortable and enjoyable.  Thank you for all of your compliments.   We appreciate your feedback and time in completing the review on our Anaheim hotel.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: King Suite was excellent for a couple with no kids.
Summary: This trip no children so we just needed one bed. The King Suite was perfect. Besides the excellent location to Disneyland, the staff did something that AMAZED me. I booked in June (only reserved- not paid) and said I wanted to include Disneyland tickets. Since June Disney raised ticket prices. However, the hotel STILL HONORED their verbal price to me for the room AND the tickets, which effectively brought the price of the room down. I work in retail and I so appreciate a company keeping its word to their customers! The Taj Mahal it is not, but it is clean, comfortable, a great value, the people on the reservation line and the front desk are very friendly and helpful, and the company honors its promises- A+ in my book!!'
Manager Response: Dear CookFamilyPharmacists,  We are honored to receive your A+!  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review and share several great compliments on our accommodations and customer service.  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed our King Suite and our excellent location.  It was our pleasure to exceed your expectations.  Again, thank you for the outstanding review and ratings.  We will look forward to your next visit.  Best Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Never again in the school holidays!
Summary: Was a lttle concerned  about this hotel had read poor reviews' We found it to be very good nothing to fault. Staff friendly and helpful. Room clean and very comfortable beds. Most problems was Disney Land far to crowded almost impossible to get on rides etc. The food inside Disney was very expensive for example $2.00 for one small banana  even the junk food expensive!
Manager Response: Dear MargaretHod,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent visit to the U.S.  We appreciate your kind remarks on our property, customer service and accommodations.  We're sure other travelers will appreciate your tourist tips as well.  Thank you for completing the review.  We hope you will be back to see us again on your next visit.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We were a little nervous booking this hotel because of the mixed reviews.  It turns out that the bad reviews seem to be from people not staying in the suites.  It seems that the suites are all located in one building and the other rooms are in another.  We stayed in a kids suite and king suite, both located on the same floor.  The kids suite and the king suite are the same except the kids suite had bunk beds where the king bed would have been.  The AC worked well.  The room was pretty clean.  I was not able to get wifi to work.  Location is good.  Parking lot fills up quickly, but you can park at the adjoining hotel, Jolly Roger, owned by the same people.  We were unable to check-in early.  They offer a 4 pm late check out (if available) for only $30 more.  Seems like a good
Manager Response: Dear redcurrybeef,  Thank you for the great review!  We are so pleased that you and your family enjoyed your stay in our Kids Suite and King Suite.  We appreciate you taking the time to detail your stay for other travelers, and look forward to the opportunity to accommodate you and your family again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: This is the worst place ever
Summary: I don't even know where to begin. First, we aren't travel snobs. We've stayed all over and in various accommodations. I don't care if someplace is old, but filth is completely different. And this place is disgusting. The wallpaper is peeling. The bathrooms are disgusting. The stairwell smelled of vomit and the stairs were covered in God only knows what. Even the doors on the elevators were covered in prints and hadn't been cleaned in a million years. I would never, ever stay there again. Look, when you stick to the carpet, you know it's a disgusting place to be in.
Manager Response: Dear flamingomamma,  We are very disappointed after reading your review and apologize for failing to deliver an enjoyable experience.  Please know that we do appreciate your opinions and comments.  We take feedback from our guests extremely seriously, as we have very strict standards and procedures in following up and addressing any concerns.  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review on our property.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: For a disney trip - this hotel is all you need
Summary: I researched a lot of hotels before I chose the Portofino. I finally chose the Portofino because of price and location. The Portofino is very close to Disneyland. You literally cross one stoplight and walk the remainder of the 8 minute walk along Disney's California Adventure. Check their websites for deals because they often due specials on the home page. We got a last minute $99 a night. Unlike almost every other hotel in the area they offer FREE PARKING!! And there are even some covered spots if you are lucky. The rooms were sparse, but clean with Bath and Body works shampoos. The beds were two queens and relatively comfortable. There was even a small balcony. Hotel staff was quick and nice. If you are visiting Disney you wont be in your room long so don't bother with the
Manager Response: Dear PHXFamilyTraveler,  We are very happy to hear that you decided to stay with us after researching all of the surrounding Anaheim hotels.  Thank you for the wonderful compliments on our affordable rates, customer service and convenient location.  As you mentioned, our parking is complimentary for our guests, which is definitely not the case for the majority of the other hotels in the area.  We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay and hope to welcome you back soon!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Hotel meets expectations, reasonably clean and very close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear GLG_074,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and completing the review.   We hope you will decide to stay with us again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Thanks again, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Last minute changes led me to this conveniently (to Disneyland) Hotel! My family & I were switched to rooms on 3 occasions; first room (kids suite)smelled like urine, second room's shower & bathroom door were broken/inoperable! After chasing down the Manager the second day of my vacation, as my daughter & I were IN the Disneyland Park, she did offer to comp one day of my stay.& did also provide myself, my daughter & my two teenagers separate rooms w/Queen beds! However, my room smelled, shower mat was dirty...I simply figured the Manager did all that she could do! Smack in the middle of our vacation, I was definitely NOT prepared to search for new accommodations & pay all over again! The hotel is a bit run down, there's not nearly enough parking, and I didn't get the feeling
Manager Response: Dear Prettiestchica,  Thank you for your review on our property.  Please accept my apology for the miscommunication and mishaps you experienced during your stay.  It was my pleasure to make the necessary arrangements to ensure that you were comfortable; however, I am disappointed to hear that we failed at delivering an enjoyable and memorable experience for you and your family.  Please know that we have taken the details of your stay and your comments very seriously.  I do hope that you will reconsider staying with us again and allow us the opportunity to accommodate you and your family in the future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great price and very near Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend for a little getaway. We picked this place for the great price and it was nearby Disneyland. Only a 10 minute walk. Diagonally is a great pizza place and further down from there is an outdoor mall with great places to eat and a great bowling alley with big screens playing either music videos or a sports game. Also only about 15 minutes away is Angels Stadium or the Honda center to take in a concert or sporting event. The rooms were very nice, but don't have much of a view unless you like looking at the hotel next to you. The staff was really friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Krazygirl,  Thank you for taking the time to write about the details of your stay with us.  We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed our accommodations, as well as our affordable rates and convenient location.  We are, indeed, so fortunate to be located near just about everything Anaheim has to offer.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that we do have several rooms  with a view of Disneyland's firework show! We hope you'll be back soon.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Old and rundown, never coming back!!!!
Summary: Our experience was horrible .  The foyer was nice but that was it.   Our room was old and dirty.  The fridge did not work and had to be replaced.  The A.C. was very inconsistant. The toilet backed up twice and flooded the bathroom. We had to ask for replacement  bath towels. I tried to do laundry  and the washers were out of order.  When mentioned we we not having a good stay and nothing was done. Never coming back again and will tell friends to stay clear of the Portofino Inn.
Manager Response: Dear ababababa,  We are extremely disappointed to hear of the inconveniences you experienced during your stay with us.  Please accept our apologies and know that we have taken your feedback very seriously.  We are sorry that we had to interrupt your stay by replacing the fridge in your room and that our maintenance staff was working on our washing machines.  We appreciate your patience with us during these types of untimely mishaps. Thank you for completing the review on our property, and hope that you will reconsider giving us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: The IS a Sheraton across the parking lot!
Summary: This hote...resor.....in.... MOTEL is rated as high as 4 stars in some places. It is NOT a resort, it's a (clean) roadside motel. I have stayed at better Holiday Inn Express, Ramada, etc.  Yes, it was clean, but little else. No food services of any kind, facility is functional, but held together with tape and glue. My toilet leaked, the old (analog) TV got only more than a few channels, AC was weak and I needed to call and remnd them to replace dirty towels & used cups. The pool has a whirlpool spa that was actually hot & functional, but you will (most llikely) need to request towels as they are always running out. You won't die from staying here, and you won't overpay either, but you will not be at a resort and you need to find food elsewhere. Parking is free, but you may have
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay at the Portofino Inn was not good. It all begin right at check-in, I knew it was going to be one of those hotels, when they could not check us in on time,...the pool and the fitness room are a joke, the hotel's main pool is very small, good luck on a busy weekend, it has a second pool (much bigger and decent), however it is not part of the hotel itself, it shares it with a neighbor hotel, or what looks like an apartment complex or Motel, the restroom at this pool was a mess, we came across a homeless person washing up entirely, there is no security for this pool, which allows things like this to happen, the originial pool does require a room for key entry.  The free wi-fi, more like dialup, ....atleast dialup will eventually load the page, we were lucky if we got to see
Manager Response: Dear willosc,  Thank you for sharing the details of your recent visit.  Albeit, we are pleased that your children enjoyed our Kids Suite and the view of Disney's fireworks from your room, we regret we were not able to provide you with a memorable experience that exceeded your every expectation.  We are constantly focused on providing the very best stay for each of our guests, and your feedback is very important in our success.  In the future, we hope you will decide to give us another opportunity to impress you.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This vacation, combined of course with the hotel, was fantastic! We loved everything about it!! The kid suite was perfect, with bunk beds, and a view of the fire works every night. Our 2 girls,, 7 and 3, were thrilled!! A super close walk to the park, maybe 10 minutes. Lot's of great food close by, at reasonable prices. I would NO problem recommending the hotel or the get away today vacations company!!  Thank you, Portofino, for making our stay the "Happiest stay on earth!"
Manager Response: Dear katame,  Thank you for your awesome review!  It's thrilling for all of us to hear that you loved everything about your stay with us.  We are ecstatic that you title your experience as the Happiest stay on earth!  That is quite a compliment and we appreciate it.  Thank you for completing the review on our Anaheim hotel and recommending our property to other travelers.   We hope you're planning you're already planning your next visit!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Great location. Good price. Very helpful Manager who emailed me back and forth many times in an effort to assist me in choosing the best option for my family on a visit to Disneyland. Clean & comfortable room. Walking distance to Disneyland - approx. 10 minutes to entrance (with a 9 yr old!)
Manager Response: Dear Boda2310,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We are very pleased to hear of your comfort and enjoyment.  It is always our pleasure to assist you in any way we can in planning your visit, as well as once you are here and ready to enjoy it!  Thank you for your time in giving us your feedback.  We look forward to hearing that you will be returning soon!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We parked & forgot about the car for 3 days.  The kids LOVED their suite with the bunk beds. It's right across from the IHOP and there's a shuttle bus that drops you off right at the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear VHowland,  It's great to hear that you and your family enjoyed your experience with us!  Our Kids Suite is always a favorite for all of our younger guests.  Thank you for your great review and excellent ratings!  We hope to accommodate you again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Do not let the lack of free breakfast drive you away!! We stayed 6 nights in the kids suite at the Portofino inn and suites.  We seem to have bad luck when it comes to hotels but this was a wonderful experience.  All staff were so friendly.  The room and pool area were very clean.  We loved that the pools were open until 11pm.  When one pool got crowded it was nice to be able to go to the other pool.  The kids loved the bunk beds.  The walk to Disneyland is not terrible, 10 or so minutes.  After the second day we decided to buy one bus pass for my husband.  He dropped us off at the resort, drove back to the hotel and took the shuttle to meet us.
Manager Response: Dear Calimo6,  Thank you for your 6 night stay with us at our Anaheim hotel.  It's great to hear of your wonderful experience with us!  Although we are only a 10 minute walk away from Disneyland, we completely understand how tired you may feel after a long day of walking.  We are glad that you worked out a way to make the most out of the shuttle service.  Thank you for your high recommendation of our property.  We look forward to your return.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary: Overall I think this hotel is a great value for families going to Disneyland or other local attractions in Anaheim.  We stayed in one of the kids suites that has the bunk bed and pull out couch.  This area is separated by a sliding door so the kids' area can be completely separated from the parents.  If you are looking for luxury, this is not the hotel for you, but if you are looking for a solid hotel to stay for families, give this one a go.  Food/Supplies:  There is a small store with food, toiletries, souvenirs, etc.  Its convenient but expensive.    Restaurants:  There is no restaurant at the hotel.  Skip the IHOP across the street and instead go to Tiffy's, which is about 2 blocks (walking distance) west on Katela Blvd.  They've got better food for less money than IHOP and
Manager Response: Dear AcapulcoBound,  We appreciate your time in sharing all of the details of your recent stay with us.  We are so glad that you had such a nice experience with us and that you recommend our property as a quality stay at affordable rates.  Thank you for your compliments and suggestions, as we take our guests' feedback very seriously.  We hope to see you and your family again in the near future.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great family hotel, great location, rooms & rates!
Summary: Very large room, with separate bedroom area for the kids- bunk beds, plus pull-out couch.  We also had a crib in here, and still plenty of room!  Two sinks, very helpful too.  Our room had a fridge & microwave also, which is appreciated. The pool was small, but Very warm.  Less than 15 walk to Disneyland, the shuttle does stop just outside the hotel, it is actually an all-day price, not a per-trip price.
Manager Response: Dear KerryVara,  Thank you for your detailed review and key tips that will definitely help other travelers.  We appreciate all of the wonderful comments on our spacious accommodations, amenities and convenient location.  Please keep in mind for next time that all of our guests are welcome to use the larger heated pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We hope you and your family will visit again soon.  Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay.People who dog this place probaly complain about everything
Summary: We stayed 4 nights and had a great time. Room was great and Clean and the front desk would do everything to make u happy. Would go back and stay anytime. Dont believe all the negatives.
Manager Response: Dear JEFSUSHAY,  We are so happy to hear of your great 4 night stay with us!  Thank you very much for taking the time to compliment us on our exceptional customer service and accommodations.  You are absolutely correct! We are always willing to do anything we can to make your experience with us an enjoyable one.  Thank you for your recommendation.  We are very pleased that you will be back again!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: A large group of people stayed end of May 2011, and bed bug alert in rooms 1217 & 1223!!!  also the gym has a light sensor that doesn't work and the on/off will drive you crazy while you're working out.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel We Ever Stayed In
Summary: The bunk beds and pull out sofa were the worst beds we have ever slept in, EVER! We had to go out and buy $100 worth of bedding to at least pad the bed to make it comfortable enough at least to sleep in. It was just terrible. When I told the person at the desk she flipently said, "Sorry". She could not have cared less. This is not the hotel it professes to be. It's very old and outdated and has a moldy smell.
Manager Response: Dear cindy_m_laban,  We are truly sorry and we most definitely care.  Please accept our apologies.  We are very disappointed to hear that you and your family were not comfortable in the bunk beds and pull out sofa.  Your opinions and suggestions are extremely valuable.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback by completing the review on our property.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Very noisey, a bit outdated, not great.
Summary: I will say that the one good thing about this hotel is the Front Desk staff.  Always very friendly and very helpful. I was traveling with my sister and we spent 4 nights here May 17-May 20, 2011. The rooms leave something to be desired.   We had a King Suite, which is simply 2 rooms separated by sliding glass doors.   Furniture is outdated and old.   The first day we had plastic cups in our suite-  then after that nothing.  I had to call the front desk to have them send cups for us to drink out of.   We were using the pull out sofa bed and one night they didn't leave any sheets....had to call about that. The walls are very thin - and you can hear the children running up and down and screaming - however, all gets pretty quiet after 9:00 pm.   Close to Disney - and if you don't
Manager Response: Dear kimmer727,  We really appreciate you taking the time to give us your excellent feedback on our friendly and helpful customer service, as well as your comments and suggestions regarding your experience with us.  We are so sorry about the inconvenience of having to call our front desk in regard to the cups and sheets for the pull out sofa.  Please accept our apologies for the oversight.  We hope that our warm and welcoming customer service and convenience location brings you back to stay with us again.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Average hotel with average service.  Great walking location to Disney.  Kids suite separated by sliding doors that have shear curtains and large gaps.  If you are looking for a great suite for the kids to get some rest and privacy while the adults are awake this is not the greatest setup.  Why don't they put real doors on the kids area and make it private??  Isn't that the whole point?
Manager Response: Dear Duke 042,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our Anaheim hotel during your recent visit to the area. We appreciate your feedback on your stay, as well as your suggestions.  The sliding doors in the suite you stayed in are a practical solution when allowing for the optimal amount of living space and the curtains give parents the comfort of being just a peek away from their little ones; however, we understand how two completely separate rooms might be the more ideal situation for some families.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our great location and hope to see you again.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We just got back from a 3 night stay. 5 adults and a 3 year old. Grandpa, Grandma, husband, Wife, Child and Aunt.  We had a Mini Suite. It had a King size bed, Pull out sofa and a bunkbed. Grandparents slept in  King bed. 3 Adults took turns in the bunkbed as they all liked it so much. Front desk were very pleasant and very helpful with our questions. Maids and the workers around the hotel were very polite and pleasant too. We had a problem with our toilet, we called Guest Services and they had someone up to our room within 5 minutes and fixed. Pool was great with a good temperature water so you could even swim later at night till 11:00pm and there was a Jacuzzi tub. You can also use the pool next door at the next hotel which as a little bigger pool. Room had a mini fridge and
Manager Response: Dear CaNaDiAn0526,  We are very pleased to read that you and your family enjoyed your 3 night stay with us.  It was our pleasure to get your restroom fixed within 5 minutes of your call to our front desk.  Thank you for taking the time to share this with other travelers, as well as other details in regard to your experience with us.  We appreciate your recommendation of our property and are happy that you and your family enjoyed a quality stay at unbeatable rates!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great choice, would stay here again
Summary: Stayed in a children's suite. The beds were comfortable. The walk to Disneyland was ten minutes. The service was good.   We did not have a glass plate in the microwave and called the front desk for one. There was someone at the door in less than 5 minutes with one.  Always extra towels.  Free parking. If you get there early, they'll let you park and hold your luggage for you.  Very polite staff.
Manager Response: Dear noonanagain,  We are very pleased that had such an enjoyable experience with us and that you would stay again!  Thank you for your feedback on our comfortable accommodations, excellent customer service and convenient location.  We appreciate your time in completing the review and look forward to your next visit.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I had chose between this hotel and another hotel and toggled between the two up until a few days of our arrival.  I ended up selecting Portofino because of the kids suite and how it was situated.  It had closing french doors for privacy as the other hotel I was looking to reserve didnt.  I traveled with my husband, 3 teenagers and a toddler.   Upon arrival, front desk was pleasant nice and knowledgable.  We arrived about an hour or so before check in and she was able to get us checked in early which was a plus.  Room was nice and clean but had an excessive order of bleach and extremely stuff which made the bleach smell that much stronger.  I quickly opened up the window to let the air circulate.  Also, found that it was a big dark where the king bed is located.  But other than
Manager Response: Dear Queenie_0001,  We are so glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us at our Anaheim hotel.  Thank you for your compliments on our accommodations, amenities and convenient location.  All of the families that stay in our Kids Suites would agree with you; having the microwave and refrigerator in the room is a definite double thumbs up!  Thank you for completing the review and recommending our property to family and friends.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: We could see the fireworks every night from our window!!
Summary: I had read a lot of reviews on the Portofino on Trip Advisor before and after we booked our trip to Disneyland. Overall, my family was quite satisfied with our stay.  When we arrived, I asked for a room on a high floor and was given the 5th floor (top) facing Disneyland. We could see the fireworks from our window every night, which was wonderful.  A few minor problems, we had a kids suite and the kid sized table did not have any chairs to accompany it. I called to the front desk and two matching stools were brought up. Also, upon arrival the bathroom floor was a bit dirty from a broken eye liner pencil.  There was a bit of noise in the hotel but we completely expected that and it wasn't intrusive or problematic to our or our kids sleep.  The dresser had a drawer that was nearly
Manager Response: Dear achinery,  Thank you for staying with us and completing the review on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate the details of your stay, as well as your compliments and suggestions.  Watching the fireworks from your Kids Suite is always exciting for the whole family.  That's just one of the many wonderful perks to being so close to all of the Anaheim attractions.  We hope you and your family will be back to visit again soon.  Regards Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I was there with my friend for a fun visit.After checking out many hotels we decided on the Portofino for the fact that it was walking distance to Disneyland.Their staffs and services were really good.I would like to recommend this to all my friends
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 'Anaheim Hotel'-A great place for stay during your trip
Summary: i was there for one of the meeting with my business client.So i have decided to stay in Anaheim hotel.it was quite amazing experience over there.the staff and services over there were very good.I would like to recommend this hotel to all my friends.
Manager Response: Dear robin321,  Thank you very much for the great review!  We are so pleased that you had an amazing experience with us.  Thank you choosing to stay with us during your trip to California and for recommending our Anaheim hotel to all of your friends!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Fantastic Location and Service With a Smile!
Summary: We were in town for a manufacturing show in February and looked at other options in the area and decided on the Portofino. Major drivers of our decision were that we could easily walk everywhere and the hotel wasn't super expensive.  When I arrive we were greeted by pleasant staff and they had our rooms ready. They were accommodating and made sure that items we needed were available. The rooms are nice and spacious, traveling often throughout North America I can say that this is a pleasant place to stay, a lot better than most, and that I will definitely go to again next year.   Thoughts: Big rooms with room for the little ones and parents, location (A+, next to the parks and the Convention Center); staff was pleasant to interact with, everyone from the staff at the front desk
Manager Response: Dear GoCaps_2011,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit Anaheim for a manufacturing show.  We are happy to hear that we were a part of what allowed you to have a successful show.  Our entire staff appreciates the A+ and looks forward to your next stay with us!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: After checking out many hotels we decided on the Portofino for the fact that it was walking distance to Disneyland and we thought for the money it was a really nice place.  Don't let the pictures fool you.  This hotel is a DUMP!!!  Great concept (kids suite with king size bed for parents) but the rooms and hotel were so run down that had we not travelled all day and had our first morning already planned, we would have packed up and stayed at another hotel.  The lobby at the Anaheim Portofino is not the lobby on the Anaheim Portofino's website.  The pool was closed and even if it was opened to swim we would have never put our 3 year old in it.  The pool area was really gross, and dirty.  Also, it was in clear view of the busy parking lot not at all private or screened in.  Our
Manager Response: Dear rl68,  Thank you for your review on our Anaheim hotel.  We apologize that we did not meet your needs on your recent stay with us. Your comments and suggestions have been reviewed and taken seriously. We appreciate your time in giving us your feedback.  Sincerely,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My husband described it as a "Days Inn with bunk beds" - I say it is more of a "Super 8" with bunk beds (@ four times the price!).  Must have been nice when it was new (& perhaps clean?) This hotel looks wonderful on the website... but in person the rooms & services are quite  another story. I booked our room on-line & then a couple of days before our trip I noticed a "special" for 15% off your hotel price by mentioning a code so I called to ask about it.  The gal I spoke with hemmed & hawed for a long time, put me on hold (with awful, loud "holding" music) while she "spoke with her Manager" (I got the feeling she was hoping I would hang up/give up) & when she came back on the line, she claimed they were "booked solid" & could not accommodate my request.  I then checked on the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel, walking distance to many things
Summary: We stayed during spring break to go to Disneyland.  This hotel was part of a package deal with Expedia-good value for the money.  When we checked in, the front desk saw our 2 kids and offered to give us a free kids meal coupon at Rainforest Cafe in Downtown Disney-just out of the blue.  He gave us a map of the area when he found out it was our first visit to Disneyland and the area-very friendly!  We saw a sign about a hockey tournament and I was worried it would be noisy and told him so.  He said he put us on the 5th floor of the next tower and that it would not be noisy.  He was right-it wasn't except for occasional plumbing noises, cleaning ladies, etc during day-normal noises.  Kids loved having their own side of the room-the "suite".  There were blackout curtains on their
Manager Response: Dear msab21_10,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your spring break vacation to California!  Thank you for all of your compliments, as well as your suggestions.  We appreciate hearing all the details.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that our guests are welcome to also use the larger pool located at the property right next door, Anaheim Jolly Roger.  Again, thank you for your time in completing the review and recommending our property.  We hope to see you again!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice staff, however hotel is low end and dingy/needs cleaning and overhaul
Summary: -Some of my thoughts:  - Outside of hotel looks nice but:   - No food on premises- just a small convenience store attached  - Housekeepers start knocking on doors at @ 8:30am and chat loudly to each other in the hall so no restful sleep if you want it - Rooms are SHABBY - the bed cover scared me, carpet dingy, bed covering had small holes, lamp was hanging sideways off the wall, air was turned off when I came in the first time so I sweltered unpacking while the room cooled down @ an hour later, floors above squeaked like a grandmother's home whenever someone above walked, the room fridge was turned off so when I went to put something in there, it was hot and WORST OF ALL, I had the a/c temp set to what I liked and the housekeepers changed it to what they liked everyday that they
Manager Response: Dear 0beachbum0,  Please accept our apologies.  We are disappointed to hear that we failed at ensuring your stay was an enjoyable one.  Thank you for your comments and suggestions.  Feedback from our guests is extremely important to us.  We appreciate your time in completing the online review and hope that you will reconsider giving us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I would absolutely recommend the Portofino Inn & Suites for any family traveling to Disneyland!    We arrived home last night after 8 nights with a family of 11, including 5 kids. We booked 2 kids suites and they were perfect!  Very spacious and enough room for everyone. ...and yes, it really is only a 10 minute walk to the parks, not to mention that there are several great family dining options also only a 5 or 10 minute walk away.  The staff were all excellent.  Everyone was friendly and very helpful.   The little store on property is also great for the basics and is open great hours.    We used both pools and the kids loved them!  The entire property is very clean, and great for families.  We would absolutely stay again!
Manager Response: Dear MrsFrog05,  Thank you for recommending our Anaheim hotel to any family traveling to Disneyland!  We are so happy to hear that our Kids Suites worked out perfectly for the entire family. Receiving your valued feedback on your family's enjoyable and memorable experience is very exciting for our entire staff.  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review and for choosing to stay with us during your visit.  We would love to have you back!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Last month I'm going to Disneyland hotel with my Honey and it's been a really nice to stay there b'coz of good environment & facilities.
Manager Response: Dear hemantnbh,  It was very nice to receive your feedback on your recent experience with us during your visit to the Anaheim area.  We appreciate your compliments and high ratings on our property, as well as your recommendations to other travelers.  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to complete the review on our Anaheim hotel.  We will look forward to seeing you again!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: That trip was a great plazer for me. This hotel and its staff's behaviour was nice and friendly. The all are educated and cultured.
Manager Response: Dear gyanendra1,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the U.S.  We certainly appreciate your kind remarks and great ratings of our Anaheim hotel.  We are very happy that you enjoyed your experience with us and look forward to the next opportunity to accommodate you.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: It really is only a ten minute walk to Disneyland
Summary: We just got back from a three-day trip to the Magic Kingdom where we stayed four nights at the Portofino Inn in a Kid's Suite. I'd read the mixed reviews and finally decided to book the hotel based on the Kid's Suite. My two and four-year old saw the picture of the bunk beds and were hooked.  We arrived a bit earlier than the 3 p.m. check in, but had no problem getting our room. The check in process was smooth. I'd prepaid so there wasn't much of a hassle. The lobby is small, but attractive. It has a small business center (fax and computer where you can print boarding passes for free).  Portofino Inn has two towers. The Kid's Suites seem to be all in the building across from the check in area. There is free parking on site between the buildings and limited covered parking under
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Value - would stay here again
Summary: We enjoyed our short stay here for a weekend Disney trip and sightseeing in the OC. The Portofino offers a nice feel, very clean, great beds, and plenty of space to move throughout the room and bathroom. After a day at the parks we met friends for dinner - never even used our rental car since everything was within walking distance. We did not use the other facilities at the hotel, but did see kids enjoying the heated pool, and parents in the hot tub. The hotel is right across from the parks. Very short walk to Disney with plenty of free parking spots, some covered.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly.  FYI - Bottle sodas in the vending machines are just $1.50 - cheaper than you will find in the stores or at the park!!  We read all the reviews before choosing this
Manager Response: Dear johnrvw,  We are so happy to hear that after during your research on Anaheim hotels and choosing to stay with us, we did not disappoint!  Thank you for completing the review and commenting on our comfortable and clean accommodations.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed our convenient location and all of the restaurants, shops and attractions within walking distance.  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the Anaheim area.  We are thrilled that you would stay with us again and hope you'll visit us again soon.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The Portofino is close to Disneyland's main gate, and their kid's suites are ideal for families.  But.  And it is a big but.  The walls and ceilings are paper thin, and you'll be bombarbed with noise from the corridor and your neighbors above and alongside you.  Sometimes it is possible to forget just how noisy kids can be - and not only smaller kids but teens too.  Expect to have too much noise going on until about midnight, and then expect it to start up again about 6am (during our stay the Disney hours were 8am (or 7am with a 'Magic Morning' pass) through midnight.  You'll hear people stomping about, talking, laughing, etc, and the plumbing (showers) are very noisy too.  Bottom line - no way you'll get anything like 8 hrs sleep a night.  A shame - it is a good hotel in almost
Manager Response: Dear TheTravelInsider,  First and foremost, we would like to apologize for the noise level you experienced during your stay.  We are definitely conveniently located close to all of the excitement over at the Disneyland attractions.  At times, our younger guests can express their excitement in ways that adults would not; however, the majority of the time it occurs during hours that do not disturb other guests.  Please accept our apologies and know that we are always here, at your service, to do anything we can to ensure that you enjoy our stay with us.  Thank you for completing the review on our Anaheim hotel.  We hope that you will reconsider and give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The service at this hotel is better than most. The staff is very helpful and accomodating. We were able to book a 2 room suite with pull out couch for our extended family with 5 adults and 3 children. The room was clean and everything worked well. We had a few extra requests and the staff accomdated us cheerfully. It's nothing fancy but great price and perfect if you're just planing to sleep there. It's really close to Disneyland. We'll be back. Thanks.
Manager Response: Dear Zmu,  We are so happy to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us at our Anaheim hotel!  Thank you very much for mentioning our exceptional customer service.  We are constantly striving to deliver the very best customer service to all of our guests.  It is a commitment that is taken very seriously by each and every member of our team.  We appreciate your time in completing the review and are delighted that you will be back to stay with us!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My company booked a dozen rooms here, all in the older building of the Portofino.  The water in the showers was tepid at best, so a long soak in a hot bath is out of the question.  Sunny California had a cold snap and rain, and I have NO heat.  I've complained about the lock on my door not working properly, and apparently they believe that it is working well enough.  WiFi is weak and sometimes absent.  The staff IS fantastic - systems maintenance is lacking.  Although the Convention Center is within walking distance, spend the extra and stay elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear GoWithMo,  We appreciate your patience and understanding, and apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  Our maintenance team did have to make a few adjustments to resolve the lack of heat that a few rooms were experiencing; however, this was resolved within minutes of receiving the call from one of our guests.  Please know that we are always at your service throughout your entire stay, and welcome your calls to inform us of how we can be of assistance in making your visit an enjoyable one!  Thank you for the great compliment on our staff and for giving us your valued feedback.  Our hopes are that you will remember our fantastic staff and give us another opportunity in the future to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Would stay at this fantastic place anytime
Summary: Nothing but good things to say about our stay. Front desk great, pool great, hot tub great, our kids suite was perfect, lots of room, room was cleaned perfectly every morning and a nice 10 minute walk to Disney. Thanks for the great stay.  Marc, Oakbank,MB
Manager Response: Dear marct35,  We are very excited to hear of your fantastic experience at our Anaheim hotel!  It is always thrilling for our entire staff when our guests have nothing but good things to say about their stay with us.  We appreciate your time in completing the review and sharing so many wonderful compliments about our hotel.  Thank you for making us your choice in accommodations during your visit to the U.S.  We will look forward to seeing you again soon!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My sister and I took our kids (5 total) to Disneyland. We stayed in a kids suite, and it was fantastic. We had enough beds for everyone. It was walking distance for even the smallest kids. Nice, clean place with courteous service.
Manager Response: Dear LuckyMomTraveler,  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to accommodate you and your family at our Anaheim hotel.   We are happy to hear that our Kids Suite was fantastic and that the short walk to Disneyland was convenient for even the smallest kids.  We appreciate all of your great comments, excellent ratings and recommendation of our property to other travelers.  We look forward to accommodating you and your family on your return visit to the Anaheim area.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Choice For Disney land and California Adventure parks
Summary: 3 blocks form Disney gate. quiet , pleasant host, nice room.  Similar to Fairfield inn in Dallas very reasonable price, Clean Quiet room. I would stay here again without question,  We  could afford better but it would not be any different or more pleasant. The room we had in Sydney was twice the price but less convenient. Good Choice
Manager Response: Dear xjadair,  Thank you for all of your wonderful compliments on our customer service, comfortable accommodations, convenient location and affordable rates!  We love to hear that you will stay here again, without a doubt.  We appreciate all of your great feedback and your recommendation of our property to other travelers.  Come visit us again soon!  Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great service, but a bit rundown and HORRIBLY UNCOMFORTABLE BEDS.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel on the weekend of January 22, 2011and were in a kids suite. The front desk person was quite helpful and knowledgable as were the other staff we interacted with. The suite was quite a bit smaller than anticipated. We had 5 people so had to use the sofa sleeper. The sofa sleeper was horribly uncomfortable and really noisy (squeeky) ever time the poor kid moved. The bunk beds were not much better. One mattress on the bunks made ALOT of noise every time the person on it moved. The king sized bed was so hard and uncomfortable it made sleeping difficult. The building with the family suites in it is appears to be somewhat worse for wear.  As much as we enjoyed the location and as nice and helpful as the staff was, I don't think we'll be staying here next visit.
Manager Response: Dear SCC915,  We appreciate all of  your valued feedback on your recent stay at our Anaheim hotel, and apologize for any inconvenience you and your family experienced.  Thank you for your kind comments on our helpful and knowledgeable staff and convenient location.  We hope you keep these things in mind, as we do have plans for renovations in the near future and would appreciate another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Again, thank you for all of your comments and suggestions.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great for kids, VERY helpful staff.
Summary: The staff was great, and early check in was allowed. Room was great for the kids.
Manager Response: Dear Promourner,  Thank you for staying with us at our Anaheim hotel and for giving us your feedback by completing the review.  It's always great to hear when families enjoy our friendly and helpful customer service, as well as our accommodations and amenities.  As you mentioned, once your room is available and ready, it is our pleasure to check you in.  Thanks again for your comments and recommendation of our hotel.  Your feedback means the world to us!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Fantastic Place to Stay-Great Value Too!
Summary: Very Clean, Friendly Staff and Wonderful Location.  The Kids suites are perfect for families as they afford privacy and security for my family.  We enjoyed every moment.  We stayed at California Hotel in the park last year and we liked this better as an alternative.  The money we saved we used to pay for the Disney tickets.   Liked we could walk to the Gardenwalk for shopping and excellent food also.  Would highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear KfromCal,  We appreciate all of your excellent compliments on our Anaheim hotel and all of the great amenities that we offer!  It is always our extreme pleasure to ensure that you enjoy every moment of your experience with us, and we are very excited to hear that you and your family did.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback and high ratings.  We appreciate your high recommendation and are awaiting your return!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Smelly, messy, terrible.  Many of us had the rooms without the "kids" amenities "upgrades".  Those were nicer as my friend had a "suite" which was somewhat better but by no means "nice".  My friends were texting me photos before we arrived.  Unbelievable!  Stained mattresses, dirt, stained ceilings, cracks.  Just a dump!  I have stayed at all the Disney hotels and every Hilton, Embassy Suites ect.  Anything is better than this place.  Save the aggravation and pay a little more for a a Disney room right on the property.  PS. just check the "pool", a diry pond with 25 year old furniture. PSS this is the first real negative review I have ever done.  I travel 75 nights a year.
Manager Response: Dear SeattleMadrona,  We are extremely disappointed after reading your review and apologize for not exceeding your expectations.  Thank you for staying with us and giving us your valued feedback.  We are very proud of the quality and value we currently offer our guests, as well as the high level of customer service we know all of our guests deserve.  Again, please accept our apologies for any inconvenience that occurred.    Regard, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We checked into the Portofino January 7th. We had surprised our son with a trip to Disneyland for his 15th birthday, and planned on doing the parks Saturday and Sunday. Naturally, after driving in from Arizona our two kids (young adults though they may be) were doing the pee pee dance. First kid went in, came out and said, "You aren't going to believe this...". The toilet had plugged up. After intense questioning about her activites in there and finally determining that there was no reason for a stoppage of the flush, we developed a tool from an extra toothbrush holder to obtain the flush result we were looking for. The toilet flushed throughout the evening, although making drowning noises all the while. An intricate flush technique had to be developed to get the toilet to take
Manager Response: Dear CGTraveler,  We are sincerely sorry for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us.  We appreciate your patience and understanding in having to move rooms, as the issue at hand required more attention in order to be resolved.  Thank you for taking the time to detail your stay and complete the review on our Anaheim hotel.  Again, please accept our apologies for the unfortunate inconvenience in regard to the restroom.  We hope you will keep in mind the many things you did enjoy while staying with us,  and give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The kids suite was awesome. We stayed a total of 13 nights over a 3 week period. Staff were very freindly, rooms were very clean. They were happy enough to store some of our baggage while we went east. An easy walk to Disneyland. Food outlets all around and supermarket nearby. Would recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear McSALaD,  Thank you for choosing us as your 13 night stay home away from home!  We are thrilled to receive your excellent review and ratings on our Anaheim hotel.  We would have to agree with you; our Kids Suite is definitely awesome!  It really is the ideal layout for any family.  Again, thank you for all of your great compliments on our staff, clean accommodations and, of course, convenient location.  We appreciate your noted recommendation to other travelers and look forward to welcoming you back to the U.S. on your return visit!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient and worth the money for a family of four
Summary: The staff is very friendly and helpful.  This was our first trip together as a family to Disneyland, and the hotel was only a seven minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  We walked every morning, and caught the ART bus back to the hotel at night.  The hotel is showing it's age, and could go through some reno's, but it is clean, and convenient.  We booked the kid's suite, and we were glad we did, if you are a family of four or more you will like this room.   I would probably stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Nova50,    Thank you for staying with us and for completing the review on our property.  We are pleased to hear that we were your choice in accommodations for your very first family trip to Disneyland!  We are happy that you enjoyed our friendly and helpful customer service, convenient location and affordable rates.  Thank you for all of your comments and suggestions.  We appreciate your recommendation and will look forward to your family's next visit.  Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Very enjoyable stay close to Disneyland
Summary: What a hidden gem Portofino Inn & Suites were. We booked a Kids Suite and weren't disappointed. The levels of service from the front desk through to the room cleaning was 100%. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend Portofino to others. While it didn't have a restaurant it's close to a range of other places to eat. It's also a short walk to Disneyland. Top marks to Portofino Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear AndrewRedlands,  Thank you for your top marks on our Anaheim hotel!  We appreciate the opportunity of being your choice in accommodations during your recent stay to the U.S.  It certainly is great to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed your experience with us.  Thank you for completing the review on our property and for your recommendation to other travelers.  We will look forward to welcoming you back on your return visit.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: A good place to crash at the end of a busy day at Disneyland
Summary: My family came to visit Disneyland in November and we stayed at the Portofino.  It took us by a little shock at first, as the kids suite was smaller than we expected.  But, as our time there went on, we realized it was plenty of room for crashing at the end of a Disney day! We didn't spend much time there, so it worked well.  We would have liked a little more dresser/drawer space to unpack though, as we lived 1/2 way out of suitcases for the week.  We liked that the walk to Disney was pretty quick (10 minutes). The front desk staff was extremely helpful every time we needed something, especially when our daughter got sick and we needed a doctor.  We used the laundry and it was convenient to have onsite (although a change machine would be nice in there).  The microwave and fridge
Manager Response: Dear jreetz,  Thank you for all of your great compliments and ratings on our Anaheim hotel!  It's really great to hear that you and your family enjoyed your experience with us and that you would stay with us again.  We understand how important it is to maintain a high level of customer service for all of our guests, and are pleased to hear that you found our staff extremely helpful.  Thank you for your comments and suggestions.  We hope to see you again soon!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed for three nights at the Portofino.    The big plus was the large room with the bunk beds which our children loved.  The proximity to the park is also a big plus an easy walk to and from the park even with children who still nap and no strollers.  Having a fridge and microwave saved us money. The beds were comfy.     Downsides...the smell from the disinfectant  IS overpowering and on the second day I figured out why.  The tile floor in the bathroom is so old that the glaze coating is gone which means every time the floor is cleaned, the natural stone just sucks up the cleanser, each time the tiles would get wet from a towel or shower the smell would become extremely strong again.  Might be time for a remodel of the bathrooms.  Could also be a health hazard for someone
Manager Response: Dear wakegirl1967,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us and other travelers.  We are happy to hear you enjoyed our comfy beds, great amenities and unbeatable location!  We appreciate all of your comments and suggestions, as we are constantly striving to provide all of our guests with the very best stay possible.  We hope that in the future you decide to give us another opportunity to accommodate you while visiting the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This hotel had a lot of good and bad qualities. First the good...there are bunk beds and a sleeper couch in a separate wing of the room with a television. Also, it is very close to Disneyland - about a 10 minute walk. Okay now the negative...the awful smell. I don't know what disinfectant they use but is is a very strong smell. Also, we found garbage on the floor and under the bed and it was filthy next to the top bunk. Lastly, the ceilings and walls are paper thin. Get a room on the top floor.
Manager Response: Dear Slangersr,  Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay with us.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed the layout of our Kids Suite, as well as our convenient location to Disneyland.  We do, however, apologize for any inconvenience that you experienced.  We have alerted our housekeeping staff and have taken the proper steps to ensure this does not happen again.  Please know that we take any service request very seriously and greatly encourage all guests to notify us immediately if there is anything we can assist with during your stay.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for your recommendation of our Anaheim hotel.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I was in Anaheim for a HUGE conference and waited a bit too long to book a hotel and ended up at the Portofino Inn and Suites.  Honestly, it was a fine hotel, but nothing fancy.  The rooms were average.  Beds were a little too soft for my liking but comfortable enough.  Very simple, but clean rooms.  The staff were great-very friendly and willing to help with directions or whatever you needed.  Location for the conference was quite convenient, it was close enough to walk to the Convention Center but also far enough away that you were able to get breakfast and coffee without hitting all of the conference goers in line.  Do note that there is no hotel restaurant or bar, so you have to go next door to the Sheraton for breakfast and everything else.  I didn't go in the pool but sat
Manager Response: Dear TravelerRe,  Thank you very much for taking the time to write about your recent stay with us. We appreciate you mentioning how happy you were with our staff's level of customer service.  We are always eager to assist our guests in any way we can.  We hope you keep that in mind, as well as  our convenient location and complimentary WiFi, when booking your next stay in the Anaheim area.  Thank you for staying with us.  We hope to see you again!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Great location - across from Disneyland, short walk to Anaheim Convention Center.  Staff very friendly and very helpful.  Internet service included - big plus.  Nice hot tub. Suite decently furnished with not only enough hangers, but enough skirt hangers as well. Not enough outlets - some very inconvenient to recharge things.  Not enough light - but that's true for most places.
Manager Response: Dear ejaffe,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for all of your comments and suggestions in your review.  We appreciate your time in giving us your feedback, as we take everything that our guests have to say seriously.  We're glad to hear that you enjoyed our convenient location, friendly and helpful customer service, and relaxing hot tub.  Thank you for your recommendation of our Anaheim hotel.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to California.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Great location to get to Disneyland.  Small shopping mall within walking distance/takeouts.  Room is very spacious, I had a Deluxe room, very happy with the space.  Beds reasonable, I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear reedz10,  We are glad to hear you were very happy with our spacious accommodations and convenient location.  We are within walking distance to all the great Anaheim attractions, as well as many shops and restaurants.  Thank you for completing the review on our property.  We are thrilled that you would stay with us again, and are looking forward to the opportunity to welcome you back!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: If you are looking for somewhere clean and comfortable (with not a lot of frills) that is walking distance to Disneyland, then this hotel would be a great choice.  The rooms and décor are basic, but clean.  There is ample parking and a small pool area out the back.  Even it is on the corner of Katella and Harbor, we didn’t hear any road noise at night. In regards to service, this hotel was outstanding.  The check-in are staff friendly, helpful and go out of their way to assist you with local area information and directions.  In addition to this, I accidently left some personal belongings in the hotel when we checked out – I didn’t realise until 11pm that night when we were at LAX.  I phoned Portofino who informed me that the housekeeping staff had found my belongings and the
Manager Response: Dear the lawsons_nz,  Thank you for making us your choice in accommodations during your recent visit to the U.S.!  We really appreciate all of your wonderful compliments on our outstanding customer service!  It's always so rewarding to receive such excellent feedback.   It's our pleasure to go out of our way to assist you; that's what we are here for!  We are happy that you were able to arrange to come back to pick up your belongings that were left behind in your room; however, had you already flown back to New Zealand, we would have happy to make arrangements to send your things back to you.  We are pleased you were comfortable and enjoyed your stay with us.  Please keep in mind for next time that all of our guests are more than welcome to also use the larger pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the U.S.!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Our family just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel.  We booked the kid suite, which was a terrific option for us, as it allowed us to get one room instead of two.  (Family of 7)  I was more than nervous about our stay due to the large number of negative reviews.  We arrived at this hotel very early, around 8am, and although our room was not yet ready, they held our luggage for us in a secured luggage room, gave us our parking pass, and our disneyland tickets (we booked a package), and we spent the day at the them parks.  When we arrived at the hotel, later that night we promptly got our bags and were on our way up to the room.  The room was spacious, and had a large bed in the main area, and two bunks, and a sofabed in the separate area.  There was plenty of room for all
Manager Response: Dear JonDre,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your 3 night stay in Anaheim! We appreciate all of your time in sharing the details of your experience by completing the review on our Anaheim hotel.   We are pleased that our very popular Kids Suite worked out so nicely for your family of seven.  It really is the ideal suite with all the extra amenities that families always need when traveling.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that we are happy to assist you with anything, at any time, to ensure that you are enjoying your stay with us.  We apologize for the slow draining tub in your room.  Our maintenance staff is happy to take care of any job and, if you prefer not to be disturbed while you are in your room, it can be handled while you and your family are out enjoying your day!  Thank you for your recommendation of our property.  We truly are a great choice for any family!  We hope you and your family find the time to enjoy our heated pool and spa on your next visit!  See you again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary: Stayed at Portofino Inn and Suites for 9 nights with 2 children aged 6 and 8 in a 2 bedromm, 2 bath suite. Fantastic choice as it gave us alot of space for extra luggage and room for the kids to move. It was great also for us parents to be able to get ready early for a day at Disneyland without having to wake the kids. Outside noise was a little annoying but drowned out by a/c. Did not hear much noise from other guests which was great. Laundry convenient and staff helpful. Would definately stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear sallya033,  We are so happy that your 9 night stay with us was comfortable, convenient and enjoyable! We couldn't agree more; staying in one of our Kids Suites is a fantastic choice for any size family looking for extra space for both the kids and adults!  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the U.S.!  We appreciate your excellent ratings and review on our Anaheim hotel.  It's great to hear that you will definitely stay with us again.  We look forward to having you back!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location  for easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland
Summary: Very convenient and comfortable. Did get free upgrade to family suite as i arrived early and the original room wasnt ready.
Manager Response: Dear GlenB062,  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us, as well as the easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland!  Our convenient location is always a great bonus for any traveler that's looking to stay walking distance to all of the Anaheim excitement!  Thank you for staying with us during your recent visit to the U.S.  We appreciate your comments in your review and hope to see you again on your return visit.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The kid suite was cool, and the kids totally loved the bunkbeds. But we could hear the people above us (stayed on the 2nd floor) like they were right in the room with us. Lots of banging, a baby crying (that sounded like he/she was right in the room with us), and we literally did not sleep the first night. The staff made efforts to rectify it, but if you're a light sleeper like I am, then this is NOT the place for you! Otherwise, the location was decent in relation to Disneyland, and the rooms were OK. Nothing more than a 2** hotel, in our opinion... if we could do it again, we'd stay in the Desert Palms Hotel a little closer to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This room would have been perfect.  It had a fabulous king size bed, with sliding glass doors to bunk beds for our kids with their own tv, table, couch, and large window.  We were close to disneyland.  We had a fridge and microwave.  We were even able to see the disneyland fireworks from our room.  The pool and hot tub were great.  The problem was that our room was absolutely disgustingly filthy.  There was an explosion of dried ?milk over our fridge, microwave, and 2 cupboards. One of the tables in our kids room was covered with outlines from a childs juice container.  The sliding glass doors were covered in childrens handprints that looked like they had recently had chocolate pudding.  I would have highly recommended this hotel to anyone who asked, but with how dirty it was, I
Manager Response: Dear citydweller32  Please accept our sincere apologies.  We are certainly surprised and disappointed to hear of the condition of the room you described in your review.  We realize that you asked the front desk to send cleaner and towels to your room; However, we are looking into after receiving your call, why we failed to inform housekeeping that your room needed attention, as well as how you were checked into a room that obviously was not ready for a guest to begin with.  Thank you for taking the time to inform us of the details of your experience by completing the review on our hotel.    Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This Hotel is a good choice for an economic family.  I will say that my family will try to stay at 3 star or higher hotels.  If your not use to anything less than a 4 star you will complain about this place.  Don't waste your time or the hotels rating cause it's not fair to them.    The walk to Disneyland was not a problem maybe 10 mins.  My wife was/is pregnant and she even could handle it without any problem.  The staff is really nice and awesome to work with.
