We understand what comes with what we are paying for so we always take nice smelling disinfectant spray.  It work and made us feel at home.  This is just to get the stuffy, stale air out of the room.  It worked wonders and suggest anyone do this at any room you stay.  The kids suite is what we rented and the bunk beds
Manager Response: Dear sithrico,  Thank you for your great review on our Anaheim hotel!  It's always exciting to hear when our guests love our property, amenities and location as much as we do.  We are happy to hear that the Kids Suite worked so well for you and your family.  The extra space and amenities are ideal for a family such as yours.  You're right; we are only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and just minutes away from several dining options and shops.  Thank you for sharing your experience and opinions with us, as well as other travelers.  We appreciate your recommendation of our hotel to family and friends and look forward to your return visit!  Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: This Is A Budget Hotel... Don't Expect Anything More!
Summary: Our family of 6 (Mom & Dad, 4 children aged 11 through 2) just returned from a 6-night stay at the Portofino.  When visiting Disneyland in the past, we've usually stayed further south on Harbor Blvd. and have driven in to Disneyland.  This time, we wanted to try a hotel within "walking distance", and decided to give the Portofino a shot.  First of all, people need to understand that this is a value/budget hotel, and need to set their expectations accordingly.  Due to its low rates and proximity to Disneyland, there are a lot of people moving through this hotel; as a result, the furniture & linens look a bit worn... because they're constantly used!  So we tried to keep that in mind during our stay, because our family typically stays in a Hilton or Marriott hotel with "nicer"
Manager Response: Dear chgumby,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us at our Anaheim hotel during your recent visit to the area.  We appreciate the list of positives you mentioned in your review; however, it is disappointing to hear that we failed to exceed your expectations.  We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay.  All of your comments and suggestions have been taken seriously and, if they have not already, will be looked into further.  Our housekeeping manager has been alerted of the towel situation you experienced.  Please know that the appropriate actions have been taken to ensure this does not happen again.  We are dedicated to delivering a comfortable and enjoyable stay for all of our guests, and hope that you will reconsider giving us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the hotel from August 18 to 24 and was very pleasantly surprised. We were four adults and stayed in the kids suite (yes that is right we had no kids). This was a perfect size for use. Plenty of room, all the amenities that we needed, very clean!  The room had a newer carpet, bedding was newer, and the king bed also appeared fairly new. It was very comfortable. Great distance for walking to Disneyland with access to plenty of good restaurants. The room and hallways smelled a bit musty when we first arrived, but a quick airing out and all was fine. This is to be expect in hot, humid climates, and as the temperatures were in the 90s and 100s, what do you expect. The only negative I have about the room was one of the draps were torn and needed to be replaced, but it was
Manager Response: Dear restseeker1,  We are thrilled to hear that we exceeded your expectations!  It's great to hear how you were pleasantly surprised throughout your 7 day stay with us at our Anaheim hotel. We completely agree with you; our Kids Suites are the ideal choice for travelers, with or without kids!  The extra space and amenities are exactly what's needed when traveling with family or friends, and we are so pleased to hear it worked out perfectly for your group of four adults.  Please accept our apologies for the miscommunication that occurred at our front desk when your husband and delivery service called.  We appreciate you bringing it to our attention and have taken the necessary steps to look into this further.  Thank you very much for completing the review.  Your time and feedback are greatly appreciated!  Sincerely,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Reasonable rooms, good service and great location
Summary: Booked two rooms for 8 nights, for a great price.  Service was terrific, staff were always available and handled our every request cheerfully.  The rooms were a bit old, but clean.  Location was terrific, only a block or so from the entrance to Disneyland, 10 minute walk.  Pool was a bit ordinary, but who needs that with DL nearby.  My mother's sink blocked up and they moved both my mother and us to new rooms immediately, and they gave us a discount on the already very good rate for the rooms.  Very good service.
Manager Response: Dear bilby001,  We can't thank you enough for your excellent review on our Anaheim hotel! It's always rewarding for our entire staff to hear that our dedication to superior customer service is commended by our guests.  It is always our pleasure to assist our guests in any way we can that will ensure your stay with us is enjoyable.  Keep in mind for your next visit, all of our guests are more than welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel. We hope to see you again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We booked this gem through Hotwire for an incredible $52 per night. It restored my faith in Hotwire after an incident six years ago. We HAD to get a last minute hotel room because the A/C had gone out on some of the hottest days in SoCal. Our daughter has multiple medical issues and can't tolerate heat so we had no choice. Because a hotel for the rest of our stay wasn't in our budget, we had to find something with as few $$$ as possible! We arrived shortly after booking and Hotwire hadn't sent through the confirmation. We went to dinner at Downtown Disney, enjoyed some shopping and came back to find they had upgraded us for the inconvenience. The clerk wanted to make sure that we had a fridge so they gave us a Kid's Suite. It was spacious, clean and the middle door made it nice
Manager Response: Dear TravelJem,  Thank you so much for your recent review on our Anaheim hotel! We are elated to be your gem in Anaheim accommodations and to hear that you enjoyed your upgrade in our Kids Suite.  The extra space and amenities definitely provide the comfort and convenience that a family such as yours needs when traveling.  We appreciate all of your wonderful compliments on our property, location and affordable rates.  We're glad your daughter and the rest of the family found comfort and a good night's rest while staying with us.  Thank you for your recommendation to family and friends.  We'll look forward to accommodating you again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: A great place to stay in Anaheim!
Summary: Portofino was a great place to stay. I had read several reviews before booking my reservation. The vast majority of the reviews were favorable, however there were a couple of negative reviews with respect to linens and cleanliness, so I was a bit concerned. We stayed in a kid’s suite with the bunk beds and our room was great! The linens, carpet, bathroom, etc. were all very clean and the room was in overall great condition. The fridge and microwave were welcome amenities. I spoke to a few other guests on the elevators and as we walked down the hallway. All of them were pleased with the accommodations as well, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The walk from the door of our room to the main gate of Disneyland was only 10 minutes. Even though the property is located near the
Manager Response: Dear beachboy08,  Thank you for such an excellent review on our Anaheim hotel!  We are thrilled that you and your family had such a great experience with us.  We would all like to thank you for the wonderful compliments on our friendly and helpful staff, clean accommodations and, of course, our prime location!  It's always exciting to be right across the street from Disneyland!  All of our guests enjoy the convenience of being so close to the attractions, as well as many restaurants and shops in our immediate area.  We are happy that you found quality and value at affordable rates here at the Anaheim Portofino.  Thank you for your recommendation to all of your friends and family.  Come back and see us again soon!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Has its pluses and minuses - stayed 8 nights and it was pleasant.
Summary: This hotel is in a great location - easy to get to Disneyland. Its a haul with small kids but it was easier to walk than to walk across the street (scary streets to cross!) and then lug stroller on and off the bus.  The rooms are sort of "masked" as a makeover, but if you look close you can see that there are issues. the sinks are stained and the bathroom floor isn't the best. The towels are very flimsy and the bedding is old fashioned. The dresser drawers were impossible to push in and out. I told the front desk twice and it was never fixed. Also, the light above one of the sink areas didn't always come on.  Again, told the front desk twice and it was never fixed. The laundry facility was pretty run down - the washer/dryer were dirty and I even needed help because quarters kept
Manager Response: Dear apr68,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback by completing the review on our Anaheim hotel.  It certainly is disappointing for our entire staff to hear of your interactions with our front desk team members.  Please accept our sincere apologies and know that this is an exception; it is not the typical feedback we receive on our staff.   We appreciate your comments and have taken the appropriate actions to look into this further.  We are, however, very pleased to read that our Kids Suite worked out for you and your family.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for recommending our property.  We hope you will give us the opportunity to accommodate you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary Heading: Pleased with my stay - poor internet connection, though!
Summary: I was very pleased with my stay at Portofino.  The beds were comfortable, it was about a 10 minute walk from Disneyland and there is a IHOP right across the street that wasn't very busy.  The only thing I had a problem with was the internet connection in the bedrooms and balcony.  It was slow and sometimes it would disconnect.  It works well in the lobby, though.  Parking is free, they have a laundry room guest can use.  I spoke with several people that complained of the pool area being small and always very crowded.  We didn't use the pool, so it wasn't an issue for us.   I would definitely recommend it and plan on staying there myself again.
Manager Response: Dear Johnfcar,  It is so wonderful to hear of your comfort and enjoyment during your recent stay at our Anaheim hotel!  Thank you so very much for all of your great compliments on our accommodations and location.  There are times during our busy summer months where our pool is a popular place to be; however, please keep in mind for your next visit that all of our guests are welcomed to use the larger pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel.  We appreciate your feedback on the internet connection in your room and apologize for the inconvenience.  We will definitely look into any improvements that can be made in certain areas.  Thank you for your recommendation of our property.  We are excited for the opportunity to welcome you back upon your return to the Anaheim area!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Sandy from front desk is awesome!
Summary: Portofino Inn & suites is a nice place to stay if you're planning a trip to the disneyland parks.  It is walking distance to the parks.. however, it is quite a walk, since the closest entrance was closed that day.  Customer service here is wonderful, I never write any reviews unless it is well deserved.  This place is very friendly and would come here again.
Manager Response: Dear brizen,  We agree with you 100%: Anaheim Portofino is a very nice place to stay if you are planning a trip to the Disneyland Parks!  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed our property as much as we do!  We can't thank you enough for all of your wonderful compliments on our friendly and helpful customer service.  We truly have the best staff, including Sandy, that is at your service 24/7!  It's always great to receive such positive feedback, as we are very proud of our what we have to offer.   Thank you for completing the review and giving us your feedback.  We're looking forward to seeing you again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Best, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary: I think the people who own this hotel know they have a pretty good location and don't really care to do much to get people to reserve rooms.  There aren't too many really nice places to stay around Disney so the choices are this place and other not so nice places.  I thought the room was pretty clean but smelled like an old sweaty attic..  The furniture  was quite dated and I don't think the bedding has been changed out for several years.  I was a little afraid to lift up the mattress for fear of bed bugs or something worse.   If you are looking for sorta cheap (but not really) and a almost good location, this place is for you.   Also, note to owners, spend a few bucks and change the bedding and towels.  A good review will take you a long way!!!
Manager Response: Dear jms990,  Please know that we absolutely do care and are currently in the process of undergoing several improvements to our Anaheim hotel.  We certainly appreciate all of your comments and suggestions, as we always take them very seriously and are eager to listen to what our guests have to say.  We hope you will reconsider and decide to visit us again.  We are working on making some changes that we know you will enjoy!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary Heading: Hallway and room smelled of an indescribable dirty foot, urine odor
Summary: We were so depressed, disgusted after arriving late @ night to be struck with a horrible odor, wet carpeting, rusted sink drains, "yucky" bedspread, and a bathroom floor that had the top layer peeled off.  I asked the front desk if they had a more updated, renovated room to no avail.  The answer was they are all the same.  She did nothing to appease my discomfort at any point in my 9-day stay.  They didn't ask if I enjoyed my stay upon my checking out.  I bought Lysol to disinfect the room, and Pier 1 room spray to make it tolerable so that I could sleep.  After 7 nights, the housekeeper finally sprayed the room with a rose scent. If it weren't the peak tourist season (I called Disney Hotels, etc), I would have checked out.  The pool also is small and deceiving from the photo on
Manager Response: Dear donna5150,  We are extremely disappointed to hear of your recent experience with us.  Please accept our sincere apologies and know that your comments are definitely taken very seriously.  We will investigate this further and address appropriately.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your valued feedback. We hope that you will reconsider and give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.   Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Not that bad considering the alternatives
Summary: We just came back from a 4-night stay at the Portofino. We stayed in a kid suite with two adults, two teens, and a 9-year-old.  This was a last-minute trip to D-land with 3 other families who were staying next door at the Jolly Roger, which was full, so that is how we picked this hotel. In the past we've stayed at cheaper places like the HoJo and more expensive places like the Grand Californian.  On the plus side:  Very roomy for a family with 2 or 3 kids - we put two teens in the bunk beds, the third kid on the pull-out full-sized bed, and we got a king ... can close off the kids and only see them when they need to go to the bathroom! ... reasonable in cost ... good wireless connection ... plentiful parking and ice ... walkable to D-Land (25 min. door-to-door) and to stores and
Manager Response: Dear Gingembre,  Thank you for completing the review and sharing the experience of your 4 night stay with us.  We appreciate all of your compliments and suggestions and value all of your detailed feedback.  Our Kids Suites are extremely spacious; ideal for a family such as yours!  We are pleased you enjoyed having access to the larger pool located at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel right next door.  It's an added bonus for all of our guests!  We hope you and your family will be back to see us on your next trip out to Disneyland!  Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Dirty, thin walls, and bunk beds unusuable.  The place smelled and was just plain dirty.  Felt like a shower and sanitizer was needed just from being in the room.  Stains and dirt were quite visable on bed spreads.  Carpet blackened our socks.  We had the kids suite and the bunk bed was about a foot away from the wall with no railing.  Couldn't move the beds closer to the wall b/c of a ledge that stuck out and the alloted space was smaller than the size of the bunk bed frame.  Kids had to sleep on pull out couch.  What a waste of money for the kid's suite. Walls were thin.  We expect noise b/c we have small children and understand the energy but no one wants to hear every jump, run, cry, and yell at all hours of the night. Had we not prepaid the room (booked through
Manager Response: Dear AimlessJ,  Thank you for your review on our property.  We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced and assure you that this does not represent the typical guest experience.  Please know that we are always at your service to assist you in any way we can.  It would have been our pleasure to place a call to the room that had small children making noise.  We hope that on your next visit to the Anaheim area you will reconsider and stay with us again.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Value but Not Great Place to Sleep
Summary: The Staff was awesome....very friendly and helpful.  We arrived early and were able to check in, which that we did like alot. The beds were very uncomfortable and every turn the kids did in their beds we could hear it. The A/C was loud but not as loud as the slamming doors and the marching and banging going on above our room. But after midnight they stopped even though we were trying to sleep since 10pm. The first room we checked into had bad plumbing and black gunk coming out of the sink. But I give them props they changed our room immediately. Housekeeping was great with keeping our room clean and smelling clean. We asked for towels over the phone and towels we received in less than 10mins. So it had its ups and downs. The walk to Disneyland is not so bad but when you are
Manager Response: Dear jmochoa5,  Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience with fellow travelers.  We are very happy that we were able to check you into a room upon your early arrival and that we immediately changed your room after finding out about the sink that needed attention.  It's always great to receive feedback from our guests, as well as hear how appreciated our friendly and helpful customer service is.  We are, however, extremely sorry to hear of the noise your experienced due to the guests above you.  Please accept our apology and know that we are always happy to be of assistance to you in any way we can.  Most of the time, all it takes is a friendly reminder call from our front desk to your neighbor above you.  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us.  We hope to see you again!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I recently travelled with my 11 year old son at the end of June.  The room was fine - clean, comfortable beds, towels, hot shower.  We were right beside the elevator, which we could hear in the room, however, after long days at the parks, this didn't bother us at all.   We did not use the pool as the weather was not great.  The only complaint was a smell in the room and especially the hallway.  We were not exactly sure what this smell was - musty and old??  When we got back to the room, we just opened the door for an hour or so and the smell didn't bother us.  As far as the walk to the parks, we found this to be no problem at all (took us about 7 - 10 minutes), although I could see it being difficult for those with young children not in strollers or those not in shape,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not as bad as I thought at the Portofino
Summary: My family was looking for a reasonably prices hotel with a short distance to the Disney Resort in Anaheim.  We traveled with another small family and all of our needs were met. My family stayed in a Kids Suite (room 1202) as the other in a Deluxe Room very close by (per our request).  We arrived way before check-in and were able to park our car and go to the park.  When we got back to actually check in, our Kids Suite was ready and clean.  There was a pungunt odor from the shower after we used it, but this was the only thing we could complain about. The separate room was a good size for our two tweens and for the time that we spent in it, it was better than adequate.  I would however,  recommend another sink for such a large room intended for more than four people.  Our feet
Manager Response: Dear Idr74,  We are glad we were your choice after looking for an Anaheim hotel with affordable rates and a short distance to the Disney parks.  It was our pleasure to exceed your expectations of our Anaheim hotel.  You're right; the ART shuttle is a convenient and affordable option for anyone that's had a full day of walking!  We're also glad you and your family had a chance to visit our heated pool and hot tub after a long day at the parks.    Thank you for your feedback and suggestions.  It's great to know you enjoyed your stay and that you would recommend us to family and friends.  See you again soon! Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a visit to Disneyland.
Summary: The Portofino Inn & Suites was the perfect location for a visit to Disneyland. It is only a 10 minute walk or a shuttle bus ride away. For all the walking done inside the park, a 10 minute walk outside the park and not having to pay for parking is pretty good.  ROOM - large and clean. Plenty of lighting. Coffee maker. Refrigerator. Lots of towels and pillows. Comfy bed. My room was a "king suite" and we had a sofa and table for dining. Soda and snack vending machine just down the hall.  STAFF - friendly & helpful  POOL - small, but perfect for a dip. Towels provided at the pool (very small). Comfy chairs.  Just across the street from the hotel you will find an I-Hop, 7-11, ABC Mart (great for inexpensive souvenirs), liquor store, Chinese food or pizza. We would take a mid-day
Manager Response: Dear BostonTravelPro,  Thank you!  We are extremely happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our Anaheim hotel! Thank you for detailing your experience and sharing it with other travelers.  We are ecstatic to hear that we were the perfect choice for a visit to Disneyland, and certainly appreciate all of your great compliments! We agree with you; a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and no parking fee is great!  Thanks again for making us your choice in Anaheim and for your recommendation to family and friends.  We couldn't be happier to hear that you will definitely stay with us again!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Another last resort hotel near Disneyland
Summary: We decided on the Portofino after a lengthy search of hotels near Disneyland that didn't cost an arm and leg.  The room pictures on the website are just that - pictures.  They make the room appear much larger than reality.  The room is too small and actually needs another bathroom if you travel with kids.  It was clean and it was within walking distance to the main gate at Disneyland.  But - that walk back to your hotel after an entire day at Disneyland was murder.  The pool was fairly small.  The security doors into the hotel are not locked during the day and typically aren't locked at all.  The room A/C was as loud as a car with no muffler (or so it seemed).  Also - be prepared to pay exceptionally high prices at nearby restaurants.  Here's an example. IHOP (across the street
Manager Response: Dear Tgowans,  Thank you for completing the review on our Anaheim hotel. We are glad that after a lengthy search of hotels near Disneyland we were your choice;however, we are disappointed to hear that we did not exceed your expectations.  Although our location is most definitely within walking distance to Disneyland, we completely understand how after a long day of walking at the park the entire family is tired.  We do hope that our affordable rates, clean accommodations and friendly customer service brings you back on your next trip to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great room, but farther to park than I thought.
Summary: I booked this hotel thinking it was an easy distance to the Park entrance. It ended up being a solid 2 km walk which added a lot on to the end of our day. I liked the layout of the room, and the separate 'room' for the kids and their Grandma worked out really well. The beds were comfortable, and the suite was clean. I don't recall any noise from other guests or the elevator (though we were next to it). The hotel is very close to an IHOP and 7-11. We discovered that the 7-11 offered whole pizzas and had an excellent selection of sandwiches and breakfast items. This drastically reduced our food costs for the trip!   The hotel was totally solid, but for families heading to DL, I would recommend something closer, like the HoJo etc...
Manager Response: Dear BeenerC,  We're so glad to hear of your comfort and enjoyment in our Kids Suite.  The separate rooms works out for any family size, allowing everyone their own space as well as choice on what program to watch on the additional television.  For your next visit to the Anaheim area, please know that the Anaheim Resort Transit will pick you up at our hotel and take you to Disneyland's main entrance. When you're ready to come back, the Anaheim Resort Transit will pick you up from Disneyland, or any other Disney attraction, and drop you off steps away from our Anaheim hotel.  You can ride as many times as you wish for a nominal daily fee.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and completing the review on our property.  We hope you and your family decide to stay with us again.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We stayed in the kids suite.  There were five of us and we had plenty of room.  The room was clean and spacious.  The shuttle for Disneyland stops right in front of the hotel, and it is the first stop so you always have a seat.  It is also the first stop coming home when everyone is tired from Disneyland.  It is only a ten minute walk to disneyland if you wanted to walk. I would not recommend it with small children though.  The shuttle was well worth the money.  We decided at the last minute to stay an extra day and the staff was so nice and gave us a great price.  We felt very safe in the hotel.  The room was very well air conditioned.  The staff was friendly and always happy to help us with directions any where.  The hotel is right around a shopping center and nice
Manager Response: Dear CarrieGafa,  Thank you for making us your choice in accommodations during your recent visit.  It's great to hear of your comfort in our Kids Suite and that you enjoyed your discounted rate while staying in the Anaheim area.  Thank you for all of your compliments on our friendly and helpful staff and convenient location.  It's always exciting to be located so close to Disneyland, California Adventures, the Anaheim Convention Center and so many other Anaheim attractions.  Please keep in mind for your return visit that all of our guests are welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Hotel.  We're looking forward to accommodating you and your family on your return visit to Disneyland!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: All of the other reviews are pretty accurate.  It is an "average" hotel, some positives and some negatives.  The positives being: it's affordable (that's huge!), and the kids suites serve its purpose in providing a separate space for the kids to be in, my room was always clean, and the grounds & lobby of the hotel were always clean.  Negatives: It IS old and dated, while my room was clean, it was old.  The paint was chipped/marked in several places, the kids chair in their room was broken, the furniture was dinged/dented.  Overall, I would recommend this place as an affordable, decent place to stay next to the park (took us about 10 minutes with young kids to walk to Disneyland), don't go expecting the Ritz Carlton or anything upscale.
Manager Response: Dear MLB79,  We are so glad that we were your choice for your recent visit to the Anaheim area.  Thank you for completing the review and all of your comments and suggestions.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our convenient location that is central to Disneyland, Downtown Disney, Anaheim Convention Center and several other visitor attractions.  We appreciate your recommendation of our hotel and hope to accommodate you on your return visit.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by the photos
Summary: The only good things about the Portofino Inn & Suites were its location and the Kids Suite concept.  Don't be fooled by the beautiful website photos.  The Portofino is in dire need of a major overhaul.  There was an odor in the hallways and in the room itself (I disinfected EVERYTHING daily).  The exercise room was a joke (old machines, cramped quarters & dated tv), the pool was small and there was only one working washer/dryer in the entire facility.  The building was not secure - anyone could enter as the key swipe was broken at main street entryway.  If you're used to a 3-4 star hotel, look elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear IslandFamily77,  We are truly sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations during your recent stay.  We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  Please know that the malfunctioning lock on the side door has been replaced and our security staff is closely monitoring to ensure that the doors remain locked at all times.  Thank you for completing the review on our property.  We appreciate your time in giving us your valued comments and suggestions.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The hotel is a good clean hotel that was a short walking distance from Disney. There are closer hotels right outside the gate but you are walking all day anyway and the Portofino is not that far. What we were looking for is a good clean hotel, within walking distance to the park, and for the kids to have there own beds oh yeah.... and not breaking the bank. The Portofino satisfed us in all areas. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Mikeyox,  We are so glad you enjoyed our hotel and our affordable rates!!  Thank you for all of your excellent ratings on our location, accommodations, value and service! We're excited to hear that we are exactly what you've been looking for!  Our younger guests always enjoy our bunk beds and separated rooms.  Our hotel was designed with all of our guests in mind!!  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us and for recommending our property to family and friends.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Cheap hotel - You get what you pay for
Summary: On the positive this is close to Disneyland, the bus transportation is near by  and easy to access. The garden walk and other restaurants are close by as well.  On the negative, the remote did not work and I had to go to the lobby to request that it be fixed. In addition, I had requested extra blankets and pillow. This was done in the AM in the lobby speaking with the receptionist, when we returned in the late afternoon the requested items were still not fixed or provided. The phone did not work.  The air conditioner was loud and woke us up all night. The walls are thin and you can hear when the person in the room next door turn on the shower. I think they clean, but the halls smell weird (and not a clean weird). The pool is small.  We have a family with 4 kids, and the rooms
Manager Response: Dear saidthegrl,  We appreciate your time in completing the review on our property.  We are extremely disappointed that we did not exceed your expectations during your recent stay with us.  Please accept our apologies for any delay you experienced in our assistance with your requests.  Delays are certainly not customary; however, there are times when the calls and list of guests' requests are a bit more than normal.  Please know that our staff does their very best to fulfill these requests in a timely manner.   Also, all of our guests are welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Anaheim Jolly Roger Inn.  We hope you will reconsider and give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.    Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The Portifino Inn & suites is a amazing establishment!  Its close to the park and easy to walk to!  My kids love the childrens suite.  The room has plenty of room for the kids play while the adults can stay in the other section of the room and watch TV.  The staff is super nice and cant ask for anything more!  VERY PESPECTIVE!!  All in all, a great place to stay!!  Definitely a must stay if you are traveking with children!!  AAA+++
Manager Response: Dear golfer_1977,  Thank you so very much for completing such a great review on our property.  We are extremely happy that you think our hotel is amazing and great for children.  Our Kids Suites are most definitely the ideal choice for any family looking for spacious, comfortable and clean accommodations.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and, again, for all of your great compliments on our staff, accommodations and location.  Come back and see us again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value and close to the park...
Summary: My family of 6 stayed in a family suite for 3 nights for our trip to Disneyland.  The room was not as big as I'd hoped, but it slept us all just fine...bunk beds, pull out sofa and king bed.  The room was also very quiet which was nice.  The best thing was the proximity to Disneyland.  It is very close which allowed us to walk over in the morning, come back around noon and go back in the evening.  No breakfast was kind of a letdown, but there is a small fridge and microwave in the room.  The pool was kind of on the small side and lacks vegetation, but it wasn' very full when we were there.  Next trip I would consider Protofino again.
Manager Response: Dear trvlnbebe,  Thank you and your family for choosing to stay with us!  You really can't get much closer to all the excitement and tourist attractions.  We are so pleased that you found our location convenient, which allowed you to walk over to Disneyland in the morning, then back to our hotel midday, and then back over to Disneyland again in the evening.  Glad to hear you were able to take some time to enjoy the pool.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that all of our guests are more than welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Jolly Roger Inn.  Thank you for completing the review on our property.  We hope you decide to visit us again on your next trip.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place at a Great Price
Summary: The staff was fantastic.  They met and exceeded all of our expectations.  I never saw anyone who worked there that was not smiling and always pleasant.  I traveled with my two grandchildren, my husband, my daughter and her husband.  We all were very comfortable in the family suite.  It was convenient to Disneyland and shopping.  You can't beat the price and they always had great Disney deals at the front desk.  We even arrived well before check-in and the hotel staff had the room ready and allowed us entrance before 10:00 a.m. with no problem.
Manager Response: Dear msimonsen1,  It was most definitely our pleasure to exceed all of your expectations during your recent stay with us!  What an excellent review!  We certainly appreciate all of the great compliments on our friendly and helpful customer service.  We enjoy our jobs and our guests, which always make us smile!  We are glad to hear that our family suite was comfortable and affordable.  You are completely right; you really can't beat the price!  We look forward to the opportunity to exceed your expectations all over again!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Value and Location for Young Families
Summary: My husband and I stayed here with our 8 and 5 year old in a family suite when we visited Disneyland the first week in May 2010.  We had concerns based on some negative reviews, but our stay was fine.  We booked through Expedia.ca and got a great price of $59 per night.  We agreed that what we got for our money was pretty darn good.  We liked the divided room very much.  The bunk beds were exciting for the kids.  They liked having their own little table to eat at.  We bought cereal, milk, yogurt and fruit and ate breakfast in the room every day.  We made coffee in the little coffee maker.  It was nice to have a couch to flop out on.  The beds were pretty comfortable but the pillows left much to be desired.  Bring your own if you are picky about such things.  The room was clean
Manager Response: Dear TheCanadianCritic,  Thank you for completing the review on our property and taking the time to detail your experience with us.  Your comments and valued suggestions are very important to us.  Please know that all of your feedback has been taken seriously and will definitely assist us in our continuous efforts in delivering a memorable, enjoyable stay for all of our guests.  Keep in mind for your next visit that all of our guests are welcomed to use the larger pool located right next door at the Jolly Roger Inn.  We appreciate your comment on our great location and comfortable, easy 10 minute walk to the park gates.  This really is an added bonus for anyone visiting the local attractions.  We would also like to thank you for noting that our housekeeping staff was attentive to your needs each day and that you found our hotel a great value at affordable prices.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Our travel group consisted of myself my wife, my son 20yrs and daughter 19yrs. For reference this is the 4th time for us in Disneyland /Anaheim so I have comparatives. If you're looking for luxury and brand new anything this is not the place for you. The hotel is dated and there is wear on the furniture and in the rooms, but they are clean. The pool is rather small but this wasn't a problem and we used it almost daily. The staff was courtious and pleasant, however we had no complaints to report so I can't attest to their problem solving ability. We booked our trip online through itravel2000 and paid $56.00 per night Can$ for a week, so expectations weren't great, but we got excellent value for our money. We have stayed previously at the Anaheim Plaza, (probably wouldn't stay
Manager Response: Dear Canadan9,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and taking the time to give us your feedback on your experience with us.   We are sorry to hear of the inconveniences you experienced previously at other properties and are so glad that you decided to stay with us on this visit to the Anaheim area.  Thank you for your compliments on our staff, clean accommodations, affordable rates and location.  Being so close to Disneyland is so exciting for many families and we apologize for the guests that were not courteous with their noise level in the hallway.  Please know that we are at your service at all times for any assistance you may need.  Also, keep in mind for your next visit that all of our guests are welcome to use the larger pool at the Jolly Roger Inn located right next door.  Thank your for your recommendation to family and friends.  We hope to accommodate you and your family again soon!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This is our second stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites.  It was recommended to me by my co-worker.  We absolutely love this hotel.  The staff is extremely friendly and inviting when we checked in.  The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are a great size.  It is a couple block walk to Disneyland and for the price, you can't beat it.  A couple of very minor things need updating and lo-and-behold the manager contacted me to let me know those things (curtains) would be updated.  This is the kind of service they have.   Last year we stayed in the Kid Suite which is perfect for families with kids, it has a separate room for the children with bunk beds and a t.v..  We just stayed in the 2 room suite with some friends and it accommodated everything we brought with us.  I would highly
Manager Response: Dear disneyland255,  Thank you for your return visit to our hotel!  It is always so great to hear that our guests love our property as much as we do.  We appreciate all of your valued feedback, including the wonderful compliments on our friendly service, beautiful grounds and affordable rates. We take your comments and suggestions very seriously, as it assists us in our commitment to deliver the very best experience our guests can enjoy!  Our entire staff thanks you for taking the time to complete the review and for honoring us as your 1st Choice in Accommodations!  Come visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: A nice place to stay, close to Disneyland
Summary: A very nice, clean hotel. Conveniently located across the street (South) from Disneyland. It's still 2/10 of a mile up the street to the entrance to the Plaza, but not too bad. At least until you've done 4 days of intensive Disney - that "last" walk back can be pretty long. We had a Kid's Suite. Looked just like the picture on the website. It worked well for us, the kids all had their own beds (there were 5 of us on the trip). It would have been nice to have another bathroom, but the room does have 2 sinks (1 in the bathroom, 1 just outside the bathroom). The fridge and microwave were very nice to have as well. Parking is pretty tight. We drove one night, got back really late, had trouble finding a spot. Also, it got a bit noisy sometimes, we could hear folks running around
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Central to Disneyland, plenty of room for families
Summary: Booked this hotel for sweet deal on Expedia, stayed in family room with bunk beds.  Plenty of room for my family of 5 (3 kids).  Disneyland was an easy 15 min max walk to front gates Disneyland with youngest child dragging feet both ways!  Would have been easier if we would have figured out buses, but enjoyed walk.  Only downside was no continental breakfast here, but kids were happy with cereal - easy with fridge in room.  Service was great - staff were friendly and accomidating!  Would recommend as a great family hotel for a Disneyland visit!
Manager Response: Dear FunintheSun111,  Thank you for your review and recommendation of our hotel!  We are so pleased to hear that you and your family of 5 enjoyed your experience so much that you took the time to share the details with us as well as other travelers.  Keep in mind for your next visit that the Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) system is a shuttle service available to and from Disneyland and all of the other Disney attractions ($4 per adult & $1 per child for all day pass).  Please allow our front desk staff to inform you of all the details on your next visit.  We are looking forward to serving you again with our friendly and accommodating customer service!  Thanks again,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed here with my sister on our first visit to Disneyland and we had no complaints whatsoever about this hotel. Rooms were decent sized, clean, and quiet. It's a pretty standard hotel, but the best part about it is the location. Close to Disney, close to GardenWalk (shopping and restaurants!), close to everything we wanted. We didn't even bother to rent a car while we were there because there was simply no need.   The one snag in our trip was when a planned shuttle to Catalina Island cancelled on us. 11:00 pm and Lori at the front desk was instantly on the phone finding us another way to "just get to the beach!" in the morning. And just like that it was done, and we had an 8:00 am pick-up for our day of beach tours. This was probably our favorite day of the entire
Manager Response: Dear wheezieC,  Wow!  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for an excellent review on our hotel!  We are very excited to hear that you thoroughly enjoyed your experience with us.  Thank you for all of your high ratings on our clean accommodations, location and great customer service.  It was truly our pleasure to help you find other arrangements and get you to the beach!  We are dedicated to making your stay the very best and are happy to assist in any way we can to make that happen!  We are honored that you chose to stay with us on your very first visit to Disneyland and look forward to your next visit with us!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Ok, so I was really hoping the reviews I read about this hotel being so-so were wrong.  I really wanted to like the Portofino and come back here in the future, but I think I will pass.  The thing is it isn't a bad place, overall it is ok, but that just isn't really enough to make me want to stay here again, when there are so many other places to choose from.   First, I had a 5 day package deal with only a few choices of hotels beyond the disney properties.  I chose this one because I really wanted a kids suite for my family of 4 (two adults, two kids ages 3 and 4) as we were going to be there for a long time and wanted plenty of space and our own beds.  The price was also very reasonable.  We usually stay at the Candy Cane Inn, but we could not beat the package deal price with
Manager Response: Dear CaliforniaMommy02,  Thank you so very much for your time in giving us such detailed feedback of your stay with us.  We are extremely disappointed that we did not exceed your expectations and have taken your comments very seriously as we are always focused on making each experience an enjoyable and memorable one.  Please accept our sincere apologies for waking your family from a nap. Our housekeeping staff do their best at knocking loud enough and waiting for a response before entering to clean a room and will not enter rooms that request privacy.  We are glad that you enjoyed our clean accommodations and location, and hope that you will decide to reconsider and give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Okay, here's the skinny. We travel a lot. Having friends that are only happy with the cream of the crop and family that only care about how cheap thay can get a room for... I've done it all. On this trip it was both!   2 Rooms, two families, Single Mom traveling with arthritic Mother and 8 year old child and a 40 something Mom and Dad with 7 and 8 year olds.  This hotel fit the bill First off, it's close. No, not right accross the street close (there is a super handy grocery store however accross the street) but close enough to walk. The Mom and Dads made the decision of taking turns being the driver and dropped the kids/Grandma off at the gate and while they waited in line to get in, we parked and walked the short 7 minute walk (the grown up time was nice too) catching up to
Manager Response: Dear kandzhawk,  Thank you so much for your detailed review on our property.  We truly enjoyed reading it!  It really shares a lot of what we are all about: spacious, clean and comfortable accommodations to enjoy while visiting and vacationing with family and friends (as well as a good old fashioned pillow fight!).  It was great to hear that your family and friends had such a great experience with us.  We enjoyed having you, as well as exceeding your expectations with the few surprises that you mentioned.  Again, thank you for your review and your visit with us.  We look forward to accommodating you again!  Best,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manger

Summary Heading: Room served its purpose, but there is definitely a mold issue in bathrooms and they could have been cleaned better.
Summary: We recently stayed at the Portofino Inn. The room was okay and it served its purpose as we were only there one night for a quick trip to Disneyland. It is relatively close to Disneyland which is a plus, but there are some cleanliness issues. The shower had 3 long black curly hairs in it on the floor and shower curtain and there was also a hair like this on one of the folded towels in the room. I noticed that the ceiling had been painted, but on the parts closest to where the ceiling meets the wall and the paint did not quite get up to, you could see black mold peeking out from underneath the paint. In some places the mold was coming through the paint or just growing on top. There is also mold beginning to appear on the walls in the bathroom as well. The bathroom wasn't overtaken
Manager Response: Dear disneyfan23,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for giving us your feedback by completing the review on our hotel.  We have taken all of your comments extremely seriously and are investigating the situation to resolve any issue that may be at hand.  Once we are informed of any concern, please know that we take immediate action and address it.  We always appreciate the opportunity to do anything we possibly can to make your stay an enjoyable one.  Please accept our sincere apologies and reconsider staying with us again.  Although your experience was the exception, we assure you that our accommodations are very clean and comfortable.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel through Disney.com and I couldn't have been happier.  This hotel is listed as 3 star, I was a little worried after reading reviews - but this isn't sold as a 5 star hotel.  We went to Walmart our first night and bought breakfast and snack items.  It is only a 5 minute walk to the entrance to the park and there is a stripmall on the way that has a subway, pizza, chinese, mexican and a 7 eleven across the street.  Buy and pack in your items into the park unless you don't mind spending $8 for a cold burger and $6 kid meal that included 3 chicken nuggets.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat.  Free wifi and parking are definitely a plus!!!  The only problem we ran into was our shower didn't drain well and the front desk had someone come up within 15 minutes.
Manager Response: Dear mloanqueen,  We are so happy that you enjoyed Spring break with your family while staying with us.  It is so exciting for us to hear that we exceeded your expectations and that you couldn't have been happier! We are also pleased to hear that on your 5 minute walk to Disneyland you took advantage of all of the restaurants and shops we have nearby.  It's always nice to have a variety of options, especially when traveling with your family.  We appreciate your review and glad to hear you would stay again in a heartbeat!  Hope to see you soon! Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Overall we were pleased with our stay at Portofino Inn and Suites. We paid $97 per night for a kids suite.  Pros: -Short walk to Disneyland. Pedestrian entrance to the park is right on Harbor Blvd. -Kids Suites accomodated family of five well (could even sleep 6) -Kids loved the bunkbeds and we loved the french doors that separated the rooms. -Microwave, fridge, and coffee pot. -Nice pool for a 3 star hotel. -Staff friendly and accomodating. -Great value -Free WIFI internet -Free parking  Cons -Our room had some minor cosmetic flaws, bunched carpet, stains on inside of drapes. -We did have trouble with the lock on our door but did not report until end of stay because I did not want to change rooms. -Housekeeping missed somethings when cleaning but was quick to replace when
Manager Response: Dear brennbug,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and completing the review on our hotel.  We truly appreciate hearing all of your great comments, as well as your suggestions.  Thank you for recommending us to other travelers and we hope to see you back again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Ok but  minor cosmetic with the room left me a little dissapointed
Summary: This is my second trip to Portofino I had such a good experience the first time that I decided to stay there again, but this time around some cosmetic issues with the room left me a little dissapointed.  So here are the PROS: Staff met my needs again to an early check in a big plus after driving for 8 hours, room was clean no smells, I had the Kid suite and like the pictures the room was nice and comfortable, no problem so far I dont know about day time noise since I spended all day at Disney but at night no problems. So here comes the CONS: The carpet was a little loose and lumpy on the main corridor inside the room one light bulb was burn out on the kids bunk bed one of the drawers would not closed properly but the deal breaker was the main door to our room got stuck twice and
Manager Response: Dear gian99Ca,  We are certainly glad you decided to stay with us again!  Thank you so very much for all of your compliments and suggestions.  Your feedback is taken seriously, as we are constantly focused on making each experience with us the very best! We also appreciate your patience and understanding regarding the dresser drawer that needed attention.  It was so kind of you to note that our maintenance staff was at your service within a few minutes of calling.  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review on our property.  We are truly honored that you have already decided to stay with us again in the future.  We're looking forward to welcoming you back once again!  Best, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Fantastic value for the money and spacious rooms
Summary: I never post reviews but always look to TripAdvisor when making my vacation plans.  Yet, after our 5 day stay at the Portofino, I had to comment.  I am the traveler who wants the best price and service for the money - and usually when my expectations are met, there is no need to comment further. Since our experience was exactly what I wanted - a clean, reasonably priced room that gives a lot of space with a great staff - it is important to me to post such a review, too, for other families looking for a great room at a great price.    As a family of four - with two elementary-age children - the Kid's Suite was perfect.  My son enjoyed the bottom bunk and my daughter chose the pull-out couch.  The suite included a refrigerator and microwave, which is an additional cost at many
Manager Response: Dear azfam033,  We are all so happy you and your family enjoyed your experience with us so much that you felt you had to post a review and share the details with us and other travelers!  We truly appreciate all of your excellent ratings and compliments on our affordable rates, spacious accommodations and great customer service.  It is always so rewarding to receive such positive feedback from our guests.  It lets us know that we are doing our job at exceeding our guests' expectations in every way we possibly can. Thank you for commenting on how you enjoyed how clean and tidy our hotel is.  Keeping our property clean is extremely important to us.  We have also forwarded your compliments to our maintenance team.  As you mentioned, our entire staff is always at your service.  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review.  We hope to accommodate you and your family again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel for the PMA conference and had an unexpected family issue causing me to cut my stay short.  The service and understanding received from Sandy Prather was both unexpected and superior.  She accomodated my needs and made a difficult situation as pleasant as it could be.  Kutos to her, I wish all my employees had the personal skills she displayed and clearly loved their job like Sandy does.  I will definitely stay here again for this reason alone.  David
Manager Response: Dear pictureu,  Thank you so very much for taking the time to complete the review on our property and detail the kind and personable customer service you received from our staff.  As you mentioned, displaying the personal skills, understanding and compassion when serving our guests, clearly shows how Sandy truly loves her job.  We are, however, sorry to hear of the unexpected family issue that caused you to cut your stay short.  We are more than happy to hear that you will definitely stay with us again!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My boys and I stayed in a children's suite at the Portifino Inn & Suites in Anaheim, CA for 3 nights.  This is what I found: Pros:  It is very close to Disneyland - only 2 blocks away.  You can purchase Disneyland tickets at the front desk.  There is an iHop across the street.  The pool is nice.  The service is friendly.  The room was clean.  The children's room had bunk beds.  Each bunk had its own light.  Their was a small love seat in the children's room, too, and a child-size table with 2 child-size stools.  My kids loved this room.  There is a small convenience store connected to the property where you can buy drinks, snacks, souvenirs, etc. Cons:  The hotel was VERY noisy.  Each morning I got woken up by loud banging noises.  i peaked out the door at 7:00 am one morning
Manager Response: Dear margies2001,  Although, we are excited to hear that you had so many great things to say about your experience with us; we were disappointed that considering all of your pros in regard to our property, you would not recommend us to family and friends.   Our housekeeping staff is very efficient at cleaning our guests' rooms to ensure that they are pleased upon their return from breakfast, etc.  Also, please know that we do have security that is on duty from night until morning; however, our doors do latch closed and require a key card to enter.  Thank you for your time in giving us your valued feedback.  We hope to see you again!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: keep on going! dont stop, dont stay here
Summary: Portofino...not what I expected. It is somewhere between decent and sub-standard at best. (over priced for what it is)  The rooms need updating, 1995 called and said that wanted their decor back!  Negatives: not very clean, spotty carpet (don’t want to know!), dirty blankets on the kids bed, some foreign substance on it, torn and tattered drapes, broken clock radio, and crummy internet.  One of the reasons that I stayed here is because I need WIFI to do a little work each night after Disney. 2 nights in a row the WIFI would connect and lose connection over and over again. I notified the front desk 3 times. The 3rd time they gave me the number to tech support, When I spoke to them they told me that the desk never even told them that there was a WIFI problem.  Now let’s add fire
Manager Response: Dear roddo1,  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience that you experienced during  your stay with us.  We are terribly sorry about the WiFi connectivity issues that occurred.  This month we are undergoing extensive WiFi testing, which will result in an upgrade to our system to improve our connectivity.  Our fire alarm testing is mandated by the city.  We notify all of our guests in advance and please know that they really do their best at completing their tests in a timely manner.  Thank you for completing the review on our property.  Your feedback is important to us.  We hope you decide to give us another opportunity to accommodate you.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't stay if you wanna sleep
Summary: The hotel was not comfortable at all and the service was horrible. I asked for clean towels twice and never got them. It was a very hard to sleep because people were constantly coming in and out. I will never stay again. You get what you pay for.
Manager Response: Dear travel_3300,  We are truly sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations during your recent stay with us.  There is, indeed, a lot of daily excitement in the air, as many of our guests are traveling as a family and are in town to see and experience all they can while they are here.  Please know that promptly honoring our guests' requests is most definitely a normal standard for our staff.  We kindly apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  Thank you for completing the review on our property.  We do hope you'll reconsider and give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: They exceeded all of our families expectations. We traveled with our 4 kids and grandpa and grandma. The rooms are divided into two areas with sliding french doors. one area with bunk beds (Which they upgraded both our rooms for free) and another with a bed. this was perfect for us and our family.  They helped us with every request, supplied us with printed and turn by turn driving directions to all the attractions we traveled to.  Easy walk to Disney even with 4 kids (youngest turned 5 there).  The only thing i wish we would have know was to request a room that the fireworks from disney were visible from our room. With our 4 young kids we only stayed late enough for them to see the fireworks one night and the youngest was sleeping thru it lol.   Would stay there again in a
Manager Response: Dear Saskcple,  What an excellent review!  We are so thrilled that you and your entire family enjoyed your experience with us!  Thank you so very much for your compliments on our accommodations, location and customer service.  It was our pleasure to help you with your every request!  We will assist you with absolutely anything we possibly can to ensure that your stay with us is a memorable one.  Thank you for completing the review and taking the time to give us such great feedback.  It really means so much to all of us here.  Come back and see us soon!  Sincerely,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We recently spent 4 nights at the Portofino Inn for a family trip to Disneyland.  Hotel rooms are what I would expect of a three star in a popular resort area.  The rooms are a little out dated and the bathrooms could use a renovation, there are no fans in the bathroom which was a draw back.  Housekeeping was inconsistent and not thorough enough.  We liked the pool area, you're able to see the fireworks from Disneyland from the hot tub, a great place to sooth those tired feet and the pool is heated for a late night swim.  Disneyland is about a 7 minute walk and there are ample restaurants and convenience stores within walking distance too.  Would stay here again if back in the area and looking for a mid-range hotel.
Manager Response: Dear love2travel040,  We appreciate all of the great comments on our property; however, we apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced due to something our housekeeping staff may have overlooked.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention and for your other suggestions mentioned in your review.  All of your feedback is extremely important to us as we are constantly striving to deliver the very best experience our guests can enjoy.  We are glad that you were able to take advantage of our convenient location by sitting in our hot tub to enjoy the Disney firework show!  Also, we are happy to hear that you would stay with us again; we would love to have you back!  Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I used to stay at the Portofino Inn whenever I was in Anaheim. However, it stopped until 2009. I came back in October and booked the two bedroom suite. It was a great value for $150/night and it was pretty nice. The rooms were a bit dated, but the most important thing was that it was comfortable and clean. There were two double beds, a queen and a sofa bed. After that stay, I was pretty happy. In December, I chose to stay at the Portofino again because of it's value and rooms. This time, we chose to stay at their Deluxe rooms which was pretty nice. To be honest, the Deluxe Rooms seem newer than the Suite. It was a lot cleaner and much more comfortable. The beds were nice and large. The bathroom was really clean and there was a balcony. I enjoyed both of my stays at the Portofino
Manager Response: Dear arthursiew,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on both of your recent visits to the Anaheim area.  We certainly appreciate hearing all of your great compliments on our property.  Most importantly, it was wonderful to read that you enjoyed both of your recent stays with us so much that you are looking forward to returning again!  Keep in mind for your next visit that our guests are welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Jolly Roger Inn.  Thank you for taking the time to give us your valued feedback.  We are looking forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I have been reviewing the comments of several guests and I can only say we had a great experience at the Portofino Inn. Our room was clean and it was a short walk to Disneyland.  The front desk gave great assistance to us on booking a bus tour to L.A. We did not encounter any of the problems some of the other guests are writing about. In fact, we plan on revisiting the area in a couple of months, and we will definitely stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites again.
Manager Response: Dear SunandFun55,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the Anaheim area.  We certainly appreciate you taking the time to complete the review on our property and share your experience with other travelers.  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you will definitely be staying with us again in a few months.  We are looking forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Experience for a great price
Summary: Hotel was picked for us by Hotwire, so I had no idea what to expect. But for $42 a night we were not expecting a whole lot.  Check in was great, and the room was clean, beds were comfortable.  I will mention I was expecting a better TV, but it didnt bother me and my wife.  I will say that the free internet is a little slow which was a drag.The location is amazing, there is a IHOP across the street, and you can walk to Disneyland from the hotel in about 5 minutes. Pool is heated which was nice, since it was only in the 50's at night. All around a great hotel for a great price.
Manager Response: Dear jikster14,  Thank you for completing the review on our hotel and for all of the great comments!  It is always so rewarding to hear about all of the great experiences our guests have with us. We are more than happy to hear that you think we are all around a great hotel and that our rates are affordable.   Thanks again for staying with us.  We appreciate your recommendation to friends and family.  Come visit us again soon!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We chose the Potrofino after researching  the internet from Australia, some of the reviews where a bit worrying so i contacted the hotel direct and they assured me that they where working on constantly improving the hotel and all of my concerns would be addressed, we arrived very early (7.30AM) we did not request an early check-in but this was not a problem at all, we found the staff to be very helpful and friendly, the hotel was about a 10 min walk to Disneyland, a very easy stroll, one of the big advantages was the choice of eateries and a 7-11 on the corner, great for snacks and things, i stayed at the "Fairfield by Marriot" a couple of years ago and found the Portofino better in many ways,(almost as close to Disneyland, better choice for dining, better appointed rooms), the
Manager Response: Dear GdayUSAAustralia,  We can't thank you enough for contacting us and giving us the opportunity to assure you that your stay with us would be an enjoyable one.   You are correct; responding to our guests' needs and valuing their feedback is very important to us, as we are constantly focused on making each experience with us a memorable one!  We are thrilled to hear that yours was exactly that!   We appreciate all of your great compliments on our service, accommodations and location and look forward to your return!  Best wishes to you and your family Downunder in the new year!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We had a reasonable stay at the portofino - the kids liked the bunk beds. The accommodations were fine, nothing fancy, but no real complaints.  There was no service to speak of, just check in and check out... An acceptable option as it was within walking distance of Disneyland, and we weren't really planning to use the hotel for anything but sleeping.  I wouldn't choose to stay there if it wasn't within walking distance of Disneyland, but that is because I prefer to stay at hotels that are a little more upscale.   However, I was happy to find that it was clean.  It suited our purposes well for this trip.
Manager Response: Dear DRLMM,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review.  We are glad that you were had a nice stay and that you appreciated our affordable rates and location; however, we are disappointed that we did not exceed your expectations.  Thank you for your compliments and recommendation of our property.  We look forward to making your next stay with us a memorable one!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary: Here is my issue.  I read all of the reviews before I booked the room.  Great location.  Very nice staff.  Some of the reviews were suspect.  However, the hotel was quick to counteract the criticism.  I took that as a positive.  I get that I am not staying at a 5 star, however, I expect my room to be clean.  We got in after driving for a day, and I said to my kids not to touch anything.....hair on the bathroom floor that wasn't ours.  Clearly not clean.  TV dusty, marks and stains on the nightstand.  Well, we powered through Disney for a few days.  I was thinking that it was just me.  We got back on the 4th night and my son's face painting stains were still on the sheets.  It was 8 at night and they were both sleeping.  I just knew everything was nasty even before we got there.
Manager Response: Dear lilbudda,  We sincerely apologize for not exceeding your expectations during your recent stay with us.  It is, most definitely, reasonable for you to expect your room to be spotless, regardless of our affordable rate, and it is our standard practice to provide you with exactly that and much more.  We truly are sorry for this inconvenience and appreciate your time in completing the review on our property.  Your feedback is always important to us, as our main focus is delivering an enjoyable experience for each of our guests.  We hope you do decide to give us another opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location and Room Size for Our Group
Summary: We recently stayed at Portofino Suites for my daughter's birthday with three of her teen friends. The kids suite was a great set up, with the double bunk beds and a pull out sofa bed. The french screen divider between two rooms also gave a sense of privacy. It's a great location to everything. We walked to Anaheim Garden Walk and shopped - and we walked to Disneyland, too. The internet pricing was a great deal, too. I would definitely choose this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear vegasmiss,  So happy to hear that your family and your daughter's teen friends enjoyed staying with us!  We are so pleased that the kids suite worked out great for your group.  The french screen divider is always nice to have when seeking a bit of privacy.  As you wrote in your review, we are located close to everything!  Being able to walk to all of the nearby attractions is always a much appreciated convenience to our guests.  Thank you for choosing us to be a part of your daughter's birthday celebration and for completing the review on our property.  It's great to hear that you and your family will definitely choose to stay with us again.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Great location and the staff at the front desk could not do enough for us, we were very pleasantly surprised as the price was a bargain but the service etc. was excellent. We stayed 10 days and had a great time. Thankyou Portofino.
Manager Response: Dear Aussie_Traveller38,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent 10 day visit.  As you mentioned, our affordable rates are quite a bargain and our customer service is second to none!  Thank you so very much for your excellent customer service rating and for noting that our front desk staff could not do enough for you.  It is always our pleasure to exceed our guests' expectations!  Once again, thank you for staying with us and completing the online review on our property.  We appreciate your valued feedback and are happy to hear you will be back!  Best Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: A Magical Trip to the Magic Kingdom
Summary: One block from Disneyland in Anaheim lies the Portofino Inn & Suites. While the 2 minute walk to Downtown Disney and the two amusement parks make it worth the low price alone, it is the rooms and staff service that make it a must. The "Kids Suites" are a must for a Family stay - two rooms separated by a sliding glass door, with a huge Queen (or was it a King?) for the adults and bunk beds AND a pull out couch in the kids room. Plus there is a TV in each room (no need to watch their cartoons) a fridge, microwave and kid size table with stools. On the 20+ times we have stayed there, our kids have had a blast. Now with one aged 5 and another almost 2, we can settle them down for the night in their room, and relax with a bottle of bubbly in our own, while watching a new release
Manager Response: Dear sbpchapman,  While we know and love all of the wonderful things about our property that make it the best in the business, it is always so exciting to hear those words from our guests!  We can't thank you enough for always choosing to stay with us and all of your great compliments on our property.   It is also extremely rewarding to hear that while staying with us you are treated like royalty and that you are given the best 5 star treatment you have ever received!  It is simply our pleasure to give you the customer service you deserve.  It truly is.  Our guests are most definitely the most important people here and we enjoy treating you as such.  Once again, thank you for your outstanding comments and for completing the review on our hotel.  We are so glad that you had a magical trip to the Magic Kingdom and we look forward to being a part of the next one!  Warm Regards,  Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Stayed with three young kids in Kid's Suite.  Within walking distance to Disneyland, but on second day decided to take ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) instead because feet are tired after walking around Disneyland all day.  ART bus stop is right in front of hotel.  PROS:  Friendly staff, Free WIFI, good location, close to Disneyland, in-room microwave and fridge, double sink, housekeeping was okay  CONS: Expected larger room, but instead was a standard room just divided by sliding doors, room furnishings/bedspeads were old, small pool, limited parking (fills up quick), no continental breakfast (most hotels around the area offer some sort of breakfast)  Overall, the hotel and room was okay.  Our kids loved the bunk beds.  Besides that, just expected the room to be bigger for
Manager Response: Dear tresangeles,  We would like to thank you for choosing to stay with us and giving us your feedback on your experience with us.  We loved hearing about the great things you enjoyed about our hotel; however, we certainly appreciate all of your comments and suggestions, as we are constantly striving to make our guests' experience a memorable and enjoyable one.  We do hope you and your family decide to visit again in the future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel That Is Close To Disneyland
Summary: I have a family of 5 and finding accomodation in Anaheim was a bit of a hard ask, especially with two special needs kids.   Price was excellent, the hotel is an easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  Beds very comfortable however pillows were terrible.  Stayed in the kids suite which is a single room that is divided in two via a sliding french door, this room was more than adequate for the 5 family members (only wish that they could add privacy curtains between the partition).  Stayed at the hotel for 7 days at which time had to complete some washing.   Whilst they do have laundry facility one of the two units did not work with the remainding unit in dire need of repairs. Staff where excellent, courteous and when called upon to fix a air conditioning problem with the room was
Manager Response: Dear marshqld,  We would like to thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent 7 day family trip to the Anaheim area and for completing the review on our property.  It is so great to hear that you and your family enjoyed our accommodations, location and affordable rates!  Thank you for your compliments on our excellent and courteous staff.  It is our pleasure to provide you with friendly and efficient customer service and appreciate your call to our front desk making us aware of the assistance needed with your air conditioner.   Also, we appreciate your suggestions noted in your review.  They have been taken seriously as we are continuously focused on providing our guests the very best experience they can enjoy.  Again, thank you for your feedback and your high recommendation of our hotel.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I went to Disneyland for my birthday with my husband & our toddler son. I had previously booked another hotel but after reading some reviews of  having bedbugs made me leery to stay there.
