I read all the reviews both positive & negative of the Portofino and the positives out weighed the negatives. And boy am I happy I booked my room with them.!!!:O) The front desk was friendly & helpful.  The room was clean though we had the view of the parking lot but guess what I didn't come to Anaheim for a view if  I wanted a view I go to Hawaii.  Our window was near the street but with the window shut we didn't  hear the traffic. This isn't the Ritz-Carlton but a nice modest CLEAN hotel.My main purpose was to sleep and rest  for my toddler.  D*I*S*N*E*Y*L*A*N*D was only a 10 minute stroll I
Manager Response: Dear mikeysmommy07,  What a wonderful review on our property!  Thank you so very much for taking the time to give us, as well as other travelers, your feedback on your experience with us.  It's great to hear that you and your family are so happy about choosing to stay with us.  As you mentioned, the 10 minute stroll to Disneyland from our property certainly makes our location an exciting place to be!  Also, thank you for your compliments on our complimentary computer use with internet access in our lobby.  We are really pleased that our guests enjoy this convenience.  Again, thank you for completing the review on our hotel and for choosing to stay with us again on your next visit!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This hotel was very close to disneyland, with many transportation options. The rooms were nice, bunkbeds were great. A little smaller than I thought but enough room. The front desk left a lot to be desired. They were not very informative and did not have any organization(took people in front of me and I was next for checkin). Room was clean and housekeeping was good. Also, the price quoted booking directly with the hotel was 109 a night and the actual rate (taxes etc) was 136. What a ripoff. They also charged my card for a temporary auth for $60 more than the 3 nights for incidentals! I was told, just in case.Imagine when I saw this on my online banking. They said they would credit me back the amount when I left. Next time I'll use a credit card instead of my bankcard. You never
Manager Response: Dear bamafanrenate,  We apologize for the miscommunication you experienced at our front desk.  We most definitely would have assisted you first had we known the guests in front you were out of turn.  We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our accommodations and that the bunk beds worked out great for your family.  As you mentioned, we are located very close to Disneyland; however, there are several transportation options.  One option that is convenient and well liked by many guests is the Anaheim Resort Transit.  For a nominal fee, this shuttle will pick you up at our hotel and take you to Disneyland Resort's main entrance. They will also transport you back whenever you are ready and drop you off steps away from our property.  Keep this in mind for your next visit.  Thank you for completing the review on our hotel and for choosing to stay with us.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Five of us spent one night at Portofino Anaheim so we'd be close to Disneyland as we did a walkathon very early the next morning.  There were 3 adults and 2 teenaged boys.  The boys slept in the bunk beds, 1 adult in the bed, and 2 adults on the sleep sofa.  The rooms were divded by a sliding semi-paned door for privacy which we never used.  We paid in the vicinity of $186 including tax and using the Entertainment Book as a discount.  Divided by 5 people it was fine.  The gift shop had lots of snacks, Disney items, postcards, and some toiletries.  Bottled water was only 99 cents and it was 20oz I think.  The room was clean. The bathroom was a good size with a sink in a separate area.   The only complaints are the elevator had no ac or ventilation and the halls were hot.  It
Manager Response: Dear LisaKB,  Thank you for staying with us and for completing the review.  It's great to hear that you and your family enjoyed staying with us during your visit for a very early morning walkathon.  We're glad you found the convenient shop handy and affordable for snacks, postcards and toiletries.  We also appreciate your suggestions, as we are committed to our 100% Guest Satisfaction Signature Service Program and are dedicated to providing a hotel experience that all of our guests will enjoy.  Thanks again for choosing to stay at our property.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: Everyone has their own opinion but thought I'd share mine. We had a KID SUITE.  You can constantly hear other DOORS SLAMMING SHUT. If it got stuffy in the room we used the VERY LOUD AIR CONDITIONER.  In the middle of the night it would kick on and be EVEN LOUDER!! The BED WAS WAY TOO SOFT, PILLOWS WERE LIKE PAPER, and the BEDDING WAS OLD. The BATHROOM FLOOR was yuck, so had to walk on towels. BATHTUB drained slow. My daughter said the PULL OUT BED in the other room was AWFUL but the kids bunk beds were convenient. Although the window didn't open very much, there was NO SCREEN on it and it was IN THE KIDS ROOM! We were 5 floors up!! Place DIDN"T FEEL CLEAN.  If you're use to decent places.....you wouldn't like this one!
Manager Response: Dear sactofb,  We are extremely sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations during your recent stay with us.  We were disappointed to hear that you did not find our new pillow top mattress to be of your liking.  We have received such positive feedback on our new mattresses; however, we certainly understand how some of our guests’ mattress preference may differ.  Our bunk beds are always enjoyed by our younger guests and we’re glad to hear they were convenient for your family.  Our windows should only open 4-5 inches. Our housekeeping and engineering staff have been notified and will double check all of our windows. Thank you for completing the review on our property.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Grandmother, Two Kids and Mom and Dad, Great Place
Summary: This is a great place to stay if you have an odd number of people......my mother took my two kids, myselaf and husband to Disney for the week. THis was perfect for us. Disney is not about the hotel....we were in the room to sleep and eat. The room could use basic maintenance and paint repairs, but for the money you can't beat it!
Manager Response: Dear ChristiniaZ,  Thank you for completing the online review for our property.  We're glad to hear that our accommodations and amenities were perfect for your whole family!  Thank you for your feedback and suggestions, as we continue our efforts in making your experience here the very best!  We couldn't agree with you more; our affordable rates make it hard to beat!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: My family and I stayed at Portofino Inn and Suites for one week. The kids 4 and 6  loved the bunk beds! The pool was on the small side, but we just popped in next door to use the adjacent hotel's pool when the pool was full, (it's allowed) but that only happened once. The customer service is top notch, and housekeeping was fantastic! It's close to everything, and a quick walk to Disneyland. We would book this place when we go back to Disneyland. You can't beat it.
Manager Response: Dear selina95,  Thank you for detailing your experience by completing the review on our property.  We appreciate all of the wonderful compliments and are so very happy that you and your family enjoyed your one week stay with us.  Glad to hear our bunk beds were a hit!  It's always nice when the entire family has something great to say about their visit with us!  We truly appreciate your top notch rating on our customer service.  It is always our sincere pleasure to assist you in any way we possibly can to ensure that your stay is an enjoyable one!  Again, thank you for your great comments on our accommodations, amenities and location.  We agree; you just can't beat it!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: We loved our stay at Portofinos and do not have a bad thing to say about it. We had a kids suite and it had plenty of room for the 4 of us, the price was fantastic, and the pool great enjoyment for the kids. The bed was extremely comfortable. It is in a great location, close to Disneyland, restaurants and a variety of shops. I loved the little gift shop it had, it was handy to just pop down to it if we needed anything.  Would recommend it to anyone, especially those with families.
Manager Response: Dear matcatps3,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the Anaheim area. We are so happy that you loved our property and that you and your family had such a comfortable and enjoyable time with us.  It truly is great being located so close to what is known as the happiest place on earth!  The short walk to Disneyland is always enjoyed by our guests.  The convenience of having several restaurants and shops nearby is definitely a plus too!  Thank you for completing the review on our property and for recommending our hotel to other travelers.  We hope you come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice little hotel, with extra fun family rooms!
Summary: We were upgraded to the kids suite, and it made me want my kids to be with us.  The room was fun with bunk beds and a room divider.  When we come back with kids we will look up this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear TM_2006,  Our Kids Suite is most definitely the ideal suite for any family!   Your kids will certainly enjoy the layout that was designed especially for a family such as yours.  The separate rooms, additional amenities and bunk beds make it comfortable and enjoyable for everyone.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review on our property. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit.!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: The hotel was great for families with small children.  We stayed in a family suite and had lots of room for all of us.  The kids enjoyed the pool and liked having bunk beds to sleep in.  The proximity to Disneyland was a plus as well.
Manager Response: Dear Sonni68,  It is always so great for all of our staff to hear how much the kids enjoyed our Kids Suite.  The bunk beds, activity table and chairs and extra space of their own always makes our younger guests comfortable and happy!  Yes, you are definitely correct: being so close to Disneyland is an added bonus for everyone!  Thank you for completing the review on our property and for sharing your experience with other travelers.  We look forward to accommodating you and your family again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel!  Will Definitely Stay Again!
Summary: Our travel family was myself, my husband, 1 year old daughter, and my older sister.  We stayed for 3 nights after a not-so-great 4 night stay in San Diego.  I had heard some "iffy" reviews of this hotel but booked it anyway and am so glad we did!  We stayed in a Deluxe Double room and it was perfect for us.  Lots of space, clean, bright, and a nice balcony with a view of Disney's California Adventure!  This hotel is a quick 5-10 minute walk from the main entrance of Disneyland.  There are a couple convenience stores between the hotel & Disneyland that we were able to get some water and breakfast at each day.  This hotel looked a lot more 'put together' and well kept than many of the other hotels close to Disneyland and the staff was very helpful and always there whenever we
Manager Response: Dear GottaLuvMickey,  We are so happy to hear that you will visit us often!  Thank you so very much for all of the great compliments on our customer service, spacious and clean accommodations, and convenient location.   We are always happy to assist you in any way we can and are glad to hear that we were helpful and available whenever you needed anything.  Please accept our apology for the wrappers, etc. that you found under your bed.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention so that we may notify the appropriate team members.  We appreciate your time in giving us your feedback and completing the review on our property.  Come visit us again soon!  Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This was a very odd hotel room.  It was dark and we felt as if we were in a cave.  I requested two double beds and got a king and a bunk bed.  Very strange.    I won't be back.
Manager Response: Dear Cybermama,  We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.  Upon your arrival, we were unable to check you into the room you requested which is the reason you were upgraded to a Kids Suite.  Again, we are sorry for the inconvenience.  We do hope you will reconsider and stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary: We just came back from Anaheim.  I was there for a conference, and my family came along to go to Disneyland while I was working.  There is nothing really fancy about the hotel, but a couple of things really stood out for me.  The service was awesome.  The girls at the front desk took care of our every need, and the housekeeping staff did a great job in ensuring we had all that we needed in the room.  We stayed in a Kids Suite room with the bunk beds, microwave, fridge, TV and couch for the kids.  The king bed that we slept in way awesome.  Very comfortable, and I had a great night sleep every night.  My wife used her Government ID to get a discount on the room rate, and I was pleasently surprised at the price, compared to some of the larger hotels in the area.  The pool was
Manager Response: Dear ScottyYEdmonton,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent 10 day visit to the Anaheim area. We appreciate all of the wonderful compliments in your review and your time in detailing several things that really stood out for you.  We are ecstatic to hear that our service is awesome!  Delivering a high level of customer service to our guests is a very important focus for each of our staff members, and it is always great to hear we're doing our job right!  It is also great to hear that you enjoyed your Kids Suite and that you had a great night's sleep every night.  There's nothing better than waking up feeling rested, especially when you are traveling.  Also, thank you for your suggestions in regard to our fitness center.  We truly value all of your feedback.  Again, thank you for completing the review on the Portofino Inn and Suites.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary Heading: Loved the Portofino - sad to leave!!
Summary: My sister and I travelled to Anaheim from Canada for two week stay in Anaheim for one of which we stayed at the Portofino.  After our travel agent booked the Portofino, we started to become more apprehensive about our stay as we read some poor reviews, but our vouchers were non-refundable, so we decided to make our own assessments upon experiencing the place.  Our first impression of the Portofino was the outside courtyard and the lobby - both of which were beautiful and reiterated why we wanted to vacation in California.  At check-in we met a wondeful lady by the name of Claudia at the front desk.  She was very efficient, and also helped us out with the basic info - how far was Disneyland, shopping, where the pool was and the hours, etc.  Claudia also helped us out with the
Manager Response: Dear cdnlilac,  We truly appreciate all of your wonderful compliments on our property and are delighted that you and your sister enjoyed your  two week experience with us!  It is always our pleasure to assist our guests in any way we can to ensure that their stay is a memorable one.  Thank you for detailing your interactions with our front desk staff member and commenting on her efficient and friendly service you received throughout your stay.  We are also pleased to hear that you found some time to enjoy our heated pool and hot tub.  Please keep in mind for your next visit that all of our guests are also welcome to use the larger pool located right next door at the Jolly Roger Inn.  We certainly appreciate your time in completing the review and recommendation of our property to other travelers.  We hope you will both decide to visit us again soon!  Warm Regards, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary Heading: A little overpriced, but enjoyed it anyway
Summary: This was my second visit to the Portofino (first 8/08) and I found the experience consistent from first to second visit.  The rooms were clean and quiet, the staff very friendly and helpful.  The ART shuttle stops just a few yards from the hotel, so multiple trips to Disneyland throughout the day are easy.  I couldn't access the free WI-FI from my room, but the hotel provides a computer in the lobby for the use of guests.  The swimming pool is small, but adequate, and usually filled with screaming kids, though my room (1127), right off the pool area, was quiet.  The Portofino is a good B+ hotel, well-located with patient and informed staff.
Manager Response: Dear zlatarifka,  Thank you so very much for choosing to stay with us again!  We appreciate all of your compliments on our patient and informed staff, clean and quiet rooms and convenient location.  The ART shuttle is definitely the optimum choice for anyone looking to make multiple trips to Disneyland throughout the day.  Unlimited rides daily for a minimal fee is a great deal, especially when the pick up/drop off spot is just steps away from our hotel!  Our guests are also welcomed to use the larger pool located right next door at the Jolly Roger Inn, so keep this in mind for your next visit.  Thank you for completing the review on our property.  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us.  Come visit again soon!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Lobby was nicer than the room--Very friendly service
Summary: I usually stay at the Double Tree Suites when I am in the Anaheim area (whether it's a family trip to Disneyland or to attend a Convention at the Convention Center). The reviews and photos of the Portofino looked pretty nice, so I thought I'd give it a try.  The photos of the lobby give you the impression that the rooms are just as nice...they're not. In fact, the room was smaller than what I thought it would be and a bit on the dark & dingy side, needing to be updated...nothing beyond average.   The staff were very friendly at the Front Desk and check-in was quick and easy. I really liked the complimentary coffee they had in the lobby. The room was a bit overpriced for what you get. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again, unless they renovated the rooms.
Manager Response: Dear azroxie,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We apologize for not exceeding your expectations; however, we appreciate all of your kind remarks regarding our very friendly staff and are glad to hear that your check-in was quick and easy.  We also appreciate your suggestions, as we are constantly striving to deliver an experience all of our guests will truly enjoy.  Also, thank you for noting that you would recommend our hotel.  We do hope to see you again!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: I booked a room at the Portofino Inn a while back because of the Kid Suites and price.  After scouring forums and reviews, I was *very* apprehensive by the time our trip arrived. I also wrote a few things about planning to stay at the Portofino on the TA Anaheim forums, and received several private messages not-so-gently suggesting that I stay elsewhere. After my stay this past week at the Portofino, I can only assume that the haters out there are sitting at the front desks of competing hotels, because we had a GREAT stay! Checked in Wednesday evening, into a Kid Suite.  Check in was smooth, the parking lot was small but convenient, the lobby looks great, and people were friendly. Our room was in the Venice tower, 5th floor, room 2523.  The Kid Suite was perfect for us.  I would
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were blown away by the service we received at the Portofino. The Staff were very knowledgeable and kind. They told us all about the ART system and gave us a map of  the area to show us other fun things to do. They even told us what time and channel our favorite TV show was on. The pool was big enough, clean and heated. Our room was very clean and we loved the kids suite.  It is close to restaurants, shopping and Disneyland. The little store was great for snacks and water everyday on the way to the park.   It was an outstanding trip and that was partly due to the great time we had at the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear travelsavymom,  We truly appreciate all of your wonderful compliments on our great service, accommodations and amenities!  It is always exciting to hear when our guests take the time to share details of an outstanding trip after staying with us.  It was our pleasure to make such an impression on you with our kind and knowledgeable customer service, clean and spacious kids suite and all of our great amenities you mentioned in your review.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the online review for our property.  We look forward to your family's next visit!  Best Regards, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary: This facility is hot, the air conditioner in the room sounds like a train, the pool is the size of a postage stamp. They share the pool with another nearby hotel that they also own. If there is a shuttle to Disneyland-- (which they don't mention on check in) I saw it posted in the elevator that they charge $4 per person each day.  There is no continental breakfast either. Beds also are not pillow top.  They charge a premium for the room with few if any amenities.  The towel are scratchy and even the kleenex is like rubbing sandpaper on your face.  I intended to stay for 5 days but cut my reservation short due to the above.
Manager Response: Dear otheroadagain1952,  We are extremely sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations during your recent stay with us.  There are two pools that our guests are welcome to use; one on our property as well as a larger one located right next door to us at the Jolly Roger Inn.  We apologize for not informing you upon check in as to how the local ART shuttle operates.  This shuttle will transport you (unlimited ride per day) throughout the Disneyland resort area for a small fee.  Although, there is signage posted in our lobby that we sell both Art shuttle and Disney tickets, we have reviewed with our front desk staff to ask each guest at check in if they need to purchase any.  Thank you for all of your feedback and for choosing to stay with us during your recent visit to the Anaheim area.  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave

Summary: Pros:  distance to Disneyland, my kids loved their "own room" , bathroom was most updated area of the hotel/room, clean, staff was helpful to tourists Cons:  one word--RENOVATE!, carpets are stained and shabby, wallpaper torn, room furniture beaten up  I must say that my most important concern is that my room is clean.  I don't want to go to bed thinking bugs are crawling into my shoes!  The room was clean and the bathroom shower was actually better compared to a beautiful major name hotel we had just stayed in in San Diego.  However, the only area that is nice in the entire hotel is the Lobby.  Everything is in desperate need of renovation.  I would not book this hotel again because there are so many nearby competitors.  My kids--who look at the world differently--loved their
Manager Response: Dear ginacope,  Thank you for completing the review on our property. We do apologize for not exceeding your expectations; however, we were pleased to hear that you enjoyed our location and our customer service.  Thank you for your compliments on our clean accommodations and our shower.  It's nice to hear it was better than one you experienced in a major brand name hotel you stayed at .  We appreciate all of your feedback and suggestions.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for giving your kids the opportunity to enjoy our Kids Suite.  The additional TV is definitely one of the great amenities that make it all worthwhile!  Sincerely, Beckley Van Cleave, General Manager

Summary Heading: Portofino should be ashamed of themselves
Summary: Just stayed here for 5 nights in a king/kids suite. The place smelled so bad especially the first floor near the laundry room. I am talking BAD- diapers/mold/vomit smell. I had read a review just prior to arriving and was somewhat worried. Saw them spraying air freshener everywhere upon arrival to cover the smell. This smell was there for 5 days and didn't go away. Not to mention our kids suite didn't have a single vent in it or any windows that even open. It was a sauna for our kids. Way more dated than their pictures show. Sheets came off our beds every single night and who wants to snuggle with a hotel mattress? Housekeeping was a zero. First day crumbs on floor upon arrival, next day no sheets on my bed, next day no wash cloths, next day no bath mat and soap. This was after
Manager Response: Dear citygirlinsuburbia,  We are sincerely sorry for any inconvenience your experienced during your recent stay with us.  It is certainly disappointing to hear that we did not exceed your expectations.  Your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we appreciate your time in completing the review for our property.  Your comments have been taken seriously and every effort has been made to address them accordingly.  We hope you will reconsider and give us the opportunity to accommodate you again in the future.  It would be our pleasure to assist you in any way we possibly can to ensure your stay is an enjoyable one!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: I took 12 girl scouts that spent their hardearned cookie money for a day at Disneyland and a sleep over in your hotel.  I will list the pros and cons.  Pros first:  within walking distance to Disneyland, staff very nice.    Cons:  Check in time was 3:00 PM one of our rooms was not ready until after 4:00PM.  Reserved two two bedroom suites with two full bathrooms, received one two bedroom suite with two full bathrooms and one two bedroom suite with one bathroom.  Toilet overflowed in the room with one bathroom, but service was quick to fix.  Slow service at the pool to restock towels.  On website hotel looks complete different not as new and fresh.
Manager Response: Dear GIRLS5915,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent visit to the Anaheim area and for taking the time to complete the review on our property.  We appreciate your compliments on our quick and efficient customer service and are glad that you enjoyed our convenient location.  Please accept our apology for the delay in your room being available at check in and also for the mix up of one of your suites only having one bathroom.  We are truly sorry for any inconvenience this caused you and your group.  Again, thank you for your feedback.  All of your comments have been noted and taken seriously as we are continuously striving to deliver the very best experience our guests can enjoy.  We hope you will reconsider and give us the opportunity to accommodate you in the future.  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: Stayed 3 nights, best thing about it was the price/location ( 10min walk to Disney ).  7-11 just across the street and some food joints for quick snack.  Hotel slightly run down and can be noisy due to the thin walls.  Higher floors @ the kid suite could see the nightly fireworks.  Good service from front desk.
Manager Response: Dear mklee,  Thank you for your compliments on our rates, location and customer service.  Delivering superior customer service to all of our guests is extremely important to us.  We appreciate all of your feedback and are so happy to read that you would recommend us to a friend.  As you mentioned, we are a short walk to the Park, as well as centrally located to shops and several restaurants in the area.  Thank you for your time in completing the review on our property and for choosing to stay with us.  We hope you to see you again soon!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Kids suites are laid out excellently
Summary: Interesting to see the mixed reviews.  I speak as I find and I found excellent.  We stopped in a kid's suite, the layout of which was excellent for those travelling with up to four young children.  No extra cost for adjoining rooms, but a bit of separation for parents and kids (a TV in each of the rooms).  I suggest you look at hotel's own website for a description of the kid's suites.  Room was clean (no odd smells), A/C was always on, plenty of towels etc.  Pool a little small/busy but very well located/maintained - in any case, apparently there is free access to pool at adjoining Jolly Roger Motel.  Microwave and fridge clean and worked well - both v.useful as no restaurant (not even breakfast room) on site.  Less than 15 minutes walk to Disneyland gates (with tired kids -
Manager Response: Dear LingfieldGambler,  We are so thrilled to hear that you found are property to be excellent! Thank you for all of your wonderful compliments and for taking the time to share your experience with other travelers.  Your valued feedback is extremely important to us as we are continuously striving to deliver the very best experience our guests can enjoy!  Thank you for all of your kind words regarding our Kids Suites.  They were designed with a family such as yours in mind and our design team really didn't miss a single detail.  As you mentioned, excellent accommodations, great location and an affordable rate; that is hard to beat!   We also appreciate your suggestions and will address each of them accordingly.  Again, thank you for completing the review on our property.  We hope you come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: This hotel was booked for the location, which was great.  The rooms were spacious but very unclean.  Entering the room, a moldy smell came rushing at us and we felt wet from the humid rooms.  The house keeping turned off our ac every morning leaving it hot and smelly every time we returned.  I put on white socks after a shower and climbed into bed to find the bottom of my socks black!!!  I hope it wasn't mold...
Manager Response: Dear krumzis,  We appreciate your time in completing the review for our property.  We were glad to read that you found your room to be spacious and that you enjoyed our great location.  Please accept our apology for any inconvenience you experienced during your stay.  We encourage all of our guests to please bring any matter at all to our attention so that it gives us the opportunity to resolve the issue while you are still staying with us.  It is our pleasure to assist in absolutely any way we can to ensure that you enjoy your visit with us.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and giving us your feedback.  Sincerely eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Great suite, great location, great value - but spoilt by noisy guests
Summary: We stayed in a kids suite for three nights as a 'Disneyland' stopover on the way from UK to New Zealand.  Kids loved the bunk room, and we found the french doors gave us space and privacy we like.  No 'bad smells' noticed and our bed was certainly comfortable.  Best bit was that it was a 'real' 10 min walk to Disneyland, so kids (9 and 11) and parents walked this easily there and back.  Hotel reception friendly and helpful and the pool was fine (OK it's not big, but was fine for a quick dip after hot day at Disneyland).  Only suite gripe would be lack of 'real' china/glassware - not keen on drinking coffee from paper cups, and a couple of glasses would be nice, but minor niggles really.  Am sorry to say the main problem was the late night corridor noise.  First night seemed to
Manager Response: Dear WindyKiwi,  We are so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed our Kids Suite!  The spacious floor plan, separated rooms and comfy beds are certainly ideal for families such as yours.  Thank you for your note on our location.  As you mentioned, we truly are a very short walk to the main gates of the park, as well as several other Anaheim attractions.  We are sorry to hear of the inconvenience you experienced during your stay.  Most of our late check in guests are extremely courteous and mindful of the late hour; however, there are times when families are very anxious and excited to get checked in, get to their room and unwind.  We apologize for any disturbance and have taken all of your suggestions seriously.  Thank you for your time in completing the review for our property.  We value your feedback and appreciate your compliments.  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: This hotel met every expectation and beyond.
Summary: I have stayed at many hotels with my family while growing up. This was mine and my friends first trip by ourselves, and the first time staying in a hotel without our families. We chose this hotel because of its convenient proximity to Disneyland. The staff was incredibly helpful and very kind. We had a problem with our toilet not flushing, and not even five minutes after speaking to the front desk, we had someone at our room to fix it. The rooms were comfortable and we had plenty of space (and that's saying something when you have a group of girls). In regards to other reviews here, we never experienced any smell, we didn't have any problems with other guests being loud, and our room was very clean. We had an incredible stay here, and we are making our Disneyland trip an annual
Manager Response: Dear TheatreNerd08,  First of all, thank you for choosing to stay at the Portofino Inn for your very first hotel stay without your family!  Also, thank you for completing the review and for all of the wonderful compliments on our staff and accommodations.  We certainly appreciate you pointing out how incredibly helpful and kind our staff is.  It really means so very much to all of us, especially from someone who has stayed at many hotels.  We are so happy that your experience was a comfortable and enjoyable one.  We're looking forward to accommodating you and exceeding your expectations each time you and your friends visit the Anaheim area!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Disappointed,  better values found elsewhere in this neighborhood
Summary: On our first trip to Disneyland, about 4 years ago, we stayed in the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Disneyland, and I was very pleased with the quality of the room and the service. We visited Disneyland about 2 years ago, and stayed at the Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel, and again was very pleased with the quality of the room and the service. The difference in price booking through Disney, between Disney's Paradise Pier Hotel and the Portofino was quite a bit, and it appeared the family suites were pretty nice, (On the Disneyland website the Portofino looked pretty nice, alot nicer than the one we stayed in). We were very disappointed in the room quality.  The first room we checked into had problems with the door that divided the main room with the kids section. We were offered another
Manager Response: Dear Philosophyguru,  Thank you for sharing your experience with other travelers.  We have read all of your comments and are truly saddened that we did not meet all of your expectations.  While we were glad that we were able to move you into a room where the divider door was operating correctly, we are sorry to hear that you were not completely satisfied.  We do recognize your note that nothing major was wrong, however, one of our top priorities is to ensure that each of our guests enjoys their experience with us.  Please know that it is our sincere pleasure to assist you in any way we can to make your stay with us a memorable one.    Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us and for completing the review.  We hope you decide to stay with us in the future.  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: My family and I stayed 10 nights at the Portinfio. I use Trip Advisory as a reference when I am staying at a hotel I have never stayed at. I will give the pros and cons.   Pros: Close to Disneyland and restaurants: We walked to Disneyland and ate at the local restaurants. Very easy walk.   Front Desk: Nice and freindly.   Parking: Easy parking and no parking fee.   Cons;  Smell: We stayed on the 5th floor in a suite. The smell was terrible. Smelled like a spoilded diaper. We thought it would go away. It never did!!!  Run Down: The hotel rooms are run down and dirty. Needs a renovation. The elevators had graffiti and the security door from outside does not lock. You do not need a key to get into the hotel due to the door broken.  My remote did not work on the tv. Service person
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 8 nights, went to Disney for 6 days.  With 3 kids 6 & under, we need more space than a single room, so the kid's suites were ideal.  The older kids loved the bunk beds, cot was fine for the toddler.  Lots of drawers for keeping clothes in etc, and a little table for the kids to sit at (too small if they are over 10 I suspect). We walked to Disney each day, takes about 10 min to the main entrance, never bothered with the shuttle as I expect it's probably quicker to walk.  Would be a bit far if you planned to walk back to your hotel multiple times a day, but we stayed at the park at least 12 hours each day (lots of walking there!) so what's another 10 min at each end? Staff were friendly and helpful, including letting us check in at 10am which was much appreciated
Manager Response: Dear DCSCL,  What an impressive review!  We really can't thank you enough for taking the time to detail your experience with us for other travelers to read.  There's no doubt your extensive review will help others that are inquiring about our property.  Thank you very much for all of the wonderful comments on our friendly staff, location, Kids Suites and overall amenities.    Our Kids Suites are definitely the best choice for any family looking for a suite that was designed specifically with them in mind.  The bunk beds in a separate room is always a kid favorite!  We certainly appreciate your compliment that our staff is friendly and helpful.  It is always so rewarding to read positive feedback on something that  is so very important to us; delivering superior customer service to each of our guests!  Again, thank you for your review and also for your suggestion.  We hope you and your family will be back to visit soon!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: We stayed at the Portofino three nights and had a wonderful experience!  It is right across from a 7-11 so we were able to restock on snacks when needed since we had a refrigerator and microwave.  This was convenient.  Also, we did walk to Disneyland and California Adventure.  We aren't in the best shape, but the walk was great.  The front desk person was very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear radoki,  Thank you for taking the time to complete the review.  We certainly appreciate all of the great compliments, but, most importantly, we are so happy that you had a wonderful experience!  It is always exciting to hear of guests that love our property just as much as we do!  Glad to hear that you also enjoyed the short walk over to Disneyland!  We agree with you:  our location is not only convenient to all of the tourist attractions, but we are very close to stores and several restaurants.  Again, thank you for your feedback and for choosing to stay with us!  We look forward to accommodating you again.  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: I was really looking forward to a nice hotel after reading the reviews, but I was dissapointed with our stay.  Our room was not comfortable and the bedding was quite worn.  The worst part was the noise.  You could hear everything in the halls, there is a gap under the door and people were so loud outside the rooms.  We have 2 little ones that need naps and people were singing and just talking normal but it was really loud in our room.  Also the kid suite only had a sheer curtain and glass that serperated us from the kids so they could see and hear us up and moving around which kept them up.  I would not reccomend getting the shuttle to disneyland, it's a short walk.  We had the pass but only used it 2 times.  One time my husband walked back to the room with my son and I took the
Manager Response: Dear sonotechsusan,  We are so sorry to hear about your incident on the Anaheim Resort Transit.  As you mentioned, we are such a very short walk to the front entrance of the park; however, a lot of families  still choose to take the shuttle because it is so convenient.  We are also sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your stay and of the noise you experienced in the hallway.  Sometimes just being so close to all of the Anaheim attractions there is a lot of excitement in the air, which may not work well with little ones in need of a nap.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent visit to the Anaheim area and for completing the online review.  We appreciate your business and your feedback.  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: The Only Review You Need To Read
Summary: We stayed at this hotel over Memorial Day weekend.  We have three kids, so we opted for the Kids Suite which had a separate bedroom with a bunk bed and sofa sleeper.  The day before our stay, I read some of the reviews of this hotel - the ones that gave it 5 stars and the ones that gave it 1 star, so I went into this with the intention of writing my own review and keeping a lookout for some of the things that I had read.  I'll start off with the negatives.  The outlet plate behind the bed was slightly detached from the wall (I was in room 2517, for the hotel's reference).  No biggie; I found another outlet to plug in my cell phone charger.  When we lifted the mattress on the sofa bed in the kid's room, there was a significant amount of dirt, several coins and a sealed package of
Manager Response: Dear SynthPopLover,  Wow! What a wonderful review!  We truly appreciate all of your time in completing such a detailed review for our property.  Feedback from our guests is so very important to us.  We not only value your business, but we value your opinion too!  We are so happy that you really enjoyed your experience with us.  Our location is not only nearby all of the attractions, but also several restaurants and shopping areas too.  The IHOP directly across the street is definitely appreciated by many of the families that stay with us.  We certainly understand why our Kids Suite was the main reason you chose to stay with us.  There is no doubt, the bunk beds, activity table and separated rooms is the ideal set up for any family.  It is always nice when each member of the family can have their own space in their own room.  It makes for a much  more enjoyable trip for everyone!  Thank you for the few suggestions you posted.  We appreciate them and will definitely forward them to our design dept.  On your next visit, please bring any inconvenience to our attention so that we may have the opportunity to resolve it while you are still staying with us.  No matter how small the matter may be, we want to do anything we can to ensure that you enjoy everything about your stay with us!  Again, thank you for choosing to stay with us. We appreciate you pointing out that there are great deals to be booked by going directly to our hotel website!  We hope you book another visit with us soon!  Best Regards, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights for a Disney trip. In the past we have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn and the Sheraton.  (Would have stayed at the Candy Cane again but they do not guarantee connecting rooms.)  Portofino is right in the middle--more space than Candy Cane, and the bunk bed rooms are fun, but not as nice as the Sheraton in terms of quality.  Also right between Candy Cane and Sheraton in terms of walking distance--which is about 10 minutes to the park. Pros: comfortable beds, refrigerator and microwave in bunk suites, clean. Cons: paper thin walls so you could hear everything in the hallway, *tiny* pool, rooms not significantly bigger than a traditional hotel room. For a true suite, would probably stay at the Residence Inn instead in the future.
Manager Response: Dear MITraveling,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for your review on our property.  As you mentioned, our Kids Suites truly are spacious and comfortable.  We are so glad that you and your family enjoyed our bunk beds.  They really are fun for guests of all ages!   We are also pleased that the refrigerator and microwave were convenient amenities for you.  We appreciate your feedback on your stay and hope that you do decide to visit again.    Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: This was our second hotel of the weekend, the first was not up to our standards. They were very welcoming with our last minute booking which was amazing. The rooms were fairly clean and livable, and my biggest concern is safety, and I felt completely at ease in this hotel! The lock on the patio was a little sketchy, but all in all it was a decent stay for a decent price.
Manager Response: Dear ynb0403,  Thank you for your recent stay with us and for taking the time to complete the review for our property.  Whether you make reservations months in advance or at the last minute, it is always our pleasure to welcome you to our property with warm and friendly customer service.  We're happy to hear that you felt at ease and safe at our property, considering that is one of your biggest concerns while staying at any hotel.  If you did not happen to mention the lock on the patio upon check out, we would very much appreciate it if you would notify us of which room you were staying in so that we can confirm it is attached securely.  Again, thank you for completing the review and for choosing to stay with us during your visit to the Anaheim area.  Best Regards, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Book here in advance and score!
Summary: Our high school was participating in an event at Disneyland and we were lucky enough to know the dates well in advance.  I booked the 2 bedroom suite at the Portofino directly through their website and was able to get an e-special rate of $135.00 per night.  One bedroom (good size) with 1 king and a full bathroom, another bedroom (good size) with 2 queens and a full bathroom....and finally a sitting room complete with a pull out sofabed, microwave, fridge and a table with seating for 4.  There is a TV (3 total) in each room and plenty of space for one large family or in our case, 2 small ones.  We've stayed here once before and were a little concerned, because at that time the rooms were showing lots of wear and tear.  But, this time everything was great from the mattresses on
Manager Response: Dear Footloose39,  We are truly thrilled that you enjoyed your experience with us!  Thank you for all of the wonderful compliments and for detailing your stay for other travelers.  Our Two Bedroom Suite is definitely an ideal choice for a large family or, as you mentioned, two small ones.  We are so glad that you were able to take advantage of our e-special rate too!  The extra space, additional televisions and two full bathrooms certainly make this suite comfortable for any family.  It was also great to hear that you were happy with everything "from the mattresses on down", as well as the suite overall.  Thank you for your compliment on our staff.  It is our pleasure to serve you with friendly and helpful customer service at all times.  Again, thank you for taking the time to complete the review on our property.  We hope you choose to stay with us again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.  Best Regards, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: The Portifino is in agreat position on 10 minute casual work to Disneyland. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. There was very little noise and whilst room was cleaned late in the day it was not an issue with Disneyland taking up most of our time. Bus leave from right acroos the road and returns at the front door for a very small charge if you don't want to walk. Plenty of food places at very reasonable prices. Would recommend this hotel and would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear ozball,  Thank you so much for your time in completing the online review.  We appreciate your feedback and are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  Our Deluxe Rooms truly are spacious, clean and comfortable.  As you mentioned, our location is hard to beat too!  We are a short walk to Disneyland, many of the favorite restaurants in town and several other area attractions.  We certainly appreciate your recommendation of our property.  That really says a lot!  It tells us our guests enjoy their experience here at the Portofino Inn & Suites, and we couldn't ask for anything more!  Again, thank you for your comments and for choosing to stay with us.  We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Great hotel at a great price!
Summary: Our family stayed at the Portofino for 6 nights during spring break.  I was somewhat hesitant to stay at this hotel based on some of the negative reviews I had read, but decided to give it a try since many others had great things to say about this hotel.  I must say, this is a great place to stay for the price. It's about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland gate and there is also an ART bus stop at the hotel if one would rather ride the bus.  Housekeeping staff were fabulous and did a great job on our room everyday.  The only thing to keep in mind is that the queen/king bed rooms do not have a refrigerator.  Next time I will be booking a kids suite that has a fridge.  This hotel is also only one block from the Garden Walk mall where there are many great places to eat including The
Manager Response: Dear tinkgirl40,  Thank you for the great review!  Our entire staff appreciates all of your wonderful compliments!  Delivering superior customer service is always a priority to everyone here at the Portofino Inn & Suites.  It is our pleasure to do anything we can for each and every one of our guests.  Our hotel is literally minutes from almost everything!  We are so glad that you enjoyed some of the local restaurants, as well as the delivery service that several of them offer.  Our guests always appreciate this convenience, especially after a long day at Disneyland.  We would also like to thank you for your high recommendation of our property!  As you mentioned, coming from a "germophobic", that is quite an outstanding recommendation!   Again, thank you for taking the time to complete the review and for all of your feedback.  We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: We recently stayed for 5 nights in a kids suite at the Portofino.  After checking trip advisor, we decided to book as our kids (9 and 6) were excited about the bunk beds.    The room was good for our family.  It was not fancy, but the extra space in the room was appreciated and the kids slept better having their own space. The price at $127/night for the kids suite near spring break was reasonable.  Some of the reviews I had read made me nervous, but the room did NOT smell bad - nor did the towels.    The maids would make beds and replace towels each day, but not a lot more.  We usually were in a hurry to leave each morning so did not tidy up as much as we normally would.  However, replacing the plastic cups and removing the empty pizza box would have made us feel a little more
Manager Response: Dear canadiantraveller03,  Thank you so much for sharing your experience with other travelers!  We certainly appreciate your feedback and all of your wonderful compliments about the Portofino Inn & Suites.  The bunk beds in our Kids Suites are undoubtably one of the big highlights for all of our younger guests.  Having the beds in a separate room, allowing the kids their own space, is definitely an extra bonus!  We are so glad that you enjoyed your suite and the affordable rate.  Please accept our apologies regarding the items that were not removed from your room.  As you so generously mentioned, our housekeeping staff is always very cautious about removing things that some families may still want to find upon their return.  We are delighted that you chose to stay with us and enjoyed your trip.  We truly appreciate your note to recommend us to family and friends.  Our rates, location and spacious rooms surely are hard to beat!  Again, thanks for completing the review.  We're looking forward to seeing you again on your next trip out to the Anaheim area!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: After traveling to Anaheim to visit Disneyland from March 23-27, 2009, we have agreed that this hotel and the location of it was excellent! We stayed in the Kids Suite and it was huge! The kids had their bunkbeds and the adults had a separate room and if the kids were fighting...then one pulled out the sofa bed and slept on it. Beware though, the sliding doors that separate the rooms are not sound buffing and they are only covered with sheer curtains. Desk clerks were ready and willing to help with whatever you needed. There was no breakfast served though and for the price we paid, the breakfast would have been a nice bonus. There was an IHOP directly across the street, but I have a feeling we wound up with the "B" staff because the service was horrible and the food was even
Manager Response: Dear rocshy76,  Thank you for all of your wonderful compliments on The Portofino Inn & Suites!  We are so happy that your entire family agreed that our property and our location are "excellent"!  It is always our pleasure and top priority to ensure that all of our guests enjoy their stay.  We appreciate your comment on our staff being ready and willing to help with whatever you needed.  Our Kids Suites are definitely spacious!  Perfect for any family!  The separate rooms are always convenient and, as you mentioned, allows both the parents and kids to enjoy their own space.  We do apologize for the laughter, etc. you heard from the room next door.  Thank you for recognizing that in a hotel with other families there is a certain amount of noise you expect to hear and we are glad that it didn't disturb you and your family.  We also enjoyed reading your comment in regard to the bus ride back from Disneyland.  You're right; our location really can't be beat with only a 10 minute walk to the entrance, but after a long day of walking at the park the short bus ride back is most definitely convenient and so welcome!  Thank you so very much for your review.  We truly appreciate your time in completing it and all of your great feedback.  We are ecstatic that you and your family are "sold" on The Portofino Inn & Suites!  We're looking forward to seeing you again soon!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: We are a family of 4 with 2 children aged 3 and 5.  We booked the Portofino because of the 'Kids Suite' and because of its close proximity to Disneyland.  The Portofino was great for what we wanted.    Tips for staying at this hotel from us are:  Yes the kids suite was good because we could put the kids to bed after a long day and have some privacy BUT really we could of done without paying the extra for the kids suite as we were so exhausted after our full days at Disneyland we were all so ready for sleep we didn't need the privacy or extra TV.  As some people have commented I too did smell something but only in the hallway - not inside the room.  The pool was lovely and absolutley empty in the daytime but at night it was very busy (as to be expected) obviously everyone is at
Manager Response: Dear Jordans4,  Thank you for your wonderful review of your stay here at the Portofino Inn & Suites.  We're glad that you enjoyed your Disneyland vacation and were able to take advantage of the hotel's proximity to the theme parks and nearby restaurants.  As you noted, our Kids Suites are ideal for families.  They provide the privacy parents sometimes need from the kids after a long day of touring around town!  We are also happy that you were able to take advantage of our late checkout and that we could accommodate you by storing your luggage for you after you checked out.  We're here to ensure that your stay with us is an enjoyable one!  Again, thank you for sharing your experience with other travelers.  We hope to see you again soon!  Warmest regards, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Perfect for Kids!  Staff was Excellent
Summary: Our stay was January 2nd through the 9th. Room 2421  Well first of all I never right reviews but thought I needed to express my surprise at how great this hotel was and it was very reasonable price.  We drove 1000 from Oregon to this Hotel pretty much non stop so imagine my surprise that we could check into our room at Noon since it was ready.  I orginally booked this Hotel back in October for our stay after much research.   When I first booked it the price was $129 a night but after many visits to the website I saw that the price dropped to $109.  I called them and they honored the lower price.  It was well worth the money as the DL Hotel was $230.  We have a 4 year old and a 2 year old so I was looking for a place they could call their own.  The kids suite was perfect and gave
Manager Response: Dear KES-29FAMILY,  Thank you for your excellent review!  We absolutely love when we exceed our guests' expectations!  It's always so rewarding to receive such positive feedback and we truly appreciate your time in sharing your experience with other travelers.  As you mentioned, our Kids Suite is perfect for a family such as yours.  The two bedrooms separated by french doors allows for the parents to have a bit a privacy, especially after a long day at the theme parks.  Also, the kids are always excited about having their very own room!  We are so thankful for all of your compliments on our staff.  We truly make every effort to ensure our guests enjoy their experience with us.  Thank you for letting us know about the sink in your room not working properly.  It gave us the opportunity to handle the situation by replacing it the very next day, while you were still staying with us.  Lastly, we would also like to thank you for recommending the Portofino Inn & Suites to family and friends.  There is no better referral than one from a guest who has actually experienced our property.  We're looking forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Okay stay, but Oh the smell!
Summary: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Disneyland and the rooms with Bunk Beds.  The bunk beds were a real hit with our daughter and son (both under 3).  There was a nearby coffee house that was great for families.  There were also some lovely fine dining choices nearby.  As much as we enjoyed the bunk beds we could not stay at the Portofino Inn again due to the smell of the rooms and the hotel.  To us it smelled like someone had vomited in the rooms and they were doing their best to cover it up with the most powerful chemicals they could find.  The smell went deep though and never went away during our two day stay.  We tried two rooms, both of which were truly offensive.  We stayed because it's too hard to change with 2 kids in tow and we figured were not in the rooms that
Manager Response: Dear Sprocket_girl,  We would first like to apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced while staying with us.   We appreciate your feedback and have taken the proper steps in order to address the odor in both rooms.  We are glad that our bunk beds were a hit with your kids!  Our Kids Suites are perfect for families like yours!  The parents usually enjoy taking advantage of the separation by french doors from the kids bedroom to the parents' bedroom.  Thank you for your kind note on our staff.   We make every effort to provide a hotel experience that our guests love.  We sincerely hope that you do decide to visit us again.  Best Regards, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: A friend and I stayed at Portofino Nov 17-21.  I got a great deal with Expedia and decided to try it.  It is a solid 5 minute walk to the transportation area of Disney, probably 10 minutes to the actual gate of either park.  It is an easy walk for adults, though lugging tired little ones after the park, may be a bit much.  There is a 24 hour IHOP across the street, so breakfast was quick and easy.  Also, a small strip of Subway, chinese food, mexican food and photo store was also just across the street.  A 7-11 and market were between us and the park on our side of the street.  The hotel itself was very nice --- good sized rooms,  2 queen beds that were actually comfortable!  The biggest thing was the cleanliness in the room, balcony, bathroom, hallways and even the stairwells.
Manager Response: Dear RSoxFamily,  Wow! Thank you so very much for taking the time to complete the review and including so many great details and compliments!  It is always such a pleasure to hear that our guests love our property as much as we do!  As you mentioned, our location is a short walk to all the fun and many restaurants.  As for "tired little ones after the park", there is another option:  For a nominal fee, the Anaheim Resort Transit can pick you up at our hotel and take you to Disneyland® Resort's main entrance.  They can also pick you up when you're ready to come back and drop you off steps away from our property.  We are so pleased to hear that you found your beds comfortable and that you appreciated the "cleanliness of everything!!"  You are correct:  We certainly do make considerable effort to maintain the cleanliness of our property!  Also, thank you for your very kind notes on our staff.  We believe in going the extra mile to make sure our guests are taken care of, and your compliments are truly our reward!  Thanks again for your feedback and for recommending us to others.   We look forward to your next visit!  Best, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: My family stayed at the Portofino Inn back in September/October for eight days.  We loved it.  The kid Suite gave us plenty of room and the beds were very comfortable.  The kids eat free at the Jolly Roger cafe for lunch and dinner and we looked forward to visiting with the staff at the end of a long day.  Our service at the restaurant and the hotel was excellent.  The only downside was the laundry facility only had one washer working and the dryer didn't dry with heat, so it took a very long time......  Other than that I can say I look forward to one day returning to Disnyland and the Portofoino Inn and Suites...    Thanks for making our frist trip to Disneyland so enjoyable.
Manager Response: Dear olleyboys,  We are so happy to hear that you loved your stay with us during your first trip to Disneyland!  Thank you for all of your very kind remarks and for taking the time to give us your feedback.  Excellent customer service is what we pride ourselves on and we are so pleased that you experienced exactly that!  Also, we are glad that you were able to take advantage of the Kid’s Eat Free program at the adjacent Jolly Roger Cafe, which offers a free kids lunch or dinner to children ages 10 and under for every adult entree purchased.  We enjoy reminding our guests about this special offer because it truly is a great deal and it is so convenient!  Lastly, we loved the picture you posted along with your review of your son on the bed in our kid suite watching Disneyland's fireworks through the window.  What a great shot!  Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your first trip to Disneyland.  We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator Portofino Inn & Suites

Summary Heading: kid friendly, clean, nice and best of all great for your money
Summary: the check in went fast, the hotel staff is very nice and professional. this is my 3rd time staying there my kids love ther own space my husband and I love our privacy. I will never stay anywhere else. and its walking distance from disneyland!!
Manager Response: Dear jesusfreaks6,  We are extremely happy to hear that you will continue to stay with us at the Portofino whenever you are visiting the Anaheim area! It is our pleasure to accommodate you and our job to ensure superior service!    Our kids suites are ideal for a family, such as yours, that are looking for space for the kids and, as you mentioned, some privacy for the parents.  We are also very proud of our unbeatable location and affordable rates!  Thank you for all of your compliments and for taking the time to complete the online review.  We truly appreciate your feedback.  We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary: We arrived in Anaheim and didn't have a place booked.  We checked around and after seeing the amenities and location decided to stay at the Portofino Inn & Suites.  The check in went well and booked it for two nights.  We then went to our room and opened the door to an overwhelming stench.  We also came to find out the phone jack was broken.  We went downstairs and told them about our concerns and were told that the phone would be fixed the next day and we could move to another room.  Well, we tried that only to find the next room smelled worse than the original.  Also when we complained about the phone being broken, we were told that if we wanted a wake up call they could have security knock on the door.   We also mentioned the smell in the rooms but that was not even
Manager Response: Dear PhxSuns1,  We apologize for any inconvenience you may have experienced and appreciate your time in completing the online review.  We have taken the proper steps to ensure that your concerns are addressed.  The phone jack was professionally inspected the following day, which actually resulted in the repair of one of the cards in our main telephone switch.  We do understand and apologize for the inconvenience this may have posed in your initial room.  We are constantly striving to deliver superior service, affordable rates and a hotel visit that our guests will enjoy.  Again, thank you for your feedback.

Summary: My daughter and I just returned from our stay at Portofino Inn for a long weekend at Disneyland/So. CA. We were originally booked at the Jolly Roger but were transferred as the Jolly Roger was undergoing renovation. The Portofino is an excellent hotel, the staff all very friendly, free internet access, water in the lobby, very clean and inviting. Our room had a balcony, it was sooo clean (bathroom, too), shower worked great (room 1321) Rooms cleaned promptly, pool & hottub wonderful after a day in the parks, security great, very quiet. Was within walking distance to park, restaurants, conv. store & a bus t stop. No food service but we used the Jolly Roger Cafe (next door) Your kids can order off the kids menu free for lunch & dinner - saved $$$$$) It is a bit out-dated at The
Manager Response: Dear MellyRussi,  We want to thank you for taking the time to complete the online review and for all of your wonderful compliments!  We are delighted  to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that you will definitely visit us again!  We truly have an unbeatable combination of affordable rates, superior service and prime location next to Disneyland® Park that our guests love!  As you mentioned, the Jolly Roger Café, which is adjacent to us, offers American cuisine served in a casual setting for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The Jolly Roger was a bit dated;  However, they are currently undergoing renovations that are going to be completed by mid November.  Again, thank you for your feedback and we look forward to seeing you again soon!  Sincerely, eCommerce Coordinator

Summary Heading: Portofino Inn & Suites had everything --location, affordability, amenities
Summary: I arrived from the John Wayne Airport around noonish 9/3 and Edgar checked me in and handled all my needs.  I stayed on the 2nd floor in the twin queensized room 1209 I believe it was and it was lovely. Everything worked, no problems, very quiet floor, wonderful housekeeping staff, a cozy home away from home experience.  I interacted with Claudia and Edgar mostly during my wonderful stay in your hotel but I also met other staff and everyone was friendly and helpful and I would definiately stay with you all again and I wish every hotel experience and hotel I stay in was exactly like what I had with your hotel.   I enjoyed the morning coffee, the lemon icewater during the day, the use of the internet with printer for boarding passes in the lobby, the convenience of your location
Manager Response: none

Summary: You cant pay for a happy meal and expect to get a steak ! For the low price you pay you get a king size bed for the parents, a sofa with a full size pull out bed and bunk beds, and there are french door dividers between the kids suite and the parents suite. You can have breakfast downstairs at the jolly roger, and then make your two block walk to Disneyland.  That was one of my favorite parts of our trip. Listening to the excitement in my kids voices on our walk to the park and hearing about all their favorite rides on the walk back. The walk is only about five minutes each way, but it was the best five minutes ever. The rooms were clean, security was good, quiet at night.  I'm planning another trip to Disneyland in 2009 and i plan on staying here again. This is not the best
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently spent 2 nights at the Portofino Inn for our vacation to Disneyland. We had one of the 2 queen rooms and one of the king kids suite rooms and both exceeded our expectations. Hotel staff was friendly, clean spacious rooms. I had requested that the 2 rooms be as close to one another as possible and they placed us across the hall, and since my father in law smokes they made sure he had a balcony. We are pretty picky when it comes to hotels, especially the cleanliness of the facility and we were very satisfied here. I would recommend using the shuttle service as we decided to do if you have small children. The walk is not too long but little ones may have a hard time making the walk back after a day walking around Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a nice hotel given the price. I had no rpoblem with noise which many complain about. It is  agreat location with good locality. The staff are very nice and helpful also.  It was also very clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I thought that the hotel was nice, clean and good size rooms. We did have some problems with the air conditioning but they  took care of that with us telling them. This is a great location to Disney. I would stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were orignially not booked at this hotel. Upon arriving in Anaheim our hotel had no air conditioning and sent us to the Portofino. The staff at the Portofino was friendly and accomodating. We took a kids suite and it was very roomy. King bed, bunk beds and a pull out sofa. The room was clean and  had a fridge, microwave and 2 TVs. Our bathroom was a little small but that was ok because there is a separate sink and mirror outside of the bathroom. The hotel was rather full and on the main street into Disneyland but is seemed quiet to us. There is an OK pool and a guest laundry. No breakfast, but there is an IHOP across the street and other restaurants nearby too. Disneyland is a 10 minute walk away. I would stay here again as it is a good hotel with a great location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Portofino suites perfect for family vacation
Summary: I booked an affordable rate on line for a kids' suite and was very pleased to arrive and find everything we'd hoped for our stay.   The room layout is perfect for even a large family.   Convenience stores and gift shops were across the street so we loaded our mini fridge with drinks and microwavable snacks.  There's no continental breakfast at the hotel but there are many family friendly restaurants within walking distance.  We were actually within safe walking distance of the park and took advantage of the shuttle service for the rides back to the hotel from Disney after a long day on your feet.  With the airport shuttle, we didn't even need to rent a car, but if you do take a drive to Laguna Beach for a nice getaway.  We were really impressed with the  Aladdin production show
Manager Response: none

Summary: we will never stay here again... i read some of the reviews and they said it was quiet??? ha... we had people upstairs from us and they sounded like they were wrestling.. we had a kid suite.. the carpet was sooo dirty.. our socks were black!!! but that wasn't the worst part.... umm try no hot water in our room! we were there w/ two infants and a 9 year old.. try giving baths w/ cold water.. our stay was terrible and i would not recommend this at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not a bad place for family with kids
Summary: We brought our 2 boys down for a good time spending our tax stimulus rebate check.  I had read and heard pretty good things about the Portofino, so we figured we'd try it.  Overall, we were pleased with our stay.  We did not book a kids' suite (not available for the 3 nights we were staying), but we did rent adjoining rooms with other family members.  Staff at the front desk was very professional and friendly, and housekeeping, while speaking only Spanish (not a problem for us), were quick to take care of any concerns we might have.  The walk to Disneyland was about 10 minutes, and through the shade for the majority of the time.  Jolly Roger restaurant left something to be desired, but when you're hungry, it will do.  Only suggestion I would have is for housekeeping to get rooms
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel during a conference.  It is within two blocks of the Convention Center.   The room was nice (we had a kids suite) with a separate sleeping area with bunk beds.  The staff at the desk was very friendly and helpful and the cleaning staff did a great job every day with keeping our room clean and fresh.  We had a nice suite that was at the end of the hallway (away from other rooms).  I will agree with one review I read that the doors slam...I never heard anyone else's door slam, but there were a couple of times we accidentally let ours slip.   I could definitely see where this would be a hit for families traveling to Disney as it's only a couple of blocks from the Disney parks.  Transportation to the parks is just a stroll down the street.  Overall

Summary Heading: Not too bad of a hotel
Summary: We stayed at the Portofino for 8 days in the middle of June, and yes my toilet leaked the entire stay; but we weren't in it enough to wait for someone to fix it. Besides, it looked like they already tried but were unsuccessful. It is a very clean hotel, and the warm pool was nice, although the adjacent Jolly Rogers hotel's pool was closed, it was extermely busy at all times during the day because you can use both. The staff is pleasant and will help you find the Target or restaurants in the area, although you have to stand at the desk and wait for them to come out from watching TV in the backroom.  Overall, if I had to pay the full price at 129-139.00 I would have picked a cheaper hotel that was closer to Disneyland. Find one that is on S.Harbour Blvd., North of Katella. The

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised.  I read some reviews from earlier this year and had concerns about our stay.  We stayed at the Portofino the first week of June and had a great time.  Our room was on the top floor facing away from Katela Ave which is a very busy street.  We were also away from the elevator and ice/soda dispensers on our floor. Contrary to an earlier review, our room was very quiet.  I did not hear doors slamming or people in the hall despite the fact we left our A/C off most of the time we were in the room. The front desk was very responsive every time I contacted them (in person or on the phone) and always sent someone to our room if we needed anything - as compared to other hotels I've been at where they ask you to stop by the front desk to get something. Summary: We chose Portofino mainly for its close location to the Convention Center, and the balconey for my travel companion who smokes. I was nervous, based on some of the negative reviews, but the price was right, and I took a chance. We were pleasantly surprised. It's not the Marriott-but that was over $100 more a night! We did not have any problems with odors or noise. The front desk staff was friendly, and very accomodating when we asked to store our baggage the last day so that we could go to Disney before we flew out. We were able to check in before 3PM. We walked to a variety of restaurants. The location was great. And yes, the 7-11 across the street was perfect for the small things we wanted.  I only had one concern- we stayed in the deluxe rooms. Summary: I was very spectacle at booking this hotel because of some of the negative reviews. But, our stay turned out to be O.K. First, unlike on the website, which says it is one block from Disneyland, it actually turned out to be a 15 minute walk. So we ended up taking the shuttle, which was real effecient. Second, the room itself wasn't the most luxurious for what we had to pay. It is very expensive for what you get. We got the kid's suite which was one king bed, with a cheap french door that didn't close all the way, with a see-through curtain over it and in the other side was a bunk bed with a sleeper sofa, an old microwave and a worn fridge. The bathroom was also quite small. Moreover, the room was very loud. You can hear the neighbors talking, then you can hear the water heater
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because we got a last-minute deal on a kids suite, which ended up being cheaper than a standard room elsewhere because of our late booking.  The room was spacious and our daughter enjoyed the bunk beds and the kid-sized table and chairs in her bedroom.  We enjoyed having a king-sized bed to ourselves.  The room did smell a bit musty and we had to crank the A/C down as low as it would go to get the room cooled off.  You could defnitely hear other families, and it sounded like there was a herd of elephants stomping around the room above us first thing in the morning.  However, having a kid ourselves and being used to noise and early mornings, we didn't think it was a big deal.  The toilet was a little temperamental and we had to call maintenance at one
