Summary Heading: Good for a family visit to Disney
Summary: I was a little worried about this hotel after reading some of the reviews on this site.  It was fine.  We booked the kids suite and yes it is not soundproof but for goodness sakes, you are a parent with kids!  It worked out just fine.  It was about a 15 min walk to Disney with the shuttle right outside.    Hotel was clean and close.  The pool was nice.  What more to do you need when you are at Disney for most of the time?
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just got back from the Portofino Inn and Suites from a 6 night stay, I would say all in all in was a very average experience.  I have read a few reviews here stating that the front desk were not friendly and I have to say that is completely false. They were very nice and wanted to help everytime I stepped in the lobby. A few complaints I would have were the same as some others...very loud!! The noise level is very high from the people walking upstairs to walking down the hallways on your floor, the doors from each room when closed are very loud and can be quite disruptive.  A few of my own complaints, I find it hard to believe that the Portofino does not offer a continental breakfast?? With virtually every hotel in the area offering one how this hotel that caters to families

Summary: We just got back from a stay here, we usually stay at one of the Disneyland Hotels, so I was a little worried, and for no reason at all.  The hotel was excellent!  We arrived at 11am, checked in, and were given our room early, that was wonderful.  The kid suite is definately the way to go.  The room was huge, plenty of space for the kids to play, they loved having their "own" room, and we weren't all stuck on top of each other.  If we wanted to watch something on tv, we actually could, their were two tv's which made it extra nice.  The room was very clean, plenty of towels, and the bed was very comfortable, which is sometimes hard to come by at a hotel.  The walk to Disneyland was only 10min, and my 5 year old had no problem.  We will be staying here again!  Oh, and I left

Summary: On our last trip to Disney, we stayed at the Travel Lodge directly across the street from the entrance on Harbour Blvd and we had every intention of staying there again. But this time we had my mom with us and I was afraid the extra adult would cramp the standard rooms that hotel had to offer. She had previously stayed at the Portofino and suggested it as an alternative. While we definitely missed the short walk into the park, this hotel room was a major hit with the kids. We had the Kids Suite which we got for $10 less than the standard room at the other hotel. There was a king bed and tv in it's own room. Summary: We stayed in the Kids Suite from 4/5 to 4/9 with 5 adults and 1 child (my in-laws stayed in a King Suite).  The rooms was clean and comfortable.  2 adults slept on the sofa bed and said it was very comfortable.  We went to Unviversal Studios, Seaworld and Disneyland and the walk from the hotel to Disneyland was only 10 min max.  I do agree with some of the reviews of the window coverings - they are very thin and do let the light in early in the morning - but if you are there for Disneyland (which most people that stay here are) who cares!!  You are going to be up early anyway. When someone walks down the hall way, you can hear it in your room. Summary Heading: Large, Clean rooms. Friendly helpful staff
Summary: I almost cancelled my reservation based on all the negative reviews. Fortunately, I ran out of time to find another location. This hotel is just fine! (I travel a lot, so I know it's no Hilton but...). If you want a room with enough space for a family. This is perfect. The kids loved the bunks and having their "own" TV and room. Everything was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location was a short walk to the park, which gave us much flexibility. No, it's not pefect...our drain stoppers didn't work properly, but we contacted the front desk as we left for dinner the first day, and found them repaired by the time we got back that evening. Summary Heading: Good Value - Kid's Suite Worked Well
Summary: We recently spent six nights at the Portofino in a "Kid's Suite" and found it to be a great value.  Our two boys 7 and 12 loved the bunk beds and we liked having a door seperating the two sleeping areas.  They could make the curtains on the french doors more opaque to keep light from getting through (I hung a blanket up...) but this room layout worked well for us.   Let's face it, while visiting the theme parks, you don't spend a lot of time in the room, but the room was always made up nicely and clean when we did come back to the room during the afternoon.
